story:
I'm a Cree/Métis filmmaker based in Toronto. I went home to Northern Saskatchewan to shoot my latest film, ASSINI.

ASSINI is a story about identity, love and acceptance.  Set in a small, Metis village in the 1970's, Assini and her friends love playing "Cowboys and Indians" - but nobody wants to be the Indian.  When Assini finds out she is one, her life changes forever.

Assini is having its World Premiere in 23 days at the ImagineNative Film & Media Arts Festival - the World's Largest Indigenous Festival of its kind.

http://www.imaginenative.org/home/node/4568

These are the STARS - Drake, Eryn & Drayanna

Please help me bring them to Toronto so they can see themselves on the BIG SCREEN!

This is a a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for them.

They will see & meet successful Indigenous Artists/ Filmmakers/Writers at a world-renowned venue - the TIFF Bell LIGHTBOX

Help them see dreams do come true! 

Help them know they can be whatever they want to be!

Help them know they are important & the world is waiting for them!

The process:

I auditioned local kids in Beauval, my village of approximately 700 people.

I found four leads, ranging in age from 7 to 11 years old.

None of them had ever acted before.

The entire village supported me in making ASSINI! I am forever grateful.

WHY THIS IS IMPORTANT:

Indigenous kids in Northern Canada don't have the same opportunities as those in Southern urban centres - especially in the arts

They deserve to sit and watch their hard-earned work presented in a state-of-the-art theatre in Canada's largest city. 
Drayanna, Eryn, Drake & Matthew put their heart & soul into this film, they deserve a moment of Pride. They deserve to feel the excitement and energy that their performances will invoke in the audience around them. 

Where the money is going

All funding will go towards airfare, travel, hotel rooms & meals for four kids and 3 adults (parents/guardians).  

The average cost of airfare (Air Canada/Westjet) is $750.00

  • $750 x 7 (4kids & 3adults) = $5,250.00
Travel from Beauval to Saskatoon return is approximately $400
The average cost of a hotel room is $150/night

  • $150/night x 4 nights x 2 rooms = $1,200.00

Per Diems for meals

  • $60/day x 4 days x 7 people = $1,680.00

Local transit (TTC & cabs)

  • $25/day = $100.00

If there is a little extra money left over we will take the kids to a few sites to make their experience extra memorable.

If we reach above & beyond our goal we will use the funds towards Film Festival submission fees which average $50 - $100/submission. We are submitting to many festivals, this is the beginning of ASSINI's film festival journey! WoooHoooo!!

The Impact

ASSINI is not just about the production of a film.  It's about giving aboriginal youth opportunities, about giving them a voice, and showing them that anything is possible.  Often people go to the north and make promises which are broken.  It was extremely important to us to follow through, no matter what the challenges.  We auditioned the children one year before shooting.  We said that we would be back to shoot the film, and although it took longer than initially expected, we did it.  We have told the kids that we will do what we can to bring them to the world premiere, where they can be amongst talented, indigenous people from around the world and see their hard work up on the big screen.  We didn't promise it would happen, but we promised we would try.  This is the last step in completing our young cast's journey with ASSINI !

Risks & Challenges

The obvious challenge would be not raising enough funds to bring all four of the children to Toronto for the festival screening.  It would be unfair, and a difficult choice, to only be able to bring some of the cast.  We truly hope we can give the same opportunity to all of them.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please let your friends, family and colleagues know about our campaign!  If you are in Toronto for the ImagineNative film festival we would love to see you at our screening on October 15th at 5:15pm at the TIFF Bell Lightbox!  Thank you for all of your help and support.

story:
(Click the 'Subtitles' button on the video above, to view with English subtitles)

Guatemala is a small country right in the middle of the American continent. Levels of poverty, crime and violence, as well as government corruption, are sky-high. These features are all part of a complex sociopolitical environment that involves social and economic inequality, very few opportunities for human development, an ineffective justice system, and an almost complete lack of education, housing, and health care for a very large part of the population.

All Guatemalans are very concerned and desperate to find a way out of this and we all strive to rebuild this country to leave a better place for our children. Since a large percentage of Guatemalans are religious believers (97%), many people turn to religion as a source of comfort in times of despair and associate all sorts of bad things with "turning away" from God. The Christian God, that is. Thus, the idea that the solution to everything is to be found in the Bible and its supposed "values" is a very popular one.

Over the course of the last 9 months, a congressman claiming he received "explicit instructions from God" during a "divine revelation," has been planning and writing a bill proposal gathering support from local Evangelical and Pentecostal churches and organizations. The proposed bill was presented to Congress last Wednesday (July 15th) in a religious act inside Congress.

Some of its stipulations are:

  • ALL schools in Guatemala, both public and private, are forced to teach a weekly "Biblical Values" class. They must employ special teachers to teach them and certified "chaplains" to serve as "spiritual guides" to students.
  • ALL students regardless of their religious beliefs, or lack of them, are required to attend these classes and obtain a passing grade. Effectively violating the right to religious freedom and freedom of conscience.
  • Government must allocate resources to pay for all of this in its National Budget, thus violating the important principle of separation of Church and State. It means taxpayers end up paying for religious instructions that should be paid for by individual churches and interested parents, not everyone.
This eliminates every option for parents that want their children to get a strictly secular education. If this bill passes, ALL education in Guatemala will have a religious element, based on a "literal and grammatical" interpretation of a particular Protestant version of the Christian Bible.

This is not good. This is how theocracies begin.


We at the Guatemalan Secular Humanist Association (Asociación Guatemalteca de Humanistas Seculares) firmly believe that everyone has the right to religious freedom and freedom of conscience, without exception, as long as it harms no one. This includes the rights of Catholics, Christians, Jews, Muslims, Hindus, Mayans, Buddhists and all other religious groups to believe whatever makes them happy, as well as the right of non-believers to do the same thing.

We already made our voices heard during the official presentation of the bill proposal in Congress. A member of our board was booed, insulted, bullied, threatened, and forcefully ejected when trying to explain the reasons why this bill is unconstitutional, why it violates several international Human Rights treaties and why it's simply a bad idea. See video below.

 

We aim to protect the rights of every parent to select and every child to receive a secular education, if that is what they want. This is what Secular States are all about: protecting the religious freedom of all individuals by not privileging any one religion over another. We already took our first step by presenting a formal complaint to our local Human Rights Commissioner. We are highly motivated to fight for these rights all the way to the end, but we need more monetary resources to cover everything we need to do so. 

The money we raise through your kind donations will be used in the following way:

  • Legal fees. We need lawyers. Good lawyers of the expensive kind. If we have to fight this all the way to the end, we are estimating that we will need a little over $3,500 to cover this. Maybe even more, depending on future developments.
  • Media exposure. Many Guatemalans still have no idea of what is going on. The news has received media coverage, mainly on online media outlets and social networks, but not everyone has access to these. We need to spread the news on printed media through paid advertisements and press releases; we need to get parents involved; we need to get Churches involved; we need to get private schools involved. If we can get them as well as other local organizations to contribute, another $3,000 have been estimated to cover these expenses.
  • Miscellaneous. We are setting aside $1,500 for other unexpected expenses that may come up. Maybe even hosting a public forum or a public debate.

This is why we request your kind assistance.

For the sake of transparency, a full expense list, along with fiscal documents (invoices, receipts, etc.) will be published on our website when this is over. Any money that is left (if there is any left), will be used for future campaigns, programs and actions focused on secular education and the separation of Church and State.

Thank you for your time and your kind help.

story:
Campaign closed? It's not too late to donate through Network for Good! 

The Manton Avenue Project (MAP) is theatre written by young people, shared with everyone. MAP’s mission is to nurture the unique potential of young people living in Olneyville by unleashing their creative voices and uniting them with professional artists to create original theatre. Olneyville is a neighborhood with a strong industrial, creative, and immigrant history, and has been hard-hit by the financial and foreclosure crisis. Over 40% of the children living in Olneyville are living in below the poverty line.


Through playmaking, The Manton Avenue Project builds each child's capacity for personal and academic success and gives young people tools to become tomorrow's creative thinkers and community leaders. MAP is founded on the belief that all young people, regardless of economic status, deserve the opportunity to imagine strong futures, and we believe that theatre is a specifically powerful vehicle for personal and social change.

Afterschool and summer playwriting workshops in the MAP Clubhouse in Olneyville provide a safe, fun space for young people to practice creative problem solving, experience empathy, and express their creativity, while learning playwriting and themed curriculum. Each MAP playwright is partnered with an adult dramaturge mentor who helps guide them through the playwriting process. MAP playwrights then see their original plays brought to life by professional local theatre artists in productions open to the public.

This year we're trying Indiegogo as a part of the end of our fiscal year appeal!

As our students grow, so do our programs, and each year we rely on more funding to support our important work. Please join us! And thank you!

story:
Our Story 

Rishima, the founder of Sol Community Education Society and a Canadian teacher, started Sol Community Education Society to improve the wellbeing of children and their families living in global poverty through education and community engagement. 

After working for six months as an intern in remote villages in Northern Peru, Rishima faced the reality of receiving an education in remote areas. She was surprised to see how early children dropped out of school,  some as young as 5 years old. This was due to a variety of reasons including a lack of basic educational resources, unqualified teachers in rural areas, the need for children to help parents, the cost of education (it is not free in Peru), the distance to travel to school, and not seeing school as relevant to their lives. 

However, Rishima did observe the powerful and lasting effects that a quality sustainable education program could have within the community. There are dedicated parents and teachers who want the best for the children and community, but at times poverty was just too strong a factor in preventing this. 

Every child should have the opportunity to receive a quality education to reach their full potential for free!

What Sol Does

Sol has been providing workshops to various villages in Norther Peru for the last three years. We were finally able to establish a small permanent school to provide education classes in the village of Las Dunas in January, 2015. Las Dunas is a village on the outskirts of the City of Piura, in Northern Peru. 

  • Classes are conducted three times a week on values education, self esteem building, heath education, literacy, and more
  • The classes are for children aged 0 - 12.  
  • We have held workshops for the last 3 years in 3 villages!

The families in Las Dunes mostly work as taxi drivers, retailers, in agriculture and cattle. There is low literacy and school attendance due to lack of income, access, and however, there is a strong drive by the parents of Las Dunes to make a better life for their children. They are dedicated to provide the best opportunities for their children. 

The Impact

  • This program enables the children of Las Dunas to get much needed support in literacy, numeracy, health education, and values education (i.e. self esteem/confidence building).
  • The ripple effect of education benefits the whole village including confidence in parents, neighbours, and eventually the children's children! 
  • There are no community centres or schools close by for the children to attend, so this program provides a place for children to go to and learn.
  • This program has been running successfully since January and we would like to support it long term and eventually have the program run daily.

What We Need 

A dollar goes far in Peru. It costs only $170 per month to run the program.

Here is where your donation goes:

  • Provide a qualified teacher for over 60 children for a year
  • Provide resources and supplies for the children for a year
  • Build a better future for the children of Las Dunas!
  • If we exceed our goal, it will go towards expansion of the program!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Let others know about our campaign. Share it on Facebook!
  • Join our Facebook page for updates on our progress.
  • https://www.facebook.com/SolCommunityEducation
  • Share the campaign and you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What We're About: Storytelling Imagination

Imagine a global campfire of people creating stories together.  Imagine unlocking the creative genius inside everyone, through tales of romance, suspense, magical fantasy, or dramatic adventure as users start stories in a chosen genre.  Imagine collaborating with professionals in the business.  Imagine all that--and more--and you have just imagined Jottopia. 

Jottopia is a fun, collaborative storytelling experience for everyone. Challenge family, friends, and millions of users with entertainingly fun plot twists and turns to forge the ultimate stories together, jot by jot. 

Through our love of stories, we are re-imagining new ways to excite and engage fans of storytelling, including the ability to collaborate with actual Best-Selling Authors and Hollywood storytellers. 


Genre & Story Page Designs:


Now, our campaign will allow us to realize our longtime vision to expand support for educators. Feature-rich additions to Jottopia's existing story creation platform will be created; dubbed Jottology!

Cool For School: Early Success

Part of the master plan for Jottopia has been the education possibilities. Now, we look to create a version of the site that benefits teachers, students and educators of all kinds. We called it Jottology. 

In early test groups, teachers loved the tools that allowed them to get kids to read and write, while not really knowing they're doing it. 

Students loved the game aspect of it and embraced getting assignments done while creatively one-uping each other in the process. The concept of out-jotting your fellow classmates caught on quick. 

And that was the beta test no frills version!! 

Great Tools: Whozits And Whatzits Galore

The new version will include gadgets and gizmos a plenty - including these ways to help teachers:

  • Track student progress. 
  • Grade work. 
  • Give improvement notes. 
  • And most important, control the environment. 

We see Jottopia's story collaboration and interaction with published authors happening in classrooms, homeschool groups, after-school and enrichment programs, kids clubs and any other private writing group worldwide. 

Check out what educators have said:

“Jottopia’s Jottology is a gift to all of us and has so much to offer all teachers of writing. I have never seen any business quite as creative. It is based on the idea that we are all storytellers. Jottopia takes writing to a whole new level!”         — Jan Fisher - English Teacher, Educator

“My students love Jottopia & Jottology! They actually called each other outside of the classroom to work on new stories.”                                                                         — Lori Martines - Educator

Tell Me More, Tell Me More, Tell Me More...





Visit Jottopia's Site to Explore More


                  

Zoltar The Wise: If Ever A Wonderful Wiz There Was

We knew to get Jottopia to the level we envision, the site would need a major overhaul. Fast forward to (spoiler alert) - it's almost here! That's right, we've cranked up the heavy computing power and it's going to be incredible! The issue we ran into is (another spoiler alert), it turns out code is expensive. That multitude of ones and zeros living inside your computer come with a hefty price tag. 

There are many, many resources required when starting a company, and we’re not just talking scented business cards. Although, hmm, note to self, come back to that idea.  

So we consulted the wisdom of Zoltar, and the card read, “you are destined to facilitate a crowd-sourced funding opportunity.” That’s new-fangled fancy-dancy talk for “raise money!” So here we are doing it! Thanks Indiegogo. 

P.S. Zoltar: Yoda and Dumbledore said 'hello.'


Contributor Recognition: Love Is In The Air

Our contributors will be deeply valued in the lore of Jottopia. Aside from our undying love and respect, backers can also enjoy exclusive perks designed and developed just for this campaign. No matter the monetary amount, our campaign contributors will be embraced as founding family members for years to come. Join us.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone will be able to contribute financially, but since you're reading this, you have access to cyberspace.  Please help us spread the word.  We want to reach as many people as possible, and we need your help to do that! Please post on Facebook, Tweet about us, and tell everyone you know and work with about our goals and our desire to encourage collaborative writing, reading and creativity in our students, and THE WORLD!  

You can also use the Indiegogo sharing tools to make it easier. Together, we can get Jottology into the hands of schools, teachers, parents and students and provide all of them with the ability to unlock their creative genius. 


Here's How Your Contributions Will Help


  • Funds raised here will go directly toward building an infrastructure to support added tools for educators. Funds will also shore up site creation as well as marketing efforts, operational costs and trade-show space. The site is coming together and will be ready to launch at campaign close. 


Our Team

Jottopia is a team of story passionates. Our Founder Chris, has a Hollywood history, having worked with top studio Producers. Stacey is a financial and marketing genius and Kevin has 20 years of experience in entertainment operations. All together, the team is wholeheartedly focused on stories and has a great respect for the impact they have on our culture.

               

The thing we’re most excited about is the prospect of reaching our audience. We want fans! Not of us, but we want to be surrounded by fans, because we’re fans too. Fans of stories from books, movies, television, art, music, you name it. We want to build a family. So join us on the ground floor. Give what you can. Especially if it’s just spreading the word. Communication and awareness is great, as is a contribution in any dollar amount, even one dollar helps us get closer to our mission. As Yoda said, “Do not underestimate the power of one dollar.” That’s right folks, join the fun and you can look forward to many more jokes of that caliber!

The Jottopia Team

Thanks You For Your Support
story_txt:
What We're About: Storytelling Imagination

Imagine a global campfire of people creating stories together.  Imagine unlocking the creative genius inside everyone, through tales of romance, suspense, magical fantasy, or dramatic adventure as users start stories in a chosen genre.  Imagine collaborating with professionals in the business.  Imagine all that--and more--and you have just imagined Jottopia. 
Jottopia is a fun, collaborative storytelling experience for everyone. Challenge family, friends, and millions of users with entertainingly fun plot twists and turns to forge the ultimate stories together, jot by jot. 
Through our love of stories, we are re-imagining new ways to excite and engage fans of storytelling, including the ability to collaborate with actual Best-Selling Authors and Hollywood storytellers. 



Genre & Story Page Designs:















Now, our campaign will allow us to realize our longtime vision to expand support for educators. Feature-rich additions to Jottopia's existing story creation platform will be created; dubbed Jottology!




Cool For School: Early Success
Part of the master plan for Jottopia has been the education possibilities. Now, we look to create a version of the site that benefits teachers, students and educators of all kinds. We called it Jottology. 
In early test groups, teachers loved the tools that allowed them to get kids to read and write, while not really knowing they're doing it. 
Students loved the game aspect of it and embraced getting assignments done while creatively one-uping each other in the process. The concept of out-jotting your fellow classmates caught on quick. 
And that was the beta test no frills version!! 


Great Tools: Whozits And Whatzits Galore
The new version will include gadgets and gizmos a plenty - including these ways to help teachers:



Track student progress. 


Grade work. 


Give improvement notes. 


And most important, control the environment. 


We see Jottopia's story collaboration and interaction with published authors happening in classrooms, homeschool groups, after-school and enrichment programs, kids clubs and any other private writing group worldwide. 
Check out what educators have said:

“Jottopia’s Jottology is a gift to all of us and has so much to offer all teachers of writing. I have never seen any business quite as creative. It is based on the idea that we are all storytellers. Jottopia takes writing to a whole new level!”         — Jan Fisher - English Teacher, Educator


“My students love Jottopia & Jottology! They actually called each other outside of the classroom to work on new stories.”                                                                         — Lori Martines - Educator



Tell Me More, Tell Me More, Tell Me More...














Visit Jottopia's Site to Explore More

                  
Zoltar The Wise: If Ever A Wonderful Wiz There Was
We knew to get Jottopia to the level we envision, the site would need a major overhaul. Fast forward to (spoiler alert) - it's almost here! That's right, we've cranked up the heavy computing power and it's going to be incredible! The issue we ran into is (another spoiler alert), it turns out code is expensive. That multitude of ones and zeros living inside your computer come with a hefty price tag. 
There are many, many resources required when starting a company, and we’re not just talking scented business cards. Although, hmm, note to self, come back to that idea.  
So we consulted the wisdom of Zoltar, and the card read, “you are destined to facilitate a crowd-sourced funding opportunity.” That’s new-fangled fancy-dancy talk for “raise money!” So here we are doing it! Thanks Indiegogo. 
P.S. Zoltar: Yoda and Dumbledore said 'hello.'

  Contributor Recognition: Love Is In The Air
Our contributors will be deeply valued in the lore of Jottopia. Aside from our undying love and respect, backers can also enjoy exclusive perks designed and developed just for this campaign. No matter the monetary amount, our campaign contributors will be embraced as founding family members for years to come. Join us.




Other Ways You Can Help We know that not everyone will be able to contribute financially, but since you're reading this, you have access to cyberspace.  Please help us spread the word.  We want to reach as many people as possible, and we need your help to do that! Please post on Facebook, Tweet about us, and tell everyone you know and work with about our goals and our desire to encourage collaborative writing, reading and creativity in our students, and THE WORLD!  
You can also use the Indiegogo sharing tools to make it easier. Together, we can get Jottology into the hands of schools, teachers, parents and students and provide all of them with the ability to unlock their creative genius. 


Here's How Your Contributions Will Help





Funds raised here will go directly toward building an infrastructure to support added tools for educators. Funds will also shore up site creation as well as marketing efforts, operational costs and trade-show space. The site is coming together and will be ready to launch at campaign close. 

Our Team

Jottopia is a team of story passionates. Our Founder Chris, has a Hollywood history, having worked with top studio Producers. Stacey is a financial and marketing genius and Kevin has 20 years of experience in entertainment operations. All together, the team is wholeheartedly focused on stories and has a great respect for the impact they have on our culture.

               
The thing we’re most excited about is the prospect of reaching our audience. We want fans! Not of us, but we want to be surrounded by fans, because we’re fans too. Fans of stories from books, movies, television, art, music, you name it. We want to build a family. So join us on the ground floor. Give what you can. Especially if it’s just spreading the word. Communication and awareness is great, as is a contribution in any dollar amount, even one dollar helps us get closer to our mission. As Yoda said, “Do not underestimate the power of one dollar.” That’s right folks, join the fun and you can look forward to many more jokes of that caliber!
The Jottopia Team
Thanks You For Your Support

story:
This magazine is going to serve language teachers, new and old, the pupils and the parents at Waldorf schools by sharing acknowledged ideas, interviews, methodology questions, and last but not least enthusiasm.

Based on a survey we conducted among teachers at Steiner schools, a quarter of the language teachers at schools in any given year are new. 



We have already received many articles, practical examples and pictures from teachers around the world. Actually a whole magazine is almost full.

The concept of the magazine is that with time it should be edited in the main languages taught at our schools: English, German, French, Spanish and Russian. For the first issue we have already got English, German, French and Spanish articles and interviews. A real team of teachers is now coming together from all over the world.

What We Need & What You Get

Our plan is to start first with two issues per year and when the magazine is established with editors and article contributors it should be 4 or even more issues per year. 

For the layout, the printing and distribution of the magazine to the more than 1000 schools worldwide we would need about 12 000 $ (11 000 Euro ). 

(layout & printing: 2390$, hardware and software: 1100 $; editing: 1500$; delivering: 6000$, fees for indiegogo: 1000$)

We hope that the schools, language teachers and parents will find the magazine a lively and necessary paper and will subscribe to further issues. That will be the engine of future editorial work.

We have found out some interesting perks for your contribution to this important project! We welcome all contributions from the smallest to the most generous ones! 

If we don’t reach our financial goal, our project will be a bit delayed. But we have got a good plan B. (See under risks and challenges.) If we reach more, we'll be able to organize even the second issue without subscribers.

The Impact

  •  We are sure that the impact in the long term will be an increase in the foreign language knowledge of our pupils, who will be really able to read, speak, write and understand the foreign languages they have been learning from the first class on.
  • We hope that the fluctuation of language teachers will be reduced (at the moment about 24% each year!), when teachers are more aware of the background and teaching methodology of our schools and get help from each other through the medium of this magazine dedicated to them.
  • We also hope that this magazine will be a well-established one with professional editors and article contributors by the centenary of our school movement in 2019.

You may help financially; see the perks in this indiegogo campaign.

  • Or If you are a(n) insider/employee of a company or organization that could help us, please recommend this project to the management with a few warm-hearted words!
  • Please tell parents and your colleagues about this project and ask them to contribute to it financially.
  • We also welcome articles and all kind of pictures about your school or pupils!
  • You may use the indiegogo share tools to present this project to your community on facebook, twitter and other social media!

The organizers and team members: 


Mihaly Hevesi, Waldorf language teacher with experience in Austria, Germany, Hungary, publisher of literature for Steiner Waldorf schools and author of educational articles. Author of the books: The Open Secret of Polyglots, 2013 published in English; The Art of Learning Languages, 2003 published in Hungarian}; {How to learn languages through your favourite movies, tracks, novels and professional text 2009, 2011, 2012 published in Hungarian}.

Alec Templeton, author of many articles about Waldorf pedagogy and the book Teaching English to Teens and Preteens- 2007. He began his long teaching career in 1972. He has taught English at Waldorf schools and trained teachers in Germany, Switzerland, Russia, Finland, Italy, Esthonia, Sweden, Hungary, Norway and Japan. He now teaches Foreign Languages at the Waldorf Teacher Training College in Dornach and in Waldorf Seminars worldwide.

Paulino Brener, Spanish language teacher with experience at Steiner schools in the US, organizer of the social media site for Waldorf Langauge Teachers WLTWS.

Nikolai Höfer, German Teacher at Ecole Rudolf Steiner de Genève, Switzerland , organizer of the Deutschwoche, a seminar for German language teachers at Steiner schools worldwide.

Peter Hari, organizer for design, layout and printing, expert in Steiner school publications. (Electropress)


The idea of the magazine is also supported by many  language teachers as Alain Denjean, Johannes Kiersch, Margarete Orlik-Walsh, Nicolai Petersen.


Risks & Challenges

The risk is that we won’t manage to raise the sum needed for layout, printing, and delivery of the magazine to each school. In this case we’ll have to wait for a few months till we can finance it on our own. Another plan B is to print a smaller version of the magazine and send that out to the schools in order to present the magazine which will then hopefully be welcomed and subscribed to by the language teachers and parents.

We would like to thank you in advance for any way you can contribute to bring about a paper that will help Waldorf school language teachers all around the world to accomplish their vocation! 

 
Best regards,

The organizers

story:
Short Summary

About this project

I see many campaigns that do not help society.  These are the campaigns that are rocking the funds! Lets change that!  I say, if you have money, use it to make a positive difference.  Your money may even save a life, if you donate to Whereabouts Kids, LLC.  If that isn't positive, I don't know what is. Imagine the next missing kid is yours--you would want as much help as possible.  We don't want any more kids to go missing, so please help us PREVENT THAT!  

 I stay awake at night researching missing kids.  I wonder, "where could they be?"  I try so hard to view the area in Google maps, collect clues.  I am always left baffled. 

These thoughts are a parent's worse nightmare--and are the reality of many parents across our nation.  I truly want to make a change.  Imagine a child goes missing.  A parent clicks their app, and it shows exactly where that kid is.  Authorities are contacted, and the child is brought home.  A happy ending. 

I created UnderWhere(TM) to ease the minds of parents, and to return those lost kiddos to their distraught families.   UnderWhere(TM) is not like any children's underwear.  It contains GPS.  UnderWhere(TM) is different from any other GPS apparel, due to its unique and discreet design.  The GPS is built into the UnderWhere(TM), in the most unobvious and comfortable way.  The child will be comfortable and the kidnapper won't know the child is being tracked.  The parent clicks their locate app and they are reunited with their kid! The kidnapper is arrested.

I can't save the kids without you.  Please help our cause.  Your donation will help us and help reduce the number of missing kids.  A portion of all proceeds be returned to the communities through regular Amber alert ads on Jumbotrons and billboards, as well as supplying free UnderWHere(TM) to low-income families across the US. 

Lets work together for the sake of the kids, they are our future.  Lets bring them home and put the fear into all predators and kidnappers across the US!

Thank you for helping me make a difference.

Please view our website for more information:  http://www.whereaboutskidsllc.com/ 

Risks and challenges

The risk would be of idea theft, but our successful legal team and trademark/patent will protect this and conquer that situation if necessary.

More about Whereabouts Kids, LLC

Whereabouts Kids, LLC is a company that is being launched in order to prevent missing kids across the nation. Whereabouts is a woman-owned company that is building its framework from the passion to keep kids safe, in addition to the education and experience of the founders.

Currently, we are in the concept stage. We have a full business plan, financial projections, and staffing all lined up. The two women owners are working on funding, sales campaign, marketing, and strengthening communication with GPS and underwear manufacturers. With funding, we will begin the manufacturing and sales of UnderWhere(TM).

About the Founder

I have an MA in Media Communications with an emphasis in PR and a BS in Business with an emphasis in Management. I was a Director of KinderCare for 4 years, and a Coordinator with the Archidocese of St. Louis in the Safe Environment Program for 7 years. I am also a mother of two (18 and 6). Child Safety is my passion and Whereabouts Kids, LLC and the product line UnderWhere(TM) will make a huge impact on the lives of many families. 

Our Product Line

The product line, UnderWhere(TM) is designed by and exclusive to Whereabouts Kids, LLC and will be in all major high end department stores across the nation.

Please view the PITCH DECK for even more information:  http://www.whereaboutskidsllc.com/#!pitch-deck/c24vq


www.whereaboutskidsllc.com

story:
Short Summary

CONNECTECH is Bermuda’s first technology incubator, a much needed technology training centre for youth and entrepreneurs to become innovators in the community. CONNECTECH provides training and co-working space for startups and people interested in advancing in the tech industry.

COMMUNITY, EDUCATION AND INNOVATION

Our website is coming soon www.connectech.bm

We believe that a thriving innovative entrepreneurial community is being formed in Bermuda, and that the local economy benefits from the formation of innovative small business when they are supported. The inventors and makers that may change the world require access to the tools, teams and training to make their ideas a reality.

CONNECTECH believes that educating our Bermudian youth, who will be the next generation of innovators is an important step in creating a prepared and empowered future workforce and community.  

Our training centre will focus on computer training, programming and coding skills for the youth of Bermuda, with the vision that collaboration amongst startups/entrepreneurs and tech students will encourage innovation for our technology industry and Bermuda as a whole.

At CONNECTECH members and visitors will be able to book resources online from a host of full services for hot desks, offices, meeting rooms and computer resources, or just hang out in the member’s TECH lounge while enjoying lightning fast internet, refreshments in a community environment.

CONNECTECH also offers seminars and workshops on hot tech topics from industry experts for all age groups, such as; Tips to starting your business, Hands on tips for Building Your Website and Shopping Cart solutions, Social Media, Driving traffic to your site, Web and internet security… plus many, many more.

We provide an environment that encourages the elements that foster innovation. Here, the barrier to entry is lowered and the playing field is made less rocky through training, access to experts, authentic networking opportunities, and events that offer promotion and exposure for our members and their businesses. 


People come together at CONNECTECH to learn, share ideas, co-develop products, work on a passion project or startup. 

Training Centre:

We will be offering computer training classes, afterschool and Saturdays to youth (primary students initially). Kids will learn about technology in the various aspects by building upon what they are learning in school. We will have the ability to teach students at various levels allowing them to learn at their own pace.

Additionally, we will also provide students with the online tools to continue the learn experience on their own.

Kids will be taught various programming languages such as Scratch, HTML/5, CSS, JAVA, PYHTON, RUBY ON RAILS, PHP to name a few.

They will be taught about Linux and Windows environments, working with Ras Pi’s, programming robots and various projects encouraging innovation.

Our future goal is to open a section of our space as a computer lab and offer access to the computers based on membership, like a library where kids can come to work on various projects together.

Kids will have the ability to use a 3D printer and 3D pens, along with other tech gadgets teaching them to think outside the box.

CONNECTECH Co-Working Space Offers:

·  Hot desks (open space), some desks are fully equipped with computers while others will allow you to connect using your own computer.

·  Private office space, meeting rooms with conference features and a large training center and seminar space available by the hour, day, week or month at affordable prices.

·  High speed lightning fast internet and printing available.

  • For a basic membership you can come relax in our TECH Lounge.
  • Complimentary coffee, tea, water and snacks are available to all our members.
  • Operational hours are currently from 9:00am-6:00pm, as we grow with your help our hours will expand.

Working around others who are starting businesses, launching campaigns, working as freelancers, inventing new products and shaping the future of Bermuda’s innovation economy is inspiring... get out of the living room and into a community workspace!

Our goal is to have a fully operational computer centre for kids/all to walk in and use computers to create and innovate. Similar to a library where they have a membership to hang out and read the books, at CONNECTECH they will be able to hang out, innovate, collaborate and code.

Our campaign goal is $30,000, which will enable us provide students and entrepreneurs alike with the tools needed to innovate, educate and collaborate.

Here's what your contributions will provide:

With your generous contributions, you will be supporting the growth of students interested in technology, fostering an environment that encourages entrepreneurs to create and develop business opportunities.   Assist in the purchasing the latest technology tools that will be available at CONNECTECH. Provide more computer equipment and access to create a ‘computer library’. These are our goals so you can see how your funds will go to assist CONNECTECH.

Equipment we plan to purchase with the support of your funding:

  • 3D printer
  • 3D pens
  • Computers
  • Laptops
  • Ras Pi’s
  • Robots and equipment

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to financially contribute, we understand and there are lots of ways you can still help us. 

Please spread the word about this campaign. The more people that see it, the more chances we'll have of people contributing.

  • Like us on Facebook
  • Follow us on Twitter  
  • Join our technology Hub
  • Volunteer you time to assist with students
  • Teach a seminar
  • Be a mentor

Share this link with your friends, family, and colleagues!

along with other tech gadgets teaching them to think outside the box.


CONNECTECH Co-Working Space Offers:
· 
Hot desks (open space), some desks are fully equipped with
computers while others will allow you to connect using your own computer. 
· 
Private office space, meeting rooms with conference features and
a large training center and seminar space available by the hour, day, week or
month at affordable prices.
· 
High speed lightning fast internet and printing available.

For a basic
     membership you can come relax in our TECH Lounge.
Complimentary
     coffee, tea, water and snacks are available to all our members.
Operational hours
     are currently from 9:00am-6:00pm, as we grow with your help our hours will
     expand.

Working around others who are starting businesses, launching
campaigns, working as freelancers, inventing new products and shaping the
future of Bermuda’s innovation economy is inspiring... get out of the living
room and into a community workspace!

Our goal is to have a fully operational computer centre for kids/all to walk in and use computers to create and innovate. Similar to a library where they have a membership to hang out and read the books, at CONNECTECH they will be able to hang out, innovate, collaborate and code.
Our campaign goal is $30,000, which will enable us provide students and entrepreneurs alike with the tools needed to innovate, educate and collaborate.

Here's what your contributions will provide:
With your generous contributions, you will be supporting the
growth of students interested in technology, fostering an environment that
encourages entrepreneurs to create and develop business opportunities. 
 Assist in the purchasing the latest technology tools that will be
available at CONNECTECH. Provide more computer equipment and access to create a
‘computer library’. These are our goals so you can see how your funds will go
to assist CONNECTECH.
Equipment we plan to purchase with the support of your funding:

3D printer
3D pens
Computers
Laptops
Ras Pi’s
Robots and equipment

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you are not able to financially contribute, we
understand and there are lots of ways you can still help us. 
Please spread the word about this campaign. The more people that
see it, the more chances we'll have of people contributing.

Like us on Facebook

Follow us
     on Twitter
      

Join our technology Hub
Volunteer you time to assist with students
Teach a seminar 
Be a mentor 

Share this link with your friends, family, and colleagues!

story:
'The Ginger'

Following the loss of her 20-year-old son Connor, also affectionately known as ‘The Ginger’, in January 2014 to Melanoma, The Melanoma Coalition Co-founder & President Tracy Mehaffey Cockerham felt an overwhelming need to do something that will drive towards the eradication of this awful disease. Her 25 years of experience in the private sector, as well as her devotion as a Melanoma advocate and a mom, lead to the founding of The Melanoma Coalition.

 

 

The grieving mother turned her focus to completing the 500-mile trek known as the Camino de Santiago, beginning on the French side of the Pyrenees mountain range and finishing at The Cathedral Santiago de Compostela in northern Spain. Not only was the Pilgrimage a unique source of healing for Cockerham, but it became the backbone of the foundation's upcoming commitment to raise $500,000 within the next 5 years, as a promise to help prevent and abolish this horrendous disease, in loving memory of Connor.

 

 

The 500-Mile Pilgrimage

In September of 2015, Cockerham began her hike along the historic Camino de Santiago from St Jean, France, crossing over the Pyrenees and the northern part of Spain to Santiago, in memory of her son Connor. 

 

The Camino, also known in English as The Way of St James, is a pilgrimage dating back thousands of years that leads to Santiago de Compestella in the Galacia region of Spain, where it is believed that the bones of St. James are enshrined. Thousands of pilgrims make this journey every year searching for their spiritual path or for spiritual growth, just as Cockerham had set off to accomplish.

 

 

The Melanoma Coalition's Indiegogo perks will coincide with Cockerham's 35 day, 500-mile journey along the Camino, including day-by-day photos, personal journal entries and the final steps that brought her to The Cathedral of Santiago de Compestela, all with the help of the love of her life, 'The Ginger’.

 

Funding for Research

With medical breakthroughs within sight, The Melanoma Coalition is pushing to continue the search for desperately needed, cure-focused research support. To date, the majority of the funds raised by The Melanoma Coalition have been allocated for ongoing research. Almost 100% of donations received have been provided to the UCSF Melanoma Research Lab to enable the efforts of Dr. Susana Ortiz and her faculty to examine, pursue treatments and ultimately discover a cure for Melanoma. The Melanoma Coalition will continue to fund research, but also expand into building and supporting education and prevention programs nationally.

 

 

To achieve our current funding goal of $100,000, Cockerham & The Melanoma Coalition will be offering rewards associated with her recent pilgrimage along the Camino and other memorabilia related to Connor, for 45 days, in order to secure early funding to push for the annihilation of this lethal disease.

 

 

The Perks!

While the majority of The Melanoma Coalition's perks are self-explanatory, a few of the levels require further understanding.

story:
A FESTIVAL of CREATIVE CULTURE!

This multi-day culturally immersive event will spotlight Florida based talent along side national/international artists and celebrate the growing culture that is defining St. Petersburg.

Founded by a team of professionals that are serious about the arts and creating a monumental event that will be one of the premiere festivals in Tampa/ St. Pete area with a three year plan to be a national recognized ,full spectrum festival.

Our goal is to support Emerging Artists and while featuring State and National level Artists, Musicians , Makers, and  Filmmakers all while  highlighting the City of St. Petersburg as a premiere arts destination in America.

We invite you to be a part of creating this event from the ground up and introductory information to get your mind wondering on the possibilities.

We will foster conversations with audiences, our community and artists while cultivating St. Petersburg’s reputation as a destination for the arts in America.

Like Et? Build Et!  and  Support Local Artists at the same time.  A donation of  10% of all sponsorships will given to local St. Petersburg non for profits, including St. Petersburg Art Alliance,  that support the growth and development of St. Petersburg and its artists’ community.

We need you to help create an all inclusive, magnification of  the growing cultural  center that St. Petersburg has become and the future that lies ahead….

We need visionaries, pioneers, and originators!

story:
THE CHALLENGE WE ALL FACE AS ONE HUMANITY

The Single Greatest Challenge that all Humans Share is to create and maintain a viable, prospering Earth that is peaceful and productive -- ensuring quality of life for future generations.

You no doubt realize how important this is, yet you wonder, “How can I possibly help make this happen?” Well, for starters, you can read this campaign page and support us.

And possibly, in the future, visit the amazing, unprecedented facility that we are building.

Here are the realizations that brought us to the point of creating this campaign. Today, our planet is in dire straits. We are experiencing overwhelming challenges.

We are bombarded every day with images of the cruelty, injustice and violence that takes place around the globe. We cannot turn a blind eye.

Remember, we are ONE humanity - What happens on the other side of the world is also impacting our own hearts.

The chaos in our world has lead to a heightened need for seekers of truth to find answers and solutions. How we view ourselves and how we relate to our higher self impacts the entire planet.

Bridges of Wellness provides a forum for new perspectives and empowerment ... Helping you find your life purpose and improving our world by how you love, nurture and forgive.

This is the new inner work. As this new “inner work” spreads, increasing the consciousness of all people in all nations, violence will decrease as humans are awakened to their true sacredness.

HOW BRIDGES IS UNIQUELY QUALIFIED TO MEET THIS CHALLENGE

Bridges of Wellness was created to be a bridge to provide enlightened pathways for both individual and collective consciousness, through educating and nurturing the body, mind and soul.  

Our core belief is that self-awareness is the only way for true awakening. We are creating a new paradigm for ongoing spiritual discovery.  

We can make a difference as we realize that the inner work we do for deeper understanding has global impact. It’s that awakening that can create a world at Peace.

Bridges of Wellness is a non-profit educational organization, founded in 2008. We are aligned with Centers for Spiritual Living – whose Vision is “A World that Works for Everyone.”

We are lead by a Spiritual Director with 44 years of ministry and are now poised for growth!

OUR MISSION

We at Bridges of Wellness feel that we’ve been charged with a great mission …To bring people back to their authentic selves, enabling them to spread the message of enlightenment and authenticity.

This then enables more and more people to come from a place of love and understanding.

To meet this need, Bridges of Wellness MUST expand its global message and impact. Please help us to do so.

Your support of this campaign allows us to expand our physical space and launch our online Soul Institute For Enlightenment.

We are creating an amazing, very special space for conscious awakening.

If you like what you’ve heard and are ready to support this effort, please select one of the gift bundles to the right, and/or share our campaign with others.

We deeply appreciate even the smallest gesture, and hope that a few will come forward in a big way as well.

We can all be part of creating a World At Peace and the global awareness that Heaven on earth is possible right now.

DONATION HELP AND SPREADING THE WORD

  1. You can help us reach our goal of doing our part to create a space for conscious awakening by selected one of the gift bundles on the right side of the page.
  2. Additionally, you can share this campaign with those you know. Everything helps raise awareness. We are so appreciative of your help. Thank you.

I AM UNABLE TO DONATE, HOW CAN I HELP?

If you’re unable to donate or in addition to your financial contribution; you can help spread the word!

Here are some ways you can help let others know about this project:

  1. Check out our Indiegogo page where you can find an email template and sample posts to use for sharing.http://www.bridgesofwellness.com/crowd-funding/
  2. Share this Indiegogo page on your Facebook wall or share to Twitter by using the links to the left.
  3. You can also share/repost our promotional videos, which you can find here at our YouTube Channel

PLEASE help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by sharing via one of the social media links to the left  where you see this image!

DR. CHARLES D GEDDESS: FOUNDER & VISIONARY

As Spiritual Director, Charles has 44 years of ministry and served on the Board of Directors of International Centers for Spiritual Living (now Centers for Spiritual Living). He was awarded an honorary doctorate degree for his many contributions and years of service in 2004, as well as being acknowledged as Minister of the Year. Under ICSL, he established the Phoenix Bridge program for Ministers in transition between positions and Focus Ministries for special ministries outside of traditional church/center parameters. He is a Founding Member of the annual Big Sky Retreat (in Montana) now in its 40th year, serving as its Board Treasurer.

Charles is an inspiring and motivational speaker. His workshops and classes are about awakening the “Mystic” within us, that teacher and inner counselor that is ever present as we invite it in. His vision for humanity is for all to realize that the inner work we do ripples out to the world for healing and transformation, and this is the “call” of Bridges of Wellness. More about Dr. Geddes can be found on our website.

WHO WE ARE

Bridges of Wellness, located in Wilton Manors, Broward County, Florida, is a unique entity that brings together all sorts of spiritual and holistic practitioners in one place. We encourage everyone’s spiritual exploration and help people to find spiritual, mental, emotional, and physical wellness. Here, you’ll learn how to participate in your own healing by discovering and investigating how to bridge what you know and what you feel.

We provide Spirit-inspired, evidence-supported, life-energy healing services (see them listed on our website.) Our unique healing modalities and programs support the personal experience of living in wellness, with more joy, love, freedom and peace. We are now expanding our global reach with our Soul Institute For Enlightenment at the completion of this campaign.

We offer:

  • a new paradigm for the new thought movement
  • soul liberation and exploration
  • a platform for ongoing inquiry and discovery via universal principles from many of the great spiritual teachings.
  • a nurturing and safe environment that encourages trust and self-expression
  • tools to help people awaken to their authentic selves

  • a curriculum that supports mind body spirit wellness with new thought teachings, holistic integrative and energetic practices, mindfulness programming, workshops and modalities that help individuals establish a loving and empowered relationship with themselves.

Soul Institute For Enlightenment:

  1. Our Vision is to expand our reach globally and provide an online educational platform.
  2. We will be providing accredited Science of Mind Classes via our affiliation with Centers for Spiritual Living.
  3. Teaching components for self-actualization.
  4. Practical Science for self awareness.
  5. Relate to the world and yourself in an enlightened way.
  6. Various avenues of accreditation for the healing arts.
  7. Provide tangible tools for conscious awakening.
REGISTERED 501c3 NON-PROFIT - YOUR DONATIONS ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE

Bridges of Wellness, Inc. is a registered 501(c) 3 non-profit educational organization. As such, all your contributions to our campaign are tax deductible.

You will receive a "Thank You" acknowledgement via email for your gift. This will be your receipt and proof of your donation to claim a tax deduction. Please watch for this email. PLEASE GIVE any amount that you can, and blessings to you and yours. And thank you again for your donation!

GIVING BACK - 5% FOR FREE COMMUNITY EVENTS, 5% TO NON-PROFITS

Dr. Geddes and everyone here at BRIDGES believes in tithing, and so 5% of all donations received from this campaign will be earmarked to provide FREE healing and educational events for the local community. Another 5% will be earmarked as gifts to other non-profit humanitarian organizations.

OUR VISION: THE 5 YEAR PLAN

We have a 5-year plan for a 5-acre campus (rendering below). The steps in the plan are:

  • Move to a new space with facilities large enough to allow us to expand our onsite programs in preparation for the final “big” move to the new campus.
  • Launch our online Soul Institute For Enlightenment.
  • Hire support personnel.
  • Broaden our Social Media reach.
  • Facilitate off-site workshops and annual community events.
  • Create a membership-based platform to provide online workshops, events and spiritual programming for our "committed giving" donor base.



HOW WE WILL SPEND THE MONEY

We at Bridges of Wellness feel that we have been charged with a great mission. To bring people back to their authentic selves. Our call is to create a space for conscious awakening.

We are asking for your help with this campaign so that we can expand our physical space and our audience. We anticipate needing $500K for completion of all goals.

New Location - $185K

  1. Larger Center - Deposit for new lease - $20K
  2. Larger Center - Utility Deposits - $5K
  3. Larger Center - Build Out of new space - $150K
  4. Moving Expenses - $10K

Office - $135K

  1. Equipment and Furnishings - $35K
  2. Administrative & Office Setup expenses - $100K

Online Soul Institute For Enlightenment - $80K

  1. Website enhancements to support the online Soul Institute For Enlightenment - $50K
  2. Create the Soul Institute of Enlightenment Curriculum - $30K

Off-site Community Workshops - $100K

  1. Speaker / workshop facilitator expense - $50K
  2. audio / video - $15K
  3. facility costs - $35K

VIDEO TESTIMONIALS

Would you like proof of our good works and how we help people? Here are some real life examples where people are asked:

  1. What impact has Bridges of Wellness had on you?
  2. What impact could Bridges of Wellness have on others?
  3. In one word, how does Bridges of Wellness make you feel?
You can find these videos here, and please feel free to share them!
https://www.facebook.com/bridgesofwellness/videos

WHAT YOUR SUPPORT MEANS TO US

Your support means the world to us because it helps us to ...

  1. Reach a larger audience.
  2. Help spread more heart focused awareness.
  3. Help people back to their authentic selves.

  4. Help with our call to create a space for conscious awakening.

Thank you so much for your support!

FAQ

Have a question? If the info above doesn't help, you can ask the project creator directly by clicking here --> Send Mail

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

We know this is a big undertaking, and we are ready to meet the challenge! Our strategic and sustainable business plan, marketing and PR strategy, and deep passion for our mission ensures that we will be successful. We’re being realistic with our 5-year length of time for the client/member growth and the construction process. We are confident that there will be a divine sequential unfolding of our success.

Challenges ... having a successful Indiegogo campaign! But we have faith that people will help us reach our goal so we can get our expansion started.

One of the key risks we might face would be the challenge to quickly achieve a steady membership and customer flow for the increased space we will move in to. However, we are confident that with our carefully planned strategic and sustainable business plan, marketing and PR strategy, that we will be successful.

Finding the right personnel quickly who are a fit with our mission and what we are about at Bridges is a key part of our growth. We are confident that we will find the right people as we are clear in our intentions of what we seek. We also have a team of angels who will be on the look out as soon as we give the word!

The length of time of the build out and the challenges and time delays that are a normal part of the construction process. However, we are confident that there will be a divine sequential unfolding of our success.

We will provide updates as the project moves forward as to how these things are progressing.

Would you like proof of our good works and how we help people? Here are
some real life examples 
where people are asked:
What impact has Bridges of Wellness had on you?
What impact could Bridges of Wellness have on others?
In one word, how does Bridges of Wellness make you feel?

You can find these videos here, and please feel free to share them!https://www.facebook.com/bridgesofwellness/videosWHAT YOUR SUPPORT MEANS TO US

Your support means the world to us because it helps us to ...


Reach a larger audience.
Help spread more heart focused awareness.
Help people back to their authentic selves.
Help with our call to create a space for conscious awakening.

Thank you so much for your support!
FAQ

Have a question?
If the info above doesn't help, you can ask the project creator directly by clicking here --> Send Mail
RISKS AND CHALLENGES



We know this is a big undertaking, and we are
ready to meet the challenge! Our strategic and sustainable business plan,
marketing and PR strategy, and deep passion for our mission ensures that we
will be successful. We’re being realistic with our 5-year length of time for
the client/member growth and the construction process. We are confident that
there will be a divine sequential unfolding of our success.
Challenges ... having a successful Indiegogo campaign! But we have 
faith that people will help us reach our goal so we can get our expansion started.  
One of the key risks we might face would be the challenge to quickly 
achieve a steady membership and customer flow for the increased space we will move in to. However, we are confident that with our 
carefully planned strategic and sustainable business plan, marketing and PR strategy, that we will be successful. 
Finding the right personnel quickly who are a fit with our mission and what we are about at Bridges is a key part of our growth. We are confident that we will find the right people as we are clear in our intentions of what we seek. We also have a team of angels who will be on the look out as soon as we give the word!
The length of time of the build out and the challenges and time delays that are a normal part of the construction process. However, we are confident that there will be a divine sequential unfolding of our success.
We will provide updates as the project moves forward as to how these things are progressing.

story:
The idea in brief

Hi, we're Johanna and Will. 

We are two recent university graduates raising funds for a two-week international summer school at Oxford University for students around the globe. We hope to educate tomorrow's leaders in a range of subjects, give young people the leadership skills they need to succeed, and forge cross-border understanding to create a better tomorrow.

With over four years experience running summer schools for young people, we decided to establish our own this year. We have already assembled a number of interested students in our scholarship programme, as well as a venue at the historic Regent's Park College in Oxford University. We have assembled a world-class team of tutors, led by the ex-Chief of Staff of the UN Mission to Sierra Leone and a world-famous human rights lawyer, Edward Fitzgerald QC. Now all we need is you!

 

How can I help?

We now need the next stage of growth capital, to enable us to place a deposit on the rent of rooms for the summer school, place various other deposits, and lead an effective advertising campaign to ensure that we have applicants to the programme who are academically excellent and intellectually curious. 

If we reach our fundraising target, any extra capital raised will be used to increase our pot of scholarship money, allowing us to offer even more places on the course to particularly able and gifted students.

 

What can I get out of it?

We have assembled a range of rewards to say thank you for your generous donations. These range from bumper stickers, tweets with your name in them, to whole scholarships named in your memory.

We are grateful for any capital we can raise, as it will allow us to transform the futures of young people around the world. Armed with the analytical, social and intellectual tools we hope to provide them with, we hope that every one of our graduates will leave Oxford having been challenged, inspired, and ready to lead the world of tomorrow.

We hope that you agree that this is a worthy end in itself, regardless of all the (amazing) goodies we're providing our donors with.

 

What will students be provided with on your course?

We firmly believe that education can change the world. We see this course as an opportunity for students to deepen their understanding about their subject but also about themselves and the world around them. Students will be provided with one-on-one tuition in their chosen 'major subject', but also be challenged with additional 'minor subject' lectures on subjects as varied and diverse as Womens' Studies, Law, Security and Terrorism Studies, and Theology.

We also provide a series of 'Leadership Development' lectures to equip students with the tools they need to become effective communicators and leaders in their home countries.

We base our applications on academic merit and have a small pot of scholarship money available which we are keen to grow.

Is this a one-off summer school?

No. Although at present we are planning to run a single two-week course for 30 students as a pilot, we intend to grow significantly in the next two- to three-years, with plans to run at least three such two-week courses over 2017, providing for at least 90 students. 

The money we raise from you all will be vitally important in ensuring our summer school has lift-off, and will provide the perfect springboard for us to develop and grow further in the future, to provide for generations of students to come.

How can I find out more?

Click here to visit our website - www.oxfordfutureleaders.com.

If you really want to help us, but can't commit any money, then tell your friends about us, tweet a link to our website or share our link on Facebook.

Half the battle is telling people that we're out here, so any help you can provide us with (monetary or otherwise) would be much appreciated!

story:
The reason for the campaign 

After 3 years and an application later, I've been accepted and have enrolled into Peoria Barber College. Making the initial deposit, I've already begun my journey of becoming a licensed barber. The only issue? Long term affordability. With the school reopening, there is no financial aid I could apply for and despite the remaining balance being $5,800, I myself cannot afford to pay that prior to program completion which would also delay taking the state test.

The back story

Few may know that a little over 3 years ago I began taking a genuine interest in the art form that is barbering. The long time running local barber college eventually closed down and the next closest location was a 50minute commute. This wasn't too bad with compliant weather, yet as it stands I reside in Illinois. Aside from the iffy commute, affordability was also an issue. With the school being opened less tan three years, they couldn't officer financial aid as they originally believed they could. 

Fast forward to December of 2015. The local Barber College officially reopened its doors with a well versed master barber as its instructor. My dream and desire to become one of the few female barbers in the area no longer felt deferred!

 Where you come in

As previously stated, my remaining balance to come up with is $5,800. The money goes toward tuition,books and the tools essential to me becoming a barber and mastering the basic skill and techniques to eventually expand upon. This is where I humbly ask for your support. If you'd like to support my journey and are unable to contribute monetarily, I ask that you please pass my message on. As a barber I'll be dedicated to providing quality personal grooming within my community and beyond. This is just the beginning.


My perks are inclusive of haircuts and if by chance I'm unable to travel to you to personally give you a cut, I will offer something in place of that such as my film photography pieces developed by me and framed myself as well.

story:
Summary

Instant messaging changed the world, placing access to friends and strangers at your fingertips. However, we felt instant messaging lacked a certain character and intimacy, that it lacked the fulfillment brought by getting a physical letter or by finding a message in a bottle. With no apps on the market that addressed this, we sought to create our own social media platform that brought physicality and substance to the instant messaging sphere. Enter Bubblgram.

Bubblgram is messaging with a twist. With Bubblgram, messages and photos take the form of “bubbles” that you can fling off of your phone screen. Your bubble then floats in the direction you sent it like a message in a bottle until it hits another user, who can open and read its content.

We are a team of Duke University students who want to change the way people chat. We’ve put hundreds of hours into this project to bring it to life, and we are dedicated in making the best product possible.

What We Need and What You Get

The iOS app is already developed, tested, and ready for the App Store! We’ve developed the app ourselves without spending a single penny so far, just sweat and passion, and we plan to continue to do so. All we’re asking for is $5000 to cover server costs in order to accommodate a larger number of users. In return, not only do you get some awesome swag, but you also help make the Bubblgram experience the best it can be.

Risks & Challenges

Bubblgram is well on its way towards a completed product. We are polishing the iOS app, and the Android app is in development. The main obstacle between us and product delivery are server costs. Getting Bubblgram online is expected to consume a significant and costly amount of server power with each additional user. We are actively working to overcome this hurdle without taking away from the user experience of our app, and we need your help to do it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help spread the word! If you’re excited about Bubblgram, tell your friends about us by sharing this Indiegogo campaign on social media and building the hype. Thank you!
