story:
---si vives en Ecuador y quieres donar en la cuenta bancaria de la escuela, escribe a ninapachaecuador@gmail.com---

ENGLISH/ESPAÑOL BELOW

Brief

We are mothers and fathers who constitute the school governance team of the Educational Community School Nina Pacha, in Quito, Ecuador. A school that provides an education towards freedom, through the deep understanding of the essence of the human being, in a historic, cultural and inclusive context, to strengthen the individual, family and social growth.

This is our history: In 2007, eight families began to gather, organized and studied to start their sons and daughters education. After an intense period of work, study, and share mingas achieved to initiate the operation of the school. It is so for December 10th, when we were fourteen families, the Ministry of Education authorized the establishment and operation of the school Nina Pacha - Light for Time. The school exists because there were families who wanted school. Since then to date some new families have been adding.

Nowadays we are a large extended family of 72 families who have a presence and a very special feeling for school.

Now we want to tell everyone, friends and curious who know about this campaign that we need your contributions to the development and enhancement of school. When school is experiencing a transition, the transition to start to be bigger, but we feel that we need a new impulse, a similar impulse that the founding families made. Therefore, teachers and school governance think this campaign to increase its infrastructure, to definitively start to be an educational reference for the country.

This campaign is important to us because it will allow us to finance the construction of the classrooms we need to have room for all.

Currently, we have classrooms for children from pre-kindergarten through seventh year of basic education, and spaces to share as: garden, sandpit, dining room and playground.

We need to build the classrooms that allow us that the children can stay in school to complete basic education, ie, classrooms for eighth, ninth and tenth basic education, and even have an auditorium for music class and eurythmy.

Breve reseña

Somos madres y padres que conformamos el equipo del gobierno escolar de la Comunidad Educativa Escuela Nina Pacha, en Quito, Ecuador. Una escuela que brinda una educación hacia la libertad, a través del conocimiento profundo de la esencia del ser humano, en un contexto histórico, cultural e incluyente, para fortalecer al crecimiento individual, familiar y social.

Ésta es nuestra historia: En 2007, ocho familias empezaron a reunirse, estudiar y organizarse para iniciar la educación sus hijos e hijas. Luego de un intenso tiempo de trabajo, estudio, mingas y compartir se logró que iniciara el funcionamiento de la escuela. Es así que para Diciembre 10, cuando ya éramos catorce familias, el Ministerio de Educación autorizó la creación y funcionamiento de la escuela Nina Pacha – Luz para el Tiempo. La escuela existe porque hubo familias que quisieron la escuela. Desde entonces hasta la fecha se han ido sumando nuevas familias. Hoy en día somos una gran familia ampliada de 72 familias quienes tenemos una presencia y un sentimiento muy especial por la escuela.


Ahora queremos contarles a todas las personas, amigos y curiosos que conocen de esta campaña que necesitamos su contribución al desarrollo y engrandecimiento de la escuela. Al momento la escuela vive una transición, la transición de empezar a ser grande, pero sentimos que hace falta un nuevo impulso, un impulso parecido al que realizaron las familias fundadoras. Por ello los docentes y el gobierno escolar pensamos en esta campaña, para aumentar su infraestructura, para definitivamente empezar a ser un referente educativo para el país.

Esta campaña es importante para nosotros porque nos permitirá financiar la construcción de las aulas que necesitamos para tener espacio para todos y todas. Actualmente, tenemos aulas para los niños y niñas desde prekinder hasta séptimo año de educación básica, además de los espacios para compartir: huerto, arenero, comedor y patio de juegos. Necesitamos construir las aulas que nos permitan que los niños y niñas puedan quedarse en la escuela hasta terminar la educación básica, es decir, las aulas para octavo, noveno y décimo de educación básica, e incluso, disponer de un auditorio para la clase de música y euritmia.



What we need and what you obtain

Once we build the classrooms which are needed, the Ministry of Education will give us in March 2016 a new operating license from first to tenth year of basic education.

We would very excited if the children end up in Nina Pacha their entire basic education; and thus to comply with the education law.

We need $ 40,000 to build from the ground the infrastructure necessary to renew the operating license: three classrooms and an auditorium.  So far, the parents have worked to prepare the ground where it will be built; other parents who are, architects and engineers have already worked on architectural plans and funded the study of soils and other families have managed to raise ten thousand US dollars with garage sales activities, particualres donations, training lectures and sale of crafts.

In return for your contribution, you can receive one of these rewards: public acknowledgments and mentions in our social networks; drawings, stickers, crafts, school supplies Waldorf and artwork produced by children and families in the school; a journey of exploration and ascentro to a mountain near Quito with the guidance of a professional; recognition in the construction, putting your name in a time capsule to be opened in the 28th birthday of the school or placing your name on the new school auditorium.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Una vez que construyamos las aulas que hacen falta, el Ministerio de Educación nos entregará en Marzo de 2016 un nuevo permiso de funcionamiento de primero a décimo año de educación básica. Estamos muy entusiasmados en que los niños y niñas terminen en la Nina Pacha toda su educación básica; y de esta manera poder cumplir con la ley de educación.

Necesitamos $40,000 dólares para construir desde cero la infraestructura necesaria para renovar el permiso de funcionamiento: tres aulas de clase y un auditorio. Hasta el momento, los padres y madres ya hemos trabajado en preparar la terreno donde se construirá; otros padres, arquitectos e ingenieros, ya han trabajado en los planos arquitectónicos y financiado el estudio de suelos y otroas familias hemos conseguido recaudar diez mil dólares con actividades de venta de garaje, donativos particualres, charlas de formación y venta de artesanías.


En recompensa a tu colaboración, podrás recibir alguna de estas recompensas:  agradecimientos públicos y menciones en nuestras redes sociales; dibujos, pegatinas, artesanías, material escolar Waldorf y obras de arte elaboradas por los niños, niñas y familiares de la escuela; un viaje de exploración y ascentro a una montaña cercana a Quito con la guía de un profesional; reconocimiento en la construcción, colocando tu nombre en una cápsula del tiempo que será abierta en el cumpleaños número 28 de la escuela o colocando tu nombre en el nuevo auditorio de la escuela.



The Impact

This project is valuable to the educational community, for our city and our country because we believe that a school with Waldorf pedagogy transforms the society, we are committed to our environment and promotes generous, compassionate and involved with its present and future citizens. We need that the construction of the classrooms could be possible to fulfill the infrastructure that the education authorities ask us and thus have a new operating license from March 2016 to allow us to work with the full ten years of basic education.

We want our children who are now between first and sixth years to complete their basic education in Nina Pacha.

We know that our children and teachers feel very happy at this school and we believe it is important for them that this school will remain as long as possible, to complete their education and can go on to secondary education as happy  boys and girls in their school career.

El impacto

Este proyecto es valioso para la comunidad educativa, para nuestra ciudad y para nuestro país porque creemos que una escuela con pedagogía Waldorf trasforma a la sociedad, nos compromete con nuestro entorno y promueve unos ciudadanos generosos, compasivos e implicados con su presente y futuro. Necesitamos que la construcción de las aulas sea posible para cumplir con el requerimiento de infraestructura que nos piden las autoridades de educación y así, tener un nuevo permiso de funcionamiento desde Marzo de 2016 que nos permita funcionar con los diez años de educación básica completos. Queremos que los niños y niñas que ahora estan entre primero y sexto año puedan terminar su educación básica en la Nina Pacha.

Sabemos que nuestros hijos e hijas y los maestros y maestras se sienten muy felices en esta escuela y creemos que es importante para ellos que se queden esta escuela el mayor tiempo posible, que completen su formación y que puedan ir a la educación secundaria como chicos y chicas felices de su recorrido escolar.



Risk and challenges

If we fail the overall goal of this campaign, the funds will go to pay the maximum amount of the infrastructure work, and it is to be done will be financed with a new fundraising campaign donations or sponsorship for educational projects.

Riesgos y desafíos
Si no logramos la meta total de esta campaña, los fondos se destinarán a pagar la mayor cantidad posible de la obra de infraestructura, y la que quede por hacerse se financiará con una nueva campaña de recaudación o con donativos de mecenazgo para proyectos educativos.


Other ways you can help

Some people may collaborate with a financial donation of any value, but that does not mean they can not offer additional help:

• Ask all your contacts that spread the campaign and generate echo. We all know that we like to see happy boys and girls. If children of Nina Pacha have full classrooms will be very very happy and excited.

• Remind all your friends and contacts who use sharing tools of Indiegogo

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Algunas personas podrán colaborar con un donativo económico de cualquier valor, pero eso no significa que no puedan ofrecernos ayuda adicional:

  • pídele a todos tus contactos que difundan la campaña y que genere eco. Todos sabemos que nos gusta ver niños y niñas felices. Si los niños y niñas de la Nina Pacha cuentan con las aulas completas estarán muy muy felices y entusiasmados.
  • Recuérdale a todos tus amigos y contactos que usen las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.

Necesitamos construir las aulas que nos permitan que los niños y niñas puedan quedarse en la escuela hasta terminar la educación básica, es decir, las aulas para octavo, noveno y décimo de educación básica, e incluso, disponer de un auditorio para la clase de música y euritmia. 



  








What we need and what
  you obtain
Once we build the
  classrooms which are needed, the Ministry of Education will give us in March
  2016 a new operating license from first to tenth year of basic education.
We would very excited
  if the children end up in Nina Pacha their entire basic education; and thus
  to comply with the education law.
We need $ 40,000 to
  build from the ground the infrastructure necessary to renew the operating
  license: three classrooms and an auditorium. 
  So far, the parents have worked to prepare the ground where it will be
  built; other parents who are, architects and engineers have already worked on
  architectural plans and funded the study of soils and other families have
  managed to raise ten thousand US dollars with garage sales activities,
  particualres donations, training lectures and sale of crafts.
In
  return for your contribution, you can receive one of these rewards: public
  acknowledgments and mentions in our social networks; drawings, stickers,
  crafts, school supplies Waldorf and artwork produced by children and families
  in the school; a journey of exploration and ascentro to a mountain near Quito
  with the guidance of a professional; recognition in the construction, putting
  your name in a time capsule to be opened in the 28th birthday of the school
  or placing your name on the new school auditorium.







Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes Una vez que construyamos las aulas que hacen falta, el Ministerio de Educación nos entregará en Marzo de 2016 un nuevo permiso de funcionamiento de primero a décimo año de educación básica. Estamos muy entusiasmados en que los niños y niñas terminen en la Nina Pacha toda su educación básica; y de esta manera poder cumplir
con la ley de educación.
Necesitamos $40,000 dólares para construir desde cero la infraestructura necesaria para renovar el permiso de funcionamiento: tres aulas de clase y un auditorio. Hasta el momento, los padres y madres ya hemos trabajado en preparar la terreno donde se construirá; otros padres, arquitectos e ingenieros, ya han trabajado en los planos arquitectónicos y financiado el estudio de suelos y otroas familias hemos conseguido recaudar diez mil dólares con actividades de venta de garaje, donativos particualres, charlas de formación y venta de artesanías.

En recompensa a tu colaboración, podrás recibir alguna de estas recompensas:  agradecimientos públicos y menciones en nuestras redes sociales; dibujos, pegatinas, artesanías, material escolar Waldorf y obras de arte elaboradas por los niños, niñas y familiares de la escuela; un viaje de exploración y ascentro a una montaña cercana a Quito con la guía de un profesional; reconocimiento en la construcción, colocando tu nombre en una cápsula del tiempo que será abierta en el cumpleaños número 28 de la escuela o colocando tu nombre en el nuevo auditorio de la escuela.




  







The
  Impact
This project is valuable to the educational community, for our
  city and our country because we believe that a school with Waldorf pedagogy
  transforms the society, we are committed to our environment and promotes
  generous, compassionate and involved with its present and future citizens. We need that the construction of the
  classrooms could be possible to fulfill the infrastructure that the education
  authorities ask us and thus have a new operating license from March 2016 to
  allow us to work with the full ten years of basic education.
We want our children who are now between first and sixth years
  to complete their basic education in Nina Pacha.
We know that our children and teachers feel very happy at this
  school and we believe it is important for them that this school will remain
  as long as possible, to complete their education and can go on to secondary
  education as happy  boys and girls in
  their school career.





El impacto Este proyecto es valioso para la comunidad educativa, para nuestra ciudad y para nuestro país porque creemos que una escuela con pedagogía Waldorf trasforma a la sociedad, nos compromete con nuestro entorno y promueve unos ciudadanos generosos, compasivos e implicados con su presente y futuro. Necesitamos que la construcción de las aulas sea posible para cumplir con el requerimiento de infraestructura que nos piden las autoridades de educación y así, tener un nuevo permiso de funcionamiento desde Marzo de 2016 que nos permita funcionar con los diez años de educación básica completos. Queremos que los niños y niñas que ahora estan entre primero y sexto año puedan terminar su educación básica en la Nina Pacha.
Sabemos que nuestros hijos e hijas y los maestros y maestras se sienten muy felices en esta escuela y creemos que es importante para ellos que se queden esta escuela el mayor tiempo posible, que completen su formación y que puedan ir a la educación secundaria como chicos y chicas felices de su recorrido escolar. 



  








Risk
  and challenges
If we fail the overall goal of this campaign, the funds will
  go to pay the maximum amount of the infrastructure work, and it is to be done
  will be financed with a new fundraising campaign donations or sponsorship for
  educational projects. 





Riesgos y desafíosSi no logramos la meta total de esta campaña, los fondos se destinarán a
 pagar la mayor cantidad posible de la obra de infraestructura, y la que
 quede por hacerse se financiará con una nueva campaña de recaudación o 
con donativos de mecenazgo para proyectos educativos.
  








Other
  ways you can help
Some people may collaborate
  with a financial donation of any value, but that does not mean they can not
  offer additional help:
• Ask all your contacts
  that spread the campaign and generate echo. We all know that we like to see
  happy boys and girls. If children of Nina Pacha have full classrooms will be
  very very happy and excited.






• Remind all your friends and contacts who use sharing tools of
IndiegogoOtras formas en las que puedes ayudarAlgunas personas podrán colaborar con un donativo económico de cualquier valor, pero eso no significa que no puedan ofrecernos ayuda adicional:   pídele a todos tus contactos que difundan la campaña y que genere eco. Todos sabemos que nos gusta ver niños y niñas felices. Si los niños y niñas de la Nina Pacha cuentan con las aulas completas estarán muy muy felices y entusiasmados.  Recuérdale a todos tus amigos y contactos que usen las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.

story:
Your support - Our food

FREE FOOD at the event - by donating and supporting us you get a free meal at the event (see details below). This way you both help the event happen as well as spend your time more efficiently at the event by avoiding queuing for food.  


What We Need 

With the growing size of the event, costs to make it happen also increase. 

With your support we are aiming to raise £5,000 this month that will be directed to organising the event. 

This support will cover cover around 1/3 of total Festival costs this year. 

Funds raised from here will be supplemented by the sponsorship of our long-term partners. 


When and Where?

Festival will be held at: 

UCL (Gower Street, WC1E 6BT) on 20th of March (Sunday) from 12pm to 4pm


The Festival program this year will include:

· Exhibition area: open space area with cultural stands, ad-hoc performances and entertainment

· Folklore concert: featuring visiting Central Asian folk performers, running throughout the Fair

· Sports tournament (Tug of War, Koresh wrestling and more)

· Food court: professional catering of a carefully selected Central Asian menu

· Other entertainment (fun for kids, board games competitions, music and art workshops, photo sets)

Therefore, your donation today will directly contribute to the high-level organisation of this year's event as well as to setting foundations of CASF's future growth.


Briefly about CASF

The Festival is organized by the common efforts of 6 main participating nations representing Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan and Tatarstan, as well as for the first time ever - Iran, Afghanistan and Turkey as observer nations. The team is about to organize the event for the 7th successive year growing from a simple concert to a large-scale festival hosting over 2,000 attendees last year. 


Last year, the event featured Central Asian folk music and dance, first-time Koresh wrestling tournament, a wide selection of traditional food as well as a cultural exhibition. 


The Impact


  • We promote cultural diversity by promoting Central Asian culture in the UK
  • The non-profit sector in the Central Asian region is small, underdeveloped and inefficient. Our solution is to use western style charitable donations of small-scale in Central Asian countries with high level of supervision and involvement. We have made more than 20 donations across 6 participating countries in the last 6 years donating over £50,000. 
  • All profits made from the Festival will be donated towards charities to support orphans problems in the Central Asian region

Team

story:
Short Summary

Karen Hotel School will be a vocational training institute situated within an operating hotel. The Hotel school will provide hospitality training to 40 ethnic Karen students (16 years and above) per year. 

The project is being developed by Karen Enterprises  a Singapore company registered to facilitate Sustainable Development with the Karen State of Burma.

Karen Enterprises was founded by Mr Kurt Hanson (a journalist)  & Nerdah Mya (a KNLA Military Officer) who have known each other for twenty years and are passionate champions for entrepreneurship and job creation in the Karen State of Burma.

We plan to lease an existing operational hotel three star hotel in Myawaddy- Burma and renovate it to add training facilities and student dormitory accommodation for the hotel school.

This project is the first Tourism job creation project for the Karen through Karen Enterprises and will create much needed trained hospitality workers for the planned network of luxury ecolodges through the Karen State.

After nearly seventy years of civil war this project will ensure that the Karen youth are trained and have access to  high skilled, well paid jobs in the emerging Karen and broader Burmese Tourism market.

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising USD$55,000 for the preliminary phase of our project. 

These funds will be used to pay for travel costs (economy airfares) for the Karen State team to visit the Bongde Institute for Hospitality & Tourism (BIHT) in Bhutan as a model of development for Karen State and the hotel school. 

The BHIT team will then travel to the Karen State of Burma to undertake field work for the customisation of their system to local conditions. It should be noted that the Karen & Bhutanese share ancestry and are both descendants of the mongol tribes with the Karen migrating to that part of Burma approx 1000 years ago.

A Cultural Anthropologist Dr. Rikei Crins will be engaged to ensure that authentic Karen customs and culture are integrated into the curriculum, systems and method along with local  venacular architecture.

If we reach the full goal the following will be achieved:

  1. Travel to Bhutan to visit Bongde Institute for Hospitality & Tourism (BIHT)
  2. BIHT team travel to Myawaddy  Burma for local integration of their system
  3. Engagement of cultural anthropologist to ensure authenticity
  4. Scoping & feasibility study for the project by Alumni of the Ecole hoteliers de Lausanne.
  5. Identification of and legal expenses paid  to negotiate 3 star hotel in Myawaddy to lease and renovate for the Hotel School
The perks include:
  • Co-Founder or Ambassador title
  • Invitation to invest in ecolodge network private placement
  • Name on Foundation Plaque in hotel lobby
  • Hotel stays & F&B vouchers
  • Personal thank you on our website
  • Personalised video interview from inaugural students
  • Thank you certificate

The Impact

With the nation-wide ceasefire signed on October 15th and the recent political elections the likelihood of sustained peace is greater. As such refugees on the Thai border have started to return to Burma and the Karen people are now looking to jobs and an economy after nearly seventy years of civil war.

Tourism is one of the lower hanging fruit and there will no doubt be a number of hotels developed through out the region over the coming years. Preparing the youth for jobs through vocational training in the tourism sector is the first step in ensuring peace & prosperity through Sustainable Development.

Kurt is a journalist and has worked for ADB and is currently with ERIA and has been focussed on the ASEAN development issues for twenty plus years.

Nerdah has been providing schooling medical and other essential services through his role in the ethnic Karen military.

I have been working on Sustainable Development projects including hotels in SE Asia for five years and for ten years previously in Northern Australia including to many remote indigenous communities.

Bongde Institute for Hospitality &Tourism have recently developed the and delivered tenor system in Bhutan and are now on their second cohort.

Risks & Challenges

The greatest risk is a return of conflict in the region. Should this occur then we would develop the project in Mae Sot the Thai border sister city to Myawaddy.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support financially then please do tell your friends, share our campaign on social media and come and visit our Hotel and School when we are operational, we look forward to serving you!

story:
About me and the project

Hi, my name is Libor Miksche. Currently working for Oil and Gas industry as CNC/PLC programmer and operator. Previously i have studied Integrated High School of Engineering, which introduced me to wide range of machining, welding, CNC and PLC programming, all sorts of machine technologies and material applications. My College was of the same sort, just deepened my knowladge, and a final bit of my education was The University of Technology, where i studied material engineering.
I have decided to start my small campaign out of my passion for flying and my dream to share it even with those who did not pass their flight school. My plan is to build fully detailed and absolutely realistic flight simulator of one of the most used airliner of our time - Boeing 737NG 800-900. My dream is to bring the experience of simulated flight to the people and let them know what it is like to fly one of these JETs! And what do you know, maybe some of them will decide, that this is exactly what they want to do and with enough skill and intelligence, they will earn their wings.

What We Need & What You Get

There is a huge amount of work to complete this dream. I have the place to put the simulator in, but thats only a start. The shell needs to be moulded and stand fabricated. There are various components, that can be obtained from other sources and are as realistic as if u take one from the plane, but some parts still need to be developped and a bit of programming and tweeking will need to be done as well. There is lots of logic circuits in those parts and all this needs to work seemlesy without a glitch. One of the tough choices will be the vision system and that will be very much dependent on the amount of money contributed by the comunity. The lesser option is to equip the cockpit with LED screens, but if the funds with my contribution allows, there will be curved projection screen with 3 projectors allowing for 220 degree seamless vision. I can not express how much appreciated all the donations will be and i have lots of hope, that this dream can become real and give many people the experience they dream of.

The cost breakdown is as fallows (some pictures as it should look like, when the project is finished included) several of the prices are well based estimate as few parts will have to be made to specification:

Cockpit shell 5600 GBP


Basic frame to hold the panels and avionics: 1500 GBP

Front and aft overhead panel (Holds inertial refference system, all the power switches, engine start swithes, air conditioning control and many more systems) 6500 GBP


Main instrument panel (holds LCD screens, flaps indicator, gear lever) 6000 GBP


Main control panel and electronic flight instrument system control panel 1600 GBP

Control Display Unit x 2 (for programming the flight plan, flight parameters etc.) 2200 GBP


Central display unit 1500 GBP

Throttle quadrant (fully motorized) 2200 GBP


Central pedestal (holds the radios, rudder trim, engine fire protection system etc.) 3200 GBP


Control Yoke (linked pair) 4600 GBP


Ruder pedals + barkes (linked pair) 3600 GBP


Nose gear steering handle (left and right) 800 GBP


2 PC´s needed to run the simulator - 1 to run the avionics and the cockpit 1 to run the actual simulation software (the one for the simulation need to be very powerfull as it need to run equivalent of 3 screens in full HD so will be equipped with 3 top range graphic cards 8 core i7 CPU and 64GB of RAM) approximately 5000 GBP

Lots of minor parts as metal sheeting, cockpit shell underframe for cooling equipment, necessary connections and other materials, two 737 seats and parts of cockpit interior, plus programming are estimated to cost 25 000 GBP

Licences for the sofrware (in this case software for commercial use will be required):

Lockeed martin P3D 1800GBP

ORBX Landscapes, terrain mesh and sceneries 340 - 500 GBP each. There are about 120 of them so some selection will be needed as mostly only the international airports are able to support 737 operations. Still there are about 50 sceneries which will do so and if i would be to buy them all it would total at about 25 000 GBP.


ORBX FTX Stockholm aiport

The realism is just unbeatable.


PMDG 737NGX-800/900 or iFly 737 licence for the plane flight model and functionality to be about 2000 GBP


Some building work will be needed in my place to accomodate the sim. I have lots of space but the ceiling will need to be reised in the simulator room as if incorporated with the amating 220 degrees vision system the height necessary to accommodate the sim is 3,4m, which is a bit higher then current ceiling. The work to do this and possibly incorporate small refreshment bar and toilet is calculated to cost 12 000 GBP. 

I was thinking about this for long time and i would like people visiting the sim to realy feel like home and enjoying themselfs. The workload in the cockpit can be realy high and demanding so after 2 or more hours of flying some refreshment and toilet will realy be appreciated.

The LAST is the BIGGEST

The projection screen with projectors to offer 220 degrees seamless vision is the big deal and the cherry on top. In combination with perfectly crafted, absolutely real looking and working pit, this is what generates the feeling of true flying, because no one can see pixels on the screens there are no edges and you can look about wich changing aspect of the cockpit frame against the screen, just amazing!

Estimated price for this cherry on top is a whooping 54 000 GBP. We can do without, but what a shame it would be?!


The Impact

There are many simmers with only basic equipment who would like to try the real deal and also private pilots, longing to fly something bigger.

It will be a great opportunity for them to enjoy themselves and also gain knowladge of the complex systems and procedures involved in flying such an aeroplane.

I would like to make this not just a sim, but also place where people can meet and share their knowladge and experiences, building friendships, try new things and for some to prepare themselves for their future career as airline pilots.

The potential is great, the knowladge that can be gained even greater, individual development plans can be tailored to suit everyone and if people walk out with smile on their face i will know i have not failed.

There are currently no up to date simulators in large area around Brno, the closest one is in Prague, but that is of the old analogue 737-300 which is realy old.

Risks & Challenges

There are not too many risks, but the challenges are quiet significant. As i said i have my own place, where the sim will be build so that takes away the necessity to rent and possibly get to any kind of trouble because of it.

Many componets have been previously tested in different simulators, but few need to be build from parts, the schematics are quiet simple for someone who has any experience with electonics, but it needs a bit of skill to make them up and get the programming and logic correct in case there is no source code available on the internet.

One of the main challenges will also be time. I aim to have everything completed within 8-10 months after my campaign ends. This involves some structural chages in my house, getting all the parts, the sim building and testing process itself and i consider this quiet a challenge. Thankfuly some friend already offered help with the programming and the rest of building should not be a big issue for engineer like me as from my perspective it nothing more them building big computer with lots of accessories.

Shall any problems arise, then i have few guys to call to action and help to solve any issues with the electronics, in case something needs to be machined or any other problems involving the sim components.


Other Ways You Can Help

I have all pretty much planed, but i may need someone who can help with international contracts and agreements as some parts will be time critical if i am to finish the sim within reasonable time and when i order multiple things from one source, say worth total of £25 000, I need to make sure the deal will be as it should be, no delays and parts in top condition. I do not have much experience with this sort of deals, so someone with knowladge in this sector could be helpful.

One more think will be necessary. To make a realy good Website that includes booking forms and some more features so pooeple who are willing to help with this aspect of the project will be looked for.

Thank You all for the attention, especially to those who made it this far thru the article. If You at least like the idea, do not forget to share! Its important to get attention as many people as possible for the project to be successful. :-) 

If someone would like to invest larger sum then please contact me by PM before doing so, and we can discuss the options, or prehabs pekr tailored to suit your whishes.

All my Perks are designed to be delivered by email.

Nose gear steering handle (left and right) 800 GBP



2 PC´s needed to run the simulator - 1 to run the avionics and the cockpit 1 to run the actual simulation software (the one for the simulation need to be very powerfull as it need to run equivalent of 3 screens in full HD so will be equipped with 3 top range graphic cards 8 core i7 CPU and 64GB of RAM) approximately 5000 GBP
Lots of minor parts as metal sheeting, cockpit shell underframe for cooling equipment, necessary connections and other materials, two 737 seats and parts of cockpit interior, plus programming are estimated to cost 25 000 GBP
Licences for the sofrware (in this case software for commercial use will be required):
Lockeed martin P3D 1800GBP
ORBX Landscapes, terrain mesh and sceneries 340 - 500 GBP each. There are about 120 of them so some selection will be needed as mostly only the international airports are able to support 737 operations. Still there are about 50 sceneries which will do so and if i would be to buy them all it would total at about 25 000 GBP.

ORBX FTX Stockholm aiport


The realism is just unbeatable.

PMDG 737NGX-800/900 or iFly 737 licence for the plane flight model and functionality to be about 2000 GBP



Some building work will be needed in my place to accomodate the sim. I have lots of space but the ceiling will need to be reised in the simulator room as if incorporated with the amating 220 degrees vision system the height necessary to accommodate the sim is 3,4m, which is a bit higher then current ceiling. The work to do this and possibly incorporate small refreshment bar and toilet is calculated to cost 12 000 GBP. 
I was thinking about this for long time and i would like people visiting the sim to realy feel like home and enjoying themselfs. The workload in the cockpit can be realy high and demanding so after 2 or more hours of flying some refreshment and toilet will realy be appreciated.
The LAST is the BIGGEST
The projection screen with projectors to offer 220 degrees seamless vision is the big deal and the cherry on top. In combination with perfectly crafted, absolutely real looking and working pit, this is what generates the feeling of true flying, because no one can see pixels on the screens there are no edges and you can look about wich changing aspect of the cockpit frame against the screen, just amazing!
Estimated price for this cherry on top is a whooping 54 000 GBP. We can do without, but what a shame it would be?!
   The Impact
There are many simmers with only basic equipment who would like to try the real deal and also private pilots, longing to fly something bigger.
It will be a great opportunity for them to enjoy themselves and also gain knowladge of the complex systems and procedures involved in flying such an aeroplane.
I would like to make this not just a sim, but also place where people can meet and share their knowladge and experiences, building friendships, try new things and for some to prepare themselves for their future career as airline pilots.
The potential is great, the knowladge that can be gained even greater, individual development plans can be tailored to suit everyone and if people walk out with smile on their face i will know i have not failed.

There are currently no up to date simulators in large area around Brno, the closest one is in Prague, but that is of the old analogue 737-300 which is realy old.
   Risks & Challenges
There are not too many risks, but the challenges are quiet significant. As i said i have my own place, where the sim will be build so that takes away the necessity to rent and possibly get to any kind of trouble because of it.
Many componets have been previously tested in different simulators, but few need to be build from parts, the schematics are quiet simple for someone who has any experience with electonics, but it needs a bit of skill to make them up and get the programming and logic correct in case there is no source code available on the internet.
One of the main challenges will also be time. I aim to have everything completed within 8-10 months after my campaign ends. This involves some structural chages in my house, getting all the parts, the sim building and testing process itself and i consider this quiet a challenge. Thankfuly some friend already offered help with the programming and the rest of building should not be a big issue for engineer like me as from my perspective it nothing more them building big computer with lots of accessories.
Shall any problems arise, then i have few guys to call to action and help to solve any issues with the electronics, in case something needs to be machined or any other problems involving the sim components.

    Other Ways You Can Help I have all pretty much planed, but i may need someone who can help with international contracts and agreements as some parts will be time critical if i am to finish the sim within reasonable time and when i order multiple things from one source, say worth total of £25 000, I need to make sure the deal will be as it should be, no delays and parts in top condition. I do not have much experience with this sort of deals, so someone with knowladge in this sector could be helpful.
One more think will be necessary. To make a realy good Website that includes booking forms and some more features so pooeple who are willing to help with this aspect of the project will be looked for.
   Thank You all for the attention, especially to those who made it this far thru the article. If You at least like the idea, do not forget to share! Its important to get attention as many people as possible for the project to be successful. :-) If someone would like to invest larger sum then please contact me by PM before doing so, and we can discuss the options, or prehabs pekr tailored to suit your whishes.
All my Perks are designed to be delivered by email.

story:
Short Summary

The Technovation Challenge is the world's largest social entrepreneurship program for young women. It’s goal is to inspire and support girls and women to become creators and innovators. Through Technovation, young girls (aged 10-18) learn how to identify a problem in their community and develop a mobile app to help solve it, following which they launch their startup to bring the app to many more.

In 2014, a team from a small rural village in Moldova competed in this challenge by creating a phone app that provides users with a map of local wells and their water quality. They traveled to the finals in the US and were awarded first prize of $10,000 to implement their project and app idea.

This year Moldova hosted an official regional competition where teams competed to win a spot as a semi-finalist in the Technovation Challenge and to have the opportunity to attend the World Pitch Summit in San Francisco July 10-14.

A team of 3 high school girls from Chisinau were awarded the semi-finalist spot for Moldova from the regional competition. The girls, Livia Chirica, Sanda-Maria Nicolaev and Diana Marusic, mentored by Ana Efros and Bonnie England created a shopping app, designed for social centers to sell handmade goods created by disabled people.  

For some of these girls, this was their 2nd or 3rd time participating in the Technovation Challenge since the program began in Moldova in 2014.

Be part of empowering girls in technology and help send them to San Francisco.


What We Need & What You Get

For every $1 that is donated it will be matched by our supporting partners: Girls Go IT, Sun Communications and Tekwill! (maximum of $5,000) Double your impact! $1 = $2

The money goes to:

  • Technovation Challenge World Pitch Summit registration and participation (workshops, hotel, food, tours, invaluable opportunity to meet and engage with other passionate young women from around the world about entrepreneurship and technology)

  • Airfare from Moldova to San Francisco, CA, USA

  • Visa fees

The Impact

Three young women from Moldova and their mentor will participate in the World Pitch Summit located in San Francisco, CA from July 10-14. This is an incredible opportunity as it gives the girls and their mentor a chance to represent Moldova in this global event as they connect with other girls from around the world who are also passionate about learning and developing tech skills. They will have an opportunity to participate in workshops, field trips to tech companies in Silicon Valley, sightseeing in San Francisco, networking with other teams, and participating in the showcase event where they’ll have an opportunity to share their project and ideas with other teams and tech industry professionals.  

But the impact doesn’t stop there.  After the World Pitch Summit in San Francisco, these young women will return to Moldova with the skills and tools that they learned at the summit.  They will share these new found skills, along with the stories of their experience in order to inspire other young women in Moldova to learn more and pursue careers in ICT.  They will take part assisting in the planning for the 2016-2017 Technovation Challenge Moldova season as well. This would pave a way to see these future leaders apply and share what they learned with others -- to become role models in their communities and in their country.

This is just the beginning of the journey as each girl will continue to learn and inspire others around them.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share the campaign, spread the word

  • ‘Like’ us on facebook

  • Check out and support the app / homemade goods

  • Check out technovationchallenge.org

  • Encourage the young women in your life to try something new that challenges them

                                                               ************
Technovation Challenge este cel mai mare program de antreprenoriat social din lume pentru tinere. Scopul sau este de a inspira si sustine tinerele sa devina creatoare si inovatoare. Participind la Technovation, fetele tinere (cu virsta cuprinsa intre 10-18 ani), invata cum pot identifica o problemă în comunitatea lor și cum ar putea rezolva-o cu ajutorul unei applicatii mobile, după care urmeaza sa lanseze un start-up pentru a dezvolta aplicatia si a o aduce la un alt nivel. 

În 2014, o echipă dintr-un mic sat din Moldova, au participat in program si au creat o aplicatie mobila care oferă utilizatorilor o hartă a fântânilor locale și calitatea apei in acestea. Tinerele s-au clasat in finala (semifinala a fost evaluata virtual) si au calatorit in Statele Unite unde au cistigat premiul mare in valoare de 10.000 $ pentru a pune în aplicare proiectul și a dezvolta aplicatia in continuare.

În acest an Moldova a găzduit o competiție regională oficială pentru a determina cistigatorul semifinalei Technovation și pentru a-i oferi posibilitatea de a participa la World Pitch Summit care va avea loc in San Francisco, 10-14 iulie.

Anul acesta, o alta echipă de 3 fete liceene din Chișinău au devenit semifinalistele Moldovei in competiția regională. Livia Chirică, Sanda-Maria Nicolaev si Diana Marusic, au fost mentorate pe parcursul concursului de Ana Efros si Bonnie England. Fetele au creat o aplicație ce are drept scop facilitarea procesul de realizare a produselor artizanale create de catre persoanele cu dizabilitati din centre sociale. 

Fii parte a acestei campanii. Contribuie la abilitarea tinerelor în tehnologii informationale  și ajuta-ne să le trimitem la San Francisco.

story:
ShareYourNotes.net:

If you’d like to share and have access to research papers and homework texts for free inspiration and information, support ShareYourNotes.net and help bring it into existence.

Studying, researching and taking notes always takes one of two different directions:

  • ·If you need information on a particular subject, and you’d like to have access to documents on any given topic written by other people who have worked on it before you.
  • ·You want to publicly share your notes, essays and research papers, so that a community of people can have access to what you have already produced, and find information on the work that you have already created.

Both directions are part of the school and academic life, but often come with obstacles that shouldn’t exist.

Now imagine that you could have an entirely free platform, where you could upload and share your notes, homework texts, research papers and essays – or download and have full access to these works that have been shared and uploaded by others.

And now imagine that you could do both things for free – with no fees, no costs, no hidden subscriptions, just a free research and note sharing platform that you and everyone else could use with no charges whatsoever.

This is exactly what we want to create through ShareYourNotes.net, the platform where you will be able to sign up for free and always use free of charge – whether you are on the uploading end of your work, or on the downloading end of the work of others.

We decided to create ShareYourNotes.net because we know that a lot of students already need to deal with high tuition fees, and cannot afford yet another expense.

Plus, we feel that knowledge should be free and not monetized – especially when those who want to share it openly agree to make it available to a community of other students and researchers.

This is why we are now seeking to raise $3,000 to develop the platform, namely to help develop the site that we need, face production and maintenance costs, and also to market it as well – so that as many people as possible can learn about it and freely use it!

·Now we invite you to support the development of ShareYourNotes.net, so that you can come to enjoy it soon, by choosing one of the great rewards that we have on offer.

·We also invite you to share this campaign with your friends and family members who may also want to support and enjoy the platform that will make studying, researching and sharing notes easy, simple, and free.

Thank you so much, and we hope to be welcoming you soon, on ShareYourNotes!

story:
Who we are:

Right downtown Traverse City, Michigan, Source is many things: soul boutique, meditation studio, workshop space. But whatever we are doing in the front or the back of the house we have the same vision: peace, clarity, joy, community, and gratitude. We have a terrific, friendly co-op of people who teach classes, volunteer in the store, and offer healing services. If we’ve learned anything since opening last July, it’s that people are lovely, Traverse City is amazing, and when we create the intention of making a better world, it simply must begin with our own hearts and minds.

A Big, Groovy Idea:

We offer five meditation classes a week, all teaching different technique and styles, and those who attend tell us what it does for them. People report back that the peace and well-being cultivated in meditation transforms the rest of their week. They are sleeping better, feeling better, and seeing life through gentler, brighter goggles. How wonderful!

Right now four of the five classes have a cost, much like a yoga studio or gym. But, one class does not: Sunday morning Seva. Seva means community service, and community service means free. This class is our most popular, of course.

We realized that if we really want to impact our community in this good way, all our meditation classes need to be free! Anyone who wants to learn should be able to come, and those who already have a meditation practice can find their tribe. Life can feel busy, rushed, loud, but we can learn the tools to quiet and reset our minds and revitalize our bodies. We think there are a lot of folks in our community who would like to come but find the fee prohibitive. Well, let’s just fix that.

With $15,000 Source can offer a year's worth of meditation classes at no-cost, and our community reach will be so much greater! 

The Impact

There is no denying the scientific benefits of meditation. Once seen as something reserved for yogis, gurus, and people who said “Ommmm” a lot, meditation has come mainstream, and with more families reporting stress, more people struggling with anxiety, depression or illness, it couldn’t have come at a better time. The medical community tells us that just 15 minutes of meditation begins to:  

·  Boost immunity and energy levels

·  Reduce blood pressure

·  Support healthy brains

·  Lessen chronic pain

·  Increase mental focus, memory retention and recall

·  Increase good decision making

·  Boost creativity

·  Heal the nervous system

·  Lessen worry, anxiety, impulsivity

·  Lessen stress, fear, loneliness, depression

·  Enhance self-esteem and self-acceptance

·  Improve resiliency against pain and adversity

·  Increase optimism and relaxation

·  Help curb emotional eating and support addiction recovery

Why Source?

Some ask us why they should come to meditation class when they can already do it at home for free. To that we ask, well are you? Are you carving out the time and space for a meditation practice? If they say yes, we say hooray! But, most of the time they say no to that question. Families, work, chores, Netflix, our own brains… the distractions are many.

Meditation is easier to learn, more enjoyable and effective when done in an intentional spot with other like-minded friends. We won't get too woo-woo on you here, but something powerful happens to the energy in a room with several people come together for peace. We have found the benefits to be exponential!

Not to mention the instructional component Source offers. While it sounds simple enough, quieting the ever-spinning mind and possibly stressed out body can be tough. Our qualified teachers are licensed counselors, yogis, and people with a decade long practice themselves; they have the tools, techniques, support and encouragement to help you establish your own practice or deepen an existing one.

Let's Do This Together! 

If you think this would be a benefit to the good people of Traverse City, please help us by donating what you can. We’ve put together a fun list of incentives from our studio and our boutique that you might like. Watch the video above to learn more about them.

If you can’t donate right now, perhaps you will consider sharing our project on social media or telling your friends. 

Have a beautiful day!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Liam Vandewalle, a final year student studying biomedical science at the University of Edinburgh and a long-time Youth Initiative Programme (YIP) hopeful. Now that I'm finishing my bachelor's degree, I'm looking to take the next step in my life and YIP is the inspiring, challenging and rewarding path I don't only want to take, but feel I need to take. It's a programme that provides youth with an education that is lacking in the world today, an education that addresses not only academic intelligence, but also creative and emotional intelligence. I feel that by developing these and other areas of myself in a holistic way, I can learn things that will help me achieve my potential, and help me give back to society on a scale that is impossible as I write this. You can find the YIP website at www.yip.se.
In order to raise the money I need to attend the programme, I will be going on a 10 day solitary walk through two of Bulgaria's National Parks (Rila and Pirin). The hike will include climbing the first and third highest mountains in the Balkan region (Musala in Rila and Vihren in Pirin). I have organised travel there and back so that it is at a minimal price (hitchhiking), and have planned the route myself to avoid paying for a guide; so any money that will be given will go towards YIP and not the trip.

What We Need & What You Get

The total cost of the programme is roughly €10,000. I have been working during my full time studies, and will be working for two months during the summer to raise the funds. On top of this, I will unfortunately still be around €2500 (~£2000) short of the €10,000 goal. This €10,000 covers accommodation, programme costs and organic food for the 10 months of the programme. For specifics about payment, you can check out the YIP section of the website at http://yip.se/application/costs_and_finance/.

As a big 'thank you!' to anyone who gives a generous donation, I will give you a personalised gift or a letter expressing my thanks! These can range from letters or poems that I will write myself, to me getting crafty with wood or knitting you something (I'm still pretty amateur) and gifting it to you! Of course, if you'd like anything else in return, just ask me and I'll let you know if I can do it! 

If I don't reach the £2000 goal, all of the money that I have earned will definitely go towards YIP anyway! Anything that I raise above £2000 will go to paying my parents back the amount they have supported me so far!


The Impact

Your contribution will make a world of change, not only to me but to the people who I will touch as a result of being a participant. I view this programme as providing an education that benefits not only me, but gives me the opportunities and tools to change hundreds, thousands or millions of lives for the better throughout my own life. Without this programme, initiatives that I have or might have in the future might not be recognised as fully and wholly. As an example of this, this year's YIP (YIP8) sent participants to volunteer in community project and help people in many corners of the globe, including South Africa, Nepal, California and Brazil. In these places, the participants used their heads, hands and hearts to make a difference to those who needed it. As well as this, they have fund-raised enough money to go and visit and help the refugees in Calais (their campaign is at https://startsomegood.com/yippiesinthejungle). By contributing to my participation fee, you are giving both me and those I will help now and in the coming years something money cannot buy, and, if you do choose to give, I would not be able to express my thanks enough.
Risks & Challenges
One of the biggest challenges I feel exists in achieving my goal is starting this fundraiser. Since I've never fundraised like this before, it is a scary situation and exposing yourself like this feels very new! I am also sure I will face challenges during my time in Bulgaria. Hitchhiking from Edinburgh to Sofia in the first place is quite challenging, and will be the longest hitchhike I have done to date, and the walking itself will be mentally as well as physically challenging. But I am determined to overcome these challenges if it means it will bring me closer to being a YIP9 participant.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you aren't able to contribute, or if you've made the decision not too, thank you for reading all of this! I respect any decision you have come to! If you would like to contribute in other ways, you can share this campaign with other people, this would also be very appreciated and help me in many ways! Thank you again!
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Liam Vandewalle, a final year student studying biomedical science at the University of Edinburgh and a long-time Youth Initiative Programme (YIP) hopeful. Now that I'm finishing my bachelor's degree, I'm looking to take the next step in my life and YIP is the inspiring, challenging and rewarding path I don't only want to take, but feel I need to take. It's a programme that provides youth with an education that is lacking in the world today, an education that addresses not only academic intelligence, but also creative and emotional intelligence. I feel that by developing these and other areas of myself in a holistic way, I can learn things that will help me achieve my potential, and help me give back to society on a scale that is impossible as I write this. You can find the YIP website at www.yip.se.
In order to raise the money I need to attend the programme, I will be going on a 10 day solitary walk through two of Bulgaria's National Parks (Rila and Pirin). The hike will include climbing the first and third highest mountains in the Balkan region (Musala in Rila and Vihren in Pirin). I have organised travel there and back so that it is at a minimal price (hitchhiking), and have planned the route myself to avoid paying for a guide; so any money that will be given will go towards YIP and not the trip.   What We Need & What You Get The total cost of the programme is roughly €10,000. I have been working during my full time studies, and will be working for two months during the summer to raise the funds. On top of this, I will unfortunately still be around €2500 (~£2000) short of the €10,000 goal. This €10,000 covers accommodation, programme costs and organic food for the 10 months of the programme. For specifics about payment, you can check out the YIP section of the website at http://yip.se/application/costs_and_finance/.
As a big 'thank you!' to anyone who gives a generous donation, I will give you a personalised gift or a letter expressing my thanks! These can range from letters or poems that I will write myself, to me getting crafty with wood or knitting you something (I'm still pretty amateur) and gifting it to you! Of course, if you'd like anything else in return, just ask me and I'll let you know if I can do it! 
If I don't reach the £2000 goal, all of the money that I have earned will definitely go towards YIP anyway! Anything that I raise above £2000 will go to paying my parents back the amount they have supported me so far!

    The Impact
Your contribution will make a world of change, not only to me but to the people who I will touch as a result of being a participant. I view this programme as providing an education that benefits not only me, but gives me the opportunities and tools to change hundreds, thousands or millions of lives for the better throughout my own life. Without this programme, initiatives that I have or might have in the future might not be recognised as fully and wholly. As an example of this, this year's YIP (YIP8) sent participants to volunteer in community project and help people in many corners of the globe, including South Africa, Nepal, California and Brazil. In these places, the participants used their heads, hands and hearts to make a difference to those who needed it. As well as this, they have fund-raised enough money to go and visit and help the refugees in Calais (their campaign is at https://startsomegood.com/yippiesinthejungle). By contributing to my participation fee, you are giving both me and those I will help now and in the coming years something money cannot buy, and, if you do choose to give, I would not be able to express my thanks enough.

Risks & Challenges


One of the biggest challenges I feel exists in achieving my goal is starting this fundraiser. Since I've never fundraised like this before, it is a scary situation and exposing yourself like this feels very new! I am also sure I will face challenges during my time in Bulgaria. Hitchhiking from Edinburgh to Sofia in the first place is quite challenging, and will be the longest hitchhike I have done to date, and the walking itself will be mentally as well as physically challenging. But I am determined to overcome these challenges if it means it will bring me closer to being a YIP9 participant.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute, or if you've made the decision not too, thank you for reading all of this! I respect any decision you have come to! If you would like to contribute in other ways, you can share this campaign with other people, this would also be very appreciated and help me in many ways! Thank you again!

story:
• My name Fiona Compton and I am a London based Photographer/Film Maker, activist and teacher. Much of my work is designed to be colourful, vibrant and a reflection of my heritage. As a photographer and filmmaker I choose to work on not only visually inspiring displays but social issues that touch people.  Last year I launched a campaign combating violence against women, which has been hugely successful in the past year winning several awards and reaching millions of people worldwide. 
  • I am out to introduce innovative and creative ways to teach children and the general pubic about Caribbean and African history and heroes who's revolutionary work made waves across the world. Through Visual art, costume design and production and original literature formed by a collective of some the best creative practitioners from the Caribbean, the project will go  on tour around schools, and galleries, accompanied with hands on workshops to help train children and young people varied practical creative platforms.  
  • Important moments in history surrounding the Caribbean and Africa are severely unrepresented in school curriculums both in the U.K and the Caribbean and my aim is to change that. To offer children an alternative hero or heroine to look up to, whilst educating about important historical and iconic moments that have been forgotten. For the most part children are of the belief that slavery is all that we come from - which is not true! 
  • We are out to uplift and educate children and young adults through creativity and hands on workshops across the UK and Caribbean. Teaching Children costume design and production, creative writing, story telling through the visual arts, photography, and about important but widely unknown freedom fighters. Learning directly from the varied professionals children will leave the workshop feeling empowered as well as having learnt several new skills. 
  • VISUAL IMPACT . The end goal is to produce a visual showcase bringing to life these most important heroes for children to remember and look up to. 
  • VITILIGO AWARENESS . One of our esteemed designers who I am collaborating with - Darcel de Vlugt lives with Vitiligo. Extremely vocal about the condition, Darcel has spoken on NBC and Ted Talks about her experiences. She will also double up as the model as we recreate Snow White as part of the series.  An opportunity to show children beauty in all forms, acceptance and awareness of the condition, and a celebration of the many tones that fall under the Caribbean umbrella .

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • $4500 to pay our creatives. As the director I will be making no financial gain on this project, I myself will be making a personal investment to cover all the other outside costs surrounding getting this project off the ground and into schools. The $3000 has been the final pricing to pay the 3 very talented costume designers from the Caribbean to design and produce 10-12 original costumes for the Fairy Tales. $1000 allocation to pay our creative writers as they pen the cohesive bond to tie all the pieces together. I strongly believe in paying those who put in the hard work! $500 to contingency float to cover any potential hurdles along the way.
  • $1500 Airfare and basic accommodation  I have done all the ground work, in depth historical research, liaison with the creatives, and schools, location scouting, and investment behind needed equipment. I just need to get there to shoot the final images.  Accommodation will be supporting a local Air BNB household - as I prefer to support smaller businesses than fancy hotels !
  • $1500 Printing costs - we want to make in impact - for the visuals to be BIG and BOLD, to make a statement as soon as you enter the room. We want children to view the alternative hero as large scale vibrant works of art that will imprint a positive memory to real life revolutionaries from our beautiful past. We would also like to provide our audience with educational memoirs to take home, such as postcards or mini prints with fun historical facts.
  • The funds will be placed into a savings account - to keep the project's transparency, the details of the funds whereabouts will be made available to contributors - whilst I continue to fund raise elsewhere, I will not give up until the project is off the ground! 
  •   Contributions of $100 will guarantee you an A4 canvas print of your choice, $200 and up will guarantee you a giant A1 mounted canvas print of your favourite image of the series, (please see my website www.fionacompton.com to see some examples of what you will get in return for your support) 
  • What happens if we pass our target?      This  will allow us to reach out to more schools, create and develop more arts concepts and the processes of where the money will go will be documented through our social media campaign. 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • You can help children and young adults learn about some of the greatest revolutionary real life heroes who made an impact not only in the Caribbean and Africa but their actions made waves across the world . 
  • Help to empower and educate people through uplifting story telling through visual arts and literature.
  • Hands on training to teach diverse creative platforms across schools and the learning facilities.
  • offering designers an alternative platform to build an audience for their creative work. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Point us in the direction of where we can get funding to help the project grow even further! We want to continue to spread this means of education to more schools, more events, more galleries and do more workshops to push forward our quest to educate and create !

Hands on training to teach diverse creative platforms across schools and the learning facilities.
offering designers an alternative platform to build an audience for their creative work.

story:
My name is Marie-Provence, I am French. I was asked for my studies in entrepreneurship to complete an internship, I didn't know that I was embarking on such an amazing adventure ! 
This is it, I am in Cape Town, South Africa, in the township called Khayelitsha, with the awesome team of 18 Gangster Museum, trying my best to help such inspiring and loving people. But don't get me wrong, I am not asking for your help because they are nice, I am asking for your help because I believe strongly in what they have accomplished and they HAVE TO do more, for the sake of their community and more...

By contributing, you will not just improve a concept, you will also help children making the right choice, ex-offenders staying in the right path, and people opening their mind towards underpriviledge communities in South Africa. 

Concretly, we choose to keep the symbolic number of 18, that represents hope and change for the museum, to ask you 1 800€. This money will allow us to buy and furnish a new container to offer further activities such as a VR system or archives. The idea is to extend the museum and offer a service as complete and relevant as possible, to touch as much people as we can. 

I know that if  we combine our efforts we can easily make it, but to motivate you even more, few surprises are waiting for you in order to make you understand better the purpose of 18 Gangster Museum, make you discover the South African culture and make you part of the family !

What's in for you ? Except the gifts, I can guarantee this good action will make you feel good about yourself and you will even be able to brag around your friends about this amazing cause you got involved in ! But more importantly, I hope you will be able to see how valuable this initiative is for Cape flats youth and community in general, I hope you will be able to see how valuable it is to try to stem this plague called gangsterism that impedes South Africa to bright as much as it should.   

For the one who cannot help us with actual money, a simple share or like on our facebook page will help us to spread the word..!

story:
What is Fungi Academy?

We are a nomadic collective of visionary movers and shakers focused on sharing the skills and knowledge of mushroom cultivation for food, medicine, and bioremediation (mycoremediation). Since the beginning of this year we have been developing a community living and learning space in San Marcos, Lake Atitlan, Guatemala, inspiring both locals and travelers through weekly public workshops.


 

Empowering and Inspiring through Knowledge

Our mission is to bring this empowering knowledge to as many people as possible through a travelling hub for learning and healing. We want to teach straightforward and sustainable mushroom cultivation and mycoremediation to local communities, permaculture projects, areas struck by ecological disaster, as well as transformational festivals throughout Central and South America. 

With Your Help We Can...

Empower those most in need in regions deeply threatened by economic and environmental collapse brought about by climate change, and inspire those most capable of growing this knowledge further; the indigenous, the farmers, the communities, the travelers and of course, the dreamers and the wonderers.

 

What We Need 

We want to buy a secondhand school bus, convert it to run on bio-diesel collected from used cooking oil, and equip it with a portable mushroom cultivation laboratory, a library, a makerspace, and more. We also need to raise money for the journey itself, paying for the bus to cross the Panama canal and the other borders of Central and South America. 

Itemized breakdown:

BUS: A used American Bluebird schoolbus

ENGINE + BODY MODIFICATIONS:Bus interior conversion to a laboratory, culture incubation system, makerspace area for collective problem solving and idea generation. Engine modified to run on used cooking oil that we will collect from restaurants along our journey,

WATER SYSTEM: Reverse osmosis water filter + water tank and pipeing.

LAB EQUIPMENT: a HEPA filter Flowhood, sterilizer unit, liquid culture station, lab tools.

LIBRARY + MEDIA EQUIPMENT:  Books, teaching equipment, projector, camera.

TRAVEL: The cost to cross the Panama canal as well as other border crossings.

WORKSHOP + COMMUNAL TENT: Two large durable tents for workshops and living.

PERK FULLFILMENT: Production and shipping costs for our perks.

TAXES+FEES: The Indiegogo and Paypal taxes and fees.

 

The Perks for Supporting Us 

New freshly oven baked stickers just came in. These are limited edition printed only once. Grab yours now.

We're really happy to partner up with The Fungus Among Us to bring you a special Fungi Academy edition of their adult coloring book. 

Help us run more workshops in schools we visit and get kids interested in the science of shrooms.

For the more studious and industrious among you, we're putting together a video course and a step-by-step ebook guide on how to build your own spore culture lab. 

Go down to Guatemala and enjoy the amazing transformational Festival Cosmic Convergence. We will be present there with our bus giving workshops and spreading the good vibe. 

Fungiculture Training Course in magical Lake Atitlan, Guatemala. Come and immerse yourself in the fantastic world of Mushroom Cultivation.This intensive course will give you all the hands-on experience and knowledge to grow your own mushrooms successfully. We limit our group size to the maximum of 6 people to provide the most valuable experience for our course participants and give you the most personal education possible.

We're most excited to invite those who feel the calling to join the Fungi family aboard the bus and travel with us for a week once we hit the road! Food, camping gear, cacao campfires and good vibes... all supplied! 

Finally our most profound reward. We come to you - wherever you are in the World. To build you your own mushroom laboratory and grow facilities. We provide you with everything you need to successfully grow mushrooms. Personal education, all equipment you need and the set up in your place. You will be able to grow your own food for your family and friends. Able to cultivate powerful natural medicine. Use fungi in your gardens for bigger yields and healthier plants. 

If we don't reach our goal...

In the event that we don't raise all the money we need for the bus, we will put the funds we do get towards creating more educational resources and programs for communities closer to us here in Guatemala. This will include developing a full Spanish language course that we will offer online in video format, as well as more hands-on workshops run through community impact centers we connect with.

Why a bus?

Our mission is to empower as many people as possible, with the help of fungi to live in healthy symbiosis with nature. Since the beginning of the year we have been teaching practical skills of mushroom cultivation, mycoremediation and responsible use of sacred mushrooms as medicine in Lake Atitlan, Guatemala. The bus can make a far greater impactby bringing this knowledge to many communities in need around Central- and South-America.

We believe that a Mobile Fungi Academy bus will help open-source mycology to spread like a social mycelial net.

Where are we going?

We want to teach straightforward and sustainable mushroom cultivation and mycoremediation to local communities, permaculture projects, areas struck by ecological disaster, as well as transformational festivals throughout Central and South America. We will be traveling from California to Mexico, Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras, Nicaragua, Costa Rica, Panama, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru and maybe to the Moon.

When do we start?

In November, 2016 we start from California going through Mexico to Guatemala for the new years eve. We will spend 2017 spreading the good mycelium in Central-America and by the end of 2017 we want to cross from Panama to Colombia. 

Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest challenges we face is deciding where to go in order to have the greatest impact possible. We wont be able to bring the bus everywhere, and we want to make sure the knowledge and culture exchange we create in an area continues to grow and evolve long after we leave.  To address this, we are dedicating many months to research and communication with impact centers and influential community and tribal leaders. Our website will invite visit requests through a form and slowly come to house a database of projects and resources all publicly available through an interactive map. 

Bus maintenance, travel costs, living expenses and emergency funds also come into play, which is why we've created different contingency buffers in our campaign and plan to continue accepting donations through Patreon and Paypal once this campaign finishes.. 

The Fungi Team

Other Ways You Can Help Us

We welcome collaborations of all kinds! If you have items to donate or resources to share that can help our mission, please contact us at welcome@fungiacademy.com.

Risks & Challenges
One of the biggest challenges we face is deciding where to go in order to have the greatest impact possible. We wont be able to bring the bus everywhere, and we want to make sure the knowledge and culture exchange we create in an area continues to grow and evolve long after we leave.  To address this, we are dedicating many months to research and communication with impact centers and influential community and tribal leaders. Our website will invite visit requests through a form and slowly come to house a database of projects and resources all publicly available through an interactive map. 
Bus maintenance, travel costs, living expenses and emergency funds also come into play, which is why we've created different contingency buffers in our campaign and plan to continue accepting donations through Patreon and Paypal once this campaign finishes.. 
The Fungi Team


Other Ways You Can Help Us
We welcome collaborations of all kinds! If you have items to donate or resources to share that can help our mission, please contact us at welcome@fungiacademy.com.

story:
Local Hub

Local Hub Bicycle Company, a Deep Ellum based community-centric bike shop, wants to find a way for all Dallasites to incorporate bicycles and learning into their daily life. The owners and employees are enthusiastic about the bookbike project and want to help facilitate building the trailer and raising funds. No matter why or how you ride, we believe that a bicycle makes you happier and increases your connection to the people around you. The bookbike trailer will let us promote cycling as an activity for everyone to enjoy in their own way, and to continue to build community around bicycles.

Dallas Public Library

The Dallas Public Library is excited that Local Hub is helping us extend our reach into the community and grow our relationships with the people we serve. Such a unique, flexible vehicle will allow a cost-effective, environmentally friendly way for our staff to pedal around the city to local parks, festivals, parades, and community gathering places. This agile, human-powered mobile library outpost lets us provide pop-up access to library materials and services and represent the library in a variety of urban settings. Our goal will be to provide a fun and positive experience with the library and bicycles that people can tell their friends about.

What It Takes

We need to raise enough for:

Detailed shop-drawing plans of the bookbike trailer from StreetSmart Trailers ($400)

Surly Ted trailer and hitch (wholesale cost $595)

Materials for trailer (Lumber, hardware, paint)  ($500)

Labor and access to carpentry tools ($500)

Graphics (Cut vinyl decals) ($100)

Any amount you can donate in support of this project, no matter how large or small, will go directly towards building the BookBike with no overhead. Any funds not used in building the BookBike will be set aside for spare parts and maintenance. 

If you'd like to contribute in another way, you can demonstrate your support for this project by sharing this page with your friends. Help us spread the word far and wide!
