story:
WigiWamas are handcrafted with love and meant to be the latest addition to your kid’s playroom or nursery. The WigiWama can serve as the centre of your child’s playtime, an escape spot for fantasies and a place to make childhood memorable and full of shared happy moments with the little one’s.

With a Wigiwama teepee, the number of possible uses, experiences to be made, and emotions to be felt are just as rich and broad as the design and color theme options. 

WigiWama is not only for indoor adventures. It compliments any outdoor scenery, from sandy beaches to that  perfect spot in the green park. 

WigiWama is made from natural origin materials. We use 100% cotton fabric both – for the teepee itself and the padded floor mat. We also use thick cotton canvas for durability and delicate bright and vibrant fabrics for a creative look. The padded floor mat filling is made of synthetic fibre – it can be washed frequently after all the fun activities and is also hypoallergenic. Specially designed smoothly sanded and lightweight wooden poles are made from birch.

We designed the WigiWama teepee with easy assembly and disassembly in mind.
With our specially designed collapsible wooden poles, the installation is a pleasing task that takes only a few minutes.

 

Nicole Manser    
So in Love! It is so easy to put together! Thank you

Haley Wubs    
Cuter than I could have imagined! Perfect size for a small growing child. The shipping took a bit of time since I'm in the US. But it was totally worth it! My niece is gonna love it! Thanks!

Jennie Crowe
Exceptional work, sweet to work with & can't wait for my kids to see what Santa made for them. Thank you all so much.

Alex Caschera
Excellent construction, fantastic quality, fast turnaround. So pleased with my purchase! Thank you!​

Check out our: instagram.com/wigiwama_

WigiWama offers four different collections of teepees, with design themes from stringent, classical looks, to warm pastel hues, all the way to absolute bursts of color. The WigiWama can fit with the decor of any nursery or room and look like it was made to be there. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

*WigiWama ships worldwide, and shipping costs are different for each country. You can check shipping costs by typing your country Shipping is calculated at the checkout.

 

 

Are you a retailer who loves our teepees? Perhaps you’re a small boutique shop with all things for little ones? Or, you’re just wondering about ordering WigiWama in bulk? Write us at wholesale@wigiwama.com

Let's get to know each other. We are the 2 young mothers – Anastasia and Santa – behind WigiWama who are raising three kids together – Timofey, Alexandra and Oliver. Teepee is a great way for us to live out the fantasies of childhood with our kids. And, even though we are newbies both to parenthood and entrepreneurship, we do what we do with great passion and love for every detail. 

Please send your questions to hello@wigiwama.com

 

For over a year, Wigiwama has brought the best kids teepees to happy customers around the world. Now we want to step up and bring Wigiwama to a broader audience. But, in order to achieve this, we need to meet a certain minimum quota with the cherry-picked manufacturer. Manufacturing is a process where many things can go wrong, but we already have the experience necessary and have formed alternate Plans B and C for all potential eventualities. We’re confident that our manufacturer can handle the size of the production we hope to achieve with this campaign – we’ve identified a partner with the capacity to scale-up easily – and we plan to personally oversee every important stage of the manufacturing process.

What do I get when I order a WigiWama teepee?
Your teepee set includes: fabric teepee tent with a window, padded floor play mat and cushion cover and 4 stackable birch poles. 

What materials do you use to make your products?
For our WigiWamas we use 100% cotton fabric. Our birch poles are collapsible to meet shipping requirements and to ease up the assembly and storage if required. 

The padded mat is made of the 100% cotton fabric and has a nice soft padding inside. The back side of the mat is made of the 100% cotton fabric. It fits perfectly inside the teepee. The padded floor mat filling is synthetic fibre - it can be washed frequently after all the fun activities and it is also hypoallergenic.

How big are your WigiWamas?
Currently we offer one size. The poles are 1.65m long and once fanned out, they end up being approximately 1.35m tall. On the inside, at the highest point of the fabric it is 1.2 m. The base size of the teepee is approximately 40'' (100cm) wide and 40'' (100cm) deep. Cushion cover measures approximately 16"*16" (40*40cm).

Where do you manufacture your WigiWama teepees?
Our teepees are handcrafted and made with love in Riga, Latvia.

When will I receive my order (Early Christmas shipping)?
We will try our best to deliver your very own WigiWama teepee before Christmas!

When will I receive my order (Worldwide shipping)?
We plan for all of our Indiegogo backers (Worldwide shipping) to receive their WigiWama teepees during January of 2017.

What should I do if I’ve bought one WigiWama and want to buy more teepees?
Simply contribute to one more perk.

Ok, A LOT more!
Please contact us through email: wholesale@wigiwama.com

Can I get a refund?
Pre-orders are not refundable. By making a contribution to this campaign, you acknowledge and understand that you are contributing to a work-in-progress and not making a direct purchase. For more details, please see Indiegogo's Terms of Use. 

There was an error with my contribution. What happened?
Please refer to this article on common contribution errors and the steps to resolve them.

What about additional taxes, duties, or VAT?
The backer is responsible for paying any additional tax or duty fees.

I don't see my answer here. Who do I contact?

story:
Hello, everybody! My name is Tanusha. I am 19 years old and I am from Ukraine.)

I study at the Faculty of International Economics and Law. Now I'm a student of a second year  education.    My dad left us a year ago and my mother doesn’t have  enough money to pay for my education. Because of lack of money I may to quit the university...  I don’t want this unhappy end . I love to study and I want to get this education! This economic-law degree is my dream and my goal  since my 14 years old!  

From fourteen age I had attended a lot of courses of  business, time management, psychology and  journalism  to develop  myself and  to get  the practical skills of  communication  with people. I need the knowledge of this economic-law education  to become a successful business woman. This let me to help my mother to open in my city a  unique rehabilitation and developing  center for parents with children who have autism, mental , speech  and physical retardation in their phyco-development.

My mom is a high-quality child- psychologist.  During  20 years she works with children which have these problems. My mom developed her original method of rehabilitation these children. She published her  book about this method and her dream is to open the private center for such families.

So, I really want to know how to start private business, how  to open and to manage this center . This knowledge I can get at my university! Also, I  want to get the education of  accounting and taxation courses to be able to calculate income and expenses. 

That is why, it is very important for me to finish  my  university education  and through my  work to be useful to other people.
 

Here's a breakdown of my  school costs for next 3 years :

                                              Tuition                                       7,000 $

                                              Room and Board                    3,500 $

                                              Books, living expenses          4,000 $

                                              Accounting Courses                 160$

                                              Courses oratory                        100$

                                               TOTAL NEED:                      14,760 $
                                              
                                                    Thank you for your support!

        Truly to say, I can’t do it without your help. I really need your support! Please, help me .

If you can not help me with money, leave a comment with the wish of "good luck" and tell  about this video to your friends. I will be very pleased to know that  someone believes in me!))

 I really want to change for the better not only my life. Help me, please!

     Thank you!

story:
Verlies je geld doordat je niet lean werkt?

 

Is je bedrijf in gevaar?

Dat hoeft niet zo te zijn. De oplossing vindt je in het succesvol implementeren van lean management.  Lean wil zeggen zoveel mogelijk waarde leveren voor de klant en verspillingen elimineren.

Hoe implementeer je lean op een succesvolle wijze?

In ons boek nemen we je mee in de reis die wij hebben gemaakt tijdens het implementeren van lean bij Docdata. Het geeft je een praktische aanpak, do's en don'ts en de formats die wij hebben ontwikkeld.

Uniek aan het boek is de blik naar de toekomst. Wat werkt wel en wat werkt niet voor de nieuwe generatie.

Wij willen onze kennis graag delen zodat ook jij successen kan gaan vieren in jouw organisatie!

Wij hebben meer dan 20 jaar ervaring in de logistieke sector met het geven van trainingen en het begeleiden van organisaties bij het verbeteren van processen, het optimaliseren van de werkplekorganisatie en het stimuleren en motiveren van de medewerkers naar een lean cultuur. Het resultaat is kortere doorlooptijden, een hogere kwaliteit, lagere kosten en elke dag verbetering.

Om het boek uit te geven hebben wij jouw donatie nodig. Kies de perk die bij je past en doneer vandaag nog jouw bijdrage! 

 Voor een impressie van docdata zie onderstaande video.

Je kan ons ook enorm helpen door onze campagne te delen in jouw netwerk. 

Hartelijk dank voor je hulp!

Caroline van der Plas en Esther Schuurmans

story:
Trish Herrera, a founding member of legacy Houston art punk band Mydolls (1978-present) and owner of Wavelength hair salon, and her Golden Retriever rescue Angel, Houston's Official Therapy Dog*, are seeking your help to fund the publication of "Tales of a Therapy Dog," a self-published book written in the voice of Angel and illustrated by Gary Yokie.

Angel's story inspires children and adults of all ages. Tales of a Therapy Dog documents Angel's experiences from her perspective as a one-eyed, three-legged Golden Retriever who visits hospitals and anywhere she can help others feel better. The book chronicles Angel's journey being born from a grand champion lineage to becoming a comfort dog under the care of her musician mom and rescuer, Trish. Angel's message is one of the power of the healing arts, and there is a lesson of acceptance of others in her story--no matter our physical and mental differences, diverse backgrounds and the challenges we collectively face in our lives. 

The work of therapy pets fosters unconditional love for all people and, as caregivers, these loving animals serve our community in positive, comforting and altogether meaningful ways.

Please watch Angel's video by Memorial Hermann or visit Angel's website for more information: www.angelhap.com

*May 18, 2015 was proclaimed Angel Therapy Dog Day by former Mayor of the City of Houston, Annise D. Parker.

Angel's Goal 

The creators of Angel's illustrated story are requesting your help to cover production costs so that the publication can be distributed widely throughout the Greater Houston area in hospitals, schools, libraries, nursing homes and other healing and learning environments.

All funds will be pledged to Trish Herrera and will support her new startup publishing cooperative, Angel Hap Press, which is distributing Tales of a Therapy Dog. Donations will not be appropriated by the organizer of this campaign. Please contact us for more information about the specifics of your pledge or for help facilitating a cash, credit or check donation in any amount in person to either Trish Herrera or Gary Yokie.

If Angel does not meet her goal in this campaign, our fundraising efforts will continue until we reach the goal of covering the production expenses for printing Tales of a Therapy Dog.  

Sweet Treats

We've put together a doggy bag of sweet treats as a thank you for donating to this campaign. Angel Donors may pledge to receive any and all of the following limited edition items:

  • A signed commemorative edition of the book stamped with Angel's paw print
  • A one-eyed, three-legged Angel Plush Toy wearing her therapy harness and guardian wings
  • A limited edition T-Shirt with Angel's Official Therapy Dog logo designed by Gary Yokie
  • Donor Recognition for funding Angel Hap Press  

Your Donation's Impact

Your contribution will help us make a difference by furthering the education of the work therapy dogs do for others and this includes helping us tell stories of comfort as part of the healing arts.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you may not be able to contribute to our campaign at this time, but please consider sharing Angel's fundraiser on social media or email this page to other dog loving friends and therapy groups who may benefit from reading Tales of a Therapy Dog. Angel's story goes beyond her backyard in the Houston area, so please help us spread the word! 

If you'd prefer to make a direct contribution to support one or both of Angel's therapy dog groups in which she is a member, please visit the following sites:

Peace, Love and Therapy Dogs

Faithful Paws Pet Therapy of Houston

The creators of this book thank you for your generosity.

Donor Recognition for funding Angel Hap Press  


Your Donation's Impact
Your contribution will help us make a difference by furthering the education of the work therapy dogs do for others and this includes helping us tell stories of comfort as part of the healing arts.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that you may not be able to contribute to our campaign at this time, but please consider sharing Angel's fundraiser on social media or email this page to other dog loving friends and therapy groups who may benefit from reading Tales of a Therapy Dog. Angel's story goes beyond her backyard in the Houston area, so please help us spread the word! 
If you'd prefer to make a direct contribution to support one or both of Angel's therapy dog groups in which she is a member, please visit the following sites:
Peace, Love and Therapy Dogs
Faithful Paws Pet Therapy of Houston
The creators of this book thank you for your generosity.

story:
MESA Sostenible now...

 

With your support, the future...

 

 

Approximately 65% of Nicaraguans are poor and 85% are deemed extremely poor. In this reality, it is very difficult to expect economic growth and vibrancy. This is especially true when the food that people eat is deficient in nutrients and leads to poor health. This is not an uncommon reality among indigenous people whose resources are depleted over generations.

By focussing on healing the land by engaging people in sustainable farm practices leading to greater personal health outcomes, our purpose serves several outcomes:

  • The people will be empowered to greatly improve their own health
  • Our collective efforts will produce efficiencies in nutritional farm practices.

  • Ultimately rural communities will be capable of serving a wider market for their organic farm products and they will be capable of managing healthy lifestyles.

 

El Tambo is a traditional rural farming community in Nicaragua where 82 families (576 people) live. Four sustenance, low market-value crops are grown: rice, beans, corn, and plantains. These crops are grown and harvested once a year using soil damaging chemical fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides and land compacting tilling practices.

 

Nicaragua’s climate change experience—now five years of drought and shortened rainy season—has caused a serious problem for small-scale rural farmers in the Tola region. Water has become increasingly scarce and wells are not replenished during the wet season. Farming livelihoods are at risk.

MESA Sostenible will grow a wide variety of produce using a permaculture model that will demonstrate how nutritious organic food can be grown year-round without the use of soil tilling and agricultural chemicals. Permaculture practices build up the soil profile, add nutrients to the soil, create a welcome environment for beneficial insects and utilizes and sequesters water in substantially efficient ways. Drought is no threat to healthy permaculture farms and chemicals are not required.

The community of El Tambo is committed to a sustainable vision for growing healthy food, promoting economic development and protecting the environment.

MESA Sostenible will serve as a role-model for rural communities throughout Nicaragua. 

The hands-on education program will include two main areas:

  • Sustainable farming education will be centered around a permaculture model using a wide variety of nutritious crops without the use of chemicals. 
  • Hands on cooking lessons will utilize organic produce grown on the farm to teach healthy food preparation techniques and vital nutrition education.

Our personal savings helped us reach the initial milestones of securing land in El Tabi. We have worked to research and grow various plant varieties and saplings from seed in two small greenhouses and began a composting initiative that will serve to reduce waste and promote soil health. Extensive community and local business consultation have enabled us to develop a cohesive vision and hands-on delivery strategy for MESA Sostenible.

Select a perk to support El Tambo!

Your support will allow us to build MESA Sostenible - Sustainable Farm and Nutrition Kitchen - where the local community and visitors will be able to participate in a unique and memorable educational experience in sustainable farming, living and healthy food preparation.

Our economic model aims to use this one-time assistance to plant the seeds of long-term financial sustainability in the community. In addition, the funds from visitors who come for the experience will feed back into the education program.

MESA Sostenible aims to have the following measurable impacts: 

  • Sustainable GROWing practices in the community will reduce malnutrition by producing a wide variety of healthy organic crops year round.
  • Hands-on COOKing lessons will ensure the maximum nutritional value of produce is maintained during consumption by teaching healthy and appropriate preparation methods. 
  • The community cooperative will SELL locally grown organic produce to nearby resorts, residents, and tourists. This will increase economic opportunities for local growers and create more jobs due to the current high demand for organic produce. 

 

We are Cade and Ron—the founders of MESA Sostenible — an Aussie and an American, respectively, who have a passion for sustainability, food and giving back.

For the past several years, our work in food and hospitality found us in different parts of the world working on private yachts. Over time, we began to feel ourselves being pulled away from life onboard and towards one rooted in land and community. We left our comfort zone, sold everything we owned and moved to Nicaragua, an area we fell in love with during our travels.

With backgrounds in cooking, nutrition and permaculture design, we found ourselves wanting to impart our skills onto others who could use them to build healthy communities.

 

We’re excited to partner with local farmer Lenner Mora, who will serve as MESA Sostenible’s farm manager and permaculture community educator.

We are proud to have these important local partnerships. Our dynamic team has the extensive skills and experience necessary to successfully establish MESA Sostenible in El Tambo.

 

The goal is to raise $95,000 in funds to bring the MESA Sostenible Sustainable Farm and Nutrition Kitchen to life. Here is where the funds will be allocated.

All support raised will go towards education materials, farm equipment, plants, livestock, construction and the nutrition kitchen for El Tambo.

 

You can back MESA Sostenible with support of any amount. Simply click the Back It button at the top of the page. Thank you!

 

Other ways you can act:

  • SHARE: Facebook, Twitter - use the social icons at the top right 
  • SHOW your family and friends, encourage them to help fund us.
  • EMAIL to five friends, show them you care. Click here.
  • VISIT our website to learn more about our work.

Thank you for your support!

 

 

Thank you for your generous products and services. We could not have done it without you. 

Please visit their websites and show how much you like them too! 

 

Q: What is MESA Sostenible's revenue model?

A: Nicaragua's tourism industry is steadily growing - INTUR Visitors and travelers to MESA Sostenible can participate in hands-on learning in permaculture, farm to table cooking lessons and dining experiences. These revenue streams will directly fund the community education program.

Q: Can I visit or stay at MESA Sostenible?

A: You are welcome to come to the hands-on classes and dining events on the farm. In the future, we hope to have accommodation and offer a farm stay experience. 

Q: Is Nicaragua Safe to visit?

A: Yes, Nicaragua ranks 69th on the Global Peace Index. It is the safest and most peaceful country in Central America. Source: GPI 2016.

 

Source:  International Bank for Reconstruction and Development/The World Bank (Washington, United States of America). Agriculture in Nicaragua: Performance, Challenges, and Options; 2015 Nov.

story:
No, srsly, click the phone.  It's awesome.  

 

 

 

 

 

Concepts we want to teach

  • Control structures (if, else, for)
  • Test-driven development
  • Variables and basic data types (Booleans, numbers, strings, arrays)
  • Refactoring

Stretch-goal concepts

(if we exceed our campaign goal)

  • Functions
  • Classes and OOP
  • Bitmaps
  • Multithreading (input queue empties itself all at once!)

 

The levels will be centered around constructing in-game projects that can be replicated in real life, like plant-watering devices, pinball machines, and robots.  There’s also a backstory that will be revealed through comic panels as players complete sections of the game.

 

Less than $50k goal

We'll get as much of the game done as we can, ship it live, and start another round of funding here on Indiegogo.  

$50k goal

We deliver sections about control structures, variables, and data-types.  All of these sections will involve refactoring and test-driven development.  We also add in the comic-book style backstory.  

$90k stretch goal

We add sections about functions/encapsulation and OOP.  

$130k stretch goal

We add sections about bitmaps and multithreading.

 

Will the full game be like the demo?

The full game will be much more expansive and interactive.  The demo is the 5 minute, drink-from-the-firehose edition, so it's limited in scope.  The full game will set up and reinforce concepts more incrementally, and allow the players more creativity.  90% of the production game’s levels will have drag-and-drop components, rather than the fixed components you see in the demo.  After setting up some of the basics of coding, the game will progress to more "physicsy" levels, where you fling fruit through the air to feed the pets, control robot cars, and control the parts on a fully playable pinball table.  If we have enough budget, we’d also like to put in some arcade-style games that reinforce certain concepts (like Boolean operations), much like Number Munchers did for arithmetic.  

 

So this is just for girls?

The game is aimed at girls, with the intention of getting more girls coding, but boys will want to play too, and we're totally cool with that.  After all, one of the contributing factors to the lack of females in tech is how poorly they are treated by their male counterparts.  If boys connect at a young age with a smart female programmer, and learn that they don't have to feel threatened by a girl who is more skilled than they are, we’re hoping they will grow up into men who don't exhibit the misogynistic ridiculousness we see too often in the software industry.

 

How much will it cost?

Our goal is to keep the game free to play and ad-free via donations and crowdfunding, in order to open it up to the widest audience possible.

 

Isn't this just like Scratch?

Kind of, but not really.  Scratch is a programming language, and has many sites and tutorials dedicated to learning programming with Scratch.  Fruit Coder is a game that teaches programming concepts, but in addition, shows some of the amazing things you can do with programming, and lets girls connect with a female role-model.  Think of Scratch as the book, and Fruit Coder as the movie.  Most Scratch tutorials tend to skew more towards the education end of the spectrum, whereas Fruit Coder is going to try to stay closer to the entertainment side of things, because we figure a lot of kids don't want to do more learning after school, they just want to chill out and do something fun.   

 

Why does the game art look different between the video and the demo?

We've gone through several iterations of art, and we'll likely go through several more as we get feedback, and see what best communicates the underlying concepts in the most intuitive way possible.  Depending on budget, we may even go 3D for the production version!

 

We have 6 months of development time slated, plus 6 months of play testing and refinement.  This won't necessarily be sequential: we'll knock out the first few levels and gather feedback as we work on the next few, because it takes a lot of cycles to get a game right.  Early access backers get to be a part of the play testing process!

story:
The story behind the stencil

As a science student with writing and drawing difficulties I faced multiple challenges while taking chemistry courses, which often require precise drawing of molecular structures. My colleagues who shared the same difficulty and I were behind on course deliverables because of the time and effort we spent trying to draw the examples that our teacher sketched on the board or presented on slides. It was hard to keep up and it took me hours to understand at home what I tried to draw earlier in my notebook. After searching for a solution, I had developed the chemistry drawing stencil for simple, easy & accurate drawing. This tool saves time in class and assists with internalizing the studying material.

“I excitingly support this project! the stencil can answer the basic and important need of drawing correctly the common molecular structures. It can be very helpful for students in various chemistry classes.” prof. Assaf Friedler, head of chemistry department in the Hebrew University of Jerusalem.   

Stencil main features

The stencil was designed and optimized to be user friendly and at the same time answer all main chemistry drawing requirements:

1. Simple and easy to draw with.

2. Includes all basic common molecular structures required for introductory courses in general and organic chemistry.

3. Transparent, super slim and limited in size (4.3 X 6.7 inches).

4. Manufactured from pure Polycarbonate for optimal durability.

5. The stencil pricing was set to be student friendly.

Chemistry stencil - For all science students

Introduction to Chemistry and Organic Chemistry are mandatory undergraduate courses taught in academic institutions throughout the world. These courses are required for chemistry students as well as for students studying other disciplines such as biology, medicine, engineering, pharmacy & more.

Why a drawing stencil in 2016?!

A major requirement in these courses is the knowledge of molecular structures and the ability to draw them for internalizing the studying material. The Chemistry Stencil is a drawing tool that was designed to help students acquire the intricate and precise skills required for the drawing of common molecular structures in organic chemistry. Some of us students have drawing difficulties which makes studying a challenging and sometimes frustrating experience. Using the stencil can help overcome these challenges, save time in class and help understanding the chemistry reactions much better. Although their are some drawing softwares you can purchase or download through the internet, most of them are not simple, easy and quick to use even when you're not in class. the stencil allows you to draw in your notebook and write notes next to your drawing while in most of the softwares it is hard to do.   

The Vision

From notebook to PC – Though technology is rapidly progressing, hand drawing skills are still required in a variety of courses in school, college and university. The next stage of drawing templates is developing a technology platform for portable devices which would allow accurate hand drawing on the device screen. This platform can reduce the use of paper, help organize and saving studying material in a computer instead of a notebook and enhance students learning experience.

Disciplinary drawing templates – While developing the chemistry stencil, students from different disciplines asked for the same solution, a drawing stencil that will incorporate the relevant shapes for their studies. (for instance engineering, architecture, etc.) we would like to create a platform that would allow course teachers, research assistants and students to build their own stencil.

Your part in helping other students

The stencil is already out in the market and can be found on the web. While it has travelled across continents to reach early adopters, it hasn’t nearly realized its potential in terms of impact on Chemistry education. I would like to kindly ask for your help to overcome the following challenges:

1.  Scale up manufacturing – I had manufactured only a small amount of stencils due to the funding I had managed to raise so far. Additional funding will ensure that I don’t run out of supply.

2. Reach more students – Informing students around the world about the stencil and reaching chemistry departments in different universities and colleges requires a go-to-market strategy as well as an upfront investment.   

3. Eyes to the future – In order to achieve our goals and fulfill our vision of developing disciplinary drawing templates and a technology platform for portable devices which would allow accurate hand drawing on the device screen more funding need to be raised.      

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

If you find my campaign interesting and helpful, get the word out and make some noise about it. Use the indiegogo share tools or share the campaign in anyway you prefer.

story:
Over 60% of the youths within working age are unemployed, a result of the theoretical education that has left most Ugandan youths seeking only for white collar jobs and not caring to become innovative and solve their community problems. During my two years studying at United World Colleges Costa Rica (UWCCR), I was opened to more skill acquisition activities than I would ever have been opened to in Uganda in a period of 10 years. I particularly picked interest in dancing, radio podcasting and photography, skills am still learning and improving in to date. In addition to these skills, I also participated in various activities such as swimming, building, basketball, College events Management, Cooking for large groups, running a clothes drive for the needy people of San Jose, cleaning National Parks and rivers, starting a College canteen, debating in the Model United Nations and Hope XXL Conferences, jogging and Gym workouts, Football, Frisbee and speaking Spanish as a language.

 
After graduation at UWCCR, I travelled through Ecuador for a year. Here, I joined Levitas Dance Academy, Volunteered as an English Teacher in earthquake affected Pedernales, managed hostel operations at Hidden House Hostel and Refugio Terra Esperanza and also interned in permaculture practices (Eco-construction, sustainable Energy and Organic Farming) at Perma Tree and CINCA Ecuador. At CINCA Ecuador, I also helped design the organization’s website and managed its social media platforms. 


In Uganda however, during my primary and middle school years, I attended school from around 5:00am in the morning to 4:00pm in the night. There were only a few short breaks in between, and these were only meant for going to the washrooms, having meals and participating in sports activities. The rest of the time, we spent reading books and being beat with sticks for failing certain questions in our exams. Most of us got to a point where we could recite the whole history of our country just as it was written in the books. But interesting enough, I cannot recite any of those notes anymore, as I forgot it all. In fact, I only ever crammed them just to pass the tests. 


Unfortunately, that is the kind of education that most young children and youths are going through in Uganda. And for this reason, I have with the help of my father’s donation of land to the project, decided to set up a talent and skill acquisition school. The whole idea is to host volunteers from different countries around the world to share their talents and skills with Ugandan youth, aged 14 - 18 years. We in the long run, hope to make this an international talent and skill acquisition school with our main focus areas being in;
1.    Games and sports.
2.    Music, Dance and Acting, 
3.    Tech Innovation. 
4.    Natural and Eco Building
5.    Organic Farming
6.    Art, Crafts and Fashion.
7.    Cooking and Baking
8.    Languages & Tourism
9.    Green Energy Innovation
10.    Online Businesses


The whole idea is to help our students start a project that will most definitely employ them in the long run, hence offering financial stability and independence to them. At the same time, these projects will offer solutions to existing problems in the local communities in which these projects are based. Some of these problems include:
•    High rates of poverty and unemployment of people with disabilities. 
•    Food insecurity and desertification. 
•    Little or no access to clean water, shelter, education and health care.

 

We will admit our students on terms that, 
•    We will help them start up profitable projects by the time they graduate; at the end of the 2 year program. 
•    We will fund promising projects offering needed solutions to problems among Ugandan communities. 
•    We will connect all our students to mentors in their field of study, thus encouraging hands on experiences and guidance throughout the learning process. 
•    We will offer opportunities for them to display their talents and learned skills to the general public and organizations that would be interested in working with or supporting these youths.

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP:
To be able to build this school, we need to raise $10,000. Funds will be used to facilitate construction of the school and volunteers’ eco-buildings, fencing the school and demonstration farm, buying the necessary equipment for various courses, and taking care of our first volunteers. Construction of the school starts, 1st September and the first 3 months short courses start 1st October, 2017. We hope to make these courses affordable, and free to some youths that may not afford the course fees. This way, we will be assured of a large and ever increasing school population during the January and August intakes for the 2 year program starting next year, 2018.


 TO THE VOLUNTEERS:

We will offer free accommodation, food and local tours. They will be staying right next to the Talent and skills school on our organic farming and eco-building project. At the farm, we offer demonstrations to neighboring farmers about irrigation farming, and cheap natural construction for animal houses. We also plan to start offering living loans to the local community, by the end of the year. Living loans work this way: We offer a farmer a pair of animals or seeds to start up a farming project. Once these animals or seeds have multiplied, the farmer pays back by offering the same amount of seeds or animals to another farmer in the community. This way, the benefits of the loan trickle down to the whole community, instead of the loan repayment coming back to us. Volunteers will be able to participate in these activities, and learn a lot during their stay.


To apply for a volunteer position at our farm and talent school, please do send us a message through WorkAway.  https://www.workaway.info/614469429736-en.html
You can apply to volunteer anytime between: August, 2017 - August, 2018. 

The plot of land where the school will be set is almost 2 acres, and the farm about 4 acres. We will be sharing photos of the schools development and future progress at least bi-weekly to keep you posted. 

We do not ask for much. Just $1 per donor, is enough to help us make a difference to the lives of 1,000,000 youth in Uganda (The number we expect to benefit from our program within the next 5 years). 

If you like the idea of our project, please do donate and share our campaign  on facebook, twittter, email and through word of mouth. For any questions or more information, feel free to email us at ecoafrotours@gmail.com.
story_txt:
Over 60% of the youths within working age are unemployed, a result of the theoretical education that has left most Ugandan youths seeking only for white collar jobs and not caring to become innovative and solve their community problems. During my two years studying at United World Colleges Costa Rica (UWCCR), I was opened to more skill acquisition activities than I would ever have been opened to in Uganda in a period of 10 years. I particularly picked interest in dancing, radio podcasting and photography, skills am still learning and improving in to date. In addition to these skills, I also participated in various activities such as swimming, building, basketball, College events Management, Cooking for large groups, running a clothes drive for the needy people of San Jose, cleaning National Parks and rivers, starting a College canteen, debating in the Model United Nations and Hope XXL Conferences, jogging and Gym workouts, Football, Frisbee and speaking Spanish as a language.
 After graduation at UWCCR, I travelled through Ecuador for a year. Here, I joined Levitas Dance Academy, Volunteered as an English Teacher in earthquake affected Pedernales, managed hostel operations at Hidden House Hostel and Refugio Terra Esperanza and also interned in permaculture practices (Eco-construction, sustainable Energy and Organic Farming) at Perma Tree and CINCA Ecuador. At CINCA Ecuador, I also helped design the organization’s website and managed its social media platforms. 
In Uganda however, during my primary and middle school years, I attended school from around 5:00am in the morning to 4:00pm in the night. There were only a few short breaks in between, and these were only meant for going to the washrooms, having meals and participating in sports activities. The rest of the time, we spent reading books and being beat with sticks for failing certain questions in our exams. Most of us got to a point where we could recite the whole history of our country just as it was written in the books. But interesting enough, I cannot recite any of those notes anymore, as I forgot it all. In fact, I only ever crammed them just to pass the tests. 
Unfortunately, that is the kind of education that most young children and youths are going through in Uganda. And for this reason, I have with the help of my father’s donation of land to the project, decided to set up a talent and skill acquisition school. Funds will be used to facilitate construction of the school and volunteers’ eco-buildings, fencing the school and demonstration farm, buying the necessary equipment for various courses, and taking care of our first volunteers. We hope to make these courses affordable, and free to some youths that may not afford the course fees. This way, we will be assured of a large and ever increasing school population during the January and August intakes for the 2 year program starting next year, 2018.

We will offer free accommodation, food and local tours. They will be staying right next to the Talent and skills school on our organic farming and eco-building project. At the farm, we offer demonstrations to neighboring farmers about irrigation farming, and cheap natural construction for animal houses. If you like the idea of our project, please do donate and share our campaign  on facebook, twittter, email and through word of mouth. For any questions or more information, feel free to email us at ecoafrotours@gmail.com.

story:
We all need a little help sometimes #difference #support

We need more ways to do good, here's one. #Wire Fraud increased by 428% in 2016 alone, and is expected to top $53 Billion in Loss. We can absolutely help prevent it, but only with your help. We need your support to finish this platform, and give you what you deserve. 

  • A socially interactive dashboard for consumers to control their experience, in any type of real estate transaction.
  • Instantly shop, compare, and choose professionals based on individual needs and budget
  • A place where consumers can learn the purpose, and value of the different types of professionals involved in ANY real estate transaction
  • A place for our military to find trusted professionals they can work with when they're relocated to unknown areas
  • A place where all professionals get a fair, and competitive opportunity to sell themselves to all consumers
  • A place to watch video bio's, ask questions, read reviews, and have live video interviews
  • A real solution to the 428% increase in wire fraud plaguing the industry
  • Able to issue RESPA (Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act) certificates of satisfaction through our unique set of back-end analytics
  • 5-10% of ALL proceeds will go into our foundation to help rebuild the homes of natural disaster victims, veterans, and victims of loan fraud

Just because we haven't seen something, doesn't mean we don't need it. We're creating something that can be used on every single real estate transaction.

A socially interactive dashboard for consumers to control their experience, in any type of real estate transaction.
Instantly shop, compare, and choose professionals based on individual needs and budget
A place where consumers can learn the purpose, and value of the different types of professionals involved in ANY real estate transaction
A place for our military to find trusted professionals they can work with when they're relocated to unknown areas
A place where all professionals get a fair, and competitive opportunity to sell themselves to all consumers
A place to watch video bio's, ask questions, read reviews, and have live video interviews
A real solution to the 428% increase in wire fraud plaguing the industry
Able to issue RESPA (Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act) certificates of satisfaction through our unique set of back-end analytics

Just because we haven't seen something, doesn't mean we don't need it. We're creating something that can be used on every single real estate transaction.

story:
OUR CAUSE

Many students dream of studying abroad. They research and apply to international institutions hoping for a chance to start a new life. Some of them do get accepted and begin their education. Some of them are cheated out of their education and remain behind, with nothing but an empty promise.

 

OUR STORY

My name is Anaelmarlon Luzayamo, and I became the victim of one such scam in 2012. I invested $3000 to study abroad and paid my admission fees through an agent. The agent promised me that the institution was exactly what I was looking for. Upon arriving at the university, I discovered that I had been cheated. The institution was not as promised.

I had been swindled.

At the institution, I met more and more students who had been swindled. This constant and prevalent swindling was so common among international students that I made it my goal to put an end to it! These students had their hopes and dreams taken away from them. I knew something had to be done, so I created the NeverGivApp platform!

 

OUR INITIATIVE

After two years in development, we launched the NeverGivApp platform in Michigan in 2020. Our online platform strives to stop swindling by supporting direct interaction between students and institutions, with no third-party involvement. It prevents so-called ‘agents’ from misrepresenting the institutions. We enable students to feel confident that their funds are going exactly where they expect them to go - for their education!

 

 

OUR SUPPORT

I immigrated to the United States in 2018 and was introduced to a great organization, Freedom House Detroit. This non-profit organization gave me a nudge in the right direction by connecting me to ProsperUS Detroit. At ProperUS Detroit, I underwent a 12 week-training to become an entrepreneur and learned how to manage a business. ProsperUS Detroit also helped me work with the lawyer from Bodmanlaw and created NeverGivApp LLC in Detroit. With NeverGivApp, we will not only fight against the international swindling of students but will also provide more employment opportunities for the local community (Detroit).

 

CHALLENGE

The COVID-19 pandemic has made it difficult to connect with others and build a network. This acts as a communication barrier for students and institutions.  Hence, it is essential to improve the accessibility of information about educational institutions and be recognized as a company with reliable and trustworthy sources.

 

YOUR SUPPORT

You can support our cause and help us to reach our goal. The sooner we reach our goal, the sooner people throughout the world will have access to better education.

100% of your generous donations will go directly to the following:

  • Hiring local talent to support growth
  • Server, cloud storage, Emails, TinyMCE, Domain name, Pusher ( $13K)
  • Developers ($30K)
  • Lawyer ($6K)
  • Slaesperson ($24K for 6 months)
  • Marketing and advertisement ($7K)

Total: $84K for years

Our team will be grateful for your generous donation. We also request you to share our initiative with your family, friends, and co-workers so that together, we can put a stop to swindling!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Join Us In Launching Imagineering Youth Camps!

We are seeking $50,000 to provide scholarships for 35 teenagers from low income families who want to attend camp during the summer of 2017.  

Imagineering Youth Camps is open to any and all interested teenagers. However, we understand that camp may be unaffordable to some and that engineering is a male-dominated field. Thus, the primary motivation for this campaign is raising money to send teenagers from low income families to camp on a full-tuition scholarship and promoting STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) to females.

Update (February 3, 2015)

Imagineering Youth Camps was featured in The University Daily Kansan today in an article titled "Imagineering Youth Camps Will Shake Up Summer Camp Style." It's a great overview of what we are doing and why it's important.

Why Imagineering Youth Camps?

Imagineering Youth Camps takes a different approach than existing engineering summer camps by limiting classroom-like settings and activities. As such, campers will be exposed to the modern-day wonders of engineering, all while enjoying the hallmark activities of a traditional summer camp location. Our long-term goal is to grow into a national franchise, with camps from coast to coast, inspiring thousands of campers to pursue careers in STEM.

We are planning to launch our first camp during the summer of 2017 in the San Francisco, California area. We will hold 7 weeks of camp with campers between the ages of 11 and 17. As we build a reputation and become an established camp, we will expand to more locations across the country.

Where Did We Get This Idea?

After attending an engineering camp as a teenager, co-founder Max Soto felt as if he had just spent a week of his summer at school. He and his fellow campers worked on "real world" engineering projects, but due to their lack of experience and knowledge at such a young age, these projects were very simplified and tended to be quite boring. On top of that, during their free time, when he and other campers were not working on those projects, they were stuck hanging out in college dorms with the movie theater or bowling alley being the peak of their fun. Max left the camp without the inspiration to become an engineer. A few years later, while thinking back on that experience, he thought to himself, "How can I change the engineering summer camp experience so that campers leave with not only a new set of engineering skills, but also with the inspiration to become an engineer and innovator?" Soon after, Max had a "lightbulb" moment that sparked the idea for Imagineering Youth Camps. Since then, he and his business partner, Wilson Hack, have been developing an entirely new and innovative approach to operating a summer camp.

A Typical Day At Camp

The daily schedule at an Imagineering Youth Camp is equally divided between recreational and STEM-focused activities. Campers will be divided into groups of 6-8 and assigned to a group leader. These leaders will be passionate engineering students from some of the nation's top universities. 

The 6-day-long sessions will consist of tinkering with high-tech gadgets, such as drones with an attached GoPro™ camera and 3-D printers. After exploring the capabilities of these gadgets, we will gather the campers and have them complete a simple workshop demonstrating the various technologies contained within the products. For example, after experimenting with drones, campers will create a simple electronic circuit and remote equipped with an IR (infrared) receiver that turns on a fan using littleBits™. The fan represents the propeller on the drone and the IR remote represents the remote controller used for power and steering. While campers are engaging in each workshop, their group leader will provide a brief explanation of how and why these technologies work. 

Each week, campers will also take part in group competitions. One of these projects will take campers through the step-by-step process of planning, designing, making and, finally, pitching a product to potential customers/investors. This will give each camper the opportunity to learn more about the business side of innovation and engineering.

Throughout the week, at least three guest speakers will present to the campers. These speakers will include co-founders Max and Wilson, entrepreneurs, executives from nearby corporations, and faculty members from surrounding universities. The presentations will cover topics ranging from the future of space exploration to the ethical considerations involved in building intelligent robots, creating a TED Talk environment in which campers will be exposed to material not covered in any traditional academic setting.

During their free time, campers will have the opportunity to take part in various traditional summer camp activities. Depending on location, campers will have access to activities like tubing, rope swings, challenge courses, a climbing wall, beaches, The Blob, tubing, zip-lining, basketball and more! 

What Will The Money Be Used For?

Our primary goal is to raise enough money to provide full-tuition scholarships for at least 35 teenagers from low income families who want to attend camp during the summer of 2017. We also have additional costs to cover in order to launch our first camp by this date. These costs include:

  • Hardware Purchases
  • Location Lease/Rental
  • Software Purchases
  • Website Hosting
  • Legal and Accounting Services
  • Marketing Materials (T-shirts, brochures, etc.) 
  • Technology Accessories (3-D Printers, Hard Drives, etc.)

Ways To Help Us Launch

First of all, we welcome and appreciate your donation. There are plenty of kids and teenagers that need a scholarship to attend our camp, as well as significant costs associated with both launching and sustaining a successful, long-term venture. 

Outside of donations, getting the word out about Imagineering Youth Camps is crucial in the early stages of growth. Please tell others in your community about our mission and this fundraiser to ensure we are able to successfully launch our first camp during the summer of 2017.

story:
"Non è mai troppo presto" ("It's never too early")

The non-profit Organisation Cuore di Mamma directs

its attention to disabled people, in particular

to children affected from serious illness, or to so

cial abandoned children. The non-profit

Organisations' aims are:

-Developing, promoting and organising activities fo

r diseased children and adults during their

permanence at the nursing facilities.

-Promoting useful assets through sport and cultural

activities

-Promoting social solidarity through social work, c

harity and education.

Currently, Cuore di Mamma's building, situated in R

onciglione (Piazza dei Bersaglieri, 2),

accomodates on its' 1st floor ill children accompan

ied from their parents. This way, families are

helped during disease duration, and also have the o

pportunity to have some days of holiday in the

surrounding areas (Lago di Vico, Monti Cimini). We

collaborate with the roman hospital Ospedale

Pediatrico Bambino Gesù .

Until 13th July 2014 we accommodated 20 families, f

or a total of 1400 nights offered for free.

Now, we have the opportunity to use the ground floo

r living spaces for our new project

"Non è mai troppo presto".

The spaces situated on the ground floor need to be

renovated because they have not been used

for years. We want to create spaces to welcome ever

yone, using our rooms this way:

-Library: a place where children will have the oppo

rtunity to read books, or borrow them. Library

will also have a projector to watch films, or to he

ar music.

-Study room: a room where children will be able to

do their homework together with other children,

or with the help of a support teacher.

-Nursery: where mums will suckle their babies

-Rest room: a room where everyone will be able to s

ay calm. A room that can be used to meditate

or to pray, whatever religion.

-Laundry.

Inside these rooms, we want to realise activities f

or children who suffer from learning disabilities.

The project "Non è mai troppo presto" aims to provi

de an early diagnosis to affected children in

order to help them as soon as possible.

Children will be helped with a three-year program f

rom specialised staff, which operates in the

teaching and treatment of dyslexia field.

As a first step of the project, we will train teach

ers and parents of affected children in the use of

computer and technologies as a teaching help for ch

ildren with learning disabilities. In fact it is

scientifically proved that technology is very usefu

l to cure dyslexia.

The second step is to teach children how to use the

ir computers and how to study. We will offer

them fun, interesting and motivating study topics.

We also want to realise "Zaino Multimediale" ("Mult

imedia Backpack"), a digital library so than

every dyslexic child will have school books on an e

-book format.

Our last objective is to organise courses for paren

ts who have dyslexic children ("Corso per

genitori con bambini dislessici"). In fact, very of

ten parents are unprepared to deal with learning

disabilities.

The cost for the specialised staff will be 35.000€

per year. They are going to work 4 hours per

week, and children will be approximately 40.

Our project is due to the fact that Italian State d

oesn't help children with learning disease, neither

with economic, nor with welfare help.

The material we need to begin the project is:

-Between 6 and 12 notebooks (depending on the afflu

ence). Every PC costs between 350 and

400€.

-A multimedia board (LIM) which costs 2.500€

-6 desks (length 140 cm, width 60 cm, height 73 cm)

-20 office chairs

-1 office closet

-softwares, handbooks and files

-internet facility

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Cuore di Mamma Onlus, rivolge la propria attenzione nei confronti dei soggetti svantaggiati affetti da obiettivo disagio, con particolare riferimento ai minori che vivono uno stato di abbandono sociale e\o di grave malattia. Le finalità sono:
  • Sviluppo, promozione, organizzazione e diffusione delle attività di accoglienza di minori e persone affette da gravi malattie durante la loro permanenza sul territorio, dove sono presenti le strutture di cura;
  • Promozione di attività per l’avvio, l’aggiornamento ed il perfezionamento nel svolgimento di pratiche sportive e culturali;
  • Promozione della solidarietà sociale, tramite lo svolgimento di attività nei settori dell’assistenza sociale e socio-sanitaria, della beneficienza, dell’istruzione e della formazione.

Attualmente Cuore di Mamma Onlus, in Ronciglione presso l’edificio sito in Piazzale dei Bersaglieri n.2, al primo piano della struttura che ha a disposizione, ospita bambini malati accompagnati da un genitori, al fine di agevolarli durante il percorso della malattia, permettendogli inoltre di passare un soggiorno.vacanza all’interno della struttura, in un luogo accoglienze e contornato da un ambiente sano e salutare (Monti Cimini e Lago di Vico). Abbiamo uno stretto rapporto di collaborazione con l’Ospedale Pediatrico Bambino Gesù di Roma, presso cui siamo anche accreditati.

Fino al 13 luglio 2014 abbiamo ospitato 20 nuclei familiari per un totale di 1400 notti gratuite donate.

Anche i locali siti al piano terra del medesimo immobile sono stati messi a disposizione di Cuore di Mamma Onlus, essi sono al centro del progetto “Non è mai troppo presto”.

Tali locali hanno bisogno di esser ristrutturati in quanto inutilizzati da molto tempo.

All’interno della struttura vogliamo creare degli spazi di accoglienza per tutti, spostando le zone ricreative dal piano superiore a quello inferiore, consentendoci così anche di aumentare il numero di posti letto disponibili al primo piano.

I locali verranno utilizzati come:

  • Biblioteca, luogo dove i libri possono essere letti nelle apposite sale o essere presi in prestito. La biblioteca sarà dotata anche di un proiettore per vedere film o ascoltare musica;
  • Sala studio, Luogo in cui trovare la giusta tranquillità per affrontare lo studio. Fare i compiti insieme ad altri coetanei, oppure con un insegnante di sostegno.
  • Nursery, piccolo ambiente separato in cui le mamme possono allattare e far risposare i loro bimbi piccoli;
  • Stanza della quiete, un luogo che consente di trovare spazio di silenzio e tranquillità lontano dal caos quotidiano. Ciascuno potrà scegliere se utilizzarlo per la riflessione, la meditazione o la preghiera, secondo la propria cultura o fede;
  • Lavanderia e stireria, per lavare e sterilizzare tutto ciò che viene usato dai nostri ospiti.

All’interno dei su scritti locali, abbiamo intenzione di realizzare un attività rivolta ai bambini con disturbi specifici dell’apprendimento. Il progetto “Non è mai troppo presto” é mirato infatti, al riconoscimento precoce di tali disturbi. La ricerca scientifica conferma che una diagnosi tempestiva è determinante per il recupero di questi disturbi: un intervento corretto entro il secondo anno della scuola primaria, permette una riduzione dell’entità del disturbo significativamente maggiore di quanto può avvenire negli anni successivi.

Questa fase specifica del progetto avrà una durata triennale, con l’ausilio di personale specializzato nel settore dell’insegnamento e del trattamento dei disturbi dell’apprendimento.

La prima fase riguarderà la formazione specifica degli insegnanti, dei collaboratori e dei genitori, con sperimentazione di modalità didattiche inclusive basate sull’utilizzo del personal computer. La ricerca scientifica infatti, ha dimostrato che l’utilizzo delle tecnologie è il miglior alleato dei ragazzi dislessici.

La seconda fase avrà come obiettivo quello di formare i ragazzi con tale disturbo all’uso degli strumenti informatici utili per lo studio e l’apprendimento, attraverso un’esperienza residenziale di gruppo e la proposta di temi e argomenti stimolanti e motivanti, che permettano di sperimentare un apprendimento attivo, creativo ed efficace.

Attraverso la realizzazione dello “Zaino Multimediale” inoltre, ci proponiamo di realizzare anche una biblioteca digitale, cercando di fornire ad ogni alunno dislessico in età scolare, libri scolastici in formato digitale e facilmente accessibile. Tale formato permette di leggere il libro su un pc anche con un programma di sintesi vocale o attraverso un lettore di e-book, uno dei più validi aiuti per il bambino dislessico.

Ulteriore obiettivo è quello di realizzare un “Corso per genitori con bambini dislessici”. Molti genitori, infatti, non sanno affrontare con sufficiente preparazione il disturbo del proprio figlio.

I nostri docenti, forniranno ai genitori le informazioni per saperne di più, nonché gli strumenti per riconoscere i primi segnali dei disturbi dell’apprendimento. Per i genitori con bambini dislessici conclamati infine, il corso sarà più specifico.

I costi per i professionisti si dovrebbe aggirare sui 35.000 euro annui, considerando un impegno, da parte dei collaboratori specializzati, di 4 ore settimanali, e considerando un’affluenza di bambini ad un numero prossimo alle 40 unità.

L’idea di realizzare il presente progetto nasce infine, dalla mancanza di attenzione che il legislatore italiano ha deciso di rivolgere nei confronti dei bambini con disturbi dell’apprendimento ( L. 170\2010 e s.m.i). I bambini con tali disturbi infatti, sono completamente sforniti di sostegno economico - assistenziale da parte dello Stato Italiano.

Il materiale per uno start up consono è il seguente:

  • Da un minimo di 6 ad un massimo di 12 Notebook, da calcolarsi in base all’utenza; l’importo per un PC di base si aggira dalle 350,00 alle 400,00 Euro circa;
  • Una lavagna multimediale (LIM) il cui importo è di circa 2.500,00 euro;
  • N. 6 scrivanie (lunghezza 140 cm, profondità 60 cm, altezza 73 cm);
  • N. 20 sedie da ufficio;
  • N.1 armadio da ufficio;
  • Materiale vario, come: software, prontuari, schedari specifici da acquistare se e quando necessario; 
  • impianto per connessione alla rete internet.
story_txt:
"Non è mai troppo presto" ("It's never too early") 
The non-profit Organisation Cuore di Mamma directs 
its attention to disabled people, in particular 
to children affected from serious illness, or to so
cial abandoned children. The non-profit 
Organisations' aims are:    
-Developing, promoting and organising activities fo
r diseased children and adults during their 
permanence at the nursing facilities. 
-Promoting useful assets through sport and cultural
 activities 
-Promoting social solidarity through social work, c
harity and education. 
Currently, Cuore di Mamma's building, situated in R
onciglione (Piazza dei Bersaglieri, 2), 
accomodates on its' 1st floor ill children accompan
ied from their parents. This way, families are 
helped during disease duration, and also have the o
pportunity to have some days of holiday in the 
surrounding areas (Lago di Vico, Monti Cimini). We 
collaborate with  the roman hospital Ospedale 
Pediatrico Bambino Gesù . 
Until 13th July 2014 we accommodated 20 families, f
or a total of 1400 nights offered for free. 
Now, we have the opportunity to use the ground floo
r living spaces for our new project 
"Non è mai troppo presto".      
The spaces situated on the ground floor need to be 
renovated because they have not been used 
for years. We want to create spaces to welcome ever
yone, using our rooms this way: 
-Library: a place where children will have the oppo
rtunity to read books, or borrow them. Library 
will also have a projector to watch films, or to he
ar music. 
-Study room: a room where children will be able to 
do their homework together with other children, 
or with the help of a support teacher. 
-Nursery: where mums will suckle their babies  
-Rest room: a room where everyone will be able to s
ay calm. A room that can be used to meditate 
or to pray, whatever religion. 
-Laundry. 
Inside these rooms, we want to realise activities f
or children who suffer from learning disabilities. 
The project "Non è mai troppo presto" aims to provi
de an early diagnosis to affected children in 
order to help them as soon as possible. 
Children will be helped with a three-year program f
rom specialised staff, which operates in the 
teaching and treatment of dyslexia field. 
As a first step of the project, we will train teach
ers and parents of affected children in the use of 
computer and technologies as a teaching help for ch
ildren with learning disabilities. In fact it is 
scientifically proved that technology is very usefu
l to cure dyslexia. 
The second step is to teach children how to use the
ir computers and how to study. We will offer 
them fun, interesting and motivating study topics. 
We also want to realise "Zaino Multimediale" ("Mult
imedia Backpack"), a digital library so than 
every dyslexic child will have school books on an e
-book format. 
Our last objective is to organise courses for paren
ts who have dyslexic children ("Corso per 
genitori con bambini dislessici"). In fact, very of
ten parents are unprepared to deal with learning 
disabilities.  
The cost for the specialised staff will be 35.000€ 
per year. They are going to work 4 hours per 
week, and children will be approximately 40. 
Our project is due to the fact that Italian State d
oesn't help children with learning disease, neither
with economic, nor with welfare help. 
The material we need to begin the project is: 


-Between 6 and 12 notebooks (depending on the afflu
ence). Every PC costs between 350 and 
400€. 
-A multimedia board (LIM) which costs 2.500€ 
-6 desks (length 140 cm, width 60 cm, height 73 cm)
-20 office chairs  
-1 office closet 
-softwares, handbooks and files 
-internet facility  
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

story:
Cyprus: C.E.L.T. for Peace

(Connecting and Empowering the Leaders of Tomorrow - C.E.L.T.)

What is Cyprus: C.E.L.T. for Peace?

The purpose and goal of this project is to bring Greek speaking Cypriot and Turkish speaking Cypriot students and youth (of the age 15-25) together at the Buffer Zone. The project will provide the opportunity to build a long lasting workshop of events and train potential students and young professionals as mentors who can start rapprochement, reconciliation and conflict resolution programs within their own schools, communities and societies. The anticipated outcome of the project will be to raise awareness of the constructive potential of both communities when they work together.

How will Cyprus: C.E.L.T. for Peace work?

This project will allow Cypriots from both sides to come together in a safe learning environment that offers students outstanding skills and growing opportunities. This will provide them with a mutual passion they can share among each other, using a combination of various theories of conflict analysis and resolution models as well as peace-building strategies. These are specialized for the purpose of simultaneously educating and creating communication between the Cypriot participants. Its sole purpose would ensue to train the students of how to create and develop similar programs within their schools, communities and societies. This results in eventually allowing them to utilize their understanding of conflict resolution and other new skills in catalyzing the interpersonal barriers created due to the inter-communal conflicts.

The project will be consisted of 8 volunteers/coordinators. A total of thirty participants will qualify to observe the workshops. These participants will include students who attend public (if possible) and private schools from both communities, as well as young professionals with academic knowledge and/or personal experience in the rapprochement initiatives.

The students will spend a total of 8-12 days learning about the people from the other community, as well as practical approaches of how to overcome the invisible “barriers” between them. This will be achieved by engaging the participants, the volunteers and the coordinators in interactive teambuilding activities and constructive communication.

Parallel Activities of Cyprus: C.E.L.T. for Peace

The program will organize several parallel activities for the increase in popularity and funding of the program.

During March and April 2015 this online fundraising campaign is organized. During the campaign donors will be able to offer various amounts. Depending on the amount given, each donor will receive some perks as thanks for their move. The proceeds will be used to conduct the program this summer.

A bicycle tour around the country will increase sensitization and elevate awareness of the existence of Cyprus: C.E.L.T. for Peace. In addition, it will support fundraising as well as the acquisition of services in the effort for Cyprus: C.E.L.T. for Peace to own a place where collaboration and togetherness will be reinforced and empowered.

Perks: 

TOGETHER WE CAN GO EVERYWHERE! 
(CELT Bookmark.) 


TOGETHER WE WRITE OUR FUTURE! 

(CELT Pen.) 

EVERYWHERE SIDE-BY-SIDE! 
(CELT Badge Pin.) 

CELT SUNSHINE! 

(CELT Cap.) 

THIRSTY FOR PEACE! 

(CELT Bottle) 

WEARABLE CELT! 
(CELT short sleeved T-shirt.) 

WONDERFUL CYPRUS! 

(A watercolor map of Cyprus.) 


HEART CYPRUS! 

(Cyprus Necklace.) 


CYPRUS TAMPOUTSIA! 

(Wonderful Cyprus themed painting.) 


TRADITIONAL CYPRUS! 

(Awesome Cyprus Traditional Outfit. Please choose either male or female outfit.)

story:
What is the Refugee Scholarship Fund?

The Refugee Advisory Board of the Catholic Charities includes concerned individuals who work tirelessly to help refugees make a home in San Antonio, Texas. The refugees come from all over the globe, having escaped from violence, terror, or political oppression.

The young people are very excited to have the opportunity to complete their education that has been disrupted. Some of them have lost five or more years of school. Many while in San Antonio have worked very hard to complete high school, some graduating with flying colors, all the while learning English and often working to support their families. These graduates now look forward to going to college, to take the first steps towards a better future and being successful in America. The scholarship fund will lend support and encourage them take these first steps and, hopefully, also be an inspiration to others.

Every dollar you donate to this fund will help refugees grow into educated and enlightened citizens who are part of a diverse and healthy US society. 


What We Need & What You Get

The goal of this campaign is to give eligible refugees a $300 set-up fund for books and other necessary supplies when they enroll in a 2- or 4-year college. The goal is to fund 10 students in the Fall semester of 2015 with $300 each, or as many students as donations allow.

There are added incentives if you donate:

§  You will have an opportunity to spend a day (or part of a day) with a refugee family and learn their story

§  Become a volunteer with the Refugee Resettlement Program

§  Out of the first 25 contributors, there will be a drawing and 3 will receive 2 tickets each to the Garden Banquet, a yearly celebration of the CIELO Garden at House of Prayer community garden project (dedicated to help refugees learn, raise some of their own food, and integrate into their new homes)


The Impact

Every day as we hear news reports from around the world, one thing becomes increasingly clear—people need to be educated. A little education will go a long way in promoting peace and harmony in the world as well as helping the refugees become self-sufficient and full participants in the American Dream. The $10, $20, $50 or more that you donate, will help make that dream become real!


Risks & Challenges

The only challenge we foresee is the growing number of students that will apply for the scholarships. In the near future we will have to find other sources of funding these scholarships, or add to the disappointment of those applications not accepted. Donors and others who learn about our fund can help by spreading the word to other possible contributors. 


Other Ways YOU can Help

This is a worthy cause and we know that each and every one of you that reads this or gets this request will want to contribute and share your resources to help these young, bright refugees.  If you can’t, there are other ways that you can be a part of the campaign until you can contribute to the fund—spread the word! Do not delete this email. Tell your friends and relatives and people you know. Even people you think will not care, may end up being the biggest donors because this is the one campaign that touches their hearts.

Also check out the Indiegogo Share Tools! You can use those to get the word out to those who may not know of these deserving young minds. Thank you for being a part of this campaign.

There are added incentives if you donate:
§  You
will have an opportunity to spend a day (or part of a day) with a refugee
family and learn their story 
§  Become
a volunteer with the Refugee Resettlement Program
§  Out
of the first 25 contributors, there will be a drawing and 3 will receive 2
tickets each to the Garden Banquet, a yearly celebration of the CIELO Garden at
House of Prayer community garden project (dedicated to help refugees learn,
raise some of their own food, and integrate into their new homes)
    The Impact 

Every day as we hear news reports from around the
world, one thing becomes increasingly clear—people need to be educated. A
little education will go a long way in promoting peace and harmony in the world
as well as helping the refugees become self-sufficient and full participants in
the American Dream. The $10, $20, $50 or more that you donate, will help make that
dream become real!   
Risks & Challenges  
The only challenge we foresee is the
growing number of students that will apply for the scholarships. In the near
future we will have to find other sources of funding these scholarships, or add
to the disappointment of those applications not accepted. Donors and others who
learn about our fund can help by spreading the word to other possible
contributors. 

Other Ways YOU can Help
 
This is a worthy cause and we know that each and
every one of you that reads this or gets this request will want to contribute
and share your resources to help these young, bright refugees.  If you can’t, there are other ways that you
can be a part of the campaign until you can contribute to the fund—spread the
word! Do not delete this email. Tell your friends and relatives and people you
know. Even people you think will not care, may end up being the biggest donors
because this is the one campaign that touches their hearts. 
Also check out the Indiegogo Share Tools! You can
use those to get the word out to those who may not know of these deserving
young minds. Thank you for being a part of this campaign.

story:
Welcome to Baan Dada Children's Home!

Founded in 1994, Baan Dada Children’s Home, located in Huay Ma Lai village, provides a safe and nurturing home to orphaned and disadvantaged children in the remote villages of Western Thailand. Many refugees and migrant families moved to this area due to poverty, disease, and political repression by the government in Burma. 


What we do?

With your help, Baan Dada empowers the children through education and practical skill building with the aim of providing them with a bright future once they finish high school.  The home also encourages the students' love of music, handicrafts, art, and language. 

From hands-on mechanical training in the workshop, to producing textiles in the weaving center, to building English language skills during nightly classes, to putting on a concert at the local market, the children are encouraged to apply themselves and to develop a wide range of skills and passions.  All of this is made possible by the generosity of people like you!



How you can help?

This incredible home needs your help.  We aim to raise enough money to send the children of Baan Dada to school for the upcoming year. The cost to educate one child for one year is US$350.  These kids have big dreams for their future - please help us make these dreams a reality.  Our goal of US$5,000 will cover one third of the annual cost to educate our children.  We hope to follow up with two more stretch campaigns to fund tuition for all of our young scholars for an entire year!


Our Values

At Baan Dada, the children are taught that through hard work and by applying themselves, they can create their own bright future.  This ethic has led the home to be remarkably self-sufficient.  Not only do they care for over 40 children, but they also operate a mechanical workshop, a weaving center, a thriving music program, and an on-site organic farm.  

Baan Dada is also an active member of its community and organizes projects to help underserved local populations, including eye care screenings and a vaccination program.  The home also provides jobs to single mothers and families. 

 

Want to learn more about Baan Dada?

Check out our website at www.baandada.org.

We also encourage you to email us at baandadavolunteer@gmail.com with questions or to learn how you can get involved.


Please help us support these incredible children!
