story:
Due to America's stringent immigration laws, I was deported to Mumbai, India on June 27, 2013. It was, and still is, a big struggle trying to adjust to the country of my birth which I left 28 years ago but with God's help I am doing the best I can. When I was in New York, I used every opportunity that great land gave me and helped others as much as possible especially at-risk youth and the poor of the poorest in the inner cities. I continue to do the same in Mumbai. I currently volunteer with two NGO that helps the slum kids with basic sanitation & educational needs. If you go to my FB page you will see their pictures: https://www.facebook.com/rehman.s.charania/media_set?set=a.1404194153130924.1073741831.100006210582968&type=3

Just last December an anonymous donor sent me some money from NY so that I could throw a Christmas party for the kids on his behalf. I did that and the kids really enjoyed a lot and had a great time. I was able to feed 25 kids KFC, Ice Cream, Cake, snacks, etc. for a small amount. Just check the pictures on my FB and see the joy on their faces. 

What I really want do with your help is to be able to throw a little party for them once or twice a month because these innocent kids don't get to eat decent meal let alone KFC, Domino's, Pizza Hut, Subway, etc and I also want to buy them basic school stuff and clothing, footwear (half of them come to the NGO center barefoot) and sports items for them. But my job only pays me 20,000 rupees a month which is $320 in today's exchange rate. 

I hope and pray that the good people in USA and around the world could donate few dollars so I could do a lot for these kids and their families. Stuff is more cheaper here than in USA. I could also lend money to some of these children's parents so they could start food stall on the sidewalks so they could earn some money so their kids don't have to beg on the streets. A small amount of $500 dollars could get one family start selling local fast food on the sidewalks. They won't make a killing but anything is better than little kids begging on Mumbai's dangerous streets and being victims of pedophiles and other criminals. So please help and donate as much as you can. On behalf of the slum kids I want to say Thank You very much for reading this. Please encourage your family & friends to donate too.

story:
Short Summary:

Financial literacy starts at home.  But for many parents of young children that can be a challenge. Our children need to be taught how to manage money from an early age.  However, financial literacy programs are few and far to be found in elementary schools or middle schools. Children need to be taught the four basic functions of money: Spend, Save, Invest, and Give.  They also need to understand that all four functions of money must work together to create a budget.  That is why I created and wrote "The Four Money Bears".  Each bear represents a function of money and shows how money works to help us accomplish our goals.   I wrote "The Four Money Bears" book to help transform the perception of money for generations of young children. 

The book, however, is just the start.  We are raising funds to develop both a digital and hard copy financial literacy educational platform.  The funds will also be used to provide free copies of "The Four Money Bears" books to schools in low income areas across the country.  


Money Bear Basics:

The financial literacy educational platform called "Money Bear Basics" will be based on the successful children's book "The Four Money Bears". The platform will allow children to learn and gain exposure to money management tools and concepts that will shape their perception of money for years to come.

Parents, teachers and children will be able to access Money Bear Basics online through an interactive community based website. Kids can play games, watch videos and complete training exercises.  These activities expose young children to the skills needed to practice healthy money management habits. Kids will love the characters and enjoy the activities that engage them along the financial literacy learning process.

Children will initially learn about the four basic functions of money: Spending, Saving, Investing and Giving. They will learn these important values from the Four Money Bears and their friends. Once kids learn the basic building blocks of money management through building their own budget they will then learn about a variety of financial topics including:

- Banking: Checking, Saving, CD
- Lending: Personal loans, mortgages, auto loans
- Credit: Credit cards, Charge Cards, Lines of Credit
- Investing: Stocks, Bond, Mutual Funds
- Gifting: Church, Non Profit, Family
- Earning: Compound Interest, Time Value of Money, Rule of 72
- Financial Planning: Assets, Liabilities, Income, Expenses
- Insurance: Life, home, auto
- Taxes: Sales tax, Income tax, Property tax

 

What We Need & What You Get

What We Need:

  • We want to raise $50,000 to fund the cost of creating both a fully interactive web based financial literacy program as well as a series of financial literacy "Money Bear Basics" workbooks driven by the newly published "The Four Money Bears" book. 
  • The web based program will offer a module based learning process that teaches children money management skills.  Each step will be taught by one of the Money Bears and will cover: Spending, Saving, Investing and Giving.
  • The workbooks will follow the similar module based learning process and can be used for teaching money management in homes or in the school system.
  • A portion of the proceeds will be used to fund the cost of distribution of "The Four Money Bears" books to schools in low income areas across the country.

What You Get:

  • Those who contribute at least $25 will receive 1 copy of "The Four Money Bears" book. A free copy of the book will be donated to a school on your behalf.
  • Those who contribute at least $50 will receive 2 copies of “The Four Money Bears” book and a 1 year subscription to the web based Money Bear Basics  educational platform. A free copy of the book will be donated to a school on your behalf.
  • Those who contribute at least $100 will receive 2 copies of “The Four Money Bears” book, a 1 year subscription to the web based educational platform and the complete Money Bear Basics workbook series.  Two free copies of the book with be donated to a school on your behalf.
  • Those who contribute at least $500 will get the opportunity to have the author Mac Gardner read "The Four Money Bears" to students at a school or organization of your choice.  The school or organization will receive free copies of the book.
  • The satisfaction of knowing that you've helped a young child become more financially literate!


The Impact

We all know that money is an important and valuable tool.  We know we need to earn it to make a living and survive.  But how financially literate are we as a society? Here's a more important question.  How prepared are our children to manage their personal finances when they become adults?  The Council for Economic Education and Jump$tart Coalition share some startling information:

  • Only 17 states require a high school course in Personal Finance.
  • Only 5 states require a stand-alone course in personal finance for high school graduation.
  • Fewer than 20% of teachers feel competent to teach personal finance.
  • 1/3 of parents are more comfortable talking to to their kids about smoking, drugs and bullying than about money.
  • 61% of US adults admit to not having a budget.
  • 40% of adults gave themselves a grade of C, D, or F on their knowledge of personal finance.
The key to a more financially literate society is to expose our children to the basic concepts of what money can do for them at an early age.  "The Four Money Bears" book was created to teach children between the age of 5 and 10 what they can do with money.  This financial educational platform will expose children to the basic uses of money and allow them to create their own budgets.  The Money Bear Basics website and workbooks will allow children to further understand the functions of money, learn money management skills and make them better prepared to practice a healthy financial lifestyle as adults. 



Risks & Challenges

The biggest risks and challenges to this campaign are the same risks and challenges that are inherent in our society today with respect to financial literacy.  The top risk to financial literacy is a lack of CONCERN.  If we as a society don't make financial literacy a top priority...it won't ever get the full attention it deserves.  Here's a list of risks and challenges that we face:

  • Lack of interest in learning personal finance.
  • Intimidation of the subject of personal finance.
  • Few, if any, role models to learn about personal finance.
  • Lack of personal finance classes and tools in schools.
  • A personal finance landscape that is becoming ever more complex.
  • An aging society that is living longer.
  • Fewer corporations providing pensions or personal finance tools.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to this campaign there are many ways to further the cause of financial literacy.  Here are some great organizations that are working to spread the word:

  • Council for Economic Education -- councilforeconed.org
  • Jump$tart Coalition for Personal Financial Literacy -- jumpstart.org
  • U.S Government official web portal for kids -- kids.usa.gov/money
  • CFP Board -- letsmakeaplan.org

Thank you for you time and interest in our fundraiser!

#TeachKidsMoney

#MoneyMentor

story:
Nino's Amateur Athletic Gymnasium (Nino's AAG) is a Non-Profit Organisation, set up to serve the local community of Musselburgh, and the surrounding towns. 

Nino's AAG has recently moved into an old, derelict building. The building is badly damaged with damaged roofs, walls, floors and graffiti. Nino, with your help, would like to restore this derelict building, into the lively community centre that it used to be. 

When restored, Nino will use the premises as a community centre, teaching martial arts, boxing, keep-fit, kickboxing and dance classes to children, adults, OAP's and the disabled. Nino will also have morning tea sessions, asking only for donations.

Nino hopes that with your donations, and with the spirit of the community, he can have this open as soon as possible. 

Thank You all for your kind help,
Nino

story:
WHO AM I?

Hello ladies and gentlemen. My name is Telila Deressa Gutema, i am male by sex and airplane systems engineer by profession. I was born on 28th July, 1987 and now i live in Addis Ababa, the capital of Ethiopia.

ACADEMICS

    I got my first degree (BSc.) in Mechanical Engineering from Jimma University in 2010.

    I earned three diplomas in maintenance of Air frame, Power plant and Avionics of Aircraft from Ethiopian Airlines Aviation Academy in 2012. The licenses were given to me by Ethiopian Civil Aviation Authority, which is part of ICAO (international Civil Aviation Organization) upon successful accomplishment of my study. They are attached for your review.

    Now, i am studying in extension program my Master Degree in Industrial Engineering at Addis Ababa University.

CAREER

  I worked as Aircraft Maintenance Technician for Ethiopian Airlines from October of 2012 up to mid of 2014.

  From mid 2014 up to present i am working as aircraft systems engineer.

WHY DO I WANT TO BE A PILOT?

 That is my boyhood ambition. I say, "I have to fly or die!" 

I and my family want a better life, a better career. And piloting is one such best option for us!

  I want to be a pilot, and fly for living.

WHY DON'T I TRANSFER FROM BEING ENGINEER TO PILOT WITH IN MY COMPANY NOW?

>The Technical Policy and Procedure Manuals (TPPM) of My Company do not permit.

WHY DID I JOIN TECHNICIAN SCHOOL, LEAVING PILOTING SCHOOL, ON THE VERY FIRST BEGINNING?

  By the time i joined Aircraft Maintenance Technician School, there was no Pilot trainee Vacancy. So, I had to have a job to sustain myself. Then, i joined Technician Schools and could not pull back still!

HAVE I EVER TRIED ANYTHING TO JOIN PILOTING SCHOOLS OR GET SPONSORS TO STUDY IT?

  My answer is a big YES!

  I wrote to numerous piloting schools in Europe, USA, Australia, Canada and South Africa pleading them a free scholarship. To my bad luck, none of them replied me positively.

  I went to heaven and earth in search of someone who might be able and willing to help me to pursue my childhood dream, but all to no avail.

  I have been writing and asking for sponsors for more than 7 years for no effect.

  Finally, after very long years of persistent correspondence, someone introduced me to this awesome website, Indeigogo.

WHAT I AM LOOKING FOR?

  Hope this is the right place where my thirst will be quenched for once and all.

  About 120,000 US dollar is needed to change my existence into life. The reason why i asked for 130,000 USD on my campaign goal is because Indiegogo will charge me about 5% for its service and also there are things like transaction costs and taxation. I want this money for the following expenditures for attending piloting school: THE COSTS ARE APPROXIMATE & MAY CHANGE WITH TIME.

            Registration and different exams including medical test grade 1: 1,500 USD

             Air Transport [from Addis Ababa, Ethiopia to Phoenix, USA]: 5,500 USD

             School tuition: 75,000 USD FOR MY WHOLE STUDY.

              Medical Insurance: 6,000 USD

              Dormitory fee: 15,000 USD

               Food, clothing and transport within the city of my study: 15,000 USD

               MISCELLANEOUS LIKE FOR VISA PROCESSING AND THE LIKE: 2,000 USD

WHERE AM I THINKING TO STUDY?

>OXFORD AVIATION ACADEMY.

DO HAVE I PERKS FOR YOU?

  Though limited, yes i have extremely amazing perks to some of you on the FIRST COME, FIRST SERVED basis!

GRATITUDE

  May God bless INDIEGOGO team.

  May God bless all that attempt to help me grasp my dream.

  May God bless my team on this campaign.

  May God bless you all!


Telila Deressa.

  My answer is a big YES!
  I wrote to numerous piloting schools in
Europe, USA, Australia, Canada and South Africa pleading them a free
scholarship. To my bad luck, none of them replied me positively.
  I went to heaven and earth in search of
someone who might be able and willing to help me to pursue my childhood dream,
but all to no avail.
  I have been writing and asking for sponsors
for more than 7 years for no effect.
  Finally, after very long years of persistent
correspondence, someone introduced me to this awesome website, Indeigogo.
WHAT I AM LOOKING
FOR?
  Hope this is the right place where my thirst
will be quenched for once and all.
  About 120,000 US dollar is needed to change my
existence into life. The reason why i asked for 130,000 USD on my campaign goal is because Indiegogo will charge me about 5% for its service and also there are things like transaction costs and taxation. I want this money for the following expenditures for
attending piloting school: THE COSTS ARE APPROXIMATE & MAY CHANGE WITH TIME.
            Registration and
different exams including medical test grade 1: 1,500 USD
             Air Transport [from
Addis Ababa, Ethiopia to Phoenix, USA]: 5,500 USD
             School tuition: 75,000 USD FOR MY WHOLE STUDY.
              Medical Insurance: 6,000 USD
              Dormitory fee: 15,000 USD
               Food, clothing and
transport within the city of my study: 15,000 USD               MISCELLANEOUS LIKE FOR VISA PROCESSING AND THE LIKE: 2,000 USD
WHERE AM I
THINKING TO STUDY?
>OXFORD AVIATION ACADEMY.
DO HAVE I PERKS
FOR YOU?
  Though limited, yes i have extremely amazing
perks to some of you on the FIRST COME, FIRST SERVED basis!
GRATITUDE
  May God bless INDIEGOGO team.
  May God bless all that attempt to help me
grasp my dream.
  May God bless my team on this campaign.
  May God bless you all!
Telila Deressa.

story:
Created in 1983, APICUR is a private high school located in Musanze District, Northern Province, Rwanda, sub-Saharan Africa. Our goal is to raise $500, 000.

Our Beginnings

When APICUR started in 1983, we offered three majors: Economics, Commerce and Accounting, and Elementary School Teaching. Between 1988 and 1994, APICUR provided Rwanda with a workforce of three hundred. Some of our first graduates became qualified teachers in elementary education while others became accountants providing quality financial services to medium and small-scale enterprises. 

Overcoming Adversity

Unfortunately, mass killings in Rwanda in 1994 hampered APICUR’s endeavor. Staff, faculty, and students lost their lives while others were exiled. Our buildings were destroyed and looted. But by the Fall of 2000, APICUR resumed its activities and rose from the ashes. In 2002-2003, we reopened the “Accountancy” major. During 2003-2004, we set up a new major in Secretarial studies, and just two years later a new major in Construction. In 2011, we launched Computer Science and Tourism majors. We aim to spearhead the professional and technical training of Rwandan youths. To constantly adapt to our changing world, we decided in 2011 that APICUR no longer needed  the Secretarial studies major, and two years ago we adapted the elementary school teaching major into teacher training colleges. 

Current Work

Presently, APICUR has been rehabilitating its essential infrastructures thanks to Rwandan local, regional, national authorities and international benefactors. The European Union, the French Parents’s Association (Lycée de Charlier) and its students, Nikolaus-Von–Kues Gymnasium of Rhine lands, and the International Fertilizer Development Center are all to thank for much of our work. 

School Details

Right now, APICUR has four combinations: Accountancy A2, Construction A2, Tourism A2, and Computer Science A2. We have 254 girls and 229 boys at APICUR.

Our Goal

APICUR is raising money to fund our Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) focus. We currently don't have the resources to give our students the technological tools they'll need for this constantly changing world. Rwanda needs a workforce that meets international labor market standards, but we need your help to continue and expand our work.

We already have departments in Construction, Accountancy, Tourism, and Computer Science. But we need to improve our students’ technical skills through more in depth STEM programs to make our Rwanda an economic success and competitive as a country. With your help, we will set a up a Mathematics-Physics-Chemistry (MPC) combination, a workshop, multipurpose hall, and a school fence.

Please, make donations to APICUR and help us reach our dreams! All of us in this world should promote the teaching of STEM. LET US DO IT BY OUR DONATIONS TO APICUR in Rwanda!!!

story:
About Us

The Saucon Rotary Foundation, Inc. is a 501(c)(3) organization that provides support to address community issues, including illiteracy.  Our Book Fairy Project provides books, delivered by Book Fairies (mentors) to children that attend financially distressed schools so that they can own and take home their very own book.  Our books are given to children that reside in the neediest of homes.

Over the past four years, we have more than tripled the number of books that we donate every year!  We have delivered nearly 5,000 books, but we now need financial support to continue and expand this very important project! 

What We Need & What You Get

Our annual operating budget is currently $8,000.  Each Book Fairy donates $100, leaving us with about $5,000 that must be raised by other means every year.  Every dollar given to the Project purchases books for nearly 700 children, twice per year!  All children keep and own the books, and they are free take them home to read!  

While there are many organizations that provide just books, what makes us special is our Book Fairies.  The Book Fairies "magically" deliver books, read to the children, and work with the children to complete a project that is tied to the selected book title.  Some projects have included planting sunflowers, while other have sent Flat Stanley around the World!  To learn more, please see our video.  

All donations are tax deductible!  If you donate $5, that will purchase one book for a very eager reader.  If you donate $100, you will help us purchase enough books for an entire class of children!  

 All funds will be directed towards purchasing books for the Project.  

The Impact

We have an enormous impact on thousands of lives.   Not only are we furthering literacy, but we also mentor children on the importance of education and, one day, developing a successful career!

Risks & Challenges

The Project is in its fourth year.  Each year our success depends on the financial contributions that we receive from various funding sources, including grants, donations, etc.  This year, however, we did not obtain a sizable grant from a local community foundation due to increased demand for community based funds.  Not obtaining the necessary funds to run the Project is a real risk that we face each year.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell your friends about the great things we do!

story:
About this project

DYN: Nashville

When you teach students design, you give them an opportunity to express their opinions and the tools necessary to inform their voice. The Nashville Civic Design Center recognized the power of engaging youth on the topic of design and created the Design Your Neighborhood project—funded in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Arts (NEA).

Design Your Neighborhood was conceived as an intensive four-week summer camp that would walk students through the topics of architecture, urban design, planning, civic engagement, graphic design, and filmmaking. During those four weeks, a film crew captured everything that took place and produced a documentary about the project.

View the full length documentary here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tkthzqAFijk&list=UUHmegP6KcNnVdCnLXpMuZSg 

A Program for Everyone

With the success of the program in Nashville, we want to take the key elements of DYN and share it with anyone interested in using it. In partnership with Anode multimedia studio (http://anode.com/graphic-design-animator/) we are in the process of creating an interactive website that will be available to any group interested in pursing the program. 

The website design will allow for an adaptable program personalized to the needs of any group. Teachers across the country and world will be able to select a Design Your Neighborhood curriculum based on their projected course timelines: two hours, one day, one week, two weeks, or four weeks. However, each program direction will be supported with documentation from a wide variety of content partners to make any version of the program possible.

Each curriculum was based on the successful four-week program created by Gary Gaston—Design Director of the Nashville Civic Design Center and a Lecturer with the University of Tennessee College of Architecture and Design.

When you teach youth about design, You empower them.

By the age of 11, children are being affected not only by their homes, neighborhoods, and schools but the city and the larger world that surrounds them. Unfortunately, children and young adults seldom have the opportunity to participate in the planning process. But when included in this process, they bring a particular vision that may go beyond the constraints of the adult world and provide dynamism to planning that would otherwise be vacant without their input and participation.

From analyzing pre and post-program interview responses, the youth who participated in DYN showed development in the areas of map orientation, neighborhood design knowledge, understanding what is a healthy community, career goals, and interest in their home city.

Making a Real Difference 

In 2014, The Metropolitan Development and Housing Agency (MDHA), in partnership with the Metro Arts Commission and Mayor Karl Dean of Nashville finished work on a new community park in honor of Nashville native William Edmondson (1874-1951)—a self-taught artist who was the first African-American to have a solo show at the Metropolitan Museum of Art (MOMA) in New York. The idea for the park, which sits on a previously underused strip of land near the Nashville Oasis Youth Center, came in summer 2011 from the students of the Design Your Neighborhood program. The teens engaged in an exercise with landscape architect Kira Appelhans to redesign the park. Shortly thereafter, MDHA contracted with Hawkins Partners to design a new park, incorporating ideas developed by the youth. Today, the park is a source of pride not only for the Design Your Neighborhood students, but also the community it resides in. 

Read more on Edmondson Park: http://www.nashville-mdha.org/view_news.php?id=225 

Hear more from DYN students: http://www.tennessean.com/story/opinion/contributors/2014/08/20/revitalized-edmondson-park-place-create/14306493/

The Next Steps

The program was funded in part by the National Endowment for the Arts and serves its overarching goal that “the arts contribute to the strengthening of communities.” The initial funding went toward the Nashville iteration of Design Your Neighborhood but we need your help to make it to neighborhoods around the world. Your support will allow us to create the interactive website for communities to use and help give young adults the design knowledge and tools needed to create sustainable changes within their neighborhoods.

Risks and challenges

As with other non-profits, lack of funding and lack of staff can always be a challenge. This website is a massive undertaking that will require a lot of hard work, funding, dedication, research, and collaboration with local, national, and international organizations. There is also always the chance that this website will not serve young adults and communities around the world in the same way it has served Nashville. 

Despite these risks, we at the Nashville Civic Design Center feel there is no limit to the potential of this project. With many local and national organizations supporting this program, we feel the Design Your Neighborhood Toolbox will absolutely change the way communities develop and how youth view their neighborhoods. The launching of this website will not mark the end of our work, but rather the beginning of a life-long iterative process. 

In order to ensure this program serves communities around the world in the most meaningful way, the website and curriculum will contain a feedback component that will allow participants and teachers to truthfully document their experiences. We will then use this information to continue developing our website and curriculum to best serve your community!

story:
Summary

The Step UP to Inspire campaign is about training young girls and women to be an entrepreneurs through mentorship.  It's a call-to-action for successful women to step up and reach back to help 15 young women realize their own success by mentoring and sharing their value. 



Have you ever been inspired, motivated, and guided by a woman who cared about your success?  

A long time ago, someone reached out to me and saw my potential when I didn't see it myself.  I was insecure, confused, and didn't know how to share my gifts and talents with the world. She took me under her wings and helped me on my path.  That is what mentoring is all about, and I believe as a successful woman entrepreneur, it is my responsibility to step up and inspire another young lady on her path to success.

My name is Kim Harris and I am the Creator/Visionary for the Stiletto Business Strategies™ brand.  You can learn more about me by clicking here.

I am very passionate about sharing information that transforms business and lives, and that is why I created the Stiletto Women Business Owners Symposium™, a live tour that travels across the U.S. and abroad.  This platform engages the most successful women entrepreneurs in their industry to share value and make a difference.  

The Stiletto Women Business Owners Symposium™ 2015 tour is on tap to visit 3 domestic cities and two international cities.  We have committed to awarding 15 scholarships within each city.  This represents 75 young girls and women between the ages of 16-30 who will be empowered with the information shared at our symposium and making important, possibly, life-long connections with successful women entrepreneurs.

Mentoring plays an important role in young lives, and this campaign will help us bridge the gap between those girls/young lades who don't have access to inspiring role models so they can realize their greatest possibility.

Here are some statistics on the importance of the mentoring relationship and how it impacts:


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $7,500 to scholarship 15 young women and girls in Washington, D.C. on April 10, 2015.  Here is how it will be allocated:

Description

Cost

Qty

Total

1-Day Training Scholarship

Training Materials

Plagues & Acknowledgement Awards

40

15

600

Transportation/Parking

15

Gift Bag

225

Other:

Marketing/Staff/Administration

1500

1

1500

Grand Total for each City

$7,425
  • We want to acknowledge your contribution and support in the most valued way we can provide, so here are some creative ways we will do that:
    • Stiletto Spotlight Business Coaching with Top Coaches from across the U.S.
    • Signature Step Up 2 Inspire T-Shirt
    • Stiletto Business Strategies Compilation CD
    • Radio Ads on Stiletto Business Strategies Show
    • Value-priced Tickets to the Upcoming D.C. Event
If our goal of $7,500 is not reached, we will lower the number of sponsored participants to match the amount raised, so that we can still implement our goal of empowering young girls and women with our platform and connecting them with successful women mentors.

The Impact

The impact of Step Up to Inspire Scholarship campaign is a far-reaching and lasting one.  The information learned by sponsored participants from our symposium format provide practical action plans that can be easily implemented.  Additionally, mentoring resources are open to participants in an ongoing relationship.  Resources are continually compiled and contributed to our online training center and available to access at any time.  The right information delivered at the right time, can change lives.

Your support will magnify our efforts to reach our goal to positively impact 75 young girls and women. It will provide a means to attend the event to receive valuable information that can enhance their lives.

Risks & Challenges

There are some challenges we face when planning our symposiums in different cities. Tickets sale benchmarks, venue location, other major events happening at the same time.  Having successfully hosting several symposiums, and evaluating the success of each one, I have discovered creative ways to address challenges that would enhance the experience.  Here are some ways we do this:

  • Target Ambassadors within each city who have established networks to champion the event process and tap into existing networks
  • Seeking non-traditional venues such as museums, campuses, and community centers to host the event provides a feasible alternative to hotels, or convention centers.
  • Identify local businesses and organizations that we can provide connections with so that cause related partnerships can be formed for sustained support.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that there may be some who want to contribute, but are limited, however, sharing this campaign with people in your circle of influence can help would be your gift.  Please ask others to help support the Step Up to Inspire Scholarship campaign, and use INDIEGOGO tools to spread the word about your own project, so that I can support you, too!

Thank you so much for taking time to read through this, watch my very modest video, and supporting the project!

spread the word about your own project, so that I can support you, too!
Thank you
so much for taking time to read through this, watch my very modest video, and
supporting the project!

story:
Donate and contribute than $ 50 or $ 100
Campaign/project name: Initiators, Always.

The Palestinians people in Gaza have been living in sanction for more than eight years because of the destructive, bloody wars by the Israeli Defense Force. First war was 2008; second war in 2012 and the most violent and fiercer was in 2014.

The 2014 Israeli war against Gaza was the most brutal and barbaric with many horrific aspects described below (but not limited to):

1.  Massive deterioration in the economic condition, structure and foundation of the City and surrounding areas

2.  Enormous suffocation in the human being life style in every way possible

3.  No means of basic/standard human living

4.  Thousands of homeless families

5.  Thousands of orphans

6.  Thousands of injured and disabled/handicapped

7.  Collapse of the overall infrastructure

In the midst of this tragedy, groups of Palestinians started out a campaign under the name of (Initiators, Always). The group was determined to work hard with all efforts possible despite limited funds, support and shortage of resources. Their mission is to help families and children, and to provide the support needed in an effort to rebuild human dignity and heal Gazan’s oozing wound. The focus is mainly on families in the Khoza’ah and Shaja’eya areas. Their homes have been completely destroyed and most became homeless (living on streets, in empty building/schools). Some are poor and deprived of basic human needs.

In addition to the continuous work to offer the basic, necessary and urgent material needs for these families, they also provide psychological, mental and social support for children 8 years of age and below. These children are suffering from insecurities, constant fear and terror and anxiety every day and night because of the continuous bombing on their homes by the Israeli Army post 2014 war.

The Gaza Strip crisis became increasingly worse because of the delayed efforts in rebuilding Gaza Strip (specifically after the last war in 2014), as many governments and countries have ignored and forgot this tragedy.

The campaign/project main objectives and goals:

1.  Strengthen the definition of solidarity between the Palestinians and the international communities

2.  Enhance and develop the standard of living for those in desperate need (especially the poor and homeless)

3.  Psychological assistance and support to effected children

Justifications and reasons behind the campaign/project:

1.  Current living situations are getting worse every day for families with destroyed homes

2.  Inability of building shelters for homeless with no construction material available due to the closing of the Rafah crossing/passageway

3.  No food and seasonal clothing (winter and summer)

4.  Increased the percentage of children with special needs and those who have mental and psychological injures

5.  No income for the thousands of families that lost their parents and family members (left with no financial support)

6.  School supplies and uniforms/clothing for students

The project/campaign main categories:

·  200 children

·  500 families (poor and homeless)

Phases of the process

1.  Field survey (survey on effected homes and families)

2.  Evaluation on poorest and homeless families and those with destroyed homes

4.  Specification on requirements/needs and prioritization for these families

5.  Distribution of such needs (goods, clothing, rebuilding of destroyed rooms in homes, etc)

6.  Evaluation and ongoing follow ups

The project/campaign budget

story:
Connected praying mat

The client will be at the heart of the project. From a member to the object and from the connected object to the service

An innovative, light and on-the-move mobile platform packed full with an onboard technology. Multiple applications  

A) The purpose

Launching and commercialisation of a multilingual Olo®  holographic mat

B) The targets

This model of "Olo holographic connected mat" will be commercialised in BtoB to start with: hotels, palaces, mosques, airports, embassies, tourist places...then in BtoC moving forward

________________________________________

Meeting the audience, presenting the concept, offering our membership to all targets.

Client membership management via the Internet with secure interactive exchanges between members 

Unite and train mosques to this new way of communicating

________________________________________

Planned exhibitions in 2016 / 2017

Casablanca Exhibition, February March 2016

Brussels Exhibition, March 2016

Algiers Exhibition, March 2016

Ramf in the Bourget, Paris, yearly meeting of the Muslims of France, April 2016

Paris Exhibition,April May 2016

Tunis Exhibition, November 2017

Allow the vast population to learn the Sourates and have knowledge of the Prophet's messages called the Hadiths, either by themselves or with their family thanks to the connected praying mat which is the main media for praying and meditating

Project success factors: education, training, teaching, learning for all, these values are the backbone of this application

________________________________________

How will your money be used

Project Phases

(2015 - 2016)

Launching of the first digital media (connected mat and touchscreen)

a) After 8 months, translation of the Sourates into Arabic, English and French

b) After 10 months, launching of a free application for smartphones, tablets in order to ease the membership process, into 3 languages

c) After 12 months, development of an Internet platform for  online members

d) After 14 months, Studio video recording (make the writings and texts become alive with explanations and sounds, into 3 languages), transforming the traditional into a digital medium

e) After 16 months, launching the Olo® connected holographic mat

________________________________________

1) Sharing of the benefits

________________________________________

2) Offered advantage

Only one advantage will be offered: a 12-month free membership

9€ for a one-year membership

The donators will be offered a 12-month free and unlimited membership and access to all identified digital services

1 Digital Tablet Olo® you connect to an iPad, storing animated images and interactive texts _ delivery by UPS Express in worldwide, without subscription basic format 307x183x10 Possibility to manufacture custom-made Digital Tablets and Contents 


________________________________________

3) Generating employment

Recruitment of 40 qualifying jobs will be planned 

  1. Experienced and religious authority-certified translators 
  2. Trilingual webmasters
  3. Video,sound and image specialists 
  4. Artistic video director
  5. Community Manager (social network management and moderators)
  6. Logistics and programmers (algorithm creation)
  7. On the road salespeople, offer our solution to religious institutions 

________________________________________

We massively rely on you all to see this project come alive.  Join the community to exchange, share and broadcast the project

________________________________________



Le client sera au cœur du projet. L'abonné vers l'objet et l'objet connecté orienté vers le service

Tapis-de-prière-connecte

Innovant, support mobile, léger, transportable avec technologie embarquée. Applications multiples (Solution Open)

A) Objectif
Lancement, commercialisation du tapis hologramme Olo® version multilingue
B) Cibles concernées
Ce modèle de 'tapis connecté hologramme Olo®' dans un premier temps sera commercialisé en BtoB, hôtels, palaces, mosquées, aéroports, ambassades, endroits touristiques ...et ensuite en BtoC

________________________________________

Rencontre avec le grand public, présentation du concept, proposer notre offre d'abonnement à tous
Gestion des Abonnements clients via Internet avec échange interactif sécurisé entre abonnés
Fédérer et former les mosquées à ce nouveau mode de communication

________________________________________

Manifestations prévues 2016 / 2017

Foire de Casablanca, Février Mars 2016

Foire de Bruxelles, Mars 2016

Foire d'Alger, Mars 2016

(RAMF) au Bourget, rencontre annuelle des musulmans de France, Avril 2016

Foire de Paris, Avril Mai 2016

Foire de Tunis, Novembre 2017

Permettre à un grand nombre, l'apprentissage des Sourates et la connaissance des messages du Prophète que sont les Hadith (s) seul ou en famille, associé au Tapis de prière connecté qui est le lien principal pour la prière et la méditation (Marqueur du projet: l'éducation, la formation, la pédagogie, l’enseignement pour tous, ces valeurs sont l'épine dorsal de cette application)

________________________________________

Comment sera utilisé votre argent

Phases du projet (2015 - 2016)

A) Phases de développement

Lancement du (ou) des premiers supports numériques (support tapis et écran tactile connecté)

a) A 8 mois, Traduction des Sourates en Arabe, Anglais et Français

b) A 10 mois, Création d’une application gratuite pour les smartphones et tablettes afin de faciliter les inscriptions en 3 langues

c) A 12 mois, Développement d’une plate forme Internet pour les clients abonnés en ligne

d) A 14 mois, Enregistrement en studio des vidéos (dématérialiser les écritures et textes avec explications et son en 3 langues) transformation du traditionnel en support numérique

e) A 16 mois, Lancement du tapis connecté hologramme Olo®

________________________________________

1) Répartition des gains

________________________________________

2) Contrepartie offerte

Une seule contrepartie sera offerte | Abonnement gratuit 12 mois

9€ pour 1 année d'abonnement

Les donateurs se verront offrir un abonnement gratuit de 12 mois et accéder à tous les services numériques identifiés en illimité

OU 1 Tablette Olo® que vous connectez à un Ipad, mémorisation des images animées et textes interactifs _ livraison par UPS Express dans le monde entier

SANS ABONNEMENT

Possibilité de fabriquer des tablettes sur mesure !

________________________________________

3) Créations d'emplois

  • Un recrutement sera planifié pour 40 emplois qualifiants 
  • Traducteurs expérimentés et 'certifiés' par les autorités religieuses
  • Webmasters trilingue
  • Spécialistes Vidéos, preneur de son et image
  • Réalisateur artistique Vidéos
  • Community manager (gestion du réseau social, modérateurs)
  • Programmeur et logistique (création des algorithmes)
  • Commerciaux itinérants, proposer notre solution auprès des institutions religieuses

________________________________________

Nous comptons massivement sur votre collaboration à toutes et à tous pour que ce projet voit le jour et se réalise. Rejoindre la  communauté pour échanger, partager et diffuser le projet
________________________________________

4) Contact

Email support at alizeesa[AT]gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

Hope in Action Network is a community based non-profit organization that aims at empowering young women and girls by advocating for access to education and health. This youth friendly network also mentors and train young women and girls on leadership, economic empowerment, life skills and breaks the taboo with talks on Menstruation and Sexual Reproductive Health and Rights (SRHR). The charity partners with friends and other organizations to distribute feminine hygiene products to the young women and girls. This transforms their lives by instilling the pride and confidence needed to lead a life filled with purpose.

my campaign focuses mostly on carrying out campaigns on access to education and reproductive health for young women and girls and also educating the community on breaking the taboo around menstruation. While many governments and non-governmental organizations support several issues affecting girls and women in Kenya, menstrual hygiene management often gets overlooked. Many girls  do not attend school due to taboos and stigma related to menstruation. They do not have access to proper sanitary pads and instead they have to improvise with mattresses, blankets, newspaper, rugs or feathers. Using these devices instead of proper hygienic pads can cause severe health risks, such as infections in girls’ genitalia – but these devices are also ineffective and humiliating, often resulting in blood-stained uniforms leading to bullying from particularly male peers and even teachers. Many girls end up missing considerable amount of school, or at worst even dropping out, due to humiliation and stigma related to menstruation. In some cases, girls engage in transactional sex so that they can raise the money they need to buy sanitary towels, putting them at the risk of HIV and STI infection. Alternatively, young girls are forced to skip school during the time they experience monthly periods to avoid both the cost of pads or use of cloths. A girl absent from school due to menstruation for four days in a month loses 13 learning days, equivalent to two weeks of learning, in every school term. My main aim is to keep girls in school and also ensure they have access to feminine hygiene products and health care services. The community also benefits from the campaign as they get to learn why its important to talk openly about menstruation.

 With these funds I will be able to reach over 100 girls, community health workers and leaders, teenage mothers and peer educators from different urban slums in Nairobi. we will have a training on menstrual management, reproductive health, teenage pregnancy and unsafe abortion as these are the major causes of school drop out among adolescent girls. I will buy them feminine hygiene products. I want to supply them with enough sanitary pads and panties for a whole school term and also follow up on the progress by carrying out an evaluation after the school term to see the impact of the campaign.

What We Need & What You Get

I will require USD6,000 for this upcoming event. with this I will be able to mobilize the participants, buy pads, panties, bathing soap, body oil,  snacks/food and soft drinks.,  pay facilitators, pay for the venue, hire tents and chairs, hire a public address system for the day. as we prepare for this big day; community mobilization is already taking place. participants are getting ready for the  talent show  that will help boost self esteem and discover new talents among participants.

- if there will be any cash left then I will use it to print out fliers for the community especially schools churches, health centers and chief camps as these are some of the safe spaces in the community and often visited by many people. this will help spread the word around and also change the attitude of the community towards girl child education and menstruation.

The Impact

this project will help create a safe space where teenage girls and community leaders  can meet and share; be mentored and empowered on issues around menstrual management and reproductive health and rights. it will also  create a safe and social platform where teenage girls from different communities can share experiences, learn from each other and work together towards the common objective of improving health and choices.  teenage girls will be empowered  with Sexual Reproductive health information on their sexuality and life skills which they will use to reduce their vulnerabilities to sexual exploitation and HIV infection. they will be  kept in schools by providing them with sufficient feminine products.

Risks & Challenges

Some of the risks in this is low performance by some of the beneficiaries and some families forcing their children to sell the items they get and use the cash to buy food instead. We  however overcome this through strong guidance and counselling for the beneficiaries and also openly talking to parents. We also guide them to avoid peer pressure that often lead to selling the items to buy other personal belongings and stay up with the current  fashions.. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate cash, you can send us feminine hygiene products, find a friend who can help us. Share this to your networks.

Remember to use Indiegogo to share this. Let's celebrate this year's International Women's day by helping get a girl through school and grow the next generation of leaders.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Josué, you and me

Us Guatemalans we are naturally skilled people, we’re quick thinkers, and we do not take anything for granted; we work for what we want and we understand things quickly.  However, even though there is a group of people that have a better set of skills, not everybody is presented with opportunities to exploit them.

Josué, from Sumpango, is a clear example of this. FUNSEPA, a non profit organization working with technology for education, detected his innate and inherent skill and love for mathematics while doing a program with Khan Academy. Growing up in a place where few possibilities appear due to its distance from the city, he was the one that carved his future thanks to his ability with numbers. His natural talent and his intellectual capacity are his biggest tools to continue shaping his future.

But Josué’s story is only beginning – it is up to us now to give him this yearned opportunity.

If you want to lear more about Josue, here is another video... 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6ADGOCn-6yA


What we need and what you get

FUNSEPA is currently collecting funds so that he can continue with his studies in an academic establishment where his talents will be polished, in hopes of continuing with the development of his talent, a talent that will surely enable him to have many more opportunities that will better his future.

Josué’s budget is approximately Q11,000. It breaks down the following way:

  • Enrollment: $400
  • Monthly tuition: $85 (for 10 months)
  • Books and school material: $300
  • Uniforms: $100
  • Total annual cost: $1,650
  • Final Total Cost (for three years): $4,950

Thus, our final objective of collecting $5,000. Truthfully, it is a number that cannot represent the improvement, in the area of educational quality, that Josué’s preparation will finally have – it is indeed an opportunity that opens the doors to hundreds of more.

With your donation, you are free to choose among a series of memoirs that Josué and FUNSEPA offer you. The more generous your action, the greater and cooler perk you’ll acquire!

What is FUNSEPA?

The Sergio Paiz Foundation (FUNSEPA) is a non-profit organization that uses technology as a tool to improve the quality of education. In an era where technology is an essential condition for development, its access is no longer a privilege; it must be a Human Right.  At FUNSEPA we work tirelessly to take this right to all schools in the country, and to make an impact on our education by improving our children’s competitiveness in the global market. 

There are 3.2 million children in Guatemala between the ages of 6 to 15, and 18,000 primary public schools, of which 93% have no access to technology.  

Our mission is to use technology as a tool to advance the educational process in Guatemala, thus contributing to the nation’s social and economic development.

Our vision is to use technology to help make a positive and lasting impact on the educational system of Guatemala, thus making our youngest citizens competitive in the 21st century and helping free our nation of poverty.

 In 2004 Funsepa  embarked on a whole new adventure. The foundation joined forces with Khan Academy, ¨KA,¨ a non-profit organization that provides world-class education for anyone, anywhere; and with the Foundation of Learning Equality creators of ¨KA Lite¨ The offline version of Khan Academy.  

With Khan, Funsepa is exploring new educational possibilities with an ambitious goal: redefining a new era in education. 

By May 2015 FUNSEPA has equipped 1,166 schools all over Guatemala (6% of the total primary schools population), with 17,632 computers, training more than the 48% of the total teacher population and benifitting 422.238 students


Looking Forward

Now, the only thing left to ask is: will you give Josué the opportunity to be able to meet his goals? The future of this young boy, who is able to change his reality and his surrounding, is in your hands.  

Your contribution will generate a direct impact. If the campaign reaches its objective, we will guarantee Josué’s education for Básicos (8th to 10th Grade)! This means three years of academic preparation in an private establishment that will provide him with the essential intellectual skills to continue with his personal development. Think about it: three years!

The power a single prepared person can have in shaping his or her community is more than profound. When people hear about these success stories, the will to better one’s own reality becomes contagious. Changing somebody’s life is, consequently, changing a lot of people’s life.

Risks and Challenges

We have 60 days to achieve our objectives, so that means that only a collective effort will help Josué.

If the final objective is not met in its entirety, the remaining funds will be destined to the financing of more Khan Academy programs, one of the main projects powered by FUNSEPA. Up until today, FUNSEPA has managed to equip a great amount of public schools across Guatemala with more than 17,000 computers, each one with access to the Khan Academy programs.

This way, we will continue to find more young people like Josué along the way – perfect examples of dedication, motivation and effort.

Other ways you can help…

Some people cannot collaborate, but that doesn’t mean they cannot help!

Now that you are aware, spread the word! We need an echo to be generated; we need people to find out that there’s someone in need and whose life we could easily change. Use the ‘share’ tools provided by IndieGoGo, share it on your Facebook page and post it on your friends’ walls…

We can all contribute to the future of an outstanding young man!
story_txt:
Josué, you and me
Us Guatemalans we are naturally skilled people, we’re quick thinkers, and we do not take anything
for granted; we work for what we want and we understand things quickly.
 However, even though there is a group of people that have a better set of
skills, not everybody is presented with opportunities to exploit them.
Josué,
from Sumpango, is a clear example of this. FUNSEPA, a non profit organization working with technology for education, detected his
innate and inherent skill and love for mathematics while doing a program with Khan Academy. Growing up in a place where
few possibilities appear due to its distance from the city, he was the one that
carved his future thanks to his ability with numbers. His natural talent and
his intellectual capacity are his biggest tools to continue shaping his future.

story:
Who we are:

We are a group of architecture and construction science students at UTSA that understand 3d printing as a revolutionary technology, and we want to get our hands on one! 
Students at UTSA pride themselves in being familiar with the latest in product-development and architectural software. By equipping us with a 3d printer, you are helping us to bring our designs out of the computer screen and into our hands. 
By donating to our campaign, you are helping students advance the art and science of building technology in ways that can change lives - with the ability to generate 3d-printed objects, a student becomes a valuable asset to the workforce and becomes part of a growing movement of makers intent on bettering the world

What We Need & What You Get

The Breakdown:

  • We need $1100 to purchase a Simple Metal Plus 3d printer and print materials
  • With every donation over $10, you will receive a 3D-printed Thank-you from UTSA Architecture!
  • If we don't reach our funding goal through indiegogo, we will donate the funds we did raise to the UTSA Department of Architecture

The Impact

3d printed technology enables design student to create things outside the realm of possibility 15 years ago. Examples of 3d-printed student projects can be found here and the amazing adoption of 3d printing in the professional world is cataloged here.

Risks & Challenges

3D printing is new and exciting, but it does present its own set of challenges. There is a learning curve to the creation of 3d printed objects, and helping students understand how to efficiently and effectively use a new technology resource is the main challenge to including a 3d printer in architecture studios.

Our response to this challenge is to create a group of students designated as "print stewards" who will walk fellow students through regular workshops and training sessions before they are granted full access to the printer. In this way the challenge of integration is met with the solution of peer learning.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • We need folks like you to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! 
  • Facebook, twitter, and indiegogo sharing tools are all appreciated!

Thanks for reading!

story:
The Reality

In Peru, a large and diverse country, a group of people who have lived, for several reasons, the reality of all Peruvian corners; know deeply the daily living of many families from its three regions: Coast, Mountains and Jungle.

These families have between three and five children which mostly dedicates to agricultural activities, fishing or, in worst cases, they are exploited by the informal mining and/or indiscriminated logging.

These children do not have access to technology. Every morning, they walk enormous distances one next to each other, sometimes fording rivers to get to the nearest school in the community or to reach a professor, in charge of several children from very different ages and educational attainment; but all of them sharing the same time and space. 

The kids living this reality are not few. As they grow, a large group of young decides to drop their studies, in many cases, to help their parents. But, there is another source of school dropouts, the growing idea that invades low-income areas that learning is hard, learning is for others, I am incapable of learning.

We cannot longer accept this reality so we have decided to act in order to change it. We want that the kids and young ones to interiorize that they can learn. We want them to realize that it can be easy and fun, even for them.

According to the latest PISA examination (2012), Peru has the worst reading comprehension, mathematic skills and science knowledge among the 65 countries studied.

Our Goal (Not a Dream)

Joining our experience and knowledge, we have built a program based on educational games and we want these kids to take advantage of it, without the distances representing an obstacle to them.

There are several tests which results tell us that the cognitive abilities rises almost 65% more when they study under the educational games program versus the traditional program.

Understand - Not Understand under the traditional program


Understand - Not Understand under the educational games program


This is the main idea, break paradigms and reach every kid and young in Peru. Furthermore, with those children and young people who live in bigger cities, we want to recuperate integration and social cohesion spaces; which are increasingly scarce.

We want to take the games there where electrical energy has already arrived and technology is a part of their lives, where kids have replaced the balls and dolls for videogames; and to recover the acquired values that everyone obtains when they play and teach us to wait for our turn, to respect the winning and losing team, and to accept and behave under some rules.

We have three methodological proposals of different and entertaining games, involving not only the children but the whole family; in order to reduce the current educational gap with the developed countries.

BEHIND THE WORDS ™ 

The proper language promotes communication, essential to understand each other. Sometimes, common language errors difficult comprehension and learning. We want this topic to be perceived as easily controllable. This game proposes to define accurately if the word shown is an adjective, substantive or verb. Also, it provides basic orthographic rules that allows us to communicate; all this as a part of the game mechanics.

MEMOCALCULUS ™

As we are sure that the starting point of good calculus is the multiplication table, we have created a game in which memory will help so that the kids could easily memorize the basic multiplication tables. Numbers are part of daily life; and we want them to see that it is really easy.

SUCCESSFUL ™

Nowadays, we see in the main social networks such as Facebook some phrases that inspire us. Sometimes words coming from successful people can be really helpful to acknowledge that we do not have limits, that we can achieve anything we propose and that it is worth all the effort in order to make a good change. We want the young to inspire in what others have made in life. We want them to see that they can also make something useful with their lives by looking themselves in other successful people that suffered the same or even worst problems than they did. The aim of this game is to increase the self-esteem of the young people and that they can in turn inspire other family members.

How to participate

As you, we want to change the life of 3 640 000 children. We want this change to be reflected in their families and, over a long period, in the country; with a new generation of people who believe in constant development, with values that new times will demand. We must do it as we are in a time of orientation towards being humans.

Your contribution is essential. With US$ 13.00 you are potentially changing the life of a kid. How many will you help? JJJJJJJ…

Participate in this campaign. Click and contribute.

The campaign will start by poors areas of our country, where there are no basic services nor technological resources.

story:
Short Summary

We are a group of 6 passionate young individuals, from Philippines, Maldives, Hong Kong, Colombia, Lebanon/Slovakia and Turkey, who are currently studying at Li Po Chun United World College of Hong Kong. We are bonded by our ideals and the sense of responsibility to bring peace and international understanding through our contributions to this world. At the same time, we are Playbackers -trained in an international therapeutic and improvisational form of theater. (Check this link for further information about International Playback Centre!)


(Hassam Saleem - The Maldives)


We believe that Playback can be used as a catalyst to start dialogue about biases and social and religious coexistence, which is why we think that introducing and performing it in the Philippines, particularly Mindanao, would be valuable in promoting mutual understanding between Christians and Muslims in the area. Through this medium of art that is intended to serve to the community, we are aiming to expose different perspectives that are difficult to share in national debates. As a group, composed of individuals of various belief and religious systems, we see it as our duty to promote these values through our art.


(Vanessa Taylor Canon - Colombia)


Our team is indeed very suitable for this mission, as our members have been working with development NGOs in Hong Kong that are closely tied to the Filipino community, running a Peace Initiative that worked with students from Mindanao and Kashmir region in the past. By having knowledge on local situation, our Filipino member is able to provide her first-hand experience on the situation in Mindanao and suggestions on how Playback can support the community. We possess a drive to make a difference to the greatest extent we can, and this project is rooted in an application that has never been employed in this extent before!

In order to launch this project, we need YOUR help. We already have a part of the funds needed, however, this will not cover all of our project's financial demands. Being secondary school students, we do not have the means to obtain the required funds so every help you send our way will bring us closer to our goal!


(Ferna Simbulan - Philippines)


The Impact

If all conditions are met, our project is set to create a meaningful impact to the community in Mindanao and potentially the whole country. We are also ensuring the sustainability of this ideal through creating a network with the theatre/art students in the region. This could initiate a shift in perspectives and promote widespread mutual understanding, as the similar projects, involving young Filipino Christians and Muslims, that our members have conducted in the past.


[Photo TBA]

(Jesika El Rifiova - Lebanon/Slovakia)


Upon the return of our team to Hong Kong, other students in the region would also receive a training on the application of Playback in the cases of social unrest and conflicts. We are aiming to disseminate the knowledge to the future generation of students. This would in turn ensure a self-feeding group of skilled and interested project leaders, who will be collaborating with other passionate individuals in the Philippines.


(Olivia Lam - Hong Kong)

How We Will Do It

  • Members of our group are trained Playbackers for over two years now, and they are thoroughly experienced in organizing conflict resolution workshops as well as working with the Filipino community in Hong Kong. 

  • Upon arrival to the Philippines, we plan to receive additional training for Playback that is focused on social unrest and social change in the region.

  • We are in contact with universities around Metro Manila and selected areas in Mindanao to introduce and perform Playback.

  • Our members, representing diverse religious backgrounds will strengthen the group’s relatability to participants.

(Belce Dogru - Turkey)


What We Need & What You Get

  • The money we will have raised will be used to cover necessary expenses such as airfare to and within the Philippines, land transportation, food and accommodation for our 6-member group. Please contact us if you would like a detailed breakdown of our costs.

  • As a show of gratitude for your donations, we will give you special tokens (see ‘Perks’)


    Other Ways You Can Help 

    If you are unable to donate money, you can still help us by sharing this page via social media with your friends! Make sure to use the share tools provided by Indiegogo.


Risks & Challenges

  1. Certain places are unreliable in terms of security and transportation means in Mindanao (e.g closed roads, etc)  so we won’t be traveling to these areas.

  2. Financial difficulties regarding transportation, food, and accommodation.

  3. Language barriers with locals of the Mindanao area because of the presence of a dialect. However, we have a native Tagalog speaker in the group so this challenge may pose only very little struggle. In addition, our target audience (consisting predominantly of university students) are generally familiar with communicating in English.


Contact Us

We are a group of passionate and dedicated Playback theatre students from Li Po Chun United World College of Hong Kong who intend to make use of our skills to instigate meaningful impacts.

If you have further enquiries, please feel free to contact us through e-mail: belce.dogru@gmail.com.

story:
• In the United States, 1 in 4 women have experienced domestic abuse. It is estimated that of all women murdered, close to half were killed by their intimate partner or a male family member.
  • 83 per cent of girls in grades 8 through 11 in the United States have experienced sexual harassment.
  • In New Delhi, a 2010 study found that 66 per cent of women have experienced sexual harassment.
  • Worldwide, more than 700 million women alive today were married as children (below 18 years of age). More than one in three—or some 250 million—were married before 15.
  •  Women and girls represent 55 per cent of the estimated 20.9 million victims of forced labour worldwide, and 98 per cent of the estimated 4.5 million forced into sexual exploitation.
  • More than 133 million girls and women have experienced some form of female genital mutilation (FGM) in the 29 countries in Africa and the Middle East where the harmful practice is most common. A mere
  • 7.4% of all countries have had female heads of states over the last 50 years.

The S.W.A.T. Institute (Simply Woman Accredited Trainer) offers something entirely unique in the world: We are the only “Empowerment Coaching Certification program,” exclusively for women.

We bring top-notch education, teachers, even New York Times bestselling authors; our three-year program is comparable to the top Universities in the United States at a fraction of the price.

We offer all women worldwide a safe online place to heal from their own stories of gender inequality, abuse, neglect, even just self-esteem struggles and limiting beliefs; we, then, empower her with concrete tools—nutrition, psychology, Women's Health & Wellness, coaching interventions and processes, and then a full module learning about the business behind the business. Once she graduates she is confident in using these skills both personally and to empower other women as a Certified Empowerment Coach (should she want to pursue this as a career). As long as she can access the Internet, we can give her the support she needs.

Our students are women who've researched our curriculum, resonated with our message, and felt drawn to our training.

Our graduates have made incredible improvements in their lives—with their health & nutrition, relationships, parenting, income, and career. They’ve not only healed their disempowered stories, they are certified to empower and educate other women, worldwide. This is a life-time of friendship, support, education, and empowerment.

Our vision for this campaign is to educate and empower 100 deserving women, who could otherwise never afford this type of education. Our bigger goal is provide full scholarships for over 1,000 women this year, alone.



Take a Behind the Scenes Video Tour of The S.W.A.T. Institute Empowerment Coaching Certification, here!

Download the Student Handbook, here!

The sad part is that thousands and thousands more women have reached out, desperate to get this specialized training to improve their lives but they simply can't afford it. This is where we need your help...

Although we’ve provided many scholarships over the past five years and set our tuition pricing at bare bone costs (with little to no profit margins -- we've even created a 3-year, interest-free payment plan), the women who need it most, still can’t afford it. It wouldn’t matter if we gave it to them for free, they can’t afford their own books or a tablet / laptop to work on.

Help us help them... We can't do it alone.


There is no funding for women’s rights organizations:

A global survey of 1,119 women’s rights organizations from over 140 countries showed that only 1 in 10 received funding from bilateral donors, national governments and international non-government organizations. Meanwhile only 6.9% received funding from UN Women. (Source: AWID Global Survey “Where is the money for women’s rights?” 2011)

We have built this school with no investors or borrowed capital. It is crucial we get the funding we need so that we can continue to help empower and educate the women who need it most. Expansion is happening! We need your help!

When you donate to this campaign, you invest in the lives of women to help them overcome obstacles and put their innovative ideas into action!

For each woman who wins “The S.W.A.T. Institute Empowerment Coaching Certification Scholarship” we will provide her books, tablet, and full tuition, as well as provide unlimited mentorship coaching, one on one time with our brilliant faculty, Professors, and Coaching Advisors; full access to our private forum where women get the sisterhood support of other students; and our founder, Crystal Andrus Morissette, even offers live weekly calls for all students to stay connected to her.

These winners will also be gifted the pre-requisite, world-renowned “12-Week Total Transformation TeleCourse” that will heal her heart, help her to effectively communicate in all aspects of her life, set healthy boundaries, and discover her purpose.

On top of it all, when she graduates, she isn’t just emotionally empowered, she is ready to launch her own business or take her training out into the marketplace!

All winners will be announced before May 1st, 2015, pending the Nominee’s acceptance of the Policies and Procedures of The S.W.A.T. Institute.

If you know of a special woman, deserving of this incredible Empowerment Coaching Certification Scholarship, please NOMINATE her, here!

The cost of this three-year, comprehensive program—including the 12-Week Total Transformation TeleCourse is just under $6,5000 USD. We must also cover the cost of her books and tablet. When you donate, we match it dollar for dollar!

The money goes directly to the Scholar's education. We immediately electronic transfer $1,000 to them to purchase their books and tablet. (Receipts are required.) The remainder is split between two women's tuition, education, mentorship, coaching, and support -- the Professors and staff must be paid (they receive minimal wages for their incredible talent and education); the peripheral rest is spent on learning platform fees and office administration. No profits have been "slipped in." This is the bare bone costs to educate two women intensively for three years (less intensively for a lifetime).

Not to mention, you will receive a multitude of fabulous PERKS as our way to say “Thank YOU!” for your donation! Together, we can help heal the world TWO important women at a time!



In the U.S., the minimum wage is $58 a day. Would you consider investing a half a U.S. day’s wages? Or even $50, $100 or even $200 can help change the lives of women—and their families? Plus, you’ll receive a fabulous gift package as our thank you.

Your gift allows women to become self-sufficient providers for themselves and their children. In honor of International Women’s Day and the 5th Anniversary of The S.W.A.T. Institute, let’s celebrate solutions!

Please, help us those who want and need this specialized training but who can’t afford it. Women who matter. Whose lives matter. When you educate and empower a woman, you help heal the entire world.



In closing, we'd love to leave you with an amazing short lecture given by our S.W.A.T. Graduate, Reya Summer, "It's A Girl; Do You Want to Keep Her?:



This is what an Empowered Woman can do!

Thank you for considering this campaign. We respect your time and donation! If you are intrigued by our Empowerment Coaching Certification and would like to speak to a Coaching Advisor by telephone to find out more details, click here.

Warmly,
The Team at The S.W.A.T. Institute

story:
UofT Involvement

Hey guys! We want to bring cool and exciting events to campus that we can all participate in together in supporting a great cause. Some of the examples that we are working on bringing forward are: 
  • Yoga and mindfulness workshops 
  • Career networking opportunities 
  • Volunteer positions 
  • Healthy lifestyle workshops 
  • Pub nights 
  • Summer parties and BBQs 
  • Competitions and awards 

Short Summary

InvisAbilities is a registered Canadian charity that promotes awareness, education and support of young adults living with hidden, chronic illness.

The organization’s mission is to break down societal misconceptions associated with invisible illness (e.g. Crohn’s disease, fibromyalgia, arthritis, endometriosis, colitis, lupus etc.) that individuals face on a daily basis.

InvisAbilities provides a variety of inclusive community events, programs and services for young adults, including:

Awareness Events, Buddy Program, InvisAble Yoga, Meditation Classes, Discussion Forums, Dog Therapy, Art Therapy, Lending Library.

What We Need

The University of Toronto chapter is a new chapter of the organization, and we are looking to raise funding so that we are able to reach out to our student community in order to provide access to events, opportunities, and services for those living with and without illness. 

Within the next few months, we are looking to implement some of the following for the University of Toronto student community: 

  • Social events for students
  • Awareness campaigns 
  • Mentorship programs 
  • Access to support
  • Volunteer opportunities

What Is A Hidden, Chronic Illness? 

A hidden, chronic illness is a longtime/recurring condition or disease whose symptoms aren’t apparent to the outside world. Individuals with hidden, chronic illness aren’t visually identifiable.

There is a variety of terminology associated with hidden, chronic illness. InvisAbilities uses “hidden, chronic illness”, “invisible illness”, “invisible disability” and “invisAbility” interchangeably. Some examples include: 

  • Diabetes
  • Asthma 
  • Mental Illness
  • Epilepsy
  • Celiac Disease
  • Multiple Sclerosis (MS)
  • Human Immunodeficiency Virus Infection (HIV)
  • Anaphylaxis
  • Cancer

The Impact

“Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter.”

– Martin Luther King, Jr.

The only way to change societal misconceptions of invisible illness and provide support for those living with hidden, chronic illness is by making invisible illness a part of everyday conversation.

Through awareness and support, InvisAbilities’ activities encourage dialogue of invisible illness, thus helping to create a more inclusive community. Advocacy has made a lasting impact on how individuals view hidden, chronic illness. 

Given that we are just starting out right now, anything helps! If you can only donate $5, then that's $5 to help with our cause — in bringing together a community of passionate students in solidarity against stigma, judgments, discrimination, and just plain misunderstanding. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute at this time, that's okay! Please feel free to spread the word, share the link with everyone you know, and help us in raising awareness for support of young adults living with hidden, chronic illness. The more people know about us, the greater it is for our cause!
