story:
¿Quiénes Somos?

Somos actores profesionales, nacidos y formados en Colombia. Decidimos crear esta fundación con el propósito de proporcionar educación artística de buena calidad y a un bajo costo o incluso gratis. Nuestro financiamiento ha corrido en parte por cuenta de nosotros mismos y por otra parte gracias a diferentes producciones de eventos empresariales (fiestas corporativas, promoción de artículos, campañas publicitarias y funciones de teatro). Quisimos buscar un sitio estable en el que pudiéramos llevar a cabo nuestros proyectos de producción y educativos; así llegó esta casa.
¿Por qué comprar esta casa? 
En estos momentos la mayor parte de nuestros ingresos están destinados a pagar la renta de la casa que equivale a US$2000. En Colombia eso representa mucho dinero. Debido a esto no podemos otorgar las becas e incentivos que quisiéramos. Con el aporte de ustedes, podremos enfocarnos más en ayudar a los jóvenes que quieran formarse con nosotros por medio de becas e incentivos que ayuden al proceso de formación artística de cada uno de ellos. 
Nuestro contrato de renta termina en Octubre de 2015. El dueño de la casa nos ha dicho que si para esa fecha no hemos podido comprar la casa tendremos que desocupar e irnos...todo nuestro esfuerzo habrá sido en vano. 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Nuestro plan es comprar la casa y terminar de adecuar las instalaciones para que los estudiantes tengan los salones apropiados y los recursos necesarios para tomar sus clases con comodidad. Los costos de reparación y adecuación no son altos. Básicamente lo más costoso es la casa como tal. Para llevar a cabo este proyecto necesitamos USD$300.000.00.

Nuestro sueño es comprar la casa. En caso de no recaudar lo necesario para comprarla inmediatamente, destinaríamos los recursos obtenidos para pagar una parte y pediríamos un préstamo bancario que nos ayude a completar el dinero. De esta forma nos encargaríamos de seguir pagando una cuota mensual (como una renta) pero sabríamos que estamos terminando de pagar nuestro propio espacio.

A continuación encontrarás una lista de lo que podrías recibir por tus contribuciones:

-  USD$50.00  Recibirás un agradecimiento en nuestras redes sociales (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram) por medio de una foto de nosotros.

-  USD$150.00 Recibirás un correo certificado con un reconocimiento de parte de la CasaTallerLP por tu aporte.

-  USD$250.00 Recibirás una camiseta con el logotipo de CasaTallerLP.

-  USD$500.00 Recibirás una carta escrita a mano por todos nosotros acompañada de una foto de Los Productores (Camila, Luisa, Juan, Johan y Jeyner).

-  USD$1000.00 Escribiremos tu nombre junto con un agradecimiento en uno de los murales internos de la CasaTallerLP.

-  USD$5000.00 Con este aporte apoyarás a un estudiante en sus estudios por un semestre. Al completar este ciclo recibirás un video con la muestra final de cada una de las asignaturas y una camiseta de CasaTallerLP.

-  USD$10.000.00 Podrás financiar toda la carrera de un estudiante (4 años). Recibirás un video con la muestra final de cada una de las asignaturas cada semestre y tu nombre tendrá un lugar privilegiado en nuestro mural interno.

-  USD$25.000.00 Podrás financiar toda la carrera de dos estudiantes. Como muestra de agradecimiento, bautizaremos unos de los salones de la CasaTallerLP con tu nombre por un periodo de dos años. Sumado a esto, escribiremos tu nombre en el mural externo de la casa.

-  USD$50.000.00 Podrás financiar toda la carrera de un estudiante (4 años). Recibirás un video con la muestra final de cada una de las asignaturas cada semestre y tu nombre tendrá un lugar privilegiado en nuestro mural interno. También recibirás un certificado que te convierte en miembro honorífico de la fundación; tu nombre será mencionado en cada una de las producciones educativas y empresariales que llevemos a cabo con la fundación por un periodo de dos años y tu nombre estará en el mural externo de la casa.

-  USD$100.000.00 Podrás financiar toda la carrera de un estudiante (4 años). Recibirás un video con la muestra final de cada una de las asignaturas cada semestre y tu nombre tendrá un lugar privilegiado en nuestro mural interno. También recibirás un certificado que te convierte en miembro honorífico de la fundación; tu nombre será mencionado en cada una de las producciones educativas y empresariales que llevemos a cabo con la fundación por un periodo de dos años y tu nombre estará en el mural externo de la casa. Adicional a esto, te regalaremos un viaje a Bogotá con todos los gastos pagos y podrás asistir a la graduación del estudiante al que hayas patrocinado.*

* CasaTallerLP asume los gastos del viaje por un periodo de cinco días. Los gastos de días extras y viajes a otras ciudades del país será asumidos por el contribuyente.

El impacto

Al contribuir en este proyecto transformarás las vidas de muchas personas; los ayudarás a través de la educación artística en un país en el que los costos de vida son cada vez más altos y la gran mayoría de los jóvenes no tienen los recursos para financiar sus estudios. Gracias a tu contribución podrás ver esto con tus propios ojos por medio de videos o incluso en persona.  

Riesgos y desafíos

Desde el comienzo nuestro principal obstáculo ha sido el dinero de la renta. Pero no ha sido un impedimento para sacar adelante este proyecto. Por medio de eventos corporativos y presentaciones de teatro hemos logrado cubrir los gastos básicos para el sostenimiento de la casa durante todo este tiempo. 

Muchas veces sentimos que no vamos a cumplir con los pagos de sostenimiento de la casa y de repente alguien llama y solicita nuestros servicios como productores. 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Dinero no es lo único que necesitamos. También necesitamos difundir nuestro nombre y nuestra fundación para que cada vez sean más las personas que conocen un lugar de formación artística y producción de eventos. Que sepan que hay un sitio en el que se pueden formar, donde pueden trabajar y traer sus ideas y sus sueños para hacerlos realidad. 

Ayúdanos a difundir nuestro mensaje, a compartir esta campaña por medio de la plataforma de INDIEGOGO y podrás estar seguro de que has contribuido enormemente en la materialización de muchos sueños.

Gracias!

este aporte apoyarás a un estudiante en sus estudios por un semestre. Al
completar este ciclo recibirás un video con la muestra final de cada una de las
asignaturas y una camiseta de CasaTallerLP.
-  USD$10.000.00
Podrás financiar toda la carrera de un estudiante (4 años). Recibirás un
video con la muestra final de cada una de las asignaturas cada semestre y tu nombre tendrá un lugar privilegiado en nuestro mural interno.
-  USD$25.000.00
Podrás financiar toda la carrera de dos estudiantes. Como muestra de
agradecimiento, bautizaremos unos de los salones de la CasaTallerLP con tu
nombre por un periodo de dos años. Sumado a esto, escribiremos tu nombre en el mural externo de la casa.
-  USD$50.000.00 Podrás financiar toda la carrera de un estudiante (4 años). Recibirás un video con la muestra final de cada una de las asignaturas cada semestre y tu nombre tendrá un lugar privilegiado en nuestro mural interno. También recibirás un certificado que te convierte en miembro honorífico de la fundación; tu nombre será mencionado en cada una de las producciones educativas y empresariales que llevemos a cabo con la fundación por un periodo de dos años y tu nombre estará en el mural externo de la casa.
-  USD$100.000.00 Podrás financiar toda la carrera de un estudiante (4 años). Recibirás un video con la muestra final de cada una de las asignaturas cada semestre y tu nombre tendrá un lugar privilegiado en nuestro mural interno. También recibirás un certificado que te convierte en miembro honorífico de la fundación; tu nombre será mencionado en cada una de las producciones educativas y empresariales que llevemos a cabo con la fundación por un periodo de dos años y tu nombre estará en el mural externo de la casa. Adicional a esto, te regalaremos un viaje a Bogotá con todos los gastos pagos y podrás asistir a la graduación del estudiante al que hayas patrocinado.*
* CasaTallerLP asume los gastos del viaje por un periodo de cinco días. Los gastos de días extras y viajes a otras ciudades del país será asumidos por el contribuyente.   El impacto
Al contribuir en este proyecto transformarás las vidas de muchas personas; los ayudarás a través de la educación artística en un país en el que los costos de vida son cada vez más altos y la gran mayoría de los jóvenes no tienen los recursos para financiar sus estudios. Gracias a tu contribución podrás ver esto con tus propios ojos por medio de videos o incluso en persona.     Riesgos y desafíos Desde el comienzo nuestro principal obstáculo ha sido el dinero de la renta. Pero no ha sido un impedimento para sacar adelante este proyecto. Por medio de eventos corporativos y presentaciones de teatro hemos logrado cubrir los gastos básicos para el sostenimiento de la casa durante todo este tiempo. 
Muchas veces sentimos que no vamos a cumplir con los pagos de sostenimiento de la casa y de repente alguien llama y solicita nuestros servicios como productores. 
Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
Dinero no es lo único que necesitamos. También necesitamos difundir nuestro nombre y nuestra fundación para que cada vez sean más las personas que conocen un lugar de formación artística y producción de eventos. Que sepan que hay un sitio en el que se pueden formar, donde pueden trabajar y traer sus ideas y sus sueños para hacerlos realidad. 
Ayúdanos a difundir nuestro mensaje, a compartir esta campaña por medio de la plataforma de INDIEGOGO y podrás estar seguro de que has contribuido enormemente en la materialización de muchos sueños.
 Gracias!

story:
What's the Scoop?

Overview

My name is Jackson Blackburn and I've been working with youth steadily since 2008.  From teaching 1st graders about rivers, to coaching college-aged students through hardships, I have found a love in mentoring young minds.  My motive for this life-long passion has stemmed from my drive to show youth they have choices to live a more healthy and fulfilled existence.  

To expand my scope in this sector, I am volunteering for a camp in Soweto, South Africa called Camp Sizanani (Zulu for 'help each other'), established in 2003. Camp Sizanani uses a traditional residential camp setting with fun-based activities as a platform for teaching HIV/AIDS prevention education and important life skills. My pledge is to cover travel expenses, room and board during my 12 days at Camp (4 days of training, 8 days with campers).   As an American volunteer counselor for an African Camp lead by local staff, my role is to primarily give counselors confidence and knowledge in how to do a better job.  This opportunity is important to me to observe and be a part of a different educational setting, to learn about working with youth and young adults from other cultures and to make a difference in the lives of children who need to be reminded good people exist in every corner of the world.

By contributing to this campaign, you are directly impacting South African children's view on white American men in a positive way.  You are enabling a Youth Development Professional (myself) to remind staff that they are making the world a safer and better place.  You are creating a culture of friendship and love in an area that has room for improvement by providing me with the chance to spread my passion and love for developing young minds and bodies more toward their potential.  

Details

My goal of reaching $2,500 would cover my travel to and from South Africa (~$1,500) and room, board and transportation to and from camp (~$1,000).   If I am not able to reach this goal, I will be contributing the remainder of the costs. If my pledge is exceeded by any amount, all donations will still be made to Global Camps Africa.  All contributions are tax-deductable, using the US Tax-ID: 91-2191939.  
To donate you may use this website and enter your card information, OR you may write a check to Global Camps Africa, with the memo, December Counselor Travel Fund.  Checks can be sent to the address below and I will forward them.

Jackson Blackburn
 PO Box 167
Florrisant, CO 80816

In addition to the ability to make a difference in the lives of South African Children and Camp Sizanani staff members, there is a possibility to invite seasoned "Vochellis" (local counselors) to be a part of Sanborn Western Camps, of which I am currently the Program Director for the outdoor adventure summer camp.  I also plan to incorporate more life skills components to our camp program.  Sanborn currently has tried-and-true programs and philosophies rooted in building better people and I still believe there is always room to grow in our Youth Development practices.  How wonderful it will be to establish a connection between two vastly different camp settings!  

The main challenge I foresee in accomplishing my goal, is my lack of ability to spread the word!  I ask that even if you cannot help financially, that you are able to spread the word to those who may.  There are Indiegogo Share tools available for you to use.  

This being my first campaign organization to volunteer abroad, I am excited to continue the planning process for this opportunity.  I believe after a fun, successful, and life changing experience I will be more adept for these types of opportunities abroad and at home.

story:
"It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge".-Albert Einstein

The first element of the Bali Creative Reuse Center is to collect waste from local businesses and the community. The process of developing relationships with over 10 businesses began 2 months before our opening date on July 20, 2014. Material collections are focused largely on non- recyclable materials in Bali such as mylar and fabric. These materials are displayed aesthetically accompanied by documentation or exhibited work from children and teachers.  Materials are made available for both local and tourist communities to drop in , learn valuable ways to reuse these materials as arts and learning materials, or participate in workshops with local artists.  These are also packaged in activity kits or sold in bulk to teachers, families, artists and the community at large. 

We are able to create educational opportunities and encourage children to become engaged creative thinkers when we begin re-envisioning trash as a resource and an inspiration for reuse.  Creative problem solving engages children to be creative thinkers in the world.  The process of creativity can be in seeing the possibilities of one material being reused for another object.  Creativity can stem from the process of designing, testing, and the innovation of an idea.  Progressive education should embody these values.  

Simultaneously, we are supporting the reduction of trash that may otherwise further degrade this beautiful island with a unique culture and environment.  By utilizing waste as learning and arts materials, we have a free and readily available resource that even the poorest communities can access in Bali, Indonesia, and other parts of the world.

Your contributions to fund a larger space will help us to continue the research, development, and expansion of our progressive programs impacting teachers across Indonesia and globally.  Outcomes include:

  • Develop lessons that focus on creativity and meet national curriculum standards -using only recycled materials and can be applied across local and international curriculums
  • Develop school models - creative learning spaces that embrace using free, recycled learning materials with an emphasis on creative thinking skills
  • On-site creative learning space, and resource library - provides information on techniques, resources, research, activity kits, and possibilities for using recycled materials for learning 
  • Local & international teacher site tours 
  • International educational consulting & workshops - developing creative learning environments, curriculum resources, and training workshops
  • Building a free Indonesian local school based on the research and models
  • 50/50 model - 50% of educational resources used for free community based educational programs
  • Local and tourist community space - outdoor explorational space designed using natural & recycled materials

What We Need 

                         

                         

The total amount needed for the building, permits, and legal fees is $12,000.  Our campaign goal is $8000 and 100% will go toward the cost for a larger location.  This is the first priority for the center to run full programs and continue to meet it’s goals.  If the amount raised is above $8000 it will be used toward permits needed to run consulting programs for schools and teachers and the legal fees needed to obtain these permits.  If the total amount raised is less than $8000, it will be used for the building fees and we will request a loan to cover the rest of the cost.  

Every dollar counts toward this goal so we are asking those interested to see this program make a difference in education to take the time to donate.  We are committed to this vision of creating a model for teachers using recycled materials in the classrooms.  There will be an email list informing and updating to each person who donates on a yearly basis. 

  • 50$ donations will receive personal thank you notes.  
  • 100$ will receive a 6 month free membership including a monthly digital newsletter containing upcycle 4 education ideas and activities.  
  • $200 will receive a 12 month membership and monthly newsletter.  
  • $500 will receive a 12 month membership and one upcycled product from our shop. 
  • All companies who donate will receive a logo on our sponsorship lists. Please let us know and send your logo so we can recognize your support!

"Understanding, identifying, and nurturing the creative potential is relevant in education if we want students able to solve academic and personal problems and challenges, to find innovative solutions and alternatives, and to have better tools and resources for success in a fast-changing world".-Dr. Rosa Aurora Chavez Eakle M.D, Ph.D                John Hopkins School of Education

The goals and visions of this center will be to impact teachers in education who are passionate to shift the future of education.  Your contributions will give us the space needed to provide a model and teacher workshops. This model will provide training for teachers to use upcycled materials in the classroom that are open-ended, hands-on, encourage problem solving skills, and are full of creative possibilities for children.   This center is committed to being socially responsible and for every resource developed it will be shared with schools that have little or no funding.  There are many remote schools in Indonesia who have no learning materials or books available.  

Our onsite location offers a rich aesthetic environment for teachers and children to visit and our expansion will allow us to have a library for teachers to gain curriculum resources.  Our main focus is on pre-primary as this supports children’s learning and values in the early stages of development.  School collaborations are an important element to inspire teachers about the various ways to develop sustainable classroom environments and curriculums. Current collaborations include:  

  • The Spring School: An Indonesian run preschool for both local and expat students is located on the same property with BCRC. The Spring School and BCRC work closely together offering collaborative teacher and family workshops. The Spring School values recycling and the arts as two important areas of the curriculum. The Spring School is a progressive model and inspiration for other preschools in Bali.
  • Dyatmika School: BCRC is implementing a 3 phase project at Dyatmika School. This is a private school for Indonesian families. They follow the Indonesian government curriculum and provide a model and training support for other Balinese preschools. Currently, we provide teacher training, consulting, and the development of a recycled arts area. Our goals are to use this project as a model for other preschool programs in Bali. 
  • Imajine That:  A playspace in the Boston Area of the USA.  Our collaboration is in the planning stages to provide a creative educational model using sustainable materials for inner city school programs. 

         

Challenges

Teacher training can inspire teachers but often the challenges are to implement these approaches in classrooms long term.  Curriculum standards often overwhelm teachers, our role is to support them and find ways to enrich their creative approaches to teaching in the classroom using sustainable materials. Our plan is to focus on the development of teacher resources such as activity packets, lesson plans, documentation of projects, integrated curriculum activities and upcycled learning materials.  Our materials are designed to support curriculum standards and supply teachers with comprehensive guides, activities, and documentation.  

We also understand on a cultural level how to meet teachers where they are at in their learning.  Teachers have various experiences and backgrounds.  We need to observe where they are at, offer support and guide them forward. 

Who We Are:

Renee has 13 years of experience as an arts educator. Four years ago, she was inspired to move to Bali, Indonesia after working as a Studio Arts Teacher for three years at Google Children’s Center Mountain View, CA.  Her passion, research, skills and experiences have given her the motivation to initiate and volunteer in the development of BCRC.  She is on the path to using this model to inspire local and global schools, teachers, and families to reuse everyday materials as arts and learning materials.  She wants to share these resources with schools that have no access to teaching materials.  Her experiences designing creative educational spaces and this model will further her research and development as an educational consultant.  She envisions the ability to contribute in the development of curriculums that engage children to be environmentally conscious and creative thinkers in the world.  

Sara’s skills are in her abilities to be detail oriented, with an eye for innovation and perfection.  Sara has worked as a Freelance Paralegal Assistant, Personal Assistant, and her past work experiences include working for companies such as the Indonesian Oil & Gas Company (PT PERTAMINA UPMS IV), the biggest Indonesian national TV broadcast (RCTI now part of MNC Group), and the South Australia North Territory Oil Search (SANTOS).  She has traveled throughout various countries and settled down in Ubud, Bali in 2009.  Motherhood has shifted her life as an independent career woman traveling the world to a stay-at-home mom.  She became part of the BCRC team as a co-owner in 2015 and shares the vision for creating innovative educational programs.

Eka’s passion is teaching children and education.  Six years ago, she earned her teaching degree in Bali, Indonesia.  Her salary was about $50 and was not enough to support her family.  She later worked on a cruise ship and then moved on as a villa manager.   Eka is extremely self-initiated and can take on multi-tasks such as managing financial systems, coordinating events, running programs, and staff training.  Her daughter has motivated her to pursue her passion and contribute to a more progressive educational future in Indonesia.  Her dream is to be part of the development of remote local schools embracing the values of BCRC.  She is now part of the research for developing local educational programs and directing the on-site programs at the center.




We want to thank those who have supported and contributed to       our center in many ways!!!  Listed are just a few among many who have supported the center over the last year!

story:
Oregon Savage Outdoors-Social Enterprise Making a Difference Needs Your Help!

 

Oregon Savage Outdoors, also known as OSO is a social enterprise company born of passion for the outdoors, use of our public lands and a deep desire to serve the greater good. Lowering the impacts of homelessness on not only the people who are experiencing it, but also lowering impacts on our public lands while permanent housing is being sought are the reasons this campaign has been launched. Together, we can begin connecting people with the natural world, leading to better stewardship, lower impacts through education centered on sanitation, site maintenance and Leave No Trace principals. Lower impacts on the environment leads to fewer conflicts among the various user groups of our public lands and resources, ultimately lowering cost to the taxpayer through fewer calls for service to law enforcement and public sanitation agencies. Instruction at the 4th grade level, along with providing quality outdoor gear is also a vehicle for deeper engagement with social services for those in need. I sincerely hope I have piqued your interest. If so, please read on...

I am the Owner, Cody Standiford and I have spent my life pursuing outdoor recreation activities, fish and game to feed my family and time in the outdoors to feed my soul. I have raised both of my sons in this lifestyle so as to impart the values of Leave No Trace, and to leave the outdoors in better shape than we found them. I have spent my adult life serving my community and my country through law enforcement, active service in the US Army, work with Veterans and Active Duty Service Members at the US House of Representatives level as a staffer in the House Wounded Warrior Program, work with fellow combat Veterans in the US Dept. of Veterans Affairs, followed by several years of work with homelessness and low-income families in the non-profit sector. Through this varied career path, I have come to possess a deep desire to help those who are in need, making the world just a little brighter through community service and policy advocacy that will begin to address the growing needs of homeless and at-risk individuals, families and children. 

Many people are forced to live in the outdoors, and few have the skills or experience before becoming homeless that are needed to not only allow for a measure of comfort and safety, but also minimize the impacts on our natural resources.

User conflicts on public lands are becoming more and more routine. People living on our public lands who do not possess outdoor living skills often reside in camps that are very hard to look at due to the unsanitary nature of their living situation.

The number of children who are forced to live outdoors is on the rise. OSO is committed to teaching these children, via our public schools, the skills and providing them the gear necessary to live a healthier, safer life in the outdoors…at no cost to the children, schools or taxpayers.

In order to minimize the chances these children will have additional unwanted attention drawn to them due to the fact they are homeless or at imminent risk of becoming homeless, OSO will teach skills to every child in the classroom, ensuring equality and instilling a sense of community through shared experience.

For those children who are not homeless, they will be connected to the outdoors in the hope that they will grow to appreciate our resources and become good stewards for generations to come.

For those children who are homeless, they too will be connected to our resources in a different light, aiming to impart the desire to live in an environment that is cleaner, healthier and with less impact on our public lands.

OSO will also provide opportunities for homeless, as well as formerly homeless people to give back to their community through teaching and mentoring of children in need through a supported employment program. Volunteer opportunities will abound for other members of our communities as well.

In order to provide this community service, at no cost to the child, school or taxpayer...OSO needs your help. The cost to teach skills and provide each child with a starter gear kit is about $500 per child. Providing a supported employment opportunity for people who are, or formerly were homeless can be done for $12,000 per year.

In order to conduct a pilot of this program, serving 90 children in our public schools, OSO is seeking initial backing via investment, and/or backing contributions in the amount of $100,000. Initial purchase of gear for each child, at retail cost, is approximately $500 (totaling $45,000) and provides the foundation for a gear closet that will last for many years to come. Basic needs of shelter, water, food, first aid and field sanitation are provided for in the kit. Operating costs, including wages (including one Supported Employment position for the first year), travel expenses, outreach and marketing make up the remainder of initial investments needed ($55,000).

In the event the initial cohort of 90 children are not reached during year one, funds and gear will roll over for the following year. If you wish to contribute as a backer, in any amount, your money will be immediately put to work in the form of gear purchases for the Pilot. Should you desire a deeper level of involvement and wish to invest, please request more information as detailed below.  

For more information regarding return on your investment, please request a copy of the business plan that is part of this campaign by emailing me at oregonsavageoutdoors@gmail.com. 

Of course there are risks involved in this endeavor, as there are for any business venture. Cultivation of sponsors who are willing to "pay for success" of the program could be challenging. The model OSO employs is, upon securing the initial start-up funding, based on the "pay for success" model employed by many organizations in the non-profit homeless services sector. OSO is in the process of securing sponsors from the outdoor recreation, fish and game, and social services sector who are willing to enter into a contract, where they agree to pay a set amount (which may vary by sponsor) for each child who is successfully educated in our program and subsequently provided with the gear starter kit. This payment for success model will provide the working capital needed to sustain operations, as well as provide a return on investment for those willing to provide a higher level of financial backing for OSO.

I have been faced with incredible challenges much of my life, whether it be high-risk law enforcement contacts, combat in Iraq, overcoming physical injury and living with disabilities or the everyday struggles of single parenthood. All the adversity I have faced has given me opportunities to grow and learn. It is these attributes that provide me with the strength and resolve needed to pursue this dream of making our communities stronger, our children healthier and our country better. I am committed to giving this company my all. 

Impacts of this program are many. Teaching people how to live in the outdoors, homeless or not, lessens the impact of human use on our public lands. De-conflicting user groups on our public lands benefits the entire community and saves taxpayer money through fewer calls for service to law enforcement, EMS and public works. Connection of children to the natural world has myriad health and welfare benefits, as well as far reaching positive impacts on land use laws, public perception and lowered cost to public services. These impacts have all been witnessed firsthand over the course of a lifetime in the outdoors, along with the last seven years spent in a variety of social services employment, homeless outreach and policy work at the state and federal levels.  

Thank you for your interest in helping OSO become a driving force for change in our communities. If you cannot contribute financially, PLEASE don't despair...you can still help make a difference! Please share my story with your networks. Help me get the word out by using the sharing tools of Indiegogo, like my Oregon Savage Outdoors Facebook page and ask for my business plan so you may share it with all who are interested. You can be the difference we all want to see in this world. 

Live Savagely My Friends.
story_txt: Oregon Savage Outdoors-Social Enterprise Making a Difference Needs Your Help! Oregon Savage Outdoors, also known as OSO is a social enterprise company born of passion for the outdoors, use of our public lands and a deep desire to serve the greater good. Lowering the impacts of homelessness on not only the people who are experiencing it, but also lowering impacts on our public lands while permanent housing is being sought are the reasons this campaign has been launched. Together, we can begin connecting people with the natural world, leading to better stewardship, lower impacts through education centered on sanitation, site maintenance and Leave No Trace principals. Lower impacts on the environment leads to fewer conflicts among the various user groups of our public lands and resources, ultimately lowering cost to the taxpayer through fewer calls for service to law enforcement and public sanitation agencies. Instruction at the 4th grade level, along with providing quality outdoor gear is also a vehicle for deeper engagement with social services for those in need. I sincerely hope I have piqued your interest. If so, please read on...I am the Owner, Cody Standiford and I have spent my life pursuing outdoor recreation activities, fish and game to feed my family and time in the outdoors to feed my soul. I have raised both of my sons in this lifestyle so as to impart the values of Leave No Trace, and to leave the outdoors in better shape than we found them. I have spent my adult life serving my community and my country through law enforcement, active service in the US Army, work with Veterans and Active Duty Service Members at the US House of Representatives level as a staffer in the House Wounded Warrior Program, work with fellow combat Veterans in the US Dept. of Veterans Affairs, followed by several years of work with homelessness and low-income families in the non-profit sector. Through this varied career path, I have come to possess a deep desire to help those who are in need, making the world just a little brighter through community service and policy advocacy that will begin to address the growing needs of homeless and at-risk individuals, families and children. Many people are forced to live in the outdoors, and few have the skills or experience before becoming homeless that are needed to not only allow for a measure of comfort and safety, but also minimize the impacts on our natural resources.User conflicts on public lands are becoming more and more routine. People living on our public lands who do not possess outdoor living skills often reside in camps that are very hard to look at due to the unsanitary nature of their living situation.The number of children who are forced to live outdoors is on the rise. OSO is committed to teaching these children, via our public schools, the skills and providing them the gear necessary to live a healthier, safer life in the outdoors…at no cost to the children, schools or taxpayers.In order to minimize the chances these children will have additional unwanted attention drawn to them due to the fact they are homeless or at imminent risk of becoming homeless, OSO will teach skills to every child in the classroom, ensuring equality and instilling a sense of community through shared experience.For those children who are not homeless, they will be connected to the outdoors in the hope that they will grow to appreciate our resources and become good stewards for generations to come.For those children who are homeless, they too will be connected to our resources in a different light, aiming to impart the desire to live in an environment that is cleaner, healthier and with less impact on our public lands.OSO will also provide opportunities for homeless, as well as formerly homeless people to give back to their community through teaching and mentoring of children in need through a supported employment program. Volunteer opportunities will abound for other members of our communities as well.In order to provide this community service, at no cost to the child, school or taxpayer...OSO needs your help. The cost to teach skills and provide each child with a starter gear kit is about $500 per child. Providing a supported employment opportunity for people who are, or formerly were homeless can be done for $12,000 per year. Basic needs of shelter, water, food, first aid and field sanitation are provided for in the kit. Operating costs, including wages (including one Supported Employment position for the first year), travel expenses, outreach and marketing make up the remainder of initial investments needed ($55,000).In the event the initial cohort of 90 children are not reached during year one, funds and gear will roll over for the following year. If you wish to contribute as a backer, in any amount, your money will be immediately put to work in the form of gear purchases for the Pilot. Should you desire a deeper level of involvement and wish to invest, please request more information as detailed below.  For more information regarding return on your investment, please request a copy of the business plan that is part of this campaign by emailing me at oregonsavageoutdoors@gmail.com. Of course there are risks involved in this endeavor, as there are for any business venture. Cultivation of sponsors who are willing to "pay for success" of the program could be challenging. The model OSO employs is, upon securing the initial start-up funding, based on the "pay for success" model employed by many organizations in the non-profit homeless services sector. OSO is in the process of securing sponsors from the outdoor recreation, fish and game, and social services sector who are willing to enter into a contract, where they agree to pay a set amount (which may vary by sponsor) for each child who is successfully educated in our program and subsequently provided with the gear starter kit. This payment for success model will provide the working capital needed to sustain operations, as well as provide a return on investment for those willing to provide a higher level of financial backing for OSO.I have been faced with incredible challenges much of my life, whether it be high-risk law enforcement contacts, combat in Iraq, overcoming physical injury and living with disabilities or the everyday struggles of single parenthood. All the adversity I have faced has given me opportunities to grow and learn. It is these attributes that provide me with the strength and resolve needed to pursue this dream of making our communities stronger, our children healthier and our country better. I am committed to giving this company my all. Impacts of this program are many. Teaching people how to live in the outdoors, homeless or not, lessens the impact of human use on our public lands. De-conflicting user groups on our public lands benefits the entire community and saves taxpayer money through fewer calls for service to law enforcement, EMS and public works. Connection of children to the natural world has myriad health and welfare benefits, as well as far reaching positive impacts on land use laws, public perception and lowered cost to public services. These impacts have all been witnessed firsthand over the course of a lifetime in the outdoors, along with the last seven years spent in a variety of social services employment, homeless outreach and policy work at the state and federal levels.  Thank you for your interest in helping OSO become a driving force for change in our communities. If you cannot contribute financially, PLEASE don't despair...you can still help make a difference! Please share my story with your networks. story:
Keen to discover more?    Email us!

 

And now...  let us explore why it is worthy to contribute to the making of this historic and ground-breaking documentary, "The Myth is Canada"

Ever wonder why our elected officials ignore us, I mean really, truly ignore us once elected?

Ever wonder why nothing of what is truly important to you, to The People of Canada, actually gets implemented by our elected officials?

Every wonder why?

 

The simple reality is that, once elected, there is no legal obligation for an elected politician to:

a) follow through on any promise made to you or the people in your community

b) follow the direct requests of your community, or

c) fulfill on any of their election promises.  

Truly.  This is a FACT.  We have court evidences proving it.

Politicians tell us what we want to hear and then, once elected, do their agenda, often something completely different - and most often, not to our benefit!   All the while spending and wasting our hard earned money, with no accountability!

What to you think about that?     

And it does not stop there!

Do you feel like everything is becoming a money grab?    While the value we derive from paying taxes goes down?    Are you getting tired of all these purported laws mandating licenses for this, licenses for that, charging fees to us for the privilege of reducing our freedoms? 

What about the  provincial / federal governments telling you what to do, how to do it, telling you where to school your children, how to enable healing of your children, even taking your kids away from you if you do not conform with what the state demands and requires you to do (even though there is often ample evidence of better ways...  

Isn't it all getting a bit much?  

 

You thought you lived in a free country, living by the motto - "Do what you want as long as it does not impinge on the rights, life and liberty of another?"   

Right?   Wrong. 

You thought your representatives were there for you!   After all, they were voted in! 

Right?   Wrong again. 

 

Guess what?   We / you have all been misled.

 

The IMPORTANT MESSAGE here is that:

  • Canada is not being run for your, for my, or for the People of Canada's best interests.
  • It is run for the politicians, for the special interest groups, for the big corporate profits.

We know this is true, don't we?   And are you really happy about this?

 

It is time.  Time to know the truth on how we got here and most importantly the simple SOLUTION  to have Canada work for  all Canadians!

 

Contributing to the making of this documentary film "the Myth is Canada" will deliver the truth the history books do not disclose, yet seriously impact our everyday life!  

"The Myth is Canada" will shock you, yet will provide you with a tremendous sense of relief!   And will bring us to the Canada that is for you, me and The People of Canada!    

Contribute to the making of The Myth is Canada and together, let us get this vital knowledge and solution out to ALL The People of Canada!   Thank you!  

ps. your kids will thank you too...  

 

What is Canada?

This year, 2017, in Canada we are told we are celebrating 150 years of Confederation.  If so, why, in 1982 did Prime Minister Trudeau go to a foreign power and ask them to create and authorize a constitution for Canada?    If we were already a de jure government for 115 years (1867-1982), why would Prime Minister Trudeau deem it necessary?    It is a question worth asking and worth answering!   Maybe he was making us double de jure?

So... What is Canada?.....  It is not a legend, not a sovereign nation, not a nation state.  Actually, we have discovered it is a Myth.   All we have been told, taught, read in official history books are deceptions, manipulations and in many cases, outright fraud.

The evidence presented in this documentary film "The Myth is Canada" has been thoroughly researched and the conclusions are based from within those researched documents.  

Evidence!  Not hearsay.  Evidence.

Yes, it is controversial.   Yes, it is ground breaking.   Yes, initially, it will create disbelief...

But... when a people have been largely unknowingly subjected to lies for 150 years by a select few, in the know...  finally hearing and gaining perspective on the truth will be monumental.  

We have invested many years ensuring all information researched is correct.

And, now we are ready.

We are ready to release this evidenced information to you, to The People of Canada, in the form of this documentary film, "The Myth is Canada".  

Join us in this epic journey!

 

This is our CALL to ACTION to you.  

We invite you to Join the Movement, Become the Movement and/or be part of Expanding the Movement for the simple release of the evidenced based truth of Canada.

 

Have you had enough?  

Enough of...

high taxes, wasted government expenditures, pretend government services, inflation eating up your wages, higher costs of living, mushrooming government debt encumbering our future, mushrooming private debt just to live - restricting the people's ability to be free and live with peace of mind,,,   

Are you sensing...  "enough is enough"?

Help us produce this documentary "The Myth is Canada"!  

Select the Perk(s) to the side of this page that inspires you the most!   Thanks!

 

The Impact of your Donation

Can you imagine knowing how we can have Canada tangibly working for us, for you, for me, for our families, for ALL The People of Canada?    Not just the top 5%.

People coming together to peacefully change its political foundation at the core...   (yes, for sure, the Canadian way.... peacefully!)

Not relying on the politicians, who once every 4 years say "whatever" to win the election, who   thereafter, largely do their work in quiet rooms, alone, big money directing the agenda.  

And the people?  uh?   What do they matter?

The result?  Many of The People of Canada now have second and third jobs to keep the lights on and food in the refrigerator. 

Is that the Canada you imagined for you?   For your family?

 

What will it take for The People of Canada, one by one, to take up the pen (yes, literally the pen) and undertake the steps to seat a legal, lawful, accountable and small government?

Your donation means - we get to take this vastly impactful and important evidence to you and all The People of Canada. 

Your donation means - we will be able to begin location scouting, start pre-production, complete production and ultimately deliver the documentary film, "The Myth is Canada", to you.

Your donation means - we deliver the documentary film, "The Myth is Canada", to all parts of Canada for the knowledge to become alive in the minds of ALL Canadians!

 

If this is of interest to you, we invite you to contribute - Join the Movement, Become the Movement and /or be a part of Expanding the Movement with us.  

See the Perks to the side of this page to select the one that inspires you the most!

We invite you to contribute whatever amount you can!  

 

We thank you in advance for the trust you show in us and the encouragement that we get with every donation. We're thrilled about this project and believe it has an incredible future.

Thank you for being a part of this adventure!

 

What we Need - The Budget 

Total: $500K

 

"The Myth is Canada" Production Timeline

 

Risk & Challenges

The major challenge with this documentary has been the 12.5 years of research and coming to understand the various pieces of the puzzle in a comprehensive manner.  Often it was a combination of "something not seeming right" that kept us digging to satisfy that nudge - and otherwise, investigating various rabbit holes that delivered additional critical pieces of information.    Yet, over the past 12.5 years, we did complete the research and now, we are ready.  Ready to reveal the truth of Canada in the format of a documentary film.    

We see the major risk with this documentary is not getting it funded so that this very important knowledge can get out to you, to ALL The People of Canada. 

Your contribution is critical to the making of "The Myth is Canada".

Thank you for contributing the amount you are "inspired" to contribute! 

 

Can't donate? No sweat! Help us spread the word!

We know money is tight for a lot of people right now. Trust us, we totally get it. So here are ways you can support your "The Myth is Canada" team:

Subscribe to Follow Us!   Send us an email to admin@nephalemfilms.com .   State Follow Us Indiegogo in the subject line.   It'll be great!    You will receive all the good updates via email.

SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN with your friends - on Facebook  Copy and paste:  https://www.facebook.com/Nephalem-Films-1732118...

SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN to your friends and associates - on your or others websites - or via your email!   Copy and paste:   http://www.nephalemfilms.com/themyth.html

We believe the documentary "The Myth is Canada" is of interest to ALL The People of Canada. 

If the People of Canada only knew the truth behind their everyday frustrations and the solution to ease those frustrations, life would be SO different for us all !!

Do Share.   The more you share your curiosity, interest, even passion for the making of this documentary film, "The Myth is Canada",  the more opportunity people have to see what a ground-breaking, honest, and revealing documentary it is!  

Thank you!

Nephalem Films

http://www.nephalemfilms.com

story:
DEAR RESPECTED, 

We're so grateful for your contribution and if you've not added your postal adress here or sent to us please send as soon as possible to info@mounteveresttower.org or info@mission2nepal.org, mounteveresttower@gmail.com

We've updated in details with photographs and videos of thanking from the children along with mentioned perk/products and matter of school supply for children in details. 
You may also checkout the following links on our websites. 

http://www.mounteveresttower.org.np/forgotten-c...
http://www.mission2nepal.org/forgotten-children...

Yours in good faith,

Founder, Chair, Director

Rajendra Nhisutu

Kathmandu, Nepal

Greetings with a Beacon of NEW LIGHT and LOVE from the TOP of the World !!!

Hi Sir, I am Rajendra Nhisutu a founder and chairperson of the Himalaya Mt. Everest Tower organization and a local resident of Kathmandu, Nepal.

We've been serving since 2011 with local community that combines the breathtaking beauty of the World Top Mountains with the desire to make a positive difference in people. 

And we have been making meaningful differences in the lives of downtrodden, under privileged and heterogeneous community groups and the children who were victim of Sex Trafficking, Earthquake, Landslide,  HIV,  AIDS, Famine, Persecution and during 10 years Civil War in Nepal. 

From the very beginning, the organization has been working from Kathmandu valley to most remote parts of Nepal for the overall development of rural and needy giving top priority to downtrodden and under privileged and heterogeneous communities to enhance the livelihood of these people and the Orphaned and Destitute Children of Nepal where the need is most acute.

There are still over 900,000 (Nine hundred thousand) Children of Nepal need spacial help with Food, Clothing, Medicine, Clean Water and Education.

This our organization is helping to develop Nepal and too poorest Nepalese and the neediest children, highlight natural heritage and the World Top Mountains, invite foreigners to do something for overall development of Nepal includes sanitation, rescue and conservation of the Himalayas.

Himalaya Mt. Everest Tower is also an institutional association with Nepal Mountaineering Association (NMA) for mountain tourism and Affiliation with Social Welfare Council (SWC) for social welfare services in all over Nepal.

We've been providing support for orphans and vulnerable children so as to enable them live a normal life like other children in the country. They who do not have parents, guardians and the children privilege to look after them. 

Our last year Feeding video: (Please check full video we'd fed three places)

HIMET assists with the health, welfare and education, of orphans, the destitute, at-risk, and children dying from AIDS and those suffering problems caused by a decade of civil war, famine, persecutions terribly earthquake and land slide disasters.

This Campaign is for humanitarian APPEAL for FEEDING, CLOTHING and SCHOOL SUPPLY for Orphans and Destitute Children of Nepal who are victim of Sex Trafficking, Terribly Earthquake, Landslide, HIV, AIDS, Famine, Persecution and during 10 years of Civil War in Nepal.

As with every year and this year also we're planning to FEED, distribute NEW CLOTHES , and SCHOOL SUPPLY on JAN 01, 2017

There will be 2,735 (Two thousands Seven hundred and Thirty five) children they're eagerly waiting to get FULL STOMACH FOOD and this time we're planning to FEED all children one place on the open big ground. And clothing and school supply will be beside too neediest 1275 children as per this collected fund allows.

Last year Education Support: 

 

'We are seeking financial HELP to manage FOOD, CLOTHES and SCHOOL SUPPLY and our required budget for 2,735 children to FEED and manage (CLOTHES and SCHOOL SUPPLY for too NEEDIEST) are minimum US D $ 12,775 (Twelve thousands seven hundred and seventy five)'.

Your only CONTRIBUTION allows us to make it HAPPEN, and You'll get to see their TEARFUL THANKING videos with the HEARTFELT DANCE of hopeless Nepalese children. 

Please help us whatever you can – no donation is too small, every dollar is a step closer to reaching our funding goal.

By the way, if there is any possibilities in lieu of funds, other in-kind support is requested (i.e. warm clothing such as children's winter jackets, thermals and socks, shoes, bags, toys etc) the children are aged from early childhood to secondary level.

Most of the children of remote areas of Nepal are victim of hunger and malnutrition and they’re keep dying please check out our website what media said recently:

https://www.mounteveresttower.org.np/nepalese-c...

 

This brings children to tearful joy most of them have not just missed their parents, family members and also missing their basic need with full stomach food, wearing clothes and schooling lives.

A, They so enjoy getting secure that there are somebody for their lives like other children in the country.

B, You'll find a pure tearful joy of children you'll be blessed in every steps of your life.

C, You'll be proud and thanks for this life from your own heart to be able to serve for too neediest.

D, There will be special count that you've done something great during  while you alive.

 

By choosing one (or more) of the PERKS you help to manage FOOD, CLOTHES, SCHOOL SUPPLY and volunteers tips.

Just go to the Sidebar Right side and click directly on the Offer/perk you want.

 

All perks are locally hand crafted in Kathmandu Valley, Nepal from e-gifts to precious items, to suit all budgets.  

The options includes TOP OF THE WORLD Card with your Name and precious photograph printed, TOP OF THE WORLD CERTIFICATE OF HONOR ON HUMANITY SERVICES, Himalayan handicrafts , Himalayan Natural Herb Yarsagumba (Cordyceps Sinensis) Himalayan Antique Rings, Bracelet, Chains, Pashmina Shawl, Green Tea etc sent with love from the Top of the World. 

Green Tea is so great to regulate body, Clean Clone, Weight loss, Diabetic, Constipation and Gastric people and it is also super for Facepack and wash Hair where Yarsagumba/Cordyceps Sinensis has extra characteristic for chronic, complex patients includes treatment for cancer, liver, kidney, impotent and infertility plus healthy body and looks natural beauty and cute.  Please checkout this video and links too.

http://www.mounteveresttower.org.np/himalayan-herb-yarsagumba

https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/worlds-most-prec...

Please check out here for in detail of Green Tea:  https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/20140725080545-5...

If you don't have money to donate right now, You can still help by getting the word out telling the members of your Friends, Family and Colleagues, Clubs wherever you think it works, share it with your loved ones, and so on.

 

We also offer TOP OF THE WORLD CERTIFICATE of APPRECIATION and AWARDS on HUMANITY SERVICES to those who help us in our determination by sharing to their Friends, Family, Colleagues and on Social Media. 

 

01, How can I be sure that my contribution go to the neediest children for their feeding, new clothes and school supply?
ANS: You'll get videos and photographs and cheerily thanking from the children after food with new clothes and school supply along with our organization's thanking letterhead and certificate.
02, What will happen if you won't reach your funding goal?
ANS: We organize whatever this collected fund allows we assure you that we do as fund allows.

03, Can I also visit your organization and school and meet children if my situation favors to travel in your country?
ANS: YES, that must be so great pleasure to meetup and you're very welcome to Nepal! 
Our mission team will be getting ready to cheers you from Airport to our mission building and will take in our children mission field along with beautiful mountain trips as per your plan and wishes.
04, Can I also involve as a volunteer in short and long term in school teaching or any health related programs? 
ANS; Yes, we heartily welcome to volunteer in our mission field and its related schools we need prior notice for necessary management. 
05, Can I also donate food, medicine, toys, used clothes, Children Comic Books, tablets
etc.? 


ANS: Yes, of course!  It is prohibitively expensive to transport these goods overseas to Nepal. However, you are welcome to earmark a monetary donation. We promise that your donation will go much further when spent in Nepal.

06,  What curriculum do the children learn?
ANS: Same curriculum as any other Nepalese children are getting under Govt. school of Nepal. 
07, What is your organization doing to root out and prevent child abuse, child labor and child right?
ANS: Nepal Mission is Community Base Organization (CBO) of Himalaya Mt. Everest Tower 'HIMET'. We work with communities to ensure that the children do not participate in child labor and is not subject to exploitation in any way.
There will never be any form of child abuse or corporal punishment be tolerated against any children at the schools.

We do monitor and internal controls  that child labor or exploitation is not taking place with any of the schools and villages where we work with. Our focal leaders visit schools most often weekly. 
08,  Does Nepal Mission of Himalaya Mt. Everest Tower also offer internships?
Ans: Yes. we are in particular need of journalism, researcher and internships students who will help documentation, projection the work of our Nepal Mission by telling the stories to the World. And you just simply need permission from the organization and we arrange further help whatsoever you may in need from us.
09,  How will the funds be used? any administrative costs handled? 

ANS: Our team take no salary and pays.  Administrative expenses include stationary, ink, stamps and computer-related costs and this website service charge. We work hard to make sure that collected amount totally go to help to the neediest children of Nepal.
10, Are you a non-profit or non-governmental organization? 

ANS: Yes, Himalaya Mt. Everest Tower is entirely volunteer based non-denominational, non- governmental and social development as a tax exempted registered 'NFP' organization in Nepal. 
11,  Can I donate from outside the USA?

ANS: Absolutely!

12, Is shipping included worldwide in the perks?

ANS: Yes, there is no any extra charge for shipping in all over the World.

13, What payment methods do you accept?

ANS: Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.

14,  I am a celebrity or public figure and would like to endorse the prize or help in some other way. How do I get in touch with you? or I have more questions. Who do I ask?
ANS: Please email to info@mounteveresttower.org.np, info@mission2nepal.org mounteveresttower@gmail.com or atten: Rajendra Nhisutu, Chairperson Skype: 'nhisutu' you may also tele-meeting or direct call to +9779843097740, +97714275636

Yours in good faith,

Rajendra Nhisutu

Founder, Chair, Director

Himalaya Mt. Everest Tower Organization

Kathmandu, Nepal

https://www.mounteveresttower.org.np/feeding-fo...

https://www.mounteveresttower.org.np/education-...

http://www.mission2nepal.org/education-support-...

http://www.mission2nepal.org/education-support-...

http://www.mission2nepal.org/education-support-...

Clothing, toys or any useful materials for children can be posted as per below. Atten: HIMET

Govt. Post Office Box No: 5020, Post/Zip Code: 44600

For general, sponsorship or donation inquiries or Tele-meetings can be arranged via Skype: 'nhisutu' I am contactable via: info@mounteveresttower.org.np, info@mission2nepal.org or mounteveresttower@gmail.com or direct call: +9779843097740, +97714275636

Everest Tower organization and a local resident of Kathmandu, Nepal.We've been serving since 2011 with local community that combines the breathtaking beauty of the World Top Mountains with the desire to make a positive difference in people. And we have been making meaningful differences in the lives of downtrodden, under privileged and heterogeneous community groups and the children who were victim of Sex Trafficking, Earthquake, Landslide,  HIV,  AIDS, Famine, Persecution and during 10 years Civil War in Nepal. From the very beginning, the organization has been working from Kathmandu valley to most remote parts of Nepal for the overall development of rural and needy giving top priority to downtrodden and under privileged and heterogeneous communities to enhance the livelihood of these people and the Orphaned and Destitute Children of Nepal where the need is most acute. There are still over 900,000 (Nine hundred thousand) Children of Nepal need spacial help with Food, Clothing, Medicine, Clean Water and Education.This our organization is helping to develop Nepal and too poorest Nepalese and the neediest children, highlight natural heritage and the World Top Mountains, invite foreigners to do something for overall development of Nepal includes sanitation, rescue and conservation of the Himalayas.Himalaya Mt. Everest Tower is also an institutional association with Nepal Mountaineering Association (NMA) for mountain tourism and Affiliation with Social Welfare Council (SWC) for social welfare services in all over Nepal.We've been providing support for orphans and vulnerable children so as to enable them live a normal life like other children in the country. story:
THE STORY 

 

 

You can't imagine what you don't know. 

In rural communities across Kenya and East Africa, local innovation is vital to improving standards of living and quality of life- whether that's related to water, energy, education, or healthcare. Yet, the vast majority of rural schools are still without computers, severely limiting the information accessible to students and young adults. Creating a generation that can employ creative thinking to imagine new innovations means giving them access to new information. It means giving them access to a computer, and providing them with a computer education. 

You can't solve what you don't realize. 

There are thousands of NGOs in East Africa- in addition to a growing number of social enterprises, and a burgeoning development sector. But the lack of infrastructure and digitalization in remote and last-mile communities means that there exists a huge data gap, making effective decision-making difficult for private and public sector alike. Without a reliable means of data collection in remote communities, organizations cannot accurately plan, fund, or evaluate their activities. 

Re-Imagining Computer Education.

Lumen integrates data collection with digital learning to bridge the educational and data gap in rural Kenya. Working with schools, Lumen creates Lumen Labs: computer labs where digital literacy is taught through data collection projects. Students are trained to conduct market surveys with their heads of households, after which Lumen aggregates and validates the data for our clients. Separately, our students are taught to analyze and create stories with the data on the computer, mastering key digital skills such as excel and word processing. Our model allows students to learn through hands-on, project-based learning while simultaneously providing data to the decision-makers who need it most.

 

MPESA DONORS

For Kenyan donors wishing to contribute via Mpesa, please send money to 0795717036.

 

PERKS

Signed Class Photograph

  • 5" x 7" - signed by Lumen's founders
  • 8.5" x 11" - signed by Lumen's founders, head teacher, and students.

Student Essays

  • Emailed in pdf
  • Includes photo, and original spelling and formatting by students

Flip Book

  • 4" x 6" flip book spiral bound with clear plastic cover (*Note: binding may differ in Kenya)
  • 10 pages with durable backing
  • 9 full bleed photographs taken by our students about their lives in rural Kenya

Signed Mug

  • 11 oz. white ceramic mug
  • Featuring "Asante Sana" print (Swahili for "thank you very much"), handwritten and signed by one of our students
  • Includes emailed digital bio of the student who wrote the message

Photo Books

  • Available in Hardcover (8" x 11")
  • 20 pages printed on premium-quality paper and professionally bound (*Note: binding may differ in Kenya)
  •  9 full bleed photographs taken by our students about their lives in rural Kenya, and 10 photographs taken in a Lumen Lab by Rick Kiilu, Lumen's founder.

 

THE TEAM

                            

                                              

Ruby Au (Co-Founder) is an alum of the University of Southern California, where she graduated summa cum laude from the Marshall School of Business. Before moving to Kenya in 2016, Ruby previously worked for Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti’s Office of Economic Development, as well as with non-profit Global Brigades. Internationally, she has worked with micro businesses in Panama, helped develop a community bank project in Honduras, and created the business training framework for Langa Quarter, a social enterprise precinct in South Africa. Most recently, she worked in Nairobi as a project consultant with social enterprise Sanergy before deciding to launch Lumen, and pursue her long-time dream of entrepreneurship. 
 

                                               

Rick Kiilu (Co-Founder) grew up in rural community in Eastern Kenya, and touched a computer for the first time when he was 21 years old. From there, he taught himself how to use and operate basic computer software- a skill that allowed him to land a job in the city, where he eventually met Ruby and helped found the idea for Lumen. With a keen understanding of the challenges in rural Kenya, and a knack for making things happen, Rick is the anchor between Lumen and the communities that we work with. On the side, Rick is a keen photographer and musician who is committed to giving voice to the untold narratives across his country. 
 

                                               

Paul Wanyanga (Data Analyst) is a data consultant and analyst, and former Lead Analyst at mSurvey. Paul holds a degree in Statistics from the University of Nairobi, and has over 2 years of experience in data analysis, sampling methods, and customer engagement. Paul has worked as a lead statistician in projects with clients including Safaricom, McKinsey, PharmAccess, and the Communication Authority of Kenya. Passionate about telling stories through data, Paul's previous project work also includes the Financial Diaries and Share of Wallet Survey: a national survey that longitudinally engaged 1000 participants over 5 months. 

 

BUDGET

The $15,000 raised will contribute to a larger overall budget, and will help cover the following start-up expenses. 

  • Legal expenses, including incorporation, fiscal sponsorship, and work visas
  • Salaries, contracting, and hiring expenses. 
  • Computer hardware and equipment
  • Travel expenses, including bus fare and vehicle rentals (Muhuru Bay is 8 hours away from Nairobi; Mtito Andei is 6 hours away). 

If you would like an itemized breakdown of expenses, please email us at info@lumenlabs.cc

story:
Short Summary

  •  My name is Gilbert Marava Shanga, PhD, President of Hamisi Community Development. You can learn more about me at my website http://gilbertshanga.com/
  •  This campaign will contribute to our efforts of raising funds for smart needy students in Hamisi Kenya. We have been helping such children since 2010. 2015 will be our third annual fundraising year.
  •  In 2014, we raised $7,685 that enabled us to award scholarships to 58 students in 27 high schools . In this campaign, we hope and pray to double the donations (at least $14,000) in order to double the number of students (at least 100) that will be awarded scholarships. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • In 2014, we raised $7,685 that enabled us to award scholarships to 58 students in 27 high schools. More details of our activities can be found on our website http://hacodefu.org/Reports.html. We are also on facebook https://www.facebook.com/hacodefu. 
  • In this campaign, we hope and pray to double the donations (at least $14,000) in order to double the number of students (at least 100) that will be awarded scholarships.
  • The third annual  fundraising will be held on August 2015.  We expect to raise a  total of $14,000.
  • We plan ahead and therefore these funds will be for 2016 academic year.
  • We have a 501(c) tax exempt status which means that all your donations will be tax exempt for those filing taxes in the US. Our Tax ID number is 27-1693925 (http://hacodefu.org/IRS_DLN_Letter.pdf). 
  • You can also check with your employer for matching donations programs. Most employers do match the donations that employees donate to registered 501(c) tax exempt organizations.

The Impact

  • In Kenya, high school students pay tuition and fees for education. The funds raised will be used to award scholarships to at least 100 smart needy students in the 2016 academic year.
  • In 2014, we awarded scholarships to 58 students in 27 high schools.
  • From our first class that graduated in 2013, we got two students who qualified to join University.
  • Results for the class of 2014 were distributed as B+ (2), B (2), B- (1), C+(1) and C (1). 

Risks & Challenges

  • Some of the risks that we may encounter in reaching our goal is the number of days that we need to raise our ultimate goal of $14,000 by August 1st 2015.
  • I will be creating three separate campaigns of  $4,667 each that will run for 30 days. This is the first of three (1 of 3) campaigns. This way, you have the time and opportunity to contribute multiple times. With this kind of break-down, it becomes manageable when donations are spread out in small amounts over a longer period of time. You want to start now as time is not on our side.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • In the event you may not be in a position for a financial donation at this time, we also accept academic materials like (used laptops, books, pencils,pens etc)
  • You can also share this campaign with your friends. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to reach more of your friends that you trust. Thanks in advance for helping advance this campaign.
