story:
Update June 16th: Our new website is finally up and running :-)

Update June 15th: Upon request, we are adding white T-shirts without logo with fun horsey pictures as perks. Pictures were drawn for us by our friend and we have a version for men and for women. Our male friends were complaining that they do not have a perk they could buy if they are not "horse people" and so came up with this idea. It makes for a nice present as well. We hope you will like them, here are the drawings, they will be printed on the shirts without background. For non-smokers, we also have a version without it, just with beer :-)

MEN'S T-SHIRT PICTURE:

SIZES:


WOMEN'S T-SHIRT PICTURE:
SIZES:




About us

Thank you for taking the time to get to know Yeguada D. Yeguada D is a small but quality breeding program of the Pura Raza Espaňola (Pure Spanish Horse) focusing on the incredibly kind and noble character that these amazing horses can have while at the same time supporting their functionality without loosing the authentic qualities of the PRE breed. This is proving to be a heroic task as these days in Spain and around the world, a Spanish Horse seems to be either athletic or kind or spanish looking - very rarely all of these put together. Of course, everybody has their own idea to an extent of an "ideal" Spanish Horse. I love the Spanish Horse, beyond what words can describe, and my own vision is of a noble and kind horse of good height and functional gates who still looks like a Spanish Horse. That is where my dream lies = a small PRE farm with 5 or so babies per year of this quality and sharing these loving soulful horses with others. 

My name is Barbora Kalinova, I am 38 years old. The Spanish Horse came to my life when I was working on my master's degree at Stanford University in the USA. After my father unexpectedly passed away in Prague, I was devastated and questioned the sense of everything. My life, my career ambitions, all of it. Things really did change for me. And then, through some "strange" circumstances, I found a black colt online. It was Ducado, the love of my life. And our journey started. He fell in love with me as much as I did with him, the first time I saw him. He flew with me back to Europe and has since taught me so much that I will always be truly deeply indebted to him. He has taught me how incredible of a relationship could be formed between a horse and a human, how forgiving and so very kind a Spanish Horse could be. He always showed me what kind of a person I was and would like to be, with a kind reflection. He could sense what was going on with me, at any stage of my life, and if I did not notice, he would let me know. They say that a horse and how he is and behaves, is a reflection of his owner. Even more true with this breed. This might sound a bit strange, however the Spanish Horse has always been bred with noble, kind and sensitive character as priority, so through the centuries, a very special human partner emerged - a loving horse that is attracted to humans in a special way. Through Ducado and our other Spanish Horses, I have learned so many new things in so many different areas of life, from veterinary medicine and nutrition, athletics, self-development all the way to soul searching and energy healing such as REIKI etc. It has been an incredible journey that has made me a better person and I have always tried to do absolutely all in my power to give back to my horses and keep them happy and healthy - from manufacturing top quality natural feed for them in the UK to regular physiotherapy sessions and so on. I strongly believe that prevention is the key to their wellbeing, be it in the form of top nutrition or physiotherapy massages or in preventative products such as Back on Track. 

I was debating whether to make a new video for the main video here, however decided on posting the one above. I have made this video last year when finding a soulmate for one of our foals, DUC Brambi. I wanted to show people how special the Spanish Horse is. Much of what Brambi is showing, was experienced by her for the first time in her life and so it shows you her true reactions to new things and how she learns. When she is touching the hand of my friend with her nose during the walk, she is showing complete trust in her human, ensuring that she is there with her and would save her if something went wrong :-) Brambi was 2 years old on this video and found her human friend only few weeks after it was published. They are very happy together and we get regular updates on their journey together.

It is very important to me to give back to these horses for their kindness and such a huge and generous heart. I never compromise on anything, be it care or devotion or expenses. They get all the best they deserve. A picture is worth a thousand words so here are some photos of our babies for you:


What We Need & What You Get

I have been very lucky over the past almost 10 years now with making some incredible friends within the PRE world in Spain. As I am used to learning and educating myself, I have researched and researched all I could related to our project and slowly things started to move into the right direction. Top quality horses found their way to us and I have made lifelong friendships, which I am truly grateful for and that helped to make it happen. It has not been easy though at all. Everything I have goes into this dream and even though every now and then a foal is sold, the expenses are astronomical. I can only do this right and so every foal gets everything best and is sold only to the best home. The new owners are friends now and I visit the foals on regular basis. Everything gets put back into the horses. Recently, we have been able to purchase a calificado breeding mare (elite breeding approval, very rare), few top quality young girls and so our future broodmare band seems to be successfully coming together. They are the highest quality girls and given the mare usually gives around 70% or more to the foal, it is really important to get the best girls. And now, an incredible opportunity presented itself, which I feel is almost the finish line to building our foundation. This stallion, Dobres PLC, is the father of some of our girls (last few in the photos above), and for me is the best Spanish Horse I have seen in terms of not just his quality but also what he consistently produces - my ideal Spanish Horse. I've had the honour of knowing him and most of his 20 or so foals for the past few years and admired him silently, never even dreaming this could happen. And then, as it happened so many times in the past, through very "strange" circumstances, it really did happen. To make a long story short, I had 10 hours to decide, as this is the way it works with these things. And if I would find the strength to decline, he would be sold to Mexico and leave as many of the good PRE horses do these days... Needles to say, Dobres is now a part of our journey, however very difficult step financially especially with all the recent huge expenses for new girls and now the additional expenses in the near future for his activities. Dobres is currently at a reproduction clinic in Northern Spain at our friend and then will go back to the "Maestro of Maestros" in Spain, Juan Gavira, who has selected him for the fall show season in Spain. We will present Dobres in the fall in the hardest breed shows in Spain and hope to qualify him for SICAB 2015 in November - the finals of the PRE show season. We, along with everybody who saw him, truly believe in him. Juan Gavira, is the most respected and knowledgeable presenter in Spain, a legend in the PRE world, and he has huge hopes for Dobres. Dobres has to place between 1st and 3rd spot in at least 3 shows in order to qualify for SICAB. We feel he deserves to do this and then he will come home to us and slowly and correctly learn dressage through the levels. We want to keep him healthy and happy as all other our horses, which of course means, that our expenses in the next 6 months are going to be extremely high. But we feel that if we last somehow until he starts showing and will be seen, we will be ok for good. As his purchase was significant and not expected and in not ideal time, we are trying to find some help while offering what we can in return...I even thought of a minority partner of Yeguada D, however that is difficult to find and I need to make sure it will always be about the horses and not about making money, if that makes sense...

Where will the funding go specifically?

  • Show expenses
  • Training expenses
  • Travel expenses of Dobres
  • Veterinary and reproduction expenses
  • Feed and special preventative supplements to keep him healthy
  • Physiotherapy expenses for Dobres
  • Insurance expenses
  • If anything is left over = Tack for shows including promotional banners for shows, tack with logos, help with his custom saddle expenses, transport home to us, many more expenses, for example dressage training expenses are always very big even though my very close friend - on many photos and the video - is a Grand Prix dressage trainer and rider and we work together because she is very gentle and kind to the horses (the amount listed above as needed is the amount we need in order to keep Dobres going until and through SICAB without his custom saddle and tack expenses). I am happy to provide detailed list and even receipts of all these expenses, please just e-mail us if interested in that.

DOBRES PLC (2009 Pura Raza Espaňola, 175 cm)


What will you get?

We are offering everything we could think of. Be it T-shirts, photographs, children horsey photo book or promotional activities for your brand/logo/company. For horse lovers and fellow breeders, we are offering semen of Dobres for breeding and even few of our future babies. If you could think of anything else we could offer you in return for your support for our horses, please do let us know and get in touch with us. I love photography and most of these photos are my work and I can promise that you will receive beautiful and professional calendars and books with much work put into them. I will do all in my power for you. And you can rest assured, that NONE of the funds will profit us, humans - everything will go to our horses and their expenses, to the very last penny. As always. My most used sentence seems to be: "Horses eat first, then horses need this and that and then, maybe, we could get something to eat"... and yes, I know how that sounds :-)))

The Impact

I believe that Dobres is the last piece of the puzzle for establishing the foundation for our dream project. He is the epitomy of the "ideal" Spanish Horse. Noble, kind, majestic. Big size with bone, exceptional morphology, true to the breed. His gates are functional and athletic, he can sit on his hind end. Good back. On top of it all, he transmits all of this to his foals and almost clones himself into them. I feel so honoured to be able to get to know him and still can hardly believe he is mine.

I also believe that if we are lucky (there are always sooo many risks with live animals, there are absolutely no certainties ever, which makes it so tough), Dobres could even help with some of the never-ending financial expenses we are always facing and help us get an actual home of our own one day. So we could finally stop renting and could give all the horses their own home they deserve so very much.


Risks & Challenges

Horses are alive, which means they could get hurt or worse. Even with my approach of investing hugely into preventative measures, it is a very risky project.  I used to stress all the time that something will happen to my beloved four legged friends and finally realized that is no way to live or to work on a dream. I cannot promise anything, all I could do is ensure they get the top care they deserve and hope it will be enough. I feel prevention and quality care is the key and they do get that. I can promise that to you.


Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you from all my heart for reading about us and our project. I understand that not everybody has the means to be able to help, of course. If you could please share this and help us spread the word out there, it would be hugely appreciated. It feels strange asking for help like this but as my friend said, who suggested it, it cannot hurt to try. Thank you again to all of you who devoted your time to this page and thank you from the bottom of my heart for your help and donations. 


Please DO CONTACT US DIRECTLY if you have any questions, suggestions, anything at all. Always a pleasure to hear from you. And please visit our new website at www.yeguadad.com for much more information. Our facebook page gets updated on regular basis and is Yeguada D Andalusians. Our e-mail is info@yeguadad.com and we would love to hear from you. Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Shane Fleming, I am a 6th grader at The Institute for Collaborative Education - I.C.E. in New York City.  This is a school that does not follow the rules and regulations of the DOE and COMMON CORE.  This way teachers can actually teach and support the individual student at there own pace without the state telling what they need to do. Sadly, this freedom comes with a price. In exchange for this we get minimal funding From the DOE. That's why we lack basic things like a library.
  • This is very important to me because,  myself and other student have been working hard on getting the room ready for new books. Also because this is a school where I'm really learning! I would like to improve my school with easy access to books for all our students. It's a DREAM of mine, and a lot of other kids too. Back in February, me and my friend Ava, (The other main librarian,) started boxing up the books no one needed anymore, and hauling them out. Now, a little project has developed into a huge thing!

This will help over FIVE HUNDRED student have easy access to free books. 


What We Need

Here are some of the things we need:

  • A computer to scan checked out books, take inventory and all the other stuff on a computer a librarian needs to do.
  • Someone to get the mice out, but not kill them! because that would be mean.
  • Stuff to make the room hospitable and a get swifter sweeper so we don't have to breath in the 100 year old dust which seems to be bringing back my cough-varient-asthma.
  • Some bean bags so we don't have to read on an old concrete floor thats probably covered in fossilized mice poop.
  • getting books---of course.
  • repainting the room so we can get rid of the graffiti.
  • We need to get one of those slide-ey ladders so we don't have to painstakingly drag the ladder to get where we need to go and then just falling off the ladder.

The Impact

•The creation of a library will help students of ICE. ICE is an all borough school and students come from a range of social and economic backgrounds. Some students travel an hour just to come to this special school.  A library would help less advantage students who cannot afford their own books.  It would also introduce all students to new books! Also, this is a 6-12 school and people in those grades seem to-umm....well they can get angry or stressed about things and this would give them a quiet place to unwind.  

• Our school raised over $8000 on an indiegogo so our debate team could attend the national tournament.                                                                             

Risks & Challenges

  • We are facing a lot of obstacles,  we still have a lot of work to do on the room, and one of our main librarians just fell off a horse and broke her arm, so that will slow things down. 
  • But, we will work around the clock (of course going to classes, but like during lunch and stuff) now in sixth grade and when seventh rolls along, we'll also work around the clock! Hopefully we will get this finished by the second semester in 7th grade.

Other Ways You Can Help

And if you can't fund this project--don't worry! share it on Facebook and other social media! Force your friends to spend money! its all for a good cause!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary 
My name is Shane Fleming, I am a 6th grader at The Institute for Collaborative Education - I.C.E. in New York City.  This is a school that does not follow the rules and regulations of the DOE and COMMON CORE.  This way teachers can actually teach and support the individual student at there own pace without the state telling what they need to do. Sadly, this freedom comes with a price. In exchange for this we get minimal funding From the DOE. That's why we lack basic things like a library. This is very important to me because,  myself and other student have been working hard on getting the room ready for new books. Also because this is a school where I'm really learning! I would like to improve my school with easy access to books for all our students. It's a DREAM of mine, and a lot of other kids too. Back in February, me and my friend Ava, (The other main librarian,) started boxing up the books no one needed anymore, and hauling them out. Now, a little project has developed into a huge thing! 
This will help over FIVE HUNDRED student have easy access to free books. 
     What We Need Here are some of the things we need:  A computer to scan checked out books, take inventory and all the other stuff on a computer a librarian needs to do.
Someone to get the mice out, but not kill them! because that would be mean. Stuff to make the room hospitable and a get swifter sweeper so we don't have to breath in the 100 year old dust which seems to be bringing back my cough-varient-asthma.
Some bean bags so we don't have to read on an old concrete floor thats probably covered in fossilized mice poop.
getting books---of course.
repainting the room so we can get rid of the graffiti.
We need to get one of those slide-ey ladders so we don't have to painstakingly drag the ladder to get where we need to go and then just falling off the ladder.    The Impact •The creation of a library will help students of ICE. ICE is an all borough school and students come from a range of social and economic backgrounds. Some students travel an hour just to come to this special school.  A library would help less advantage students who cannot afford their own books.  It would also introduce all students to new books! Also, this is a 6-12 school and people in those grades seem to-umm....well they can get angry or stressed about things and this would give them a quiet place to unwind.  
• Our school raised over $8000 on an indiegogo so our debate team could attend the national tournament.                                                                             
Risks & Challenges

We are facing a lot of obstacles,  we still have a lot of work to do on the room, and one of our main librarians just fell off a horse and broke her arm, so that will slow things down. 

  But, we will work around the clock (of course going to classes, but like during lunch and stuff) now in sixth grade and when seventh rolls along, we'll also work around the clock! Hopefully we will get this finished by the second semester in 7th grade.    Other Ways You Can Help And if you can't fund this project--don't worry! share it on Facebook and other social media! Force your friends to spend money! its all for a good cause!  And that's all there is to it.

story:
GOAL $10,000 (Phase #1)
Professional training program for sexologists and religious leaders.

Your gifts will help us:
1) IDENTIFY leading thinkers and researchers, $2,500
2) INTEGRATE the curriculum of sexology and theology, $4,500 
3) ORGANIZE and train the leadership team, $3,000

OUR FOCUS is to train pastors and religious professionals in basic sex education and to teach sexologists in basic Christianity that contradicts the shame-based and guilt-inducing religious teaching. We are building a unique training opportunity.

This is the first step.
It's time!

story:
In 2011, Tunisian youth sparked the arab spring. With the help of technology and peaceful protests The young people of Tunisia succeeded in toppling down one of the middle east toughest dictatorships. The Tunisian revolution started because of the lack of opportunities and unjustice. With one of the highest rates of unemployed graduate, Tunisia educated youth has been feeling hopeless.

Many Tunisian activist decided to come together and create Youth Decides- a Tunisian Not-for-Profit organization. The organization was launched about a year ago. In a year, with the combined effort of many civil society actors, Our organization has succeeded in creating change with the use of technology to create opportunities and hope. We also worked hard on creating the frame that will make our work more beneficial. Structural reform is one of our many challenges that we has been tackling one by one.

Tunisia is facing a tough transition, just as the 2010 Jasmine Revolution continues to transform the ancient land of Hannibal, Ibn Khaldun, Barbarossa and Khayr al-Din. From the deep sahara in the south to the beautiful Mediterranean in the north. We hope to share our enthusiasm with all the Tunisian youth. We want to help everybody acquire the tools and solve the unemployment problem. All of us is on the front lines of the change.

 WeCode. Is a boot camp that started by taking place in Tunis to train young Tunisians. These young people learn how to develop mobile apps, websites, pitch ideas. They learn how to take their ideas from a pen and a paper to a computer screen that helps them create change and make a living. 

The money will be spent on making more camps happen in all the regions of the country. We hope we can bring together more youth and turn their unique ideas into lines of codes and a very useful mobile apps or websites. We are determinant to create change and step by step make the project a national economical inclusion project --and know the value of having a strong team. We are relying on environmentalists and our friends across the world to help us push this project forward a wider scope, more outreach and in major impact.

We want a Tunisian society that is free of unjustice and full of opportunities. We want the Tunisian youth to be able to create and invent. We want hope to be reborn among our young generation. We started the change and we will keep working to make Tunisia a success story. Moreover, we want a Tunisia that outlaws all forms of racism, discrimination, and violence.  

We will invest in our youth at the grassroots level. They are our future.

The Youth Decides Team

story:
Short Summary

Jacqulyn is a self-proclaimed “Jax of all trades.” She drove a school bus in West Chester, PA and volunteered for the Downingtown Fire Department while she attended the nursing program at West Chester University. Upon returning to her hometown, she continued her education at Plymouth State University in another direction : Biology and Education. During this time she also worked as a Residential Counselor at Spaulding Youth Center, and a tutor for children ages 6 to 56 in subjects from basic math and reading to ecology, conservation, microbiology, and genetics. She researched water quality with the Department of Environmental Services and tree phenology with the Margret and H.A. Rey Center. She's also a doula. Now a mother of two rambunctious toddlers, she spends her days inspiring a love of nature in her children and her nights running around the Italian Farmhouse. In her free time, she enjoys gardening, brewing beer with her husband, making messes in the kitchen, and developing curriculum for nature-based programs who strive to get children unplugged and outdoors.


Her latest endeavor is called “Saplings,” a forest and nature preschool to be located in Sanbornton, NH. She has designed the curriculum, spent hours filling out planning, zoning and licensing documents, and has everything she needs to get the school up and running except for the structure and amenities (or much time). Help her start this school by donating! 100% of your contribution goes towards the purchase of a “one-room school yurt,” the septic system, and the well and pumping system.


Since we were able to stay afloat with the added challenges of late, we know that we can take on a business loan. However, 40% of new small businesses that fail in the first few years do so because they don't start off with enough capital. Our goal here is to have a cushion for any unexpeced expenses. There are many permits, surveying fees and licensing costs, not to mention the insurance rates for starting any program involving children.  Your contribution will help us build a structure-- a warm, safe, and welcoming schoolyurt for 12 children of Sanbornton and neighboring towns. There are nearly 1600 children under the age of five in Sanbornton and the six surrounding towns. There are only 21 licensed childcare facilities which have a capacity of just over 900. I'm not saying that we will even put a dent in these numbers, but I am saying our community needs this! I have the curriculum. I have the supplies. I have the patience and perserverance. Your contributions--which may even be simply $5 or an advance payment of tuition-- will help build the structure and put in a well.

In our society today, it is a cultural norm for people to have "money-making" weddings and registries where people can help pay for honeymoons. And no one thinks anything of it. Paul and I were together for four years before we were married, had established a home together and although a celebration would have been beautiful, we did not have the expectation of receiving anything for the sake of our marriage. We do not have the expectation that people will contribute here just because we're trying to start a family business either. Folks support what they believe in. There have been successful campaigns for medical expenses, down payments on homes, opening schools in third-world countries, sending local athletes to championship competitions, and helping people start businesses. Why do people help? Because they want to. Because they believe in the cause. Because they are family, neighbors, community members. Because a lot of small contributions can make a big impact. Although I enjoy hearing stories of communities coming together to help a farmer raise a barn, or a failing small business keep their doors open, I do realize that this is not how most people think. So, what's in it for you? Since we are trying to start a business and not a non-profit, not a tax break. If you are a parent in our communities, Saplings would be a unique alternative learning environment for your child. If you do not have children, please remember an educated population benefits all of society and having a good school in your community, whether public, charter, or private, raises home values. If you hope to change how our society chooses to educate our children, please contribute and help us make the change.


Our mission is to engage the whole child in a sustainable, natural environment offering a treasure trove of adventures and possibilities. The children will have endless opportunities to become strong in mind, body and spirit and strongly connected to each other and the natural world. With several acres of land, children will enjoy hundred of hours of exploring, imagining and growing a love of nature.

Our holistic plan and emergent curriculum shares attributes of Reggio Emilia, Maria Montessori and Waldorf (Steiner). This balanced approach addresses the cognitive, physical, social, emotional, and creative development of every child and embraces each child in a unique way.

Our teachers strive to facilitate learning, ensure safety, and provide guidance. Our wishes are to foster the innate curiosity, joy and inner discipline essential to learning, to reinforce the respect and compassion for the earth and all living things and to plant a seed for the love of nature in children-- our future naturalists.

Our philosophy supports frequent, unstructured outdoor childhood play that research has identified as being the most common influence on the development of life-long conservation values. Instead of following the American society's shift of formal academic instruction into earlier and earlier years, our model provides hands-on experiences and encounters in the natural world during these formative years. Our supporters strongly advocate for making mudpies, jumping in puddles, climbing trees, building forts, and slaying dragons. These childhood moments strengthen the curiosity and joy-- the fundamentals-- which should pervade all education. Afterall, childhood should be joyful and wholesome.



 

Don't forget to check out the perks! Much like how community supported agriculture works, I have set up levels of contributions or "shares" which double as early (discounted) tuition payments!

You can also donate via PayPal to avoid the added fees for Saplings.


The Impact

  "Imagine a world in which all children grow up with a deep understanding of the life around them. Where obesity is reduced through nature play. Where anti-depressants and pharmaceuticals are prescribed less and nature prescribed more. Where every school has a natural play space. Where children experience the joy of being in nature before they learn of its loss, where they can lie in the grass on a hillside for hours and watch clouds become the faces of the future. Where every child and every adult has a human right to a connection to the natural world, and shares the responsibility  for caring for it."
--Richard Louv, founding chairman, Children & Nature Network, is author of 'Last Child in the Woods' and 'The Nature Principle,' from which these words are drawn.

 “The future will belong to the nature-smart—those individuals, families, businesses, and political leaders who develop a deeper understanding of the transformative power of the natural world and who balance the virtual with the real. The more high-tech we become, the more nature we need.”

—Richard Louv, C&NN


Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

Please spread the word and make some noise!

story:
Short Summary

“Girls as Techies” is a first-time project-based initiative striving to support and identify future innovators in media arts & interactive multimedia among underserved and under-represented girls and women through digital advocacy and empowerment.  The initiative will help advance the mission through advocating and battling employment disparities existing due to barriers such as economic, lack of resources, and a distorted cultural interpretation of art/technology, which leads to creative crippling therefore, by providing future innovators with arts learning opportunities in combination of technology elements i.e. such as web/internet languages/hardware mixed with artistic skills such as painting, design etc. to encourage experimentation in arts learning through provided space, paid mentorship opportunities, and paid arts creation opportunities for recruited youth and artist mentors.

What We Need & What You Get

We are launching the campaign to support one time stipends to give to youth upon completion of the yearlong mentorship program.  What you will get is the opportunity to help support adolescent girls in the pusuit of technology through new media arts and media technology!

The Impact

The need for this project stemmed from the lack of representation of women in new media art careers such as creative coding, web design/programming etc. According to the a report from the Girl Scout Research Institute, girls are interested in STEM fields and aspire to those careers; however, the need for adult support and exposure in these careers are needed to carry on these interests.  The dilemma is that technology like fine arts is considered as an elective in school; therefore, exposure to technology or art is at an expense of the other.  In addition, the project benefit will help encourage adolescent girls and women to experiment in new media arts and introduce career pathways to higher paying jobs.  Lastly, combining art and technology, one eliminates the need to choose one or the other and enable the pursuit of new media art forms to one’s full capacity.

Risks & Challenges

If we can't raise enough money, our youth will not be able to get the stipend for their hard work and participation.  Because the retention rate for girls in art & technology activities is far and few due to barriers such as fewer supports, less exposure, and lower academic achievement. 

How the fund will be used:

$1,000 Stipends for 10 girls
$500    Transportation costs for low income participants
$500    Food and snacks
$500    Art Supplies, circuit tapes, and anything to make their work possible

Any questions can be directed to girlsastechies@gmail.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we will still love your help by passing the word around through your network of friends and family.  A huge thank you in advance for your support.  Visit us on our facebook page: www.facebook.com/Girlsastechies

story:
**So far we've raised 3.21 bitcoin!  Our grand total is $2022!  That's 29% of our goal!!!** 

Send the Liberty Beat to NYC to Report on the Ross Ulbricht Trial!

               "I get updates on the Ross Ulbricht trial exclusively from 
               The Liberty Beat and John Bush. Bush is dedicated to 
               truth about the key criminal trials that affect our freedom
                -- which is perhaps why the mainstream media is looking away". 
                                  - Millie Thompson (Antonio Buehler's Attorney)

The Liberty Beat daily news service is raising money to provide you with full in-depth coverage of the Ross Ulbricht Trial with reporters on the ground during the entirety of the trial.  Money we will raise will pay for travel costs, living expenses, advertising, graphic design, live blogging, and other activities supporting our coverage.  We will also have writers and staff support back at in Central Texas writing stories and compiling information from the trial and coordinating advertising, outreach, and fundraising efforts. 

Everything we raise above our goal will be split 50/50 between the Free Ross Legal Defense Fund and ongoing media and activist efforts to bring attention to Ross Ulbricht's ongoing legal battles.  

Our coverage of the first week of the trial reached hundreds of thousands of people, providing them with breaking news and a perspective and depth of knowledge they won’t find on other media outlets.  

About the Case

               John Bush is the only journalist I interviewed with 
               the first week of Ross' trial. I look forward to more 
               of his good work." - Lyn Ulbricht (Ross' Mother)

Ross William Ulbricht is facing federal charges associated with his alleged involvement with the Silk Road marketplace, a dark net website that allowed users to buy and sell illicit goods.  The case has big implications not only for Ross and his family, but for the future of internet freedom as we know it.  The State is attempting to hold Ross responsible for the actions of users on a website he created.  If they are able to do this, it sets a dangerous precedent that other webmasters and site owners may be legally responsible for their user's behavior.

For those that know Ross Ulbricht, he is a good person and no criminal.  He is now facing 30 years to life in prison.  Regardless of the level of involvement he had in the building or administering the Silk Road website, he does not belong in a cage.  

Also at stake is the age old battle of freedom vs. control.  The Silk Road, Bitcoin, TOR, and encryption represent major threats to the powers that be and this trial is one of the first cases where all of these technologies are being brought in to the public spotlight.  The outcome of this case will impact the way the public views these radical technologies. 

How You Can Help

Let The Liberty Beat be your eyes and ears on the ground in New York City.

1. Donate via Credit/Debit Card or PayPal - choose one of the perks to the right or donate any amount through the IndieGogo

2. Donate with Bitcoin - To receive a perk and donate with bitcoin, click here!

To donate bitcoin with no perk. send btc to this address: 

182YuaV7Kn6V9fPSuMhBvm4CWfvNeCmacG

3. Donate Frequent Flier Miles - this will cut our trip costs significantly!  If you can donate miles, please contact us through our IndieGogo page.  

4. SHARE this with your friends, talk about, blog about it, invite us to do an interview.

Coverage

               "Liberty Beat has done a fantastic job covering
               the Ross Ulbricht trial. The world is a more informed
               place thanks to their work." - Roger Ver

Check out our LIVE BLOG PAGE with breaking updates from multiple news outlets:

http://thelibertybeat.com/silk-road-trial-coverage-ross-ulbricht/

Check out the stories the Liberty Beat has written about the case thus far: 

http://thelibertybeat.com/?s=silk+road

story_txt:
**So far we've raised 3.21 bitcoin!  Our grand total is $2022!  That's 29% of our goal!!!** 
Send the Liberty Beat to NYC to Report on the Ross Ulbricht Trial!

               "I get updates on the Ross Ulbricht trial exclusively from                The Liberty Beat and John Bush. Bush is dedicated to                truth about the key criminal trials that affect our freedom                -- which is perhaps why the mainstream media is looking away".                                   - Millie Thompson (Antonio Buehler's Attorney)
The Liberty Beat daily news service is raising money to provide you with full in-depth coverage of the Ross Ulbricht Trial with reporters on the ground during the entirety of the trial.  Money we will raise will pay for travel costs, living expenses, advertising, graphic design, live blogging, and other activities supporting our coverage.  We will also have writers and staff support back at in Central Texas writing stories and compiling information from the trial and coordinating advertising, outreach, and fundraising efforts. 
Everything we raise above our goal will be split 50/50 between the Free Ross Legal Defense Fund and ongoing media and activist efforts to bring attention to Ross Ulbricht's ongoing legal battles.  
Our coverage of the first week of the trial reached hundreds of thousands of people, providing them with breaking news and a perspective and depth of knowledge they won’t find on other media outlets.  

About the Case
               John Bush is the only journalist I interviewed with                the first week of Ross' trial. I look forward to more                of his good work." - Lyn Ulbricht (Ross' Mother)
Ross William Ulbricht is facing federal charges associated with his alleged involvement with the Silk Road marketplace, a dark net website that allowed users to buy and sell illicit goods.  The case has big implications not only for Ross and his family, but for the future of internet freedom as we know it.  The State is attempting to hold Ross responsible for the actions of users on a website he created.  If they are able to do this, it sets a dangerous precedent that other webmasters and site owners may be legally responsible for their user's behavior. 
For those that know Ross Ulbricht, he is a good person and no criminal.  He is now facing 30 years to life in prison.  Regardless of the level of involvement he had in the building or administering the Silk Road website, he does not belong in a cage.  
Also at stake is the age old battle of freedom vs. control.  The Silk Road, Bitcoin, TOR, and encryption represent major threats to the powers that be and this trial is one of the first cases where all of these technologies are being brought in to the public spotlight.  The outcome of this case will impact the way the public views these radical technologies. 
How You Can Help
Let The Liberty Beat be your eyes and ears on the ground in New York City.
1. Donate via Credit/Debit Card or PayPal - choose one of the perks to the right or donate any amount through the IndieGogo
2. Donate with Bitcoin - To receive a perk and donate with bitcoin, click here!
To donate bitcoin with no perk. send btc to this address: 
182YuaV7Kn6V9fPSuMhBvm4CWfvNeCmacG
3. Donate Frequent Flier Miles - this will cut our trip costs significantly!  If you can donate miles, please contact us through our IndieGogo page.  
4. SHARE this with your friends, talk about, blog about it, invite us to do an interview.
Coverage
               "Liberty Beat has done a fantastic job covering                the Ross Ulbricht trial. The world is a more informed                place thanks to their work." - Roger Ver
Check out our LIVE BLOG PAGE with breaking updates from multiple news outlets:
http://thelibertybeat.com/silk-road-trial-coverage-ross-ulbricht/

story:
Hello all!

My name is Richard, and I am launching my first campaign to raise funds to realize one of my dreams. And that dream is to get the training that would allow me to seriously get on board with co-creating 1) a consent culture 2) a culture that enables us to intervene when we see harm happening 3) healthy masculinity with boys and men. Taking the Bystander Intervention / Healthy Masculinity 3-day training that is being provided by Men Can Stop Rape in New York City on February 18th would be a major first step to this goal. 

I've done work raising thousands of dollars for San Francisco Women Against Rape, organized community forums to talk about street harassment under the umbrella of a group i founded, Men of African Ancestry Action Network to Unlearn Patriarchy (MAAAN UP), and blogged about anti-patriarchal / anti-sexist perspectives in a blog i wrote for 3 years called fem.men.ist. But it's been clear to me for some time that it's time to take some bigger steps.

To be clear, this is not about villianizing boys and men. The heart of my mission is purely based in LOVE. Love and Accountability. I personally don't feel that i can honestly say i love women while standing by and watching the ravages of sexism and patriarchy take it's toll on them. I have seen too many women in my life suffer. Meanwhile, I am watching so many women led movements advocating for the lives of unarmed black men who are being murdered by police. Surely, it's time for me to take a bigger step for humanity during these revolutionary times. 

And while the people who bear the brunt of the ravages of sexism and patriarchy are girls and women, i am also concerned about my woman-loving brothers, who are shortchanged on the experience of love itself. How can you truly love someone you don't respect? Or regard as an object? The voice of a man i know, who has slept with countless women, but admits that he doesn't think he has ever experienced love, echoes sadly in my head. 

Men Can Stop Rape is the nation leader in Bystander Intervention / Healthy Masculinity trainings. I want to take this training, to reach youth and interrupt the programming that devalues girls, devalues boys, and devalues love. I want to take this training, and go to colleges across the country, where rape culture is very ingrained, and there is great need for this work. I want to take this training, so i can create a consultancy that allows me to be contracted out to various organizations.

So I come to you to help me actualize this goal for me, and for a better future for all of us. 


What Is Needed

My fundraising goal is $1400:
  • Bystander Intervention / Healthy Masculinity training: $600
  • Plane ticket to New York: $375
  • Lodging for 3 nights in Midtown Manhattan: $350
  • Winter Gear (!!): $75
If I don't make my whole goal, I will prioritize the training fee and plane ticket, and work everything else out. 
I realize that I am making this ask at a time where many of us are experiencing a "crowdsourcing fatigue", and that many of us are just doing our best to keep our heads above water financially. If you can't donate right now, I ask that you consider helping me spread the word. And honestly, if you give one single dollar, i will be humbled. This takes a lot for me, I've never done a crowdsourcing campaign for myself. It's kinda huge.
Thank you for taking the time out to read this and consider this! Much love and gratitude. May we all actualize our goals for ourselves and the world!
Thank you,
Richard 

ps read more about MCSR and the training here: http://www.mencanstoprape.org/

story:
Hello, I’m so happy you’re here!

My name is Lindsey, and I am the Founder of World-Changing Kids, a non-profit educational organization dedicated to leadership development and community building through active kindness.  We teach children how to change the world.

I have written a book, "Plant a Garden of Kindness, A Child's Guide to Filling a Year with Weekly Acts of Kindness", which consists of 75 Acts of Kindness that children can do to build their kindness, empathy and compassion muscles, while also building a friendlier, more resilient community.  The goal is to select 52 Acts of Kindness from the book and complete one a week for a year.  By the end of the year, the child will have made kindness and community engagement a habit.

In addition to our book, we also run an annual Kids Love Peace festival - two days of free children's programming during the Ottawa Peace Festival, we offer a "Year of Kindness" program for schools, plus we do loads of other collaborations, activities, presentations and events as they pop up.  There are so many ways to do good in this world - and we want to be part of all of them!

OUR CAMPAIGN AND WHY IT’S IMPORTANT:

Let’s teach our children that we are all more the same than we are different.

This campaign will help us build, print and sell our 2018 World-Changing Kids Calendar - a collection of important dates sourced from children and youth.  These dates include religious holidays, social justice dates, environmental dates, etc.  They include any and all dates deemed important by the children and youth.  Two weeks before each date, the calendar owner will receive by email a "conversation starter" that provides a child size explanation of the date, why it is important and an action that the child can take to honour the date.  In addition to all this amazing learning, you will also get a beautiful wall calendar with artwork created by students at Charles H. Hulse Public School.

We wanted to work with Charles H. Hulse on this because it is a beautiful school in our community with very high needs. It has such high needs because its population is mostly made up of immigrants and newcomers, with English being the second language for a lot, if not the majority, of the kids. Some of the children’s only previous experience with school has been in a refugee camp.  As a result of having a high population of immigrants and newcomers, the School Council is not able to do much fundraising, which other schools do to purchase things like technology and workshops for the kids.  We are going to donate a portion of the proceeds from the sale of our World-Changing Kids 2018 Calendar to Charles H. Hulse so they can get those extras for their students.  With your contribution towards our calendar project, you will be telling the kids at Charles H. Hulse that they are loved, supported and valued.  And they will have pride in knowing that they helped create this calendar, they did the artwork, they were agents for change for their community.  The positive impacts of this will have lasting benefits for these kids.

Your support of this calendar will help us achieve our mission of teaching children acceptance, kindness, empathy, social activism, inclusion, community engagement and peace.  We can achieve all this by simply teaching children about all members of their community - people of all skin colours, languages, religions, backgrounds, abilities and cultures.  If children are introduced to all this beautiful diversity when they are young, it will become normal.  They will learn that we are all more than same than we are different.  They will not look at some members of their community as "others".  There will be no "us vs. them".  Because this diversity will be known and valued from a young age, it will not be feared.  And often it is fear that leads to hate and racism.

WHAT YOU WILL HELP US ACHIEVE:

Join us at the ground level of a global movement of kindness, empathy, compassion, acceptance, social activism, community engagement and peace building.

This calendar project is really the launching pad for taking World-Changing Kids from the grassroots level we have been working at for the last few years to the global level.  We have been doing 10 years of field research in our community (while raising our kids), we have been building up our programs, and now we are ready to take it to the next level. We are ready to bring our programs outside of our community.  We are ready to reach world-changing kids from around the world!

A contribution to our crowdfunding campaign is more than just the purchase of a calendar, it is throwing your support behind World-Changing Kids so that we can teach children how to change the world for the better.  You will be supporting our work to help children build their kindness, empathy and compassion muscles.  You will be helping us to empower children to take action for the causes they care about.  Together, we will build more resilient communities and raise a generation of kids who are engaged and inspired to do good.

With your financial contribution, you will be joining us at the ground level of a global movement of kindness, empathy, compassion, acceptance, social activism, community engagement and peace building.  And that is something that the world desperately needs right now.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET:

Let’s raise a generation of children who will change the world for the better.

We need to raise $7,000 in order to cover the costs of building and printing our first print run of our 2018 World-Changing Kids Calendar.  Any funding received over this amount will allow World-Changing Kids to do more good.  We will use it to get more World-Changing Kids programming into schools.  We will use it to do more marketing for our book, "Plant a Garden of Kindness", and get it into the hands of more families.  We will use it to collaborate with more organizations who are doing fantastic, world-changing work.  We have a million ideas of great things we could do - more funding will allow us to start more of them sooner!

Our Awesome Perks

For a contribution of $20 - you will receive a copy of our book "Plant a Garden of Kindness"

For a contribution of $45 - you will receive an advance copy of our 2018 World-Changing Kids Calendar (which will be mailed out the first week of December)

For a contribution of $60 - you will receive a copy of our book and our calendar

For a contribution of $250 - you will receive a copy of the calendar and a World-Changing Kids workshop for the classroom of your choice (in the Ottawa area) - if you don't have a classroom in mind, we can suggest some classrooms who would be very grateful to receive a free workshop

For a contribution of $1,000 - you will receive a copy of the calendar and a World-Changing Kids "Year of Kindness" program for an entire school (in the Ottawa area) - again, if you don't have a school in mind, we can suggest some schools who would be very grateful to receive this program

Where the Funds Will Go If We Don't Reach Our Entire Goal

Your contribution will make a difference.  If we don't receive the entire $7,000 goal, we will continue with our World-Changing Kids 2018 Calendar, but with a smaller print run.

THE IMPACT:

Help us plant the important idea seeds with our future leaders and decision makers.

Our calendar will make a lasting difference by teaching children about these important dates and empowering them with an action they can take to honour the date.  We will plant all these idea seeds in their minds when they are young and these will stay with them as they grow up to become the future leaders and decision makers.

As children, they will start with building empathy, understanding and compassion for members of their community, but as they get older, they will extend this thinking to all members of their city, their province, their country and then the world. They will learn to consider how their decisions and actions will affect all the different groups and people we share this planet with.

OUR SUCCESSFUL TRACK RECORD:

Many small acts make a big impact.

Check out the "What We're Up To" section of our website to see our successful track record with World-Changing Kids projects - http://worldchangingkids.ca/what-were-up-to

To give two recent examples ....

1. Kids Love Peace Festival

We recently completed our second annual Kids Love Peace festival.  We held two days of awesome children's activities - including art, science, face painting, yoga, storytelling, sports, and more!  We had 150 people attend each of the days.  We worked with partners including the Ottawa Public Library, the Ottawa Police, Maker Junior, Arts Express Ottawa, White Butterfly Yoga, City Councilor, Jean Cloutier, City Councilor Diane Deans, and our MPP for Ottawa South, John Fraser ... to name a few.

These festivals are held in communities with a high immigrant and newcomer population.  A lot of the children in these communities don't get to attend the other festivals around Ottawa due to language barriers, financial barriers and transportation barriers.  So we wanted to bring the activities to their backyards!  The festival is open to all children in the Ottawa area as well.  This provides awesome leadership development opportunities for the children who live in the communities where Kids Love Peace is held - they get to welcome children from all over the city to their communities, they get to be the leaders.  There are also volunteer opportunities for the older children.  All of this increases the pride they feel for their community.  So much good is created over these two days each year.

2. Peace, Love, Kindness Mural and Mural Unveiling

We also just completed our Peace, Love, Kindness Mural Unveiling Celebration at Charles H. Hulse Public School.  This mural, funded by Crime Prevention Ottawa, was completed last spring by students at Charles H. Hulse and Ridgemont High School.  It was a collaboration between World-Changing Kids, Arts Express Ottawa and Mural Artist Claudia Salguero. 

The Mural Unveiling Ceremony was attended by 150 people, including John Fraser, our MPP for Ottawa South, Chris Ellis, our School Board Trustee, Algonquin Elder Albert Dumont, and a representative from the office our City Councilor, Jean Cloutier.  It was translated into Nepalese, Arabic and Somali to reach the school population.  A group of wonderful students from Charles H. Hulse read parts of the Mural Story.  And Elder Dumont gave an Opening and Closing Prayer.  It was such a beautiful event.

 

Check out our website for information on our other awesome projects and initiatives like Kindness Club at Billingswood Manor Retirement Residence, our Kindness Paintings, our CHEO Edition of our book "Plant a Garden of Kindness" with proceeds going to the Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario, and our involvement in the "Thank You Malala" event on Parliament Hill in April.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:

We believe every child can be a World-Changing Kid.  It’s time to amplify our impact.

In order for this campaign to be a success, we need to get this campaign out to a large audience.  We can achieve a significant reach through our World-Changing Kids social media pages, but we are going to need to do more than that for this larger scale project.  We are ready to do more!

We have been building World-Changing Kids officially for two years now.  In that time, we have created an amazing community of friends who support our mission of teaching children how to change the world.  We have a strong social media following, a committed email distribution list, an amazing advisory board and support from many leaders in our city.  Our events, workshops and activities have reached thousands of people in Ottawa.  We have a proven track record of successfully completing projects, hosting events and connecting with kids and their families.

To ensure a large audience for this campaign and our calendar, we will reach out to the media.  We will call on all the friends, supporters and organizations that we have collaborated with in the past to push this campaign out to a wider network.

WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

There are 3 ways you can help.

1. Contribute Financially

We have many different contribution levels for you to choose from - with amazing perks.  Any and all amounts help!  Just click on the pink “BACK IT” button on the top right of this page to make a contribution, in any amount.

2. Share this Campaign

Share this with your email list.  Share this on your social media pages. Talk to your neighbours about it.  Talk to your children's teachers about it.  Talk to everyone you can!  And remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!  They’re at the top right of the page, and just need one click.  We need lots of people talking about this in order to make it a success.

3. Submit a Date for the Calendar

We would love to hear about a date that is important to your family.  You can email us at worldchangingkids@gmail.com to tell us about your date.

 

We will be forever grateful to everyone who supports this calendar project and our launch from grassroots level to global level in any and all ways you can!  Let's work together to build the community, the country and the world that we want to raise our children in.  Let's flood the world with love and kindness!  This is what the world needs so desperately right now.
story_txt: Hello, I’m so happy you’re here!My name is Lindsey, and I am the Founder of World-Changing Kids, a non-profit educational organization dedicated to leadership development and community building through active kindness.  We teach children how to change the world.I have written a book, "Plant a Garden of Kindness, A Child's Guide to Filling a Year with Weekly Acts of Kindness", which consists of 75 Acts of Kindness that children can do to build their kindness, empathy and compassion muscles, while also building a friendlier, more resilient community.  The goal is to select 52 Acts of Kindness from the book and complete one a week for a year.  By the end of the year, the child will have made kindness and community engagement a habit.In addition to our book, we also run an annual Kids Love Peace festival - two days of free children's programming during the Ottawa Peace Festival, we offer a "Year of Kindness" program for schools, plus we do loads of other collaborations, activities, presentations and events as they pop up.  There are so many ways to do good in this world - and we want to be part of all of them!OUR CAMPAIGN AND WHY IT’S IMPORTANT:Let’s teach our children that we are all more the same than we are different.This campaign will help us build, print and sell our 2018 World-Changing Kids Calendar - a collection of important dates sourced from children and youth.  These dates include religious holidays, social justice dates, environmental dates, etc.  They include any and all dates deemed important by the children and youth.  Two weeks before each date, the calendar owner will receive by email a "conversation starter" that provides a child size explanation of the date, why it is important and an action that the child can take to honour the date.  In addition to all this amazing learning, you will also get a beautiful wall calendar with artwork created by students at Charles H. Hulse Public School.We wanted to work with Charles H. Hulse on this because it is a beautiful school in our community with very high needs. It has such high needs because its population is mostly made up of immigrants and newcomers, with English being the second language for a lot, if not the majority, of the kids. Some of the children’s only previous experience with school has been in a refugee camp.  As a result of having a high population of immigrants and newcomers, the School Council is not able to do much fundraising, which other schools do to purchase things like technology and workshops for the kids.  We are going to donate a portion of the proceeds from the sale of our World-Changing Kids 2018 Calendar to Charles H. Hulse so they can get those extras for their students.  With your contribution towards our calendar project, you will be telling the kids at Charles H. Hulse that they are loved, supported and valued.  And they will have pride in knowing that they helped create this calendar, they did the artwork, they were agents for change for their community.  The positive impacts of this will have lasting benefits for these kids.Your support of this calendar will help us achieve our mission of teaching children acceptance, kindness, empathy, social activism, inclusion, community engagement and peace.  We can achieve all this by simply teaching children about all members of their community - people of all skin colours, languages, religions, backgrounds, abilities and cultures.  If children are introduced to all this beautiful diversity when they are young, it will become normal.  They will learn that we are all more than same than we are different.  They will not look at some members of their community as "others".  There will be no "us vs. them".  Because this diversity will be known and valued from a young age, it will not be feared.  And often it is fear that leads to hate and racism.WHAT YOU WILL HELP US ACHIEVE: Join us at the ground level of a global movement of kindness, empathy, compassion, acceptance, social activism, community engagement and peace building.This calendar project is really the launching pad for taking World-Changing Kids from the grassroots level we have been working at for the last few years to the global level.  We have been doing 10 years of field research in our community (while raising our kids), we have been building up our programs, and now we are ready to take it to the next level. We are ready to bring our programs outside of our community.  We are ready to reach world-changing kids from around the world!A contribution to our crowdfunding campaign is more than just the purchase of a calendar, it is throwing your support behind World-Changing Kids so that we can teach children how to change the world for the better.  You will be supporting our work to help children build their kindness, empathy and compassion muscles.  You will be helping us to empower children to take action for the causes they care about.  Together, we will build more resilient communities and raise a generation of kids who are engaged and inspired to do good.With your financial contribution, you will be joining us at the ground level of a global movement of kindness, empathy, compassion, acceptance, social activism, community engagement and peace building.  And that is something that the world desperately needs right now.WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET: Let’s raise a generation of children who will change the world for the better.We need to raise $7,000 in order to cover the costs of building and printing our first print run of our 2018 World-Changing Kids Calendar.  Any funding received over this amount will allow World-Changing Kids to do more good.  We will use it to get more World-Changing Kids programming into schools.  We will use it to do more marketing for our book, "Plant a Garden of Kindness", and get it into the hands of more families.  We will use it to collaborate with more organizations who are doing fantastic, world-changing work.  We have a million ideas of great things we could do - more funding will allow us to start more of them sooner!Our Awesome PerksFor a contribution of $20 - you will receive a copy of our book "Plant a Garden of Kindness"For a contribution of $45 - you will receive an advance copy of our 2018 World-Changing Kids Calendar (which will be mailed out the first week of December)For a contribution of $60 - you will receive a copy of our book and our calendarFor a contribution of $250 - you will receive a copy of the calendar and a World-Changing Kids workshop for the classroom of your choice (in the Ottawa area) - if you don't have a classroom in mind, we can suggest some classrooms who would be very grateful to receive a free workshopFor a contribution of $1,000 - you will receive a copy of the calendar and a World-Changing Kids "Year of Kindness" program for an entire school (in the Ottawa area) - again, if you don't have a school in mind, we can suggest some schools who would be very grateful to receive this programWhere the Funds Will Go If We Don't Reach Our Entire GoalYour contribution will make a difference.  If we don't receive the entire $7,000 goal, we will continue with our World-Changing Kids 2018 Calendar, but with a smaller print run.THE IMPACT:Help us plant the important idea seeds with our future leaders and decision makers.Our calendar will make a lasting difference by teaching children about these important dates and empowering them with an action they can take to honour the date.  We will plant all these idea seeds in their minds when they are young and these will stay with them as they grow up to become the future leaders and decision makers.As children, they will start with building empathy, understanding and compassion for members of their community, but as they get older, they will extend this thinking to all members of their city, their province, their country and then the world. They will learn to consider how their decisions and actions will affect all the different groups and people we share this planet with.OUR SUCCESSFUL TRACK RECORD: Many small acts make a big impact.Check out the "What We're Up To" section of our website to see our successful track record with World-Changing Kids projects - http://worldchangingkids.ca/what-were-up-toTo give two recent examples ....1. story:
Emergency Business French Lessons  - An Audio Book!

HI! My name is Simon Borland, and I'd like to tell you about how this project became a truly unexpected part of my life. When I grew up, French lessons were not on my personal agenda and I studied Maths and Physics and all manner of other subjects instead.

Fast forward to 2017, and I found myself living in London, with a French wife, taking frequent trips in Paris, to renovate an apartment. I had to rapidly learn how to strike various business deals in French.

All too often I found myself way, way out of my depth. So I tried every audio book and course book I could get on Amazon. I tried 1 to 1 tutors. I have even tried reading old Asterix and Obelix comic books in their original French language versions - (and loving them!), but nothing was really helping me fast track to sensible business-related conversations.

What I really needed was emergency Business French lessons, as a particular need.

And so I decided to completely change direction - I stopped seeking beginners lessons, where they were telling  me what I should learn, and instead decided to approach a professional corporate translator, a native French speaker living in Paris, with corporate experience, and  tell him all the phrases I needed.  

So I contacted professional language teacher and corporate translator Eric Baron, and everything changed.

Eric is an incredibly talented language teacher and corporate translation expert with clients all over the world. Amazon, Wondershare, financial clients, stockbrokers, financial news channels, iTrader.com, marketing campaigns, international movie translation, strategy documents, business presentations - Eric has translated them all. He started me off on a series of fast paced lessons getting straight to the core of the business related subjects I really needed to focus on. 

And so now, after hundreds of hours of intense collaboration, Eric Baron and I have put together the complete Emergency Business French language course.

Now - with your help - we are going to turn this into a fantastic audio book of 100 essential Business French Phrases, with clear and concise explanations, useful repetitions, grammar, nouns and tips. You will soon be listening and learning from a native french speaker - Eric - exactly how and why he would choose each phrase and particular wording for each situation.

You can even CONTRIBUTE business phrases that you think would be useful, and Eric will translate them and construct lessons for the phrases you want. 

What We Need & What You Get

OK so to achieve this we will need to raise money for the following steps

$1,325 for professional sound studio hire, audio engineer editing of the sound files.

$3,800 for professional print editing / formatting, design and layout, as a printed accompaniment to the audiobook.

$6,600 Limited Edition Printing of 300 Business French Phrasebooks for you

$1,275 graphic design various elements

Total Costs:  USD$13,000

The Impact

Eric and I believe this is a truly unique language audiobook, and will really benefit all of you who have to do any kind of business French dealings, no matter if it is in person, or by email or over the telephone.  We have been excited creating the framework and working together, and have worked painstakingly over the past 18 months to craft every single chapter and phrase for a logical progression of key words, verbs, and jargon, into a culturally nuanced and relevant teaching guide.

The Perks

Please browse through the options for various levels of perks: the PDF book, the audio book, the limited edition printed book, plus there are options for you to include phrases in the audio book, relevant to your industry or needs.

Additional perks include bespoke translation work by Eric, and also the option to have Eric work as your consultant for several days if you need a professional translator on contracts and wing-man for business negotiations or presentations, even coaching you for your own big presentation in French etc.

The project is so close to completion - we just need your support to get into the final phase and have it professionally mastered in a sound studio, and to have the limited edition print version professionally edited.

This is a very low risk project - we will deliver this audio book no matter what happens and all of our supporters will receive all of their perks.

Studio recording will take place in December 2017, Eric is heading over to London UK (from Paris) to join me for 3 days recording in a professional studio, with editing and mastering of the audio book to be completed by late January 2018 - and we anticipate the limited edition print version will be completed by March 2018.

Other Ways You Can Help

This is our first campaign ever, and we really would love to hear from you - ideas and feedback, and any tips on how we might best promote this concept

Merci!

Simon Borland (London) and Eric Baron (Paris)

story:
Cultivating Resilient Youth, Inc.

Cultivating Resilient Youth, Inc. is a non-profit organization in Pittsburgh, PA  that focuses on mentoring, education programming, leadership and personal development of youth (primarily girls) in 9-12th grade youth.  

Our mission is to empower, educate and mentor youth for success in life through program development and academic preparation, while creating opportunities for social change that builds a strong foundation for a successful future.

We have several programs that reinforce our mission and vision including our signature F.I.Y.A. Program (Fierce Inspiring Young Adults). F.I.Y.A.  is our high school girls development and mentoring  based program that sets goals for greatness in personal growth, youth development,  academic excellence and leadership.

This campaign is extremely important to F.I.Y.A. because it allows the students to become more politically, educationally and culturally conscious. Through F.I.Y.A.  we teach our students to strive to become well rounded leaders in their communities, schools and in life.  

The young ladies of F.I.Y.A. specifically chose Washington D.C. because they wanted to embrace themselves in the cultural experience that the numerous museums, monuments and possible trip to the White House will give them. 

Many of our young ladies have not yet had the opportunity to leave the city they grew up in,  yet alone visit Washington DC and we want to reward them with a trip that will enrich them culturally and educationally. Our hope is that this experience opens up their eyes and minds for a plethora of cultural and educational opportunities in the future. 

We truly believe that education is essential to growth and opportunity and the more opportunities we give our youth the more we are able to cultivate them to become stronger change agents within their communities. 

All contributions will help with transportation, food and additional trip costs to and from Washington D.C. 

Thank you for all your support!

For more information on our program visit www.cultivatingresilientyouth.org.
