story:
Short Summary

WHAT IS TBX (TAMPA BAY EXPRESS)?

Tampa Bay Express (TBX) is a FDOT proposed $9 Billion toll-way concept that would mix toll lanes with freeway lanes (I-275, I-4 & I-75) essentially creating two separate highways a first class (TBX tolled version) and second class (Current freeways) . TBX or toll way lanes would cost up to $2.00 a mile to ride and would interweave with our current freeway causing all types of bottlenecks and public safety concerns with cross flowing traffic as well as creating a 2nd malfunction junction while taking up to 15-years to construct. This new monster highway would be up to 18 lanes wide, larger than the length of a football field running right through the heart of Hillsborough county. Think LA & Atlanta type congestion traffic that TBX will induce.

Watch video  for more information about TBX


     

WHY #STOPTBX ?

  • We don't need another highway let alone a $9 Billion tolled version (TBX).
  • Building a tolled highway (TBX) designed to keep cars off it (variable congestion pricing) doesn't solve our traffic congestion or fix malfunction junction-  it actually makes it worse!
  • 7 to 15 years of more construction will ruin traffic in Hillsborough County.
  • Double taxation - we already pay a gas tax to maintain our highways. Paying tolls is another way for government to tax us.
  • Giving FDOT the license to charge up to $2.00 a mile is their real motivation -  not solving a congestion problem or "economic development".
  • FDOT's own TBX Draft Master Plan states a 7 to 11% usage of TBX tollway while taking up to 50% of our highway capacity.
  • Huge negative economic impacts for the county including: closed exits, delayed travel for 7 to 15 years, encouraging development in surrounding counties while leaving Hillsborough to pay for their convenience.
  • Magnifying the malfunction junction bottleneck; instead of taking pressure of the bottleneck, FDOT wants to jam more lanes through it.
  • Paying TOLLS on our PUBLIC Highway without a vote? Just sounds wrong.
  • The need for TBX is based on data from the 1980's. Overwhelming data now shows TBX is not needed.


What We Need & What You Get

We need help getting the message out about the TBX project and to organize more town hall meetings all over the county for citizens to get the truth of the impacts that TBX will have on the region. FDOT has been billing this as a widening which implies more freeway lanes but this is misleading. Also, FDOT has claimed TBX as vital for congestion and economic growth which is just not supported by the facts! To date FDOT has been misleading the American public and only 3 public outreach meetings have been organized, all of which provided very little information of the true impacts of this project.

  • Your funds will help us buy marketing materials, support our educational outreach efforts and help us fight administratively and legally against FDOT and their continous practice of providing misleading information to us, our local businesses and political leadership.
  • We have set up some exciting perks to help everyone participate in the #stoptbx movement.


The Impact

If we suceed in STOPPING TBX, we will have:

  • Saved the Tampa Bay region from one of the worst investments ever for public infrastructure projects.
  •  Preserved our city's aesthetics and emergence as a renewed, dynamic Metro.
  •  Protected our historical neighborhoods from being ravaged by the 18-lane monster, preventing the worst engineering design since FDOT built "malfunction junction."
  • Saved everybody in the region from 7 to 15 years of more construction that doesn't even solve our transportation woes.
  •  Prevented 35 to 50 years of risky debt that would have been used to fund TBX; debt that is secured by all state taxpayers.

#stoptbx


Risks & Challenges

FDOT holds an iron fist over our local transportation leaders and basically holds them hostage to their plans. We need to support and encourage our county commissioners and city council members to stand up and not be afraid of FDOT-  give them the strong backbone of public support so they can do what's right for the region!

#stoptbx

Who We Are

My name is Mit Patel, a concerned citizen, and I am collaborating with a non-profit organization, Sunshine Citizens, to help educate and promote the #stoptbx movement. In a very short period this group managed to organize the best town hall educational forum I have ever attended with over 250 people attending, representing local news channels, newspapers, elected officials and residents from all over the county. Sunshine Citizens then managed, with the support of other local organizations, to drive over 400 people to the August 4th public hearing on TBX held by the Hillsborough Metropolitan Planning Organization (MPO). This group is passionate, professionals from all areas of expertise, and I truly believe with our support they can help #stoptbx!
Sunshine Citizens is a non-partisan and grassroots organization that promotes walkable, inclusive communities and smart growth. We are actively building a coalition of like-minded groups, citizens and local leaders in Tampa Bay who share our vision for better fiscal choices and positive economic development for our area. We are committed to holding the government accountable to open and transparent planning processes and real costs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Contact our local elected officials

http://stoptbx.sunshinecitizens.org/join-the-fight/contact-officials/

Volunteer to be a part of the #STOPTBX movement

http://stoptbx.sunshinecitizens.org/join-the-fight/volunteer/

Learn more @

whatistbx.com & stoptbx.com 

TBX in the News

http://stoptbx.sunshinecitizens.org/press/

TBX Town Hall Presentation

http://stoptbx.sunshinecitizens.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/Town-Hall-Presentation-Final.pdf
story_txt:
Short SummaryWHAT IS TBX (TAMPA BAY EXPRESS)? Tampa Bay Express (TBX) is a FDOT proposed $9 Billion toll-way concept that would mix toll lanes with freeway lanes (I-275, I-4 & I-75) essentially creating two separate highways a first class (TBX tolled version) and second class (Current freeways) . TBX or toll way lanes would cost up to $2.00 a mile to ride and would interweave with our current freeway causing all types of bottlenecks and public safety concerns with cross flowing traffic as well as creating a 2nd malfunction junction while taking up to 15-years to construct. This new monster highway would be up to 18 lanes wide, larger than the length of a football field running right through the heart of Hillsborough county. Think LA & Atlanta type congestion traffic that TBX will induce.Watch video  for more information about TBX  WHY #STOPTBX ?
We don't need another highway let alone a $9 Billion tolled version (TBX).
Building a tolled highway (TBX) designed to keep cars off it (variable congestion pricing) doesn't solve our traffic congestion or fix malfunction junction-  it actually makes it worse!
7 to 15 years of more construction will ruin traffic in Hillsborough County.
Double taxation - we already pay a gas tax to maintain our highways. Paying tolls is another way for government to tax us.
Giving FDOT the license to charge up to $2.00 a mile is their real motivation -  not solving a congestion problem or "economic development".
FDOT's own TBX Draft Master Plan states a 7 to 11% usage of TBX tollway while taking up to 50% of our highway capacity.
Huge negative economic impacts for the county including: closed exits, delayed travel for 7 to 15 years, encouraging development in surrounding counties while leaving Hillsborough to pay for their convenience.
Magnifying the malfunction junction bottleneck; instead of taking pressure of the bottleneck, FDOT wants to jam more lanes through it.
Paying TOLLS on our PUBLIC Highway without a vote? Just sounds wrong.
The need for TBX is based on data from the 1980's. Overwhelming data now shows TBX is not needed.
   What We Need & What You Get We need help getting the message out about the TBX project and to organize more town hall meetings all over the county for citizens to get the truth of the impacts that TBX will have on the region. FDOT has been billing this as a widening which implies more freeway lanes but this is misleading. Also, FDOT has claimed TBX as vital for congestion and economic growth which is just not supported by the facts! To date FDOT has been misleading the American public and only 3 public outreach meetings have been organized, all of which provided very little information of the true impacts of this project.  Your funds will help us buy marketing materials, support our educational outreach efforts and help us fight administratively and legally against FDOT and their continous practice of providing misleading information to us, our local businesses and political leadership.  We have set up some exciting perks to help everyone participate in the #stoptbx movement.     The Impact If we suceed in STOPPING TBX, we will have:



Saved the Tampa Bay region from one of the worst investments ever for public infrastructure projects.

 Preserved our city's aesthetics and emergence as a renewed, dynamic Metro.
 Protected our historical neighborhoods from being ravaged by the 18-lane monster, preventing the worst engineering design since FDOT built "malfunction junction."
Saved everybody in the region from 7 to 15 years of more construction that doesn't even solve our transportation woes.

 Prevented 35 to 50 years of risky debt that would have been used to fund TBX; debt that is secured by all state taxpayers.

story:
Hello

I'm starting a PhD in Linguistics and I need your help! In order to study for this full-time, I need to raise £5000 for my first year. If you donate, just £5, that will greatly help me pay my fees in October and throughout the year.

About Me

Everyone who knows me knows I'm a little in love with linguistics.

For those of you who don't know what linguistics actually is, I tend to describe it as the science of language. It's an awesome interdisciplinary field comprising of aspects from biology, sociology, history, psychology, literature, neuroscience, computer science, anthropology, mathematics, archaeology, and physics among others.   

Linguists study how language came into existence, where language is going, and how individual speakers are changing their own languages constantly.

I'm extremely happy to have been accepted back into the University of Stirling to work on a PhD in Linguistics.
In order to carry out this research full-time, I need £5000 for my tuition, fees, and associated travel expenses by October 2015. 

Why Metaphor?

When we talk to others about our internal thoughts, we have to find common ground - a shared framework in which to discuss those thoughts. 
I will be studying the metaphor and the linguistic systems that humans use to process information from the world around us and how we turn these thoughts into language that can be expressed to, and understood by, others.

The Impact of this Project

  • I believe that my research can contribute to the growing field of Linguistics from the approach of metaphor construction, social collaboration, and the importance of finding common-ground. 
  • Evolutionary Linguistics not only tells us about the how language came into existence, but how it is still evolving. Language is extraordinarily organized. Humans have the ability to change language to make it work for us. 
  • This project will provide us with deeper insights into how we, as humans, structure metaphor and how it has become a crucial device in the development of language as a whole.
  • This project will allow me to gain a doctorate which, in turn, will give me the knowledge and qualifications to work as a postdoctoral researcher. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • £4052 for tuition (1 year full-time or 2 years part-time)
  • £220 for university fees 
  • £300 approx. for travel expenses 
  • £400 approx. for books, recording equipment, and additional resources
Total Amount Required: £5000 for 1 full-time year/2 part-time years of Doctoral Research
  • If I don't reach my £5000 goal, your contribution will still be put towards my tuition and fees. However, I may study on a part-time basis in order to work to afford all expenses throughout the course. Nevertheless, your donation will be used directly for this project and will still make a HUGE difference.

Perks
  • If you can contribute £5, I'll handwrite a personalized postcard sent to you by snail mail. 


  • If you can contribute £25 or more, you will be acknowledged in print within my thesis + a handwritten postcard, i.e. you'll be immortalized in my thesis forever! 
  • At £75 and up, you will receive a beautiful 11"x17" print of the Indo-European & Uralic linguistic family tree (one of my favourites!) + an acknowledgment in my thesis + a handwritten postcard.


  • By donating more to this project you will receive a copy of my completed thesis in e-book format (£100) or as a bound book (£500) + an acknowledgment in my thesis + a handwritten postcard.
  • Full details of these perks are available at the side of this page.

More Ways To Help
  • Don't worry if you can't help out financially. By sharing my project with friends and family, you can help too. You can also use the share buttons below to spread the word! Thanks!

story: I am the mother of an African American profoundly gifted child.  She goes to a special school for gifted children.  Just to give you an idea of her abilities, last school year she was in the 6th grade and was doing 9th grade work in most of her subjects.  New York State does not consider gifted a “special needs”.  That being said, I am not able to receive any assistance paying her tuition.  Every year more and more of her friends do not return, a lot of them do not return because of the high cost of tuition at her school.  I feel this is a shame; these are the kids of tomorrow.  My husband and I have two other children and with the rising cost of everything these days, we too are having trouble affording the tuition.  This makes me feel completely helpless.  My child isn’t asking for video games, or things that are pretty meaningless in the general scheme of things; she is asking for an education that will challenge her on her level, and will let her go on to become a doctor.  My daughter currently tutors children in math and reading.  She earns approximately $400.00 a month.  Even with this help we still cannot pay her tuition of $1,815.00 per month.  Her tuition is more than some mortgage payments. I need financial help.  I want to be able to continue her education at this school for the next 3 years.

story:
Hello family, friends and environmental conservationists! I know some of you may know what I’ve been doing here in Guatemala, but I’d like to give you a short update and request your help! My official position here is entitled Environmental Education Intern for the Wildlife Rescue and Conservation Association ARCAS located on the pacific southwest coast of Guatemala. As the environmental education intern, I work with six local schools weekly with the hopes of developing a more sustainable and environmentally caring community for and with the people of Guatemala. 

At ARCAS, I also assist with the sea turtle conservation project run by Lucia, Lucha and Ale. Here is a short synopsis of that program:

Within Guatemala there is a law that states every individual who harvests sea turtle eggs needs to give 20% donation of each nest to a Sea Turtle Hatchery —> At ARCAS, we have a Tortugario (Sea Turtle Hatchery). Each night we patrol in search of sea turtles nesting on the beaches of Monterrico, but we are not the only people in search of nests. Parlamero’s, or local members of the community are also in search of eggs for a source of either income or food. When we encounter a Parlamero, we ask if they are willing to exchange the eggs they collected for two times the price in “Viveres” with a comprobante. A comprobante is basically a form that certifies the exchange, allowing members of ARCAS to protect more turtles and Parlamero’s to visit ARCAS the following day to receive the viveres or alternative sources of food for their families. 

                                                    (Above: One of our tortugitas!)

Where you come in: RALLY PARLAMA 

As the education intern I have the task of organizing educational activities and a trip called RALLY PARLAMA which promotes awareness and the importance of trash management and wildlife conservation within six different schools in Guatemala.

For many children, Rally Parlama is a trip of a lifetime here in Monterrico, Guatemala. Not many community members have the opportunity to travel outside of the area because of financial limitations or other barriers. 

The students ranging in age from 9 to 14 participate in six different activities correlated to wildlife conservation and environmental awareness to qualify for one of the spots on the trip! The first 20 students (depending on how much money we raise) who complete all 6 activities, win the trip for three days and two nights to Antigua. This trip is scheduled to occur on the first weekend of December 4th-6th. Antigua is a beautiful city located approximately 2 hours Northeast of Monterrico where the students live and attend school. 

In order to win a spot on the trip, the students must successfully and individually finish the following activities by November 30th—->

         (Above: Estefania with her Rally Parlama activity card!)

ACTIVITY 1: Find a nest

Find a nest! The first activity has the students out on the beaches of Monterrico searching for a sea turtle nest of 8 dozen eggs. There are three different species of turtles which nest on the beaches of Guatemala’s Pacific Coast; Olive Ridley’s, Green, and the prehistoric Leatherback. The most commonly spotted is the Olive Ridley, or more commonly called here in Guatemala, Parlama.

ACTIVITY 2: Beach clean up

The students participate in a beach cleanup with me and other Staff or Volunteers from ARCAS for approximately an hour. Each School is located no more than a five minutes walk away from the beach.

                                           (Above: Beach clean up at Hawaii!)

                                          (Above: Beach clean up at Mananitas!)

                                         (Above: Beach clean up at Curbina!)

ACTIVITY 3: Ecoblocks 

Each student needs to complete 10 ecoblocks! An ecoblock is a used plastic bottle filled to the brim with what we consider garbage (i.e., soft plastic, a chip bag, a grocery bag, a candy wrapper etc.) In order to pack the trash into the plastic bottles, the students resourcefully use sticks laying around the park. Each student brings trash from the beach, road or their homes to the park in order to complete all of the ecoblocks. If they need more trash to fill their ecoblocks, we search for the trash around the park in order to fill them. Ultimately, with these bottles at ARCAS our goal is to build a library for students and other local members of the community! Yep, each individual ecoblock becomes a brick for a wall!

                            (Above: Antoni, Ricardo and Debora making ecoblocks!)

ACTIVITY 4: Patrol with members of ARCAS! 

Patrolling with ARCAS members in search of a sea turtle! The students are assigned two nights to patrol with ARCAS volunteers for 2 hours each night. If they encounter a turtle, they will assist the volunteers and staff members of ARCAS, carefully put the eggs in a bag and return them to our Tortugario (Sea Turtle Hatchery)!

ACTIVITY 5: Reforestation

Reforestation of native trees is extremely important here at ARCAS. We have a reforestation program here called the Finca where we have planted more than 7,000 trees. In order for the students to receive a stamp for this activity, each student needs to plant 100 native species of mangrove (blanco, negro o rojo) trees with a member of ARCAS.

       (Above: Students from Hawaii planting mangroves!)

           (Above: Students from Dormito planting mangroves!)
 

ACTIVITY 6: Toys for our parrots!

Here at ARCAS we have a captive breeding program for the highly endangered yellow naped parrots. In order to create the toys, the students and I hit the beach and surrounding area to find 100 discarded bottle caps per person. Once they’ve found 100 caps we then search for a stick and string to create a toy for the parrots!

                         (Above: Some of our endangered yellow naped parrots)

                              (Above: Curbina students making toys for our parrots) 

Risks and challenges

So here’s the thing... We have these students working extremely hard each week to complete all of the activities, resulting in a cleaner earth BUT we have 20 spots and ARCAS is a nonprofit organization. The funding for this trip and the financial needs of ARCAS come from local tourists and donations from people around the world who care about the education of these pretty amazing children in Guatemala and the health of our planet. Donations like yours can help the children here become better stewards of the local environment and the population of amazing sea turtles and wildlife here in Guatemala. 

With YOUR help, we can make it possible for the students to have an unforgettable educational trip to Antigua this year. Every dollar helps. 

MY GOAL in regards to activities with the kids is as follows: to hike with the kids up Volcano Payaca where they will learn about this amazing land form and maybe roast a marshmallow, explore an organic coffee farm, make some chocolates at a chocolate museum and most importantly, tour a recycle factory to learn about and stress the importance of recycling!

We need to pay for transportation, accommodations in regards to meals and lodging for the students during the three day trip. Again, your help would be greatly appreciated by both myself, the staff at ARCAS and most importantly the children fortunate enough to take the trip.

MY GOAL in regards to activities with the kids is as follows: to hike with the kids up Volcano Payaca where they will learn about this amazing land form and maybe roast a marshmallow, explore an organic coffee farm, make some chocolates at a chocolate museum and most importantly, tour a recycle factory to learn about and stress the importance of recycling!
We need to pay for transportation, accommodations in regards to meals and lodging for the students during the three day trip. Again, your help would be greatly appreciated by both myself, the staff at ARCAS and most importantly the children fortunate enough to take the trip.

story:
Hello Dear Friends


My name is Gerasimos Kazianis, I am 29 years old and I was born and live in Greece. I work in the  tourism industry and I am currently study in a public Institute of vocational education and training in the field of Tourism Finance Administration. I am also study in Hellenic Open University a pre-graduate in the field of European Civilization. I am trying to raise money to restore my grandfather's windmill and eventually turn it into a museum.

Story
In old times, Windmills played a vital role in people's lives. Today, few of them remain, but those that do play an important role in our lives as cultural heritage monuments. One of these such windmills is very close to my heart, and still stands in Cephalonia, in the Ionian islands. It was built in 1926 by my grandfather and ten volunteers. It is located in Markoulata on the island of Cephalonia in Greece. It used to grind barley and wheat until 1960 when it stopped working. In the last 89 years it has survived a series of disasters, among them three devastating earthquakes (7,3 on the Richter Scale in 1952, 6,1 in 2014, 6,1 in 2015 and a fire). By the time the 1953 earthquake struck all the windmills on the island were in ruins except my Grandfather's one, and currently there is no other working windmill in the whole of Cephalonia. Some stories said that by chance my  grandfather had placed some iron supports around the windmill, which helped it not to be torn down. To this day it is still standing, but has been severely damaged by the ravages of time. It is in a dilapidated state, leaking rain water and with no sails left. Having been neglected over time, the roof leaks and the wooden mechanism in a state of desrepair.
                         1956 condition                                                  Current contition



Time has come for it to be restored to its original specifications, making it fully operational, and turning it into a beautiful museum open to visitors from all over the world. The visitors will be able to admire a traditional windmill in operation, and have the opportunity to see how we used to grind the grain in the past, and learn about the history of windmills. More than 100.000 people visit Cephalonia every year. It will also be protected as a historic site and formally recognized by the Ministry of Culture as a museum and monument of technical heritage. I have been working on this project for many years and have done extensive research into renovating it and converting it into a museum and I have gathered together a team of professionals who will work together with me to make this a beautiful windmill into a museum. This project will cost about €200,000, which includes the rebuilding of the windmill, turning it into a museum and to build all the necessary facilities that a museum would need. I aim to initially raise €100,000, enough for the repairs of the building, building a new cap (roof), laying down a new wooden floor, and replacing the old wooden mechanisms with new ones. Changes will also be made to beautify the surrounding area, growing grass, planting flowers, create paths and also facilities that a museums needs like disability access, info kiosk, wc etc. As for the remaining 100,000, I will try to find other funding or come back with a second project later. Every penny we raise will go toward restoring the building and turning this area into something worthy of awesomeness.

I am also sending an open invitation to any cultural institutions, cultural organizations, any corporate sponsors and influential people who may want to help us out.

With your help we can save a cultural heritage monument and turn it into a museum. So lets act now and make some history.

Reasons to back this venture:

  • To restore the windmill and turn it into a museum
  • To promote cultural values
  • To promote Technical Heritage
  • To promote Cephalonia and Greece abroad
  • Because people from all over the world will be able to visit it
  • To share values with young people
  • For production of eco - grinding and flour production for educational purposes
  • Help the project be a success, we are depending on you
  • Because some people say I can't do it, and I can!
What museums offer:
  • Museums are instrumental in the  preservation and promotion of world cultural heritage, and are places where the visitors have the opportunity to study the past and present, be entertained and to enrich their knowledge and thought.
  • Museums make you think
  • Museums provide an effective way of learning
  • Museums inspire
  • Museums are a great way to spend time with friends and family
How funds will be allocated:
  • For the installation of a new cap (roof)
  • The installation of new wooden mechanisms
  • New sails
  • New wooden floors
  • Painting
  • Craftsmen fees
  • Developing and enhancing the surrounding area
  • Planting flowers
  • Installing benches
  • Creating disability access
  • Info kiosk

ALL SUPPORTERS WILL GET A FREE TOUR  REGARDLESS OF THE AMOUNT OF THE DONATION!!!


Some informations about Cephalonia
  • Cephalonia is the largest of the Ionian Islands in Western Greece. The capital of Cephalonia is Argostoli. Cephalonia became also widely known when Captain Corelli's Mandolin was shot on location. Cephalonia has also been suggested as the Homeric Ithaca, the home of Odysseus, rather than the smaller island bearing this name today.

Other ways you can help
If you just can't afford to contribute, but really want to help you can!

  • Please share this campaign with as many people as you can all over social media, and any media connections you may have. Use the hashtag: #goodwillforthewindmill
  • Make sure to use the Indiegogo share tools and spread this project EVERYWHERE on social media for all 39 days of the campaign!

I will act now for now is all I have. This is the time. This is the place. We are the persons. Lets all Act Now. Lets build a museum. Lets make history !!!

Sincere regards,

Gerasimos Kazianis

story:
UPDATE...24\2\2016.......Thanks your patience, lovely people. More detailed update will follow soon.

REALLY SAD STOP PRESS NEWS.....APRIL 3rd 2015

Pengraig farm is no longer available to buy therefore the crowdfunding is more urgent than ever ! Please please support us to help cover the gap in our funds to purchase the longterm home for our youth organisations.

THE BACKGROUND STORY

The Majical Youth Theatre Project have been based at Pengraig farm for ten years. We are now in a situation where we have TO MOVE OUT. We are a youth and community organisation run by volunteers and have survived on good will and generosity for over 30 years. We also host two other youth and children's groups as well and have been  planning a third group. Unfortunately this 3rd group has had to be put on hold due to the situation at the moment. 

During our time at Pengraig we have worked one to one with over 800 young people to improve their life skills, raise confidence and increase self esteem and we have helped many hundreds running into thousands more through our efforts at festivals. These teenagers have been from areas of urban and rural deprivation all over the UK. Please have a look at the 3 websites to see a more in-depth report of the things we have done.

WHAT WE HAVE DONE SO FAR TO ACHIEVE OUR END GOAL

Sooooo, we have been fund raising for the last year and have raised just over £150,000 cash. We also have people interested in investing smaller amounts (in return for shares in the land) and some loans on the table from supportive parties. They all want to see us continue the work we have been doing with disadvantaged and disaffected teens, single parents and families living below the poverty line. But it is now not enough to purchase a new base, hence this campaign!

We understand that people are helping us to fund the dream that many others hold too. The dream of making a secure future for Majical Youth  and all the children and young adults that benefit from our activities. Plus the other numerous options and opportunities this will allow when we have the security to be able to plan and share this wonderful space . We would like to thank everyone who has committed their time, energy ,and help towards this venture And obviously the people who have already committed their monies! We understand that investing in a dream can be pretty daunting...

 We still NEED to look for, a home to carry on the works of Majical Youth and  the other projects outlined here, 

WHEN WE BEGAN THIS CAMPAIGN WE WERE FUNDRAISING TO BUY OUR BASE OF THE LAST TENS YEARS, THIS IS NO LONGER AN OPTION SO WE NOW NEED TO LOOK FOR A NEW BASE.




WHY WE NEED A FARM....

We are totally committed to buying our own base. We have spent 10 years developing our resources on Pengraig Farm to allow us to grow, evolve and expand on what we were creating with and for young people and families living below the poverty line.


PROJECTS DEVELOPED AT OUR FORMER BASE, PENGRAIG FARM.

A bush craft camp (potential forest school centre) and disabled accessible woodland walk with sensory gardens, musical playground and child orientated sculptures. These were all built and designed by local teenagers in conjunction with Majical Youth and our sister organisation 'Plant Natur' which is Welsh for 'nature's child'. This is the Wales based version of Majical Youth with a ten year lease on the woodland walk at Pengraig Farm.

An eco friendly gathering/camp site which includes composting toilets, borehole water supply, solar shower block and even a pirate ship adventure play area with a mahooosive sand pit!

With the community based on the farm we fund-raised for, designed and planted a forest garden and woodland for firewood coppicing. This is now 6 years old                 

We have forged links within the local community and know that our work there is helping keep this rural community alive and attractive for the up coming generations. 

Our activities were bringing employment and prosperity to the local area which has been listed as an area of rural deprivation.

We have organically managed the land at Pengraig for ten years and have re planted the grazing fields  (when necessary) with a pioneering conservation mix of  grasses, that is showing good results AND the local farmers are now happy with it :) We have also developed the hedges as wildlife corridors to increase Bio-diversity and brought in bees and... to be honest we had only just begun...our intention is to promote a system at our new base detailed in the videos below.

(farm for the future  https://youtu.be/qVBYgg013KM )

(permaculture in practise  https://youtu.be/qVBYgg013KM)

We also intend to be offering Permaculture design courses and increasing on site food production for residents and visitors,                                                                                                


We have now formed a pioneering multi stakeholder co-operative to take the project forward.

( P.E.A.C ) is to manage the farm and provide a community base to home educating families. They will be able to engage in Majical Youth,activities as well as run separate "micro" businesses. increase local job availability


FUTURE PLANS....

We have more kids camps lined up waiting to use a gathering site,  but as it is becoming prohibitively expensive to hire it, everything is on hold until we raise the money to buy a new site. The gathering site has also played host to numerous other child and youth camps, retreats and community events working with MajicalYouth we will now need to rebuild that gathering site when we move, so we can carry on making it available to other community groups in need, for a peppercorn rent.


We will be setting up a healing retreat centre for disaffected vulnerable young adults  with trained counsellors on board and healthy stimulating projects to engage with.


We will be running respite care in the style of a "care farm" for learning disabled adults based around a permaculture bio dynamic gardening project. including simple carpentry projects and other stimulating useful creative activities.


We aim to buy enough land to host  a 'low impact eco hamlet'.  we intend to facilitate a One Planet Development eco hamlet, similar to the Lammas project in West Wales. We already have local, council and Welsh assembly support. We have been preparing this bid for over a year already, a community land trust will eventually own its site providing eco housing to local families, individual freehold plots will also be available in the future we hope!


We have more "MICRO" businesses linked to majical youth and the community waiting to come use our facilities, including toy designers and craft workers and a team of forest school leaders waiting to start using a bush craft site for their activities.


WE NEED A FARM AS A BASE OR NONE OF THIS CAN CONTINUE AND          

                                                           DEVELOP........                             

                                   

                            

WHAT HAPPENS NOW WE CANT BUY OUR FARM?....WE HAVE TILL 31st OCTOBER to find a base

 We are now so committed to our over all project that we have elected to CARRY ON REGARDLESS! Although it is a huge blow that we cannot now buy the base we have spent 10 years developing, we will seek to buy somewhere else to continue our work there, but it will mean starting from scratch...absolute proof we need to buy our own land could not be more self evident to us if it tried...it took ten years to get it running properly at Pengraig! It's make or break time for these 4 compatible youth and community organisations in Wales... your donations will be used to help the four projects find a new home. 

If you wish to leave your money in the fund under these circumstances, we thank you :) ,if you would like it returned (minus paypal handling fee) that is not a problem and we still thank you for helping us to try and realise a long held dream :)


WHAT WE HAVE DONE IN THE PAST.....

We have completed a number of projects during our time at the farm, these include:- 

The Eco Extreme Kids Camp-to help break down social barriers between teenage gangs.

Millennium Volunteers project.

The design, fundraising for and build of Merlin's Way-disabled accessible woodland walk and sensory garden, a project designed by local teenagers, for the benefit of the whole community.

The teenagers yurt building and film camp.

On Yer Bike- recycling push bikes project.

Walkabout teenage theatre team workshop and rehearsal studio for Glastonbury Festival.

Working with teenagers on work experience, to provide a children's play area at festivals and community events.

Project managers training course for local teenagers.

Travellers Aid Trust outdoor events training programme for young travellers.

The manifestation of the Wales Environmental Home Education Camp.

The creation of Circus Camp Cymru.

The manifestation of Women's Retreats Wales.

The designing, fundraising for, and building of a forest garden permaculture site.

Providing activities in the woods to Princes Youth Trust and local youth offending teams.

Work experience for under 25's, and references where appropriate.

'Big Time' inner city youth projects with the St Paul's Full Circle Project. 

The Party With a Purpose Project, which redesigned a local skate park, hosted a "half pipe" in the barns and designed a woodland walk with local teenagers, and also supported and empowered numerous other,local youth led initiatives.



These activities have, by all accounts, empowered teenagers and families to go onto brighter futures, where they have re-engaged with their communities, RE entered education and been helped towards employment. We often get visits from the "old" youth to see how THEIR project is still doing. 
WE HAVE JUST HAD CONFIRMATION THAT A LOCAL SIGNWRITER WILL PAINT THE LITTLE BUS AND WE WILL BE OFFERING TO HAVE YOUR COMPANY NAME AND LOGO ON ITS SIDE GET IN TOUCH IF YOU ARE INTERESTED.....XXX


TESTIMONIALS...

"I have never had time on my hands with the children until I came to a work weekend on the farm and the kids were so busy I learnt woodcarving and carved a stool."

"I was in a rut, depressed and had such low self esteem till I met Majical Youth who inspired me to volunteer for local community groups, I now run a charity shop and have my own business to boot!"

"I was taking drugs and homeless when I first met Majical Youth. Since then I've been back to college with their support and I'm hoping to run a tree surgery business."

I went back to collage thanks to Majical Youth, and now I come back to help out as a volunteer and share my skills with the "next lot"

"I got a qualification via Majical Youth and work experience that has helped me get a full time job with a marquee company."

"Majical Youth people are so much fun and very caring, I would definitely recommend them to any one running an event as the best kids area ever!" their sign saying "warning this field may contain nuts" was so very true, they had us all in stitches!" 

LINKS AND OTHER INFORMATION.

P.E.A.C. Co - OP Facebook Group.

P.E.A.C CO - OP Volunteers Facebook Group.

http://majicalyouth.com

"I was in a rut, depressed and had such low self esteem till I met Majical Youth who inspired me to volunteer for local community groups, I now run a charity shop and have my own business to boot!"
"I was taking drugs and homeless when I first met Majical Youth. Since then I've been back to college with their support and I'm hoping to run a tree surgery business."
I went back to collage thanks to Majical Youth, and now I come back to help out as a volunteer and share my skills with the "next lot"
"I got a qualification via Majical Youth and work experience that has helped me get a full time job with a marquee company."
"Majical Youth people are so much fun and very caring, I would definitely recommend them to any one running an event as the best kids area ever!" their sign saying "warning this field may contain nuts" was so very true, they had us all in stitches!" 
LINKS AND OTHER INFORMATION.
P.E.A.C. Co - OP Facebook Group.
P.E.A.C CO - OP Volunteers Facebook Group.
http://majicalyouth.com

story:
So where will we spend all your money?

OUR GOAL. $500,000.

This will get the Truck on the road. It will build a website and load it up with all kinds of talk. 

If we raise half this amount, we will fill the Truck with half the languages (24 instead of the 48 shown on the Truck's side panel), 

If we raise a quarter of this amount, we will load it up with 12 languages, and pro rata thereafter.

If we do manage 12 languages, this will put us in a great position. It will enable us to fund the Language Truck into the future by selling its products - languages. 

We will never sell languages individually! We want people to enjoy access to all of them at once. 

We will then increase the cargo as we move forward.

People are on the move! They're coming and going all over the place. It seems there's never been a better time to be a polyglot. That's English for multilingual. Like to be one? 

 

School teachers certainly would - especially when faced with 20 kids from around the globe all speaking different languages. 

How much easier it would be if pupils could look up at lots of languages on a big screen and see a translation of what the teacher's saying to them.

English pupils in the same class could study the foreign pupils' languages on the screen and pick up a language or two themselves. Using this system, foreign kids could learn our language and English kids could learn theirs.

How much would it cost the school? $60 a year, plus the cost of a flatscreen. $60 a year to purchase one password to the Truck and kids would get language skills that would enhance their future. Just leave the thing constantly on in class. Even in history, science, English lit, maths. What? Kids can't soak it up? 

'Listen up, kids, we all know how important good grades are. They give us a better start in our working lives, right? Well, here's a little something that might help you with that. Here's ten words in Chinese today. We're going to put them up on screen alongside the same ten words in English so you'll know what they mean. We'll also put up 10 images of what they are. Learn them, don't learn them, it's up to you. Same applies to the ten we'll put up in a couple of days'time, and so on. Languages talk!' 

Why hasn't somebody already loaded multiple languages onto one platform like the Language Truck?

Why are languages made available one at a time, with price hikes as you move up through the various levels?

Why aren't they available all at once?

Well they are now! 

Or they will be if you give us a hand to make it happen.

Did you know that 

Foreign language skills heighten your brain’s ability to recognize and solve tasks, regardless of age?

That people who speak more than one language on average stave off dementia and Alzheimer’s 4 years longer than those who don't?

That bi, or multilingual, people, especially children, are generally more skilled at multitasking, maths, reading, writing?

That people make fewer driving errors?

That they can better exploit business opportunities?

If your brain can juggle languages it can juggle other tasks. 

And how do you learn a language anyway?

Regardless of which route you take, it always comes down to studying the written word, hearing the spoken word, memorizing and practicing. 

Practicing with whom?

CHAT ROOM

When the Language Truck is loaded up, we will set up chat rooms in all our languages.
They say nothing beats travelling to a country to learn its language.

So travel on SKYPE

And practice with friends you've yet to meet. They want to hear how you speak just as much as you want to hear them. At no extra cost!
Where are they? Here, among other places:



From people who've moved from the places above.

  

They will form our Team

How many people are we talking about in our Team?

Hundreds!

Who are they?

Across the UK and Ireland immigrant communities who speak every language on the Truck and more.

We are enlisting native speakers fluent in their own language and in English to provide written translations on every topic. 

They will also provide voice recordings.

You will be learning from native speakers.

Thousands of written words and sentences per language.

Thousands of voice recordings per language.

Thousands of images per language (such as images shown in School 1 on the demo video).

Their communities will get free access to the Truck. 

Whether a plasterer or a plumber, a carpenter or a computer programmer, the Language Truck will enable you to be fluent at work, at rest and at play in whichever language(s) you choose to learn. 

Language teachers will consult and sign off on every syllable and pronunciation.


Perks!.

$60 for one year's access to The Language Truck (available to our funders only: $40 discount on the launch price of $100, Launch date Christmas 2015).

This gets you unlimited access to the Truck for 1 year. Unlimited means unlimited.  

A password will be delivered to you electronically. 

$110 gets you 2 years' access (available to our funders only: $80 discount on launch price of $190).

$150 gets you 3 years' access (available to our funders only: $125 discount on launch price of $275).

The Truck will be loaded in 3 parts.

Part 1 will comprise 16 languages, including the main European languages, delivered to you Christmas 2015.

Part 2: a further 16 languages, including Mandarin, delivered June 2016.

Part 3:  a further 16 languages, delivered Dec 2016.

Check out our Triple Lock - $35 per person a year for 7 years! 

Or our Classroom Deal  - only $20 per person a year for 7 years! 

And a lot more other great perks besides! 


Here's another good reason to spread the words: If we know what the other person’s saying, maybe we can correct any misunderstanding he or she might have about us, and vice versa. 


FUNFACT! 

Languages are really hard to learn.

Two-year-olds can manage them easily enough but anyone younger than that can only understand coochycoochycooooo! when said by mothers in hundreds of countries.


This is how focused we are. 

Eventually, when the Truck has been round the clock a few times, and when we have the money to fund it, we would like to add other languages. 


Like these:

African Language Family Groups

African Languages fall into four basic families following ancient migratory patterns of influence. In the north, following the Saharan routes of trade and travel are the Afro-Asiatic Linguistic groups. Mid-Saharan and extending southward into North Central Africa are the Nilo-Saharan languages. From Western Africa (south of the Sahara) to Southeast Africa is the Niger-Kordofanian family of languages. And finally, in Southwest Africa are the Khoisan languages.

Afro-Asiatic

  • Arabic
  • Kushite
  • Amaharic
  • Afro-Asian
  • Berber

Nilo-Saharan

  • Chadian
  • Eastern Sudanic
  • Eastern Adamawa
  • Songhay

Niger-Kordofanian

  • Mande
  • Voltic
  • Kwa
  • Bantu-Congo

Khoisan

  • San
  • Khoi

When a kid in Africa was recently asked what his idea of heaven was, he replied:

 'A big American supermarket.' 

His greatest wish was to take his mom in and fill her cart to scrumptious overflowingness!

Besides giving free access to the Language Truck to charities, we will also load its languages onto discs, for them to use in places where broadband is but a distant dream. Folk will be able to access the truck. And they won't need a teacher.

That's why we put images in School 1. We put them in for those who don't know any of the Truck's languages. If they read the word 'pencil' in 48 languages, or hear it spoken in 4 dozen tongues, it won't mean a thing. Until they look at the image. Then they'll go: 'Ah.....So that's what that's called in English.....' We aim to load the Truck with every image we can click a mouse on.


Be part of it…

Help us make it happen!
Help bring down Babble!

Help us help people communicate…

How else can you help?

Ask your Friends to tell their Friends!

Make noise.
Know anybody who can make noise? Turn up their volume.
And how about using those Indiegogo share tools!
Check 'em out, folks!

story:
Vietnam 2015 

"........and help one another in righteousness and piety" (Ch.5:V.50, the holy Quran)

Coming from a privileged society we often overlook our responsibility as human beings to care for those that are less fortunate than us and those who our actions as a human race in the past have bound to constant spiral of poverty. 

The truth is the people effected years on from ideological clashes have no political agenda. The children of Vietnam like any one else just want to live, play and laugh just like us. 

In my gap this year I wanted to do something out of the ordinary. I didn't want to spend my summer lazing around in a resort, rather I hope, with your help to go out and do something with a positive impact. I found a way to do this through an organisation called World Challenge which helps people like me with little knowledge of the region be directed to rural areas where they are very much needed.    

  

What I Need You For 

In Vietnam I will be helping improve local infrastructure in the rural areas Ill be visiting and also help supply local children with much needed supplies for school and fun such as books and footballs.  

I will be paying for all of my own personal expenses including accommodation and and flights. 

Your money will go directly to supporting the projects and buying the supplies for the children, this includes: 

  • Buying school supplies that will be distributed to Children on site
  • Funding the onsite project 
  • Providing the children with small gifts such as footballs, toys and clothes.

Every Cent Counts 

The reality is that I am only a teenager with no particular wealth, I need your help to make this happen, and more importantly they need your help:

Every small donation helps 

Even if you cant contribute you can help me raise awareness by simply clicking a button and maybe someone you know can help.  


About Me

My Name is Khaled Alkhawaldeh and I am a 17 year old student at Al Yasmina School in Abu Dhabi. Given the chance through the school me and 16 other students signed up to make an impact this summer and do something outside of our comfort zone. There will be many challenges and Vietnam and we have been preparing accordingly, most recently we went on a training weekend in Ras Al Khaimah where we learnt a variety of skills from cooking for ourselves to navigating through wilderness.

we will be going with World Challenge, the leading provider of life-changing school expeditions. 

World Challenge expeditions are designed to develop important life skills, helping students to:

  • Hone teamwork and leadership skills 
  • Gain confidence and self-esteem 
  • Become more globally aware 
  • Enhance employment prospects
For more information on world Challenge visit:  http://www.world-challenge.co.uk/

story:
Inspire Initiative Limited 

Inspire Initiative Limited (under the logo ‘Inspire – for the love of mountains’) is a charitable organisation founded in 2014 and supporting primary education in Gilgit-Baltistan region of Pakistan. The Founder & Chief Executive, Bushra Farooqui has been working with schools (promoting girls’ education) in this region since 2009 but has recently given it a formal structure under the Inspire charity. The motivation behind running a primary school in this beautiful mountainous region is the collective love of mountains, trekking and child (especially girls) education!

‘Investing in Education is the Greatest Return!’

We believe that every child deserves access to and the best opportunities for quality education and learning. We want to see children learning skills that will help them earn their own livelihood and break the cycle of poverty and dependency. We also want to see them getting a chance to cherish their childhood days, play, build long lasting friendships and freely express their creativity!


Aims and Objectives:

  1. Our main aim is to provide quality education to children who cannot afford to go to schools at all. The Inspire Sadpara & Malpan Primary Schools today provides primary education to 180 children both girls and boys between the ages of 4 to 14 years. These are children from remote Sadpara valley in Baltistan who are from under privileged backgrounds and cannot even afford the nominal fee of the government school. Their parents earn their livelihood by farming and raising cattle. Most of our children have to leave school by the age of 12 to help their parents earn a living. We aspire to give them a taste of childhood while they are with us and enough education to want to better their lives.
  2. We work with community leaders to establish Village Education Committees (VECs) that hire local teachers and help enroll children in school.
  3. The overall support provided by Inspire Initiative consists of teacher salaries and professional development, school supplies and materials, uniforms, school maintenance and development. Above all we try our best to ensure a child-friendly learning environment!
  4. The secondary aim is to promote the beautiful mountainous Gilgit-Baltistan region of Pakistan through involvement in community development projects, organizing awareness building talk sessions and participating in charity treks in Pakistan and other countries.
  5. Our focus for 2015-16 is to sustain funding received through the Inspire-a-Child sponsor scheme and other donors as well as consider potential local & international funding opportunities.
  6. In addition to the above, our focus remains on enhancing the quality of education by introducing teacher training programs, as well as curriculum development and assessment. For this we have partnered with Aga Khan Education Services, Pakistan who will provide all of the above services.


What We Need?

There are two projects that we're currently working on: 

  1. Adopting a new Nursery School for 2016
  2. Extension of a School building to add two more Classes.
The School that we plan to adopt:



The School that we plan to extend:


The beautiful mountains in the surroundings of the School:


We have set a target of collecting $10,000. The amount is attainable and adequate to achieve the above mentioned objectives. We firmly believe that only Education can help break the shackles of Poverty and bring about a Socioeconomic change in Pakistan. By donating to this cause, YOU will be directly helping the children of Gilgit Baltistan in getting educated. No amount is too little to donate. We assure that each and every Dollar will help us achieve our objectives. And, it's not the amount that matters, it's the intention that counts. YOU can change lives! 


The Impact

I am Shoaib Abbas and I want to become an Army officer when I grow up! 
- (Class 3, Inspire Sadpara Primary School, Baltistan)


I am Madiha Batool and I want to become a Teacher when I grow up! 
- (Class 4, Inspire Sadpara Primary School, Baltistan)

I am Zeeshan Ali and I want to become a Pilot when I grow up! 
- (Class 1, Inspire Sadpara Primary School, Baltistan)


Education is a basic need and nobody must be deprived of it. By supporting this cause, YOU can help Shoaib, Madiha, Zeeshan and many other children live a successful and independent life. Yes, YOU can help them live their dreams. Getting an education will completely transform the lives of the children of Gilgit Baltistan. In return, they'll help us make the world a better place to live. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Although collecting the funds is our first priority, but there are other ways that you can help us:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

For more Information:

Facebook: Inspire - for the love of mountains

Web: inspire-initiative.org

Instagram: @inspireinitiative

Twitter: @inspireinitiate

Facebook: Inspire - for the love of mountains
Web: inspire-initiative.org

Twitter: @inspireinitiate

story:
It's been said, "All you need is a dollar and a dream".  At Davis College, it was that first dollar, given to our founder by a wash woman in 1900, that enabled the college to begin and flourish.


From our humble beginnings in Johnson City, NY Davis College has educated people, young and old to serve others.  Yesterday, today and tomorrow our students have crossed the globe to help others in their time of need.

As a non-denominational Christian College, Davis College has a global impact and a Global student body. Our International Internship Program-IMPACT is  graciously seeking funding so we can help others, near and far.

Through this funding goal we will be able to have dozens more students out of the classrooms to directly helping those who are less fortunate.  Our students come from all walks of life, from different states and countries.  They are all here to learn and serve-in a safe and welcoming Christian environment.  We welcome All and want to continue to make our impact globally.  Your support is essential!

Your $1.00 contribution (or more) will have a direct influence on making a REAL difference.  From our Back Pack for Kids program (ensuring that no child goes home hungry), to helping build schools or homes across the world, your support in a one-time or reoccurring gift will have a long lasting and positive impact.  Please invest today in the potential of our young people. It is a sound investment with great returns.  Thank you.

story: I've been wanting to travel outside of the country for years,and my first opportunity is my high school's trip to Spain for those in the higher-level Spanish classes. But I need some help funding the trip.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Alicia Vega. I have worked in youth services for over 20 years. With the support of the Wesley United Methodist Church,  I was able to start a ministry for LGBTQA youth ages 16-21 with the goal of creating a safe space for them to explore what it means to be spiritual, heal from the harms of society, and develop as youth leaders. The first group of youth leaders named the program QYES: Queer Youth Exploring Spirituality and decided it would be nondenominational.

What We Need & What You Get

Each year QYES holds a 2 night retreat that is led and run by youth leaders and supported by adult allies and spiritual guides. The response has been so high that we have needed to use the full year's resources to meet the needs of youth and have placed several youth on a waiting list.

QYES is in need of $2,000 that will be used to allow additional youth to attend the retreat, fund the additional adults needed and allow on-going programming through the end of year.

The Impact

 This year, QYES conducted outreach to 3 agencies that service youth who have or are experiencing homelessness.  The majority of the youth who   registered are from these agencies.

Other Ways You Can Help 

If you are unable to make a financial contriburion, please pass this campaign information to your friends.

story:
What's A MakerSpace?

A MakerSpace is a creative, Do It Yourself space where people can gather to create, invent, and learn. They often have 3D printers, software, electronics, craft supplies, power tools, and more. 

The CoasterDad MakerSpace is all that and more, and more, and more!  In response to feedback from thousands of CoasterDad fans, we're building a space to bring Physics, Family and Fun to Kids Everywhere. Will we build roller coasters? Naturally! But that's not all. The CoasterDad MakerSpace will be a wonderful place where kids and grownups can

  • Learn STEM and STEAM techniques and skills through hands-on, gently guided and self-directed classes, collaboration, and activities
  • Connect with other kids and their grownups who share similar interests and have the same kinds of questions
  • Build robots and drones to do wonderful and amazing things that kids really love. Ever heard of Game of Drones? BattleBots? Yeah. Us, too. 
  • Invent kooky new things with Science-y tools like 3D Printers, laser cutters, welding equipment, hand tools, power tools, micro-controllers, and computers
  • Learn YouTube Video Production skills to create a unique YouTube Channel, or collaborate with others to contribute knowledge to the second largest search engine on Earth.
  • Find adult mentors and teachers to help develop the skills and knowledge that you think is important
  • Host events like Birthday Parties for kids and  even fancy, catered events for grownups.
That's just a short list of what's already going on at The CoasterDad Project, which was founded by "CoasterDad," Will Pemble. 

It All Started With A Roller Coaster

Once Upon A Time, Will Pemble's son Lyle asked a simple question. "Wouldn't it be cool if we had a roller coaster in our backyard?"  Inspired by the idea, Will got to work. Three months later, to the delight of every kid in the neighborhood, Will's first roller coaster, "The Caution Zone," was complete. Throughout the project, Will documented his progress on YouTube Channel. Hundreds of videos, thousands of subscribers, and millions of views later, The CoasterDad Project is a real thing.

From the start, The CoasterDad Project has had no shortage of coverage on television, in blogs, newspapers, and social media. Google Will Pemble, and you'll see for yourself just how much passion and commitment he brings to the work. 

Will and his projects have been covered on Good Morning America, Discovey Channel Canada, CBS News, NBC News, ABC News, and dozens of television stations worldwide. Will has been featured in hundreds of online media outlets, including AOL.com, Hackaday.com, Popular Science, Popular Mechanics, Make Magazine, Edutopia, just to name a few. Most recently, the CoasterDad Project won Four Editors Choice Blue Ribbons at the 2015 Maker Faire Bay Area, where Will and the CoasterDad Team built a full-sized, interactive roller coaster exhibit to show kids and their grownups just how much can be learned in the world of "Physics, Family and Fun." 


What We Need 

Just like a roller coaster, we need your help getting to the top of that first hill. For The CoasterDad MakerSpace, that's mostly about equipment, and a little about operating capital as well. 


Our First Target is $15,000, which we'll use for

  • Laser Cutter
  • 3D Printers
  • Arduino & Robotics Lab
Our founder, CoasterDad Will Pemble has a little workshop filled with big tools. Will is happy to donate all of it to The CoasterDad MakerSpace. Those tools include
  • Table Saw
  • Pneumatic nail nun
  • Pneumatic impact wrench
  • Pneumatic staple gun
  • Right angle drills
  • Skill saw
  • Sawzall
  • Dremels
  • Air compressor
  • Router and router table
  • Compound mitre saw
  • Saw horses
  • Hand tools
  • Cordless drills
  • Welding machine
  • Pipe benders
  • Steel chop saw
  • Welding helmet and gloves
  • Angle grinder
  • Skill saw
  • Dual grinding wheel
  • Video Studio Lights
  • 2 HD Video Cameras
  • 2 GoPro Hero Action Cameras
  • 1 Time lapse camera
  • Three 27" iMac Computers with all the trimmings
  • and more.
So, yes.  Quite a lot of The CoasterDad MakerSpace equipment already exists. When it comes to Bringing Physics, Family and Fun to Kids Everywhere, Will is all in. 
Our Stretch Goal is $25,000
Our target goal will provide the funds and equipment we need to get The CoasterDad MakerSpace up and running. If you help our campaign raise more, we'll do more! More equipment, more programs, more outreach to kids and grownups who will surely benefit from our programs and offerings. We'll also purchase additional tools, such as
  • Drillpress
  • Metal lathe
  • Wood lathe
  • Drone training kits
Our Super Stretch Goal is $35,000
That'd be crazy awesome, right? Thirty-five thousand dollars to spend on teaching kids the things that kids want to learn! At this level, we'll add two incredible things to The CoasterDad MakerSpace.
  • A cooking studio
  • A slow motion camera 
  • YouTube Learning Center
Totally unrelated things, except that they're kind of pricey. A moderately priced slow motion camera can shoot video at thousands of frames per second. In addition to being amazingly cool, SloMo is also an incredibly good way to get kids thinking in terms of the micro-world around them. Understanding just how much can happen in a thousandth of a blink of an eye opens up the mind to worlds of possibility. The CoasterDad MakerSpace will offer a Super SlowMo class to amaze, engage, and yes, to educate kids about MicroTime. 
Ever seen a cooking show on TV or YouTube? Cooking isn't just great fun, and it isn't just a crucial life skill. Cooking is a language unto itself. Cooking opens up the worlds of chemistry, creativity, communication and the arts. A Cooking Studio at The CoasterDad MakerSpace would enhance those already stellar experiences by adding the opportunity for our students and members to create their own Cooking Shows, which they can enjoy in private, or even publish on YouTube. 
Oooh! What if we did a Cooking Show... in SlowMo!  See? We just thought of that! We thought of it because That's What A MakerSpace Can Do. A MakerSpace Opens The Mind and allows for infinite often unlikely connections. Looks like a cooking studio and a slow motion camera aren't so totally unrelated after all. 


STEM & STEAM Learning For Everyone

Whether you're a grownup, a kid, or somewhere in between, now is always the best time to learn something new.  

Preparing kids for careers Science, Technology, Engineering Art, and Math (STEM/STEAM) is the very best way we know to ensure that the next generation is active, aware, and engaged with the kinds of innovation and creativity that fuel personal, social, and economic growth. 

For adults, we're creating a variety of classes and memberships to help you build new skills and hone your existing ones. The MakerSpace community, both online and at the CoasterDad MakerSpace facility, closes the loop and keeps you in touch with like minds and complimentary skill sets. 

In addition to competitively priced classes and memberships, The CoasterDad Project aims to provide free learning opportunities for low-income adults and children, through scholarships and free training programs.  Your support will help these programs - and these people - to continue and grow.


501(c)3 + You = Education

Though Will Pemble is an experienced, successful entrepreneur, The CoasterDad Project wasn't started as a business. The CoasterDad Project started out as Will's gift to his children, Ellie and Lyle. 

To the delight of millions, Will's videos, interactive learning experiences, and the articles he's published on topics like Project Based Learning are helping kids to learn, and grownups to teach. Will insists that The CoasterDad Project, and The CoasterDad MakerSpace, continues to be a gift. Not only to his kids, but to all kids, all parents. 

As the Maker Movement as grown, so has the popularity and impact of Will's videos. Will's goal, however, has never changed: Bring Physics, Family and Fun to Kids Everywhere. We're organizing The CoasterDad MakerSpace as a non-profit to keep our goals and purpose clear. You can be sure that your contribution to this important work will be used to the benefit of the kids, community, and projects we serve. 


CoasterDad Is Local and Global

The CoasterDad MakerSpace will be located in Concord, California. People from all over the Bay Area will have access to our classes, tools, people and resources. We envision a vibrant community where members become makers, and students become teachers. We know that hands-on experience is the best way to learn.

We also know that sharing content, ideas, and lessons online is a great way to teach. That's where The CoasterDad MakerSpace Video Production Shop fits in. Just like CoasterDad Will Pemble has been doing to the tune of millions of YouTube views for years now, we aim to continue Bringing Physics, Family and Fun to Kids Everywhere through our YouTube presence.

All our classes will be produced as Online Learning Modules and offered For Free to anyone who wants them. Providing valuable, meaningful education to anyone who wants it is simply the best investment we can think to make in our community, our children, our future. This desire, this passion, is at the very core of The CoasterDad Project, and we need your help to.. well, help :)


Risks & Challenges

The CoasterDad Team is experienced in every facet of the operation of this project. We've run technical training businesses that taught thousands of students. We're certified project and product managers. We're moms and dads. Will is certified in all kinds of things, including technical training, behavioral analysis, flight instruction, personal training, and too many other things to list here. We're experienced businesspeople who know how to win. We're award winning customer service providers. Will was the founding CEO of Web.com, one of the biggest web hosting companies in the world. Our latest roller coaster won 4 Blue Ribbons at Maker Faire Bay Area 2015. Will is a featured, master maker according to makezine.com.  

So, yes. We're up to the challenge. We're also experienced enough to know that plans don't always go to plan. We're okay with that. Mistakes get made, schedules push. We're ready to work as hard and as long as it takes to realize our vision. We're also ready to promise deliverables carefully, and to keep those promises. Challenges are met, and problems get solved through communication, realistic expectations in the first place, and above all, perseverance. For The CoasterDad MakerSpace, we'll bring our A Game, and we'll keep on keeping on. GRIT is one of the many crucial lessons we aim to teach our members and our students. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Not everybody has extra cash, even for the best of causes. If that's you at the moment, you can still help out in big ways. Subscribe to the CoasterDad YouTube Channel. Share This Campaign with Indiegogo's awesome sharing tools. Tell your friends and neighbors. Send us email and suggestions. Join our Mailing List! Money is awesome. Relationships and dialog are crazy strong, too! 

We live in an amazing time where information, inspiration and ideas move at the speed of light. Let's change everything. Everywhere. Let's teach Physics, Family and Fun to Kids Everywhere. 


Thank You, Thank You, and Thank You!

The CoasterDad MakerSpace will teach kids amazing things
And we need your help. 

We’re experienced, successful entrepreneurs who know how to win. 
And we need great partners. 

We’re parents who know that the education our kids need is more important than the things we might want. 
Thank you all so much for your consideration.

story:
A rapidly growing city, Austin is also a hub for innovation. Field Constructs Design Competition grew out of our collective desire to create a new opportunity for emerging architects, landscape architects, designers, and artists to realize and share their work with our community. We have forged connections with incredible partners to make this idea a reality; we launched the competition and responses from many corners of the world have inspired us all; we held a jury with some of the leading-edge experts in architecture, design and art, resulting in a selection of 18 visionary projects; and finally, we recently announced four winning proposals that will be constructed at the site in Austin, the Circle Acres Nature Preserve. The winning teams’ installations, and associated programming, will be on view and free to the public from November 14 to 22, 2015. Our fundraising efforts have allowed us to continue to move forward with this ambitious project so far, but we need your help to bring it to full fruition. The funds raised through this campaign will go toward public programming, operational costs of the overall exhibition at the site, and some of the materials for individual installations.

We are excited to tell you more about the winning projects, the Circle Acres site, and the larger mission of Field Constructs Design Competition: 

A buoyant chain of balloons wired with sensors floating above the landscape; a camouflaged canopy lasercut from polished steel; a brightly-colored egg overgrown with grass; and a patterned root system fabricated on a digital lathe are the four 2015 Field Constructs Design Competition (FCDC) winners. These projects marry experimentation with design innovation while uniquely addressing the history and ecology of the competition site, the Circle Acres Nature Preserve in Austin, Texas. 

2015 FCDC WINNERS
99 White Balloons
INVIVIA 
Cambridge, Mass., USA
Blurred Bodies
Studio Roland Snooks 
Melbourne, Australia
Duck Blind in Plain Site
OP.AL + And-Either-Or
Brooklyn, New York, USA
Hybroot
OTA+
Austin, Texas, USA

The winners represent a diverse group of architects, landscape architects, and designers focusing on digital fabrication, material innovation, and interactive design. Themes of camouflage; waste cycles in a landfill; dynamic, repetitive, growth in nature; and interactivity unite the four projects — which will all generate, apply, and test innovative thinking with regard to site specificity, environmental impact, and the use of new technological advancements in design.

As small-scale installations on view at Circle Acres from November 14–22, the projects also represent the possibility of engaging the public by promoting the value of contemporary design along with the mission of the Circle Acres Nature Preserve. 

This will be the first time architectural installations will be installed at Circle Acres. It is a remediated brownfield (meaning a former landfill) and the terrain is varied. We will work hard with each of our winning teams to help with logistics of the site. We also anticipate working with Ecology Action of Texas, and the EAST Austin Studio Tour to promote the installations and get visitors to the site.

About FCDC

In November 2014, Field Constructs Design Competition invited emerging designers, architects, landscape architects, and artists to participate in a juried competition to design, fabricate, and install a site-specific intervention at the Circle Acres Nature Preserve in Austin, Texas. FCDC’s mission is to explore innovative design ideas using full-scale installation as a medium, while fostering a dialogue between the participating designers and the broader public. Award recipients will receive a $5,000 reimbursable budget toward the realization of the projects. 

About Circle Acres Nature Preserve

The Circle Acres Nature Preserve and Center for Sustainable Futures is located in East Austin. Ecology Action of Texas purchased the 10-acre retired landfill in 2010 with the goal of transforming the once-hazardous site into a viable park for the local neighborhood and the city at large.

FCDC has joined into a relationship with Ecology Action, the non-profit organization
in charge of the competition site, Circle Acres Nature Preserve. This collaboration allows for a rich exploration and fostering of ideas related to sustainability, design, and creative reuse of a former landfill. Ecology Action of Texas was founded in 1969 with a mission to create a healthier environment through resource recovery operations, brownfield remediation, and zero-waste initiatives.

Sponsors

Ecology Action of Texas, Texas Architect Magazine, Texas Society of Architects, Pentagram, AIA Austin, Austin Foundation for Architecture, Bustler, Archinect, and MFArchitecture
